Jean Santeuil is an unfinished novel written by Marcel Proust .
The Fall of the Imam is a novel by Egyptian writer Nawal El Saadawi published in Arabic in 1987 .
Flight from the USSR is David Turashvili 's 2008 novel .
The Radium Pool is a collection of science fiction short stories by author Ed Earl Repp .
Grantchester Grind is a novel written by Tom Sharpe , a British novelist born in 1928 who was educated at Lancing College and then at Pembroke College , Cambridge .
A World Lit Only by Fire ( 1992 ) , by American historian William Manchester , is an informal history of the European Middle Ages , structured into three sections :
The Dissertation is a novel by R. M. Koster , part of the Tinieblas trilogy .
The Exploding Detective ( ISBN 0 - 9755799 - 6 - 7 ) is a comedic novel written by John Swartzwelder , a writer most famous for his work on The Simpsons television series .
No Picnic on Mount Kenya ( Italian : Fuga sul Kenya ) by Felice Benuzzi is a mountaineering classic recounting the 1943 attempt of three escaped Italian prisoners of war to reach the summit of Mount Kenya .
The Thought Gang is the second novel by English author Tibor Fischer , published in 1994 .
The Bowels of Liberty ( Portuguese : Os Subterrâneos da Liberdade ) is a trilogy of Brazilian Modernist novels written by Jorge Amado in 1954 .
Lost Everything is an apocalyptic science fiction novel by Brian Francis Slattery , published in 2012 by Tor Books .
Werewolves in Their Youth is a 1999 collection of short stories by Michael Chabon .
The Dark Half is a horror novel by Stephen King , published in 1989 .
`` The Mystery of Marie Rogêt '' , often subtitled A Sequel to `` The Murders in the Rue Morgue '' , is a short story by Edgar Allan Poe written in 1842 .
The Last Days of the Celtic Tiger is a 2007 play by Irish writer Paul Howard , as part of the Ross O'Carroll - Kelly series .
Economic and Philosophic Manuscripts of 1844 ( also referred to as The Paris Manuscripts ) are a series of notes written between April and August 1844 by Karl Marx .
`` The Old Castle 's Secret '' is a 32-page funny animal comic book adventure / mystery / horror story written , drawn , and lettered by Carl Barks .
Silent Honor is a novel written by Danielle Steel , published in 1996 .
Singularity 's Ring is the debut science fiction book by Paul Melko .
The Memory of Whiteness is a science fiction novel written by Kim Stanley Robinson and published in 1985 .
Nearly Neptune is a juvenile science fiction novel , the twelfth in Hugh Walters ' Chris Godfrey of U.N.E.X.A. series .
Robot Visions ( 1990 ) is a collection of science fiction short stories and factual essays by Isaac Asimov .
First Contact ? is a juvenile science fiction novel , the thirteenth in Hugh Walters ' Chris Godfrey of U.N.E.X.A. series .
Bread and Roses , Too is a 2006 children 's historical novel written by American novelist Katherine Paterson .
The General in His Labyrinth ( original Spanish title : El general en su laberinto ) is a novel by the Colombian writer and Nobel laureate Gabriel García Márquez .
À vau - l'eau ( English : With the Flow or Downstream ) is a short novel ( or novella ) by the French writer Joris - Karl Huysmans , first published by Henry Kistmaeckers in Brussels on January 26 , 1882 .
The Autumn of the Middle Ages , or The Waning of the Middle Ages ( published in 1919 as Herfsttij der Middeleeuwen and translated into English in 1924 ) , is the best - known work by the Dutch historian Johan Huizinga .
Freddy the Pilot ( 1952 ) is the 19th book in the humorous children 's Freddy the Pig series written by Walter R. Brooks and illustrated by Kurt Wiese .
Relación de las cosas de Yucatán was written by Diego de Landa Calderón circa 1566 shortly after his return from Yucatán to Spain .
The Feminine Mystique is a 1963 book by Betty Friedan which is widely credited with sparking the beginning of second - wave feminism in the United States .
Asterios Polyp is a 2009 graphic novel by American cartoonist David Mazzucchelli .
The Log of the Ark is a children 's book written by Kenneth Walker and Geoffrey Boumphrey .
Ummachu ( Beloved ) is a Malayalam novel written by Uroob in 1954 .
Klee Wyck is an autobiographical work by artist Emily Carr .
Marchers of Valhalla is a collection of two Fantasy novelettes by Robert E. Howard .
The Wrestling is a nonfiction book by Simon Garfield , a British journalist and non - fiction author .
`` Allal '' is a short story written by American writer , composer , and world traveler Paul Bowles .
Lend Me a Tenor is a comedy by Ken Ludwig .
The Man with My Face is a 1948 mystery novel by Samuel W. Taylor , which was the basis for the 1951 film of the same title .
Choritrohin is a 1917 novel by Bengali novelist Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay .
Echo in the Skull is a science - fiction novel by British novelist John Brunner , first published in the United States by Ace Books as part of Ace Double # D-385 .
A Perfect Night to Go to China is a novel by David Gilmour , published in 2005 .
The White Goddess : a Historical Grammar of Poetic Myth is a book - length essay on the nature of poetic myth - making by author and poet Robert Graves .
To Whom This May Come is a short story by American author Edward Bellamy .
Ståle Storli , also spelled Staale Storlid , is the title of a Norwegian folksong and a novel by John Lie , published in 1880 .
The Sand Pebbles is a 1962 novel by American author Richard McKenna about a Yangtze River gunboat and its crew in 1926 .
On the Yankee Station is a short story collection by William Boyd .
`` Why Should We Idly Waste Our Prime '' is an Scots poem written by Robert Burns .
Dancing the Dream is a 1992 book of poems and reflections written by American recording artist Michael Jackson .
Madness in Valencia ( `` Los Locos de Valencia '' ) is a farce from the Spanish Golden Age by Félix Lope de Vega y Carpio .
The Freshest Boy is a short story by American writer F. Scott Fitzgerald .
The Golden Turkey Awards is a 1980 book by film critic Michael Medved and his brother Harry .
S / Z , published in 1970 , is Roland Barthes 's structuralist analysis of `` Sarrasine '' , the short story by Honoré de Balzac .
The Moffat Museum by Eleanor Estes is the fourth and final novel in the children 's series known as The Moffats .
Explosion in a Cathedral ( Spanish title : El Siglo de las Luces , The Century of Lights ) is a historical novel by Cuban writer and musicologist Alejo Carpentier .
Sucker 's Portfolio , by Kurt Vonnegut , is a collection of six short stories , one non - fiction essay , and one unfinished short story written by Vonnegut and published posthumously by Amazon Publishing .
An Unsuitable Attachment is a novel by Barbara Pym , written in 1963 and published posthumously in 1982 .
On This Island is a book of poems by W. H. Auden , first published under the title Look , Stranger ! in the UK in 1936 , then published under Auden 's preferred title , On this Island , in the US in 1937 .
Here Lies Arthur is a young - adult novel by Philip Reeve , published by Scholastic in 2007 .
Who Rules America ? is a book by psychologist and sociologist G. William Domhoff , first published in 1967 and updated in 2000 & 2009 , that argues against the concentration of power and wealth in the American upper class .
The Cloven Viscount ( Italian : Il visconte dimezzato ) is a fantasy novel written by Italo Calvino .
When God Was a Woman is the U.S. title of a 1976 book by sculptor and art historian Merlin Stone .
Sengsara Membawa Nikmat ( English : Blessing in Disguise ) is an Indonesian novel written by Tulis Sutan Sati .
Miss Smilla 's Feeling for Snow or Smilla 's Sense of Snow ( Danish : Frøken Smillas fornemmelse for sne ) is a 1992 novel by Danish author Peter Høeg .
The Pigtail of Ah Lee Ben Loo with Seventeen other Laughable Tales and 200 Comical Silhouettes is a children 's book written and illustrated by John Bennett .
Hot Six is the sixth novel by Janet Evanovich featuring the bounty hunter Stephanie Plum and was written in 2000 .
The Shangri - La Diet is both the name of a book by the psychologist Seth Roberts , a professor at Tsinghua University and professor emeritus at UC Berkeley , and the name of the diet that the book advocates .
Tonio Kröger is a novella by Thomas Mann , written early in 1901 , when he was 25 .
Rachel and Leah ( 2004 ) is the third novel in the Women of Genesis series by Orson Scott Card .
Flight to Arras ( French : Pilote de guerre ) is a memoir by French author Antoine de Saint - Exupéry .
The Maytrees is American author Annie Dillard 's second novel , a fictional account of the lives of Toby and Lou Maytree in Provincetown , MA , from the time of courting to old age .
A Heritage and Its History is a novel by Ivy Compton - Burnett first published in 1959 by Victor Gollancz .
The Last Jew is a novel by Noah Gordon , 2000 .
10:04 is the second novel by the American writer Ben Lerner .
Postsingular is a 2007 science - fiction novel written by American writer Rudy Rucker .
The False Subtlety of the Four Syllogistic Figures Proved ( German : Die falsche Spitzfindigkeit der vier syllogistischen Figuren erwiesen ) is an essay published by Immanuel Kant in 1762 .
The Unreals is a science fiction / fantasy novel by Donald Jeffries , published in 2007 by StoneGarden .
The Monsters of Templeton is a dramatic novel written by Lauren Groff .
`` The Aurelian '' is a short story first written in Russian as Pil'gram by Vladimir Nabokov during his exile in Berlin in 1930 .
`` What Must Be Said '' ( German : `` Was gesagt werden muss '' ) is a 2012 prose poem by the German writer Günter Grass , recipient of the 1999 Nobel Prize in Literature .
Frog and Toad are the main characters in a series of easy - reader children 's books , written and illustrated by Arnold Lobel .
Beat Not the Bones is a 1952 suspense novel ( and psychological thriller ) by Charlotte Jay ( pseudonym of Geraldine Halls ) which won the inaugural Edgar award for best novel .
The Guerilla Filmmakers Handbook is a bestselling textbook on low - budget and independent film production written by Chris Jones and Genevieve Jolliffe .
My Little War ( Mijn kleine oorlog 1947 , translation by Paul Vincent 2010 ) is the fourth novel by Louis Paul Boon , and the first one to show his formidable innovative powers in shaping literary constructions .
The Book of Kane is a collection of fantasy short stories by Karl Edward Wagner featuring his character Kane .
Cracking India , ( 1991 , U.S. , 1992 , India ; originally published as Ice Candy Man , 1988 , England ) is a novel by author Bapsi Sidhwa .
Concepts of Modern Mathematics is a 1975 book by mathematician and science popularizer Ian Stewart about recent developments in mathematics .
Memories , Dreams , Reflections ( German title : Erinnerungen , Träume , Gedanken ) is a partially autobiographical book by Swiss psychologist Carl Jung and an associate , Aniela Jaffé .
Tehelka as Metaphor is a 2009 nonfiction book by Indian journalist , Madhu Trehan .
The Satanic Rituals includes the child baptism ritual used by Anton LaVey at the first publicly recorded Satanic baptism in history for his youngest daughter Zeena ( in The Satanic Rituals , LaVey dedicates the ceremony to Zeena ) .
The Formation of Vegetable Mould through the Action of Worms , with Observations on their Habits ( sometimes shortened to Worms ) is an 1881 book by Charles Darwin on earthworms .
Maximum Boy is a series of eight chapter books for young readers written by the humorist Dan Greenburg , illustrated by Greg Swearingen , and published by Scholastic from 2001 to 2003 .
The Posthumous Papers of the Pickwick Club ( also known as The Pickwick Papers ) is Charles Dickens 's first novel .
For Marx ( French : Pour Marx ) is a 1965 book by Louis Althusser , a leading theoretician of the French Communist Party .
Hangman 's Holiday is a collection of short stories , mostly murder mysteries , by Dorothy L. Sayers .
Pudd'nhead Wilson is a novel by Mark Twain .
The Second Form at Malory Towers is a children 's novel by Enid Blyton set in an English boarding school .
If Democrats Had Any Brains , They 'd Be Republicans is a book by American conservative columnist Ann Coulter .
Speaker for the Dead is a 1986 science fiction novel by Orson Scott Card and an indirect sequel to the novel Ender 's Game .
The Devil and Miss Prym ( Portuguese : O Demônio e a Srta . Prym ) is a novel by the Brazilian novelist Paulo Coelho .
A History of Money and Banking in the United States is a 2002 book by economist Murray Rothbard .
Conservatives without Conscience is a book written by John Dean , who served as White House Counsel under U.S. President Richard Nixon and then helped to break the Watergate scandal with his testimony before the United States Senate .
The Silent Gondoliers ( ISBN 0 - 345 - 44263 - 6 ) is a 1983 novel written by William Goldman , under the pseudonym of `` S. Morgenstern '' , about why the gondoliers of Venice no longer sing through the tale of the protagonist Luigi .
`` Ker - Plop '' is a science fiction novella written in 1979 by Ted Reynolds .
Tarry Flynn is a novel by Irish poet and novelist Patrick Kavanagh , set in 1930s rural Ireland .
The Wizard of Linn is a science fiction novel written by A. E. van Vogt and a sequel to Empire of the Atom .
The Dragon Ca n't Dance is a 1979 novel by Trinidadian author Earl Lovelace , set in a slum of Port of Spain .
D.C.O. Cargunka is a fictional sailor created by English writer William Hope Hodgson .
Black Mischief was Evelyn Waugh 's third novel , published in 1932 .
The Refugees ( 1893 ) is a historical novel by British writer Sir Arthur Conan Doyle .
A Walk to Wachusett is an essay penned by Henry David Thoreau accounting an excursion he took with a companion , Richard Fuller , from Concord , Massachusetts to the summit of Mount Wachusett located in Princeton , Massachusetts .
The Harleian Miscellany is a collection of material from the library of the Earl of Oxford collated and edited by Samuel Johnson and William Oldys between 1744 and 1753 on behalf of the publisher Thomas Osborne .
The Day of Forever , is a short - story collection by J. G. Ballard .
Starship Traveller is a single - player adventure gamebook written by Steve Jackson and illustrated by Peter Andrew Jones .
Space Platform is a YA science fiction novel by author Murray Leinster .
The King 's Damosel ( also known as The King 's Damsel ) is a fantasy novel based on Arthurian legend by Vera Chapman first published in 1976 .
The Scarlet Fig : or , Slowly through a Land of Stone , is a fantasy novel by Avram Davidson , edited by Grania Davis and Henry Wessells , published in hardcover by Rose Press in 2005 .
The Tin - Pot Foreign General and the Old Iron Woman ( ISBN 0241113628 ) is a 1984 picture book , ostensibly for very young children , written and illustrated by Raymond Briggs and published by Hamish Hamilton .
C Traps and Pitfalls is a slim computer programming book by former AT&T Corporation researcher and programmer Andrew Koenig , its first edition still in print in 2005 , which outlines the many ways in which beginners and even sometimes quite experienced C programmers can write poor , malfunctioning and dangerous source code .
TCP / IP Illustrated is the name of a series of 3 books written by W. Richard Stevens .
Menino de engenho ( Plantation boy ) is a novel written by the Brazilian writer José Lins do Rego .
The Diary of a Cross - Stealer ( Խաչագողի հիշատակարանը / Khachagoghi Hishatakarane ) is an 1890 novel by the Armenian novelist Raffi .
Chronopolis and Other Stories is a 1971 collection of science fiction stories by J. G. Ballard .
Gødland is an American comic book series by Joe Casey and Tom Scioli , published by Image Comics from 2005 to 2012 .
The Rain Before It Falls is a lyrical novel written by British author Jonathan Coe .
The Twelve Little Cakes ( 2004 ) is a memoir by Czech author Dominika Dery .
Because of Winn - Dixie is a children 's novel written by Kate DiCamillo , which was published in 2000 , and was the winner of a Newbery Honor distinction the following year .
Fall on Your Knees is a novel by Canadian playwright , actor and novelist Ann - Marie MacDonald .
`` First Law '' is a science fiction short story by American writer Isaac Asimov , first published in the October 1956 issue of Fantastic Universe magazine and later collected in The Rest of the Robots ( 1964 ) and The Complete Robot ( 1982 ) .
The Millionaire Mind , published February 1 , 2000 by Thomas J. Stanley , draws from the author 's research of America 's affluent to examine the ideas , beliefs and practices of the segment of the financial elite that use little or no consumer credit .
`` Gimpel the Fool '' ( 1953 ) is a short story by Isaac Bashevis Singer , translated into English by Saul Bellow in 1953 .
Un taxi mauve ( `` a mauve taxi '' ) is a 1973 novel by the French writer Michel Déon .
Wildwood Dancing is a young adult fantasy novel written by author Juliet Marillier and published by Pan Macmillan Australia in 2006 .
Mr. Monk on Patrol is the thirteenth novel written by Lee Goldberg to be based on the television series Monk .
Patience and Sarah is a 1969 historical fiction novel with strong lesbian themes by Alma Routsong , using the pen name Isabel Miller .
Babyji is a novel by Abha Dawesar first published in 2005 .
Adventures of Huckleberry Finn ( or , in more recent editions , The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn ) is a novel by Mark Twain , first published in the United Kingdom in December 1884 and in the United States in February 1885 .
Los Amos del Valle is a Venezuelan novel written by psychiatrist Francisco Herrera Luque and published in 1979 .
Twilight in the Forbidden City ( Chinese : 紫禁城的黄昏 ; pinyin : Zǐjìnchéng de Huánghūn ) is Reginald Johnston 's 486-page memoir of Henry Puyi , who had been the Xuantong Emperor of the Qing dynasty .
Shabash Professor Shonku ( Bravo Professor Shonku ) is a Professor Shonku series book written by Satyajit Ray and published by Ananda Publishers in 1974 .
A Long Long Way is a novel by Irish author Sebastian Barry , set during the First World War .
Elizabeth and After is a novel by Matt Cohen , first published in 1999 by Knopf Canada .
Oakfield ; or , Fellowship in the East is a novel by William Delafield Arnold , first published in 1853 .
Dear Mr. Capote is a 1983 novel by Gordon Lish .
The Book of Healing ( Arabic : کتاب الشفاء Kitab Al - Shifaʾ , Latin : Sufficientia ) is a scientific and philosophical encyclopedia written by Abū Alī ibn Sīnā ( Avicenna ) from ancient Persia , near Bukhara in Greater Khorasan .
Blanquerna ( Catalan pronunciation : ( bɫəŋˈkɛrnə ) ) is a novel written around 1283 by Ramon Llull .
`` Epitaph to a Dog '' ( also sometimes referred to as `` Inscription on the Monument to a Newfoundland Dog '' ) is a poem by the British poet Lord Byron .
Var är bus - Alfons ? is a 1982 children 's book by Gunilla Bergström .
The Promise of American Life is a book published by Herbert Croly , founder of The New Republic , in 1909 .
The Peripheral is a 2014 science fiction mystery - thriller novel by William Gibson .
A Short History of the English People is a book written by English historian John Richard Green .
A Hidden Life is a memoir by the Dutch - American author Johanna Reiss .
Gideon 's Day is the first in a series of police procedural novels by John Creasey writing as J.J. Marric .
The Poem of the Man - God ( Italian title : Il Poema dell'Uomo - Dio ) is a multi volume book of about five thousand pages on the life of Jesus Christ written by Maria Valtorta .
`` Umney 's Last Case '' is a short story by American author Stephen King , first published in King 's collection Nightmares & Dreamscapes ( 1993 ) .
The Throwback is a 1978 satirical novel by Tom Sharpe .
Leonardo 's Mountain of Clams and the Diet of Worms ( 1998 ) is the eighth volume of collected essays by the Harvard paleontologist Stephen Jay Gould .
Coming Up for Air is a novel by George Orwell , first published in June 1939 , shortly before the outbreak of World War II . It combines premonitions of the impending war with images of an idyllic Thames - side Edwardian era childhood .
`` The Gunslinger and the Dark Man '' is a short story by Stephen King , originally published in The Magazine of Fantasy and Science Fiction in November 1981 .
The Killing of Tupac Shakur is a biographical and true - crime account by American journalist and author Cathy Scott of the 1996 murder of rapper Tupac Shakur .
Last Drinks is a 2000 Ned Kelly Award winning novel by the Australian author Andrew McGahan .
Conan the Avenger is a 1968 collection of two fantasy works written by Björn Nyberg , Robert E. Howard and L. Sprague de Camp featuring Robert E. Howard 's seminal sword and sorcery hero Conan the Barbarian .
As Sure as the Dawn ( 1995 ) is a novel by Francine Rivers , and the third book in the Mark of the Lion Series .
Your Best Life Now : 7 Steps to Living at Your Full Potential is the bestselling book by pastor Joel Osteen .
Facing the Future is a young adult Christian novel written by Jerry B. Jenkins and Tim LaHaye , number four of the Left Behind :
The Theory of Money and Credit is a 1912 economics book written by Ludwig von Mises , originally published in German as Theorie des Geldes und der Umlaufsmittel .
In the Valley ( 1890 ) is a historical novel by Anglo - American novelist Harold Frederic .
The First Casualty ( 2005 ) is a historical crime novel by English author Ben Elton , set during the First World War .
What Looks Like Crazy on an Ordinary Day is a novel by Pearl Cleage , and was chosen as an Oprah 's Book Club selection in September 1998 .
Calico Captive is Elizabeth George Speare 's first historical fiction children 's novel .
The Naked Society is a 1964 book on privacy by Vance Packard .
Home , and Other Big , Fat Lies is a middle grade novel by Jill Wolfson .
2 Die 4 is a novel by British author Nigel Hinton first published in 2009 .
Human Croquet is the second novel of Kate Atkinson .
Spring Storm is a 1937 play written by American playwright Tennessee Williams .
The New Science ( original title Scienza Nuova ( ˈʃɛntsa ˈnwɔːva ) ) is the major work of Italian philosopher Giambattista Vico , published in 1725 .
Through a Glass , Clearly ( 1967 ) is a collection of four short stories by Isaac Asimov .
The Flying Sorcerers is a humorous 1971 science fiction novel by David Gerrold and Larry Niven .
The Art of Transformation ( ISBN 9781933966007 ) is a 2006 book by former U.S. House Speaker Newt Gingrich and Nancy Desmond .
`` Æpyornis Island '' , or `` Aepyornis Island '' , is a short story by H. G. Wells , first published in 1894 in the Pall Mall Budget .
Cutters Do n't Cry is a young adult novel written by American author Christine Dzidrums , first published in 2010 .
Torch of Freedom is a science fiction novel by American writers David Weber and Eric Flint , published on November 3 , 2009 .
La Guerre is a novel by French Nobel laureate writer J. M. G. Le Clézio and translated into English as War .
Blue Genes is the fifth story in the `` Kate Brannigan Series '' written by Val McDermid A popular Scottish author .
Divina Trace ( 1991 ) is an experimental novel by Robert Antoni , and the winner of the 1992 Commonwealth Writers Prize for best first novel .
The Orphan of the Rhine was a gothic novel by Eleanor Sleath , listed as one of the seven `` horrid novels '' by Jane Austen in her novel Northanger Abbey .
Aramis , or the Love of Technology , was written by French sociologist / anthropologist Bruno Latour .
The End of the Affair ( 1951 ) is a novel by British author Graham Greene , as well as the title of two feature films ( released in 1955 and 1999 ) that were adapted from the novel .
The Moonlight Bay Trilogy is a proposed trilogy of three novels by Dean Koontz .
The Coroner 's Lunch is a crime novel by British author Colin Cotterill first published in 2004 .
The Durdane series is a trilogy of science fiction books written by Jack Vance between 1971 and 1973 , and detail the political and social adventures of Gastel Etzwane on the world Durdane .
Upara ( a Marathi language word meaning outsider ) is an autobiography written by Laxman Mane , a writer who lives in the state of Maharashtra , India .
Is Religion Dangerous ? is a book by Keith Ward examining the questions : `` Is religion dangerous ?
The Petrified Planet is an anthology of three original science fiction stories , edited by the uncredited Fletcher Pratt and published by Twayne in 1952 .
The Beautiful Things That Heaven Bears , is the debut novel of Ethiopian author Dinaw Mengestu .
Between Facts and Norms ( German : Faktizität und Geltung ) is a 1992 book on deliberative politics by the German political philosopher Jürgen Habermas .
Hons and Rebels is an autobiography by political activist Jessica Mitford , which describes her aristocratic childhood and the conflicts between her and her sisters Unity and Diana , who were ardent supporters of Nazism .
This Law of Ours and Other Essays is a book written by Muhammad Asad , first published by Dar al - Andalus , Gibraltar in 1987 .
The Man Who Folded Himself is a 1973 science fiction novel by David Gerrold that deals with time travel .
The Mammoth Book of Best New Manga is edited by ILYA .
Impossible Things is a collection of short stories by Connie Willis , first published in 1993 , that includes tales of ecological disaster , humorous satire , tragedy , and satirical alternate realities .
The Accidental Time Machine is a science - fiction novel by Joe Haldeman that was published in 2007 .
The Hoopster ( 2005 ) is a novel by American author Alan Lawrence Sitomer .
Hover Car Racer is a Sci - fi / Sports / Action story written by Australian author Matthew Reilly , originally released as a free fortnightly online serial , and later published by Pan MacMillan in 2004 .
The World 's Desire is a classic fantasy novel first published in 1890 and written by H. Rider Haggard and Andrew Lang .
Wives and Concubines ( 妻妾成群 Qīqiè Chéngqún ) is a 1990 novel by Su Tong that describes a college girl whose mind is broken by the concubine system in 1930s China .
Soccer Comes First ( originally published as Soccer Is Also a Game ) is a 1966 children 's novel by prolific British author Michael Hardcastle .
The War of the End of the World ( Spanish : La guerra del fin del mundo ) is a 1981 novel written by Peruvian novelist Mario Vargas Llosa .
Cannon - Fodder ( French : Casse - pipe ) is an unfinished novel by the French writer Louis - Ferdinand Céline .
Mysteries of the Moonsea was written by Wil Upchurch , Sean K. Reynolds , Darrin Drader and Thomas M. Reid , and published in June 2006 .
The Kill Artist is a 2000 spy novel by American author Daniel Silva .
Our Lady of the Nile ( French : Notre Dame du Nil ) is a French - language novel by Scholastique Mukasonga , originally published in 2012 by Éditions Gallimard .
The Sensitive Man is a science fiction novella by Poul Anderson that was first published in the January 1954 issue of Fantastic Universe and reprinted in the 1981 collection The Psychotechnic League .
The Damnation of Theron Ware ( published in England as Illumination ) is an 1896 novel by American author Harold Frederic .
Space Station Seventh Grade is a young adult novel by Jerry Spinelli , published in 1982 ; it was his debut novel .
From A to Z , in the Chocolate Alphabet , a work by Harlan Ellison , is a collection of 26 extremely short stories on abstract and basically unrelated topics , displaying various aspects of Ellison 's well known preoccupations with morality , mythology , the trivia of history , and humor .
The Burden of Proof , published in 1990 , is Scott Turow 's second novel , somewhat of a sequel to Presumed Innocent .
The Eye of the Heron is a 1978 science fiction novel by U.S. author Ursula K. Le Guin which was first published in the science fiction anthology Millennial Women .
A Child 's Christmas in Wales is a prose work by the Welsh poet Dylan Thomas .
The Simple Art of Murder refers to hard - boiled detective fiction author Raymond Chandler 's critical essay , a magazine article , and his collection of short stories .
Lottie and Lisa ( original German title : Das doppelte Lottchen `` The double Lottie '' ) is a 1949 novel by Erich Kästner , about twin girls separated at birth who meet at summer camp .
Chief Culture Officer ( 2009 ) is the eighth book by Canadian author and anthropologist Grant McCracken .
The Conversion of Chaplain Cohen is a 1963 novel by the American writer and rabbi Herbert Tarr about a young rabbi serving as a United States Air Force military chaplain .
Winesburg , Ohio ( full title : Winesburg , Ohio : A Group of Tales of Ohio Small - Town Life ) is a 1919 short story cycle by the American author Sherwood Anderson .
John Needham 's Double is an 1885 novel and 1891 play by Joseph Hatton , and 1916 silent film .
The Borderland of Sol is an English language science fiction novelette written in 1975 by Larry Niven .
The Chainbearer ; or The Littlepage Manuscripts is a novel by the American novelist James Fenimore Cooper first published in 1845 .
Tickets to the Devil ( 1968 ) by Richard P. Powell is novel taking a glimpse into the world of duplicate bridge in the late 1960s .
Straight and Crooked Thinking , first published in 1930 and revised in 1953 , is a book by Robert H. Thouless which describes , assesses and critically analyses flaws in reasoning and argument .
The Toll - Gate is a Regency novel by Georgette Heyer , which takes place in 1817 .
Danger Along the Ohio is a novel of historical fiction written by Patricia Willis and first published in 1997 , it was the paperback edition .
Franka is a popular Dutch comic book series drawn and written since the mid-1970s by the graphic artist Henk Kuijpers .
Dialogues of the Gods ( Ancient Greek : Θεῶν Διάλογοι ) are 25 miniature dialogues mocking the Homeric conception of the Greek gods written in Attic Greek by Syrian author Lucian of Samosata .
A Manhã do Mundo ( literally The Morning of the World ) is a debut novel by the Portuguese writer Pedro Guilherme - Moreira .
By the Candelabra 's Glare is a 1898 collection of poems written by L. Frank Baum .
Sun Horse , Moon Horse is a historical novel for children written by Rosemary Sutcliff and published in 1977 .
Helbeck of Bannisdale is a novel by Mary Augusta Ward , first published in 1898 .
Dada Kamred ( Hindi : दादा कॉमरेड ) is a novel written by Yashpal .
The Death - Defying Pepper Roux is a 2010 book by British children 's author Geraldine McCaughrean .
The Reprieve ( French : Le sursis ) is a 1945 novel by Jean - Paul Sartre .
The Little Emperors is a 1951 historical novel by the English author Alfred Duggan .
Isle of Fire was written by Wayne Thomas Batson and published in 2008 as the sequel to his book Isle of Swords .
Grasshopper Jungle is a 2014 young adult novel written by American author Andrew A. Smith that follows a cast of characters living in the fictional , run - down , half - abandoned town of Ealing , Iowa .
Anti - intellectualism in American Life is a book by Richard Hofstadter published in 1963 that won the 1964 Pulitzer Prize for General Non - Fiction .
Moments of Being is a collection of posthumously - published autobiographical essays by Virginia Woolf .
The Ragged - Trousered Philanthropists is a novel by Robert Tressell first published in 1914 after his death in 1911 .
Leather Maiden is a crime / mystery novel written by American author Joe R. Lansdale .
Ragazzi di vita ( Italian pronunciation : ( raˈɡattsi di ˈviːta ) ; English : literally boys of life , idiomatically hustlers ) is a novel by Italian author , poet and intellectual Pier Paolo Pasolini .
Confessions of an English Opium - Eater ( 1821 ) is an autobiographical account written by Thomas De Quincey , about his laudanum ( opium and alcohol ) addiction and its effect on his life .
Capable of Honor is a 1966 political novel written by Allen Drury .
The Reavers is a 2007 comic novel from George MacDonald Fraser set during the Elizabethan Era .
Oriental Tales ( French : Nouvelles orientales ) is a 1938 short story collection by the French writer Marguerite Yourcenar .
Myši Natálie Mooshabrové is a Czech psychological novel by Ladislav Fuks .
Plåster ( lit . Plaster ) is the sixth novel by Swedish author Klas Östergren .
Bright Island is a children 's novel by Mabel Robinson .
Tusen gånger starkare ( A Thousand Times Stronger ) is a 2006 young adult novel written by Christina Herrström .
I Shall Wear Midnight is an Andre Norton Award - winning comic fantasy novel by Terry Pratchett set on the Discworld .
The Peppered Moth is a 2000 novel by English writer Margaret Drabble ; it is her fourteenth published novel .
The Character of Physical Law is a series of seven lectures by physicist Richard Feynman concerning the nature of the laws of physics .
Arthur 's Nose is a children 's book written and illustrated by writer Marc Brown , focusing on the experiences of Arthur Read , a fictional anthropomorphic bipedal aardvark .
Medicamina Faciei Femineae ( Cosmetics for the Female Face , also known as The Art of Beauty ) is a didactic poem written in elegiac couplets by the Roman poet Ovid .
Paddy Clarke Ha Ha Ha is a novel by Irish writer Roddy Doyle , first published in 1993 by Secker and Warburg .
Pitcher - Plants of Borneo is a monograph by Anthea Phillipps and Anthony Lamb on the tropical pitcher plants of Borneo .
Lu Ann Hampton Laverty Oberlander is the second play in the series A Texas Trilogy by Preston Jones .
In mathematics , Canon arithmeticus is a table of indices and powers with respect to primitive roots for prime powers less than 1000 , originally published by Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi ( 1839 ) .
The Adventures of the Black Girl in Her Search for God ( and Some Lesser Tales ) is a book of short stories written by George Bernard Shaw .
The Career of Nicodemus Dyzma ( Polish title : Kariera Nikodema Dyzmy ) is a 1932 Polish bestselling novel by Tadeusz Dołęga - Mostowicz .
The Tears of Autumn ( 1974 ) is American author Charles McCarry 's second novel , and the second novel in the Paul Christopher series .
Naši furianti ( in English : Our Swaggerers ) is a Czech play based on story by Ladislav Stroupežnický , played for the first time in 1887 .
The Fire Pony is a children 's novel written by Rodman Philbrick , first published in the United States in 1996 by Blue Sky Press .
Economy and Society is a book by political economist and sociologist Max Weber , published posthumously in Germany in 1922 by his wife Marianne .
A Matter of Profit is a science fiction novel written by Hilari Bell published in 2001 .
Murder at School is a detective novel by James Hilton first published in 1931 .
Earth Inferno is the first book by the English artist and magician Austin Osman Spare when he was 18 .
Rage of a Demon King is the third book in Raymond E. Feist 's Serpentwar Saga and the eleventh book of his Riftwar cycle .
The Desire of Ages is a book about the life of Jesus Christ by the Seventh - day Adventist pioneer Ellen G. White .
Cousin Henry is a novel by Anthony Trollope first published in 1879 .
Ecstasy and Me is the tell - all style autobiography of Austrian - born actress and scientist Hedy Lamarr , co - written with Leo Guild and Cy Rice and first published in 1966 .
Otherwise Known as Sheila the Great is a children 's novel by Judy Blume , first published in 1972 .
The Georgics ( /ˈdʒɔrdʒɪks/ ; Latin : Georgica ( ɡɛˈoːrɡɪka ) ) is a poem in four books , likely published in 29 BC . It is the second major work by the Latin poet Virgil , following his Eclogues and preceding the Aeneid .
The Amazing Bone is a 32-page picture book by William Steig from 1976 .
`` Encounter in the Dawn '' is a short story by Arthur C. Clarke published in 1953 in the magazine Amazing Stories .
Johnny Gone Down is second novel written by Indian Author Karan Bajaj about an Ivy League Scholar who had a bright future at NASA ahead of him but things seem to take a dramatic turn from an innocent vacation .
Other Lives but Mine ( French : D'autres vies que la mienne ) is a 2009 book by the French writer Emmanuel Carrère .
The Cat Who Saw Red is the fourth book in the Cat Who series of mystery novels by Lilian Jackson Braun , published in 1986 .
Science Fiction Terror Tales is an anthology of science fiction horror short stories edited by Groff Conklin .
Urban the Ninth is a 1973 Novel by Scottish writer Bruce Marshall .
`` Dr. Heidegger 's Experiment '' is a short story by American author Nathaniel Hawthorne , about a doctor who claims to have been sent water from the Fountain of Youth .
Lectures on Jurisprudence , also called Lectures on Justice , Police , Revenue and Arms ( 1763 ) is a collection of Adam Smith 's lectures , comprising notes taken from his early lectures .
When the World Shook is a novel by H. Rider Haggard written in 1919 .
Fear and Misery of the Third Reich ( German : Furcht und Elend des Dritten Reiches ) , also known as The Private Life of the Master Race , is one of Bertolt Brecht 's most famous plays and the first of his openly anti - Nazi works .
Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde is the original title of a novella written by the Scottish author Robert Louis Stevenson first published in 1886 .
30 Days in Sydney is a book written by Australian novelist Peter Carey .
In computing , the Common Public License ( CPL ) is a free software / open - source software license published by IBM .
Le Fils naturel ( English : The Natural Son ) is a 1757 play by Denis Diderot .
Le Curé de Tours is a long short story ( or , more properly , a novella ) by Honoré de Balzac , written in 1832 .
She Returns to the Floating World is a book of poetry that was written by Jeannine Hall Gailey and published by Kitsune Books in 2011 .
Wibbly Pig 's Silly Big Bear is a children 's picture book written and illustrated by Mick Inkpen , published in 2006 .
The Road to Jerusalem ( Swedish : Vägen till Jerusalem ) is the first book in Jan Guillou 's The Knight Templar book series .
Grammar of the Gothic Language is a book by Joseph Wright describing the extinct Gothic language , first published in 1910 .
The Enemy Papers is a short story collection by Barry B. Longyear containing the novella Enemy Mine , later made into a feature - length film of the same name , along with two sequels :
You Know Me Al is a book by Ring Lardner , and subsequently a nationally syndicated comic strip scripted by Lardner and drawn by Will B. Johnstone and Dick Dorgan .
The Reign of the Brown Magician ( 1996 ) is the final fantasy novel in The Worlds of Shadow trilogy by Lawrence Watt - Evans .
Pseudolus is a play by the ancient Roman playwright Titus Maccius Plautus .
Moonheart is an urban fantasy novel by Charles de Lint .
Year 's Best SF 10 ( ISBN 0 - 06 - 057561 - 1 ) is a science fiction anthology edited by David G. Hartwell and Kathryn Cramer that was published in 2005 .
The Fifth Gospel ( Das fünfte Evangelium ) , first published in Germany in 1993 , is a novel by Philipp Vandenberg .
The Spirit of Romance is a 1910 book of literary criticism by the poet Ezra Pound .
Staying On is a novel by Paul Scott , which was published in 1977 and won the Booker Prize .
The Impulse to Preserve is Robert Gardner 's 2006 memoir about his career creating actuality films .
Half the Blood of Brooklyn is a 2007 pulp - noir / horror novel by American writer Charlie Huston .
Handling the Undead ( Swedish : Hanteringen av odöda ) is a 2005 horror novel by Swedish writer John Ajvide Lindqvist , translated into English in 2009 .
Rediscovering God in America is a book written by former House Speaker Newt Gingrich with photography from his wife Callista Gingrich .
Voices of a People 's History of the United States ( ISBN 978 - 1583229163 ) is an anthology edited by Howard Zinn and Anthony Arnove .
The Edict on Maximum Prices ( Latin : Ēdictum Dē Pretiīs Rērum Vēnālium , `` Edict Concerning the Sale Price of Goods '' ; also known as the Edict on Prices or the Edict of Diocletian ) was issued in 301 by Roman Emperor Diocletian .
Computers and Typesetting is a 5-volume set of books by Donald Knuth published in 1986 describing the TeX and Metafont systems for digital typography .
The Money Lenders is a 1981 book on finance by British journalist Anthony Sampson .
Breaking Stalin 's Nose is a 2011 children 's historical novel written and illustrated by Eugene Yelchin .
Annales Ecclesiastici ( full title Annales ecclesiastici a Christo nato ad annum 1198 ; `` Ecclesiastical annals from Christ 's nativity to 1198 '' ) , consisting of twelve folio volumes , is a history of the first 12 centuries of the Christian Church , written by Caesar Baronius .
The Hill of Devi is an account by E. M. Forster of two visits to India in 1912 - 1913 and 1921 , during which he worked as the private secretary to Tukojirao III , the Maharaja of the state of Dewas Senior .
The Morgaine Stories , also known as The Morgaine Cycle , are a series of science fantasy novels by science fiction and fantasy writer C. J. Cherryh , published by DAW Books .
Boy A is the title of a 2004 novel by British writer Jonathan Trigell .
The Deniers is a 2008 book by Lawrence Solomon , a Canadian environmentalist and writer .
The Stolen Spring ( Danish : Det Forsømte Forår , The Neglected Spring ) is a Danish novel by Hans Scherfig , published first in 1940 .
The Colossus of Maroussi is an impressionist travelogue by Henry Miller which was first published in 1941 by Colt Press of San Francisco .
The Memoirs of Cleopatra is a 1997 historical fiction novel written by American author Margaret George , detailing the purported life of Cleopatra VII , Queen of Egypt .
De Geuzen ( `` The Geuzen '' ) was a Belgian comics series , drawn by Willy Vandersteen from 1985 until his death in 1990 .
Traveling with the Dead is a 1995 vampire / mystery novel by Barbara Hambly .
When Did You See Her Last ? is the second book in the All the Wrong Questions series by Lemony Snicket ( also known as Daniel Handler ) , a series set before the events of A Series of Unfortunate Events .
The Wonder Book of Bible Stories is a 1904 literature by Logan Marshall printed in the United States .
The Draft History of Qing ( Chinese : 清史稿 ; pinyin : Qīng Shǐ Gǎo ) is a draft of the official history of the Qing dynasty compiled and written by a team of over 100 historians led by Zhao Erxun who were hired by the Beiyang government of the Republic of China .
Planet of Adventure is a series of four science fiction novels by Jack Vance , which relate the adventures of Adam Reith , the sole survivor of an Earth ship investigating a signal from the distant planet Tschai .
Double Fudge is a 2002 children 's novel by Judy Blume and the fourth and final in the Fudge series .
Elegy Written in a Country Churchyard is a poem by Thomas Gray , completed in 1750 and first published in 1751 .
Swift as Desire ( in Spanish Tan veloz como el deseo ) is a 2001 novel by the Mexican novelist Laura Esquivel .
The Mandaean Book of John ( Mandaic language Drāšā D - Yaḥyā ; Hebrew script - Aramaic Modern Mandaic : דרשא דיחיא‎ ) is a Mandaean holy book in Mandaic Aramaic written traditionally by their chief prophet John the Baptist .
The Genocides is a 1965 science fiction novel written by American author Thomas M. Disch .
The Black Hole of Auschwitz is a collection of essays by the Italian author Primo Levi .
Mister Pip ( 2006 ) is a novel by Lloyd Jones , a New Zealand author .
The Archaeology of Shamanism is an academic anthology edited by the English archaeologist Neil Price which was first published by Routledge in 2001 .
Regiment of Women is the debut novel of Winifred Ashton writing as Clemence Dane .
Who Killed Palomino Molero ? ( Spanish : ¿ Quién mató a Palomino Molero ? ) is a 1986 novel by Peruvian novelist Mario Vargas Llosa .
Glenarvon is Lady Caroline Lamb 's first novel , published in 1816 .
The Urth of the New Sun is a 1987 science fiction novel by Gene Wolfe that serves as a sort of coda to his 4-volume Book of the New Sun series .
Philosophy and Real Politics is a 2008 book by British philosopher and scholar Raymond Geuss whose main subject is the relationship between politics and human needs .
Plutarch 's Lives of the Noble Greeks and Romans , commonly called Parallel Lives or Plutarch 's Lives , is a series of biographies of famous men , arranged in tandem to illuminate their common moral virtues or failings , written in the late 1st century .
Sperm Wars is a primarily nonfiction book by evolutionary biologist Robin Baker .
The Peaks of Lyell is a book by Geoffrey Blainey , based on his University of Melbourne MA thesis originally published in 1954 .
I Heard the Owl Call My Name is a best - selling 1960s book by Margaret Craven .
The Machine God Laughs is an anthology of three science fiction short stories edited anonymously by William L. Crawford .
Forty Thousand in Gehenna , alternately 40,000 in Gehenna , is a 1983 novel by science fiction and fantasy author C. J. Cherryh .
The Magician 's Land is a fantasy novel by Lev Grossman , published in 2014 by Viking Adult , the second sequel to The Magicians .
Conversation in the Cathedral is a 1969 novel by Peruvian writer and essayist Mario Vargas Llosa , translated by Gregory Rabassa .
Movies in Fifteen Minutes ( known as m15 m for short ) is primarily the name of a set of Internet - based movie parodies by Cleolinda Jones ( a pen name ) .
Belles on Their Toes is a 1950 book written by Frank Bunker Gilbreth , Jr. and Ernestine Gilbreth Carey .
The Blue Octavo Notebooks ( sometimes referred to as The Eight Octavo Notebooks ) is a series of eight notebooks written by Franz Kafka from late 1917 until June 1919 .
An Unfinished Journey is a posthumous collection of essays by Shiva Naipaul , published by Hamish and Hamilton in 1986 .
Persecution and the Art of Writing , published in 1952 by the Free Press , is a book of collected articles written by Leo Strauss .
Behind a Mask , or A Woman 's Power is a novella written by American author Louisa May Alcott .
In Persuasion Nation is short story writer George Saunders 's third full length short story collection .
Beneath the Wheel ( Unterm Rad ) is a 1906 novel written by Hermann Hesse .
Consider the Oyster is a book by M. F. K. Fisher that deals in the history , preparation and eating of oysters .
Playing with the Devil ( Czech : Hrátky s čertem ) is a 1945 Czech fairy - tale comedy play by playwright Jan Drda .
The Garden of Abdul Gasazi ( ISBN 0 - 395 - 27804-X ) is a best - selling children 's picture book written in 1979 by the American author Chris Van Allsburg .
The Stonemason is a play in five acts by American writer Cormac McCarthy , first performed in 1995 .
The Enchanted April is a 1922 novel by British - American writer Elizabeth von Arnim .
The Golden Legend ( Latin : Legenda aurea or Legenda sanctorum ) is a collection of hagiographies by Jacobus de Voragine that became a late medieval bestseller .
Hollywood Babylon is a book by avant - garde filmmaker Kenneth Anger which details the sordid scandals of many famous and infamous Hollywood denizens from the 1900s to the 1950s .
The Book of the New Sun ( 1980 -- 1983 ) is a series of four science fantasy novels or one four - volume novel by the American author Gene Wolfe .
A Delicate Truth is a 2013 spy novel by John le Carré .
Of Love and Evil is the second novel by American author Anne Rice in her Songs of the Seraphim series , which tells the story of Toby O'Dare , an assassin with a tragic past .
The Color of Distance is a science fiction novel by Amy Thomson published in 1995 by Ace Books .
Corporal to Field Officer , 4th Edition Up To Date was a reference work written by Captain H.P.E. Phillips , MC , and Lieutenant - Colonel R. J. S. Langford , designed for use by officers and NCOs in the Canadian Army to contain the essentials of all the army 's other military manuals .
Candide , ou l'Optimisme ( /ˌkænˈdiːd/ ; French : ( kɑ̃did ) ) is a French satire first published in 1759 by Voltaire , a philosopher of the Age of Enlightenment .
Fukurō no Shiro ( 梟の城 , Owls ' Castle ) is the ninja - themed 1959 debut novel of Japanese author Ryōtarō Shiba , which won him the Naoki Prize in 1960 after the story was published by Kodansha .
A History of Pi ( also titled A History of π ) is a 1970 non - fiction book by Petr Beckmann that presents a layman 's introduction to the concept of the mathematical constant pi ( π ) .
Missionaries in India is a 1996 nonfiction book by Arun Shourie .
Nothing But Blue Skies is a humorous fantasy novel by English author Tom Holt .
The Phenomenon of Man ( Le phénomène humain , 1955 ) is a book written by the French philosopher , paleontologist and Jesuit priest Pierre Teilhard de Chardin .
River Boy is a young adult novel by Tim Bowler , published by Oxford in 1997 .
The Fur Country ( French : Le Pays des fourrures ) is an adventure novel by Jules Verne in The Extraordinary Voyages series , first published in 1873 .
The Boy Who Cried Wolf is one of Aesop 's Fables , numbered 210 in the Perry Index .
Thy Soul Shall Bear Witness ! ( Swedish : Körkarlen ) is a 1912 novel by the Swedish author Selma Lagerlöf .
The Year of the Flood is a novel by Canadian author Margaret Atwood , released on September 22 , 2009 in Canada and the United States , and on September 7 , 2009 , in the United Kingdom .
Witch & Wizard is the first novel of the Witch & Wizard series , written by James Patterson & Gabrielle Charbonnet .
The Continental Association , often known simply as the `` Association '' , was a system created by the First Continental Congress in 1774 for implementing a trade boycott with Great Britain .
Paroles ( ( pa.ʁɔl ) ; `` Words '' ) is a collection of poems by Jacques Prévert , first published on May 10 , 1946 .
Los relámpagos de agosto ( officially translated in 1986 as The Lightning of August ) was the first novel written by Mexican author Jorge Ibargüengoitia .
Je suis écrivain is a Belgian novel by François Weyergans .
Letters from Iceland is a travel book in prose and verse by W. H. Auden and Louis MacNeice , published in 1937 .
The Racial Contract is a book by professor Charles W. Mills in which Mills puts forth his political philosophy regarding the role of race in the formation of the social contract .
Obama 's Wars is a 2010 book written by Pulitzer Prize - winning investigative journalist Bob Woodward .
If It Had Happened Otherwise ( ISBN 028397821X ) is a 1931 collection of essays edited by J. C. Squire and published by Longmans , Green .
The Tales of Beedle the Bard is a book of children 's stories by British author J. K. Rowling .
Larklight , or the Revenge of the White Spiders ! or to Saturn 's Rings and Back ! is a young adult novel by author Philip Reeve .
Gianni and the Ogre is a 1971 anthology of 18 fairy tales that have been collected and retold by Ruth Manning - Sanders .
Anvil of Stars is a book by Greg Bear and a sequel to The Forge of God .
The FairTax Book is a non - fiction book by libertarian radio talk show host Neal Boortz and Congressman John Linder , published on August 2 , 2005 , as a tool to increase public support and understanding for the FairTax plan .
`` Up in Michigan '' is a short story by American writer Ernest Hemingway , written in 1921 and revised in 1938 .
The Third Philippic was delivered by the prominent Athenian statesman and orator , Demosthenes , in 341 BC . It constitutes the third of the four philippics .
The Assassin King is the sixth book in the Elizabeth Haydon series , the Symphony of Ages , released December 26 , 2006 , by Tor Books .
The Dragon in the Sea ( 1956 ) , also known as Under Pressure from its serialization , is a novel by Frank Herbert .
The Bulgari Connection is a 2001 novel by Fay Weldon that became notorious for its commercial tie - in : in exchange for £ 18,000 from the jeweler Bulgari , Weldon was required to mention the name of the jeweler at least 12 times - which was more than exceeded by the author .
Pontos Kültürü or Pontos Culture is a 1996 book by Turkish author Ömer Asan about the Greek Muslims of Trabzon Province .
The History of Sandford and Merton ( 1783 - 1789 ) was a bestselling children 's book written by Thomas Day .
`` The Reign of the Superman '' ( January 1933 ) is a short story written by Jerry Siegel and illustrated by Joe Shuster .
The Timothy Files is a 1987 best selling work of fiction by Lawrence Sanders .
`` Shadows in Zamboula '' is one of the original stories by Robert E. Howard about Conan the Cimmerian , first published in Weird Tales in 1935 .
Mindkiller is a 1982 novel by science fiction writer Spider Robinson .
The Second Plane ( 2008 ) is a collection of twelve pieces of nonfiction and two short stories by the British writer Martin Amis on the subject of the 9/11 attacks , terrorism , Muslim radicalisation and the subsequent global War on Terror .
In Abraham 's Bosom is a play by American dramatist Paul Green .
Mr. Monk and the Two Assistants is the fourth novel based on the television series Monk by Lee Goldberg .
Best Friends in Love is the third and last part of the Best Friends series by Rosie Rushton .
Children of Scarabaeus is a 2011 science fiction novel with a touch of romance by Australian author Sara Creasy , published by Harper Voyager .
Ang Paboritong Libro ni Hudas ( The Favorite Book of Judas ) or The Black Book is a 2003 semi - biography book by Filipino author Bob Ong .
The White Lioness ( Original : Den vita lejoninnan ) is a crime novel by Swedish writer Henning Mankell , the third in the Inspector Wallander series .
Invisible Yet Enduring Lilacs is the title of a collection of essays by Melbourne writer Gerald Murnane , published by Giramondo Publishing in 2005 .
The Antiquary ( 1816 ) is a novel by Sir Walter Scott about several characters including an antiquary : an amateur historian , archaeologist and collector of items of dubious antiquity .
The Magic Goes Away is a fantasy short story written by Larry Niven in 1976 , and later expanded to a novella of the same name which was published in 1978 .
Acid Row is a 2001 novel by crime - writer Minette Walters .
Collateral Karma is the second novel by T.L. Orcutt in the Path of Return Trilogy and first published in September 2008 .
What They Did to Princess Paragon is a humor novel by Robert Rodi , which tells the story of what happens when a venerable comic book superheroine is retconned as a lesbian .
Sacred Country is a novel by English author Rose Tremain , it was published in 1992 by Sinclair Stevenson and won both the James Tait Black Memorial Prize and Prix Femina Etranger .
Seedless in Seattle is a 2015 novel by Irish journalist and author Paul Howard and serves as the fifteenth book in the Ross O'Carroll - Kelly series .
Lily Beach ( 1993 ) is a literary novel by Jennie Fields .
`` That Hell - Bound Train '' is a fantasy short story by Robert Bloch from 1958 that won the Hugo Award for Best Short Story in 1959 .
Farewell Fantastic Venus is a science fiction anthology edited by Brian Aldiss and Harry Harrison .
The Story of Appleby Capple is a complex children 's alphabet book by Anne Parrish in which alliterative narrative , with each chapter focusing on a different letter , is used to tell a story .
Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel ( ISBN 0 - 590 - 75803 - 9 ) is a children 's book by Virginia Lee Burton .
A Bad Spell in Yurt is a fantasy novel by C. Dale Brittain first published in 1991 .
The American Way of Death is an exposé of abuses in the funeral home industry in the United States , written by Jessica Mitford and published in 1963 .
Letter to His Father ( German : Brief an den Vater ) is the name usually given to the letter Franz Kafka wrote to his father Hermann in November 1919 , indicting him for his emotionally abusive and hypocritical behavior towards him .
The Horn of Mortal Danger is a 1980 novel by British musician Lawrence Leonard .
The Lawless Roads ( 1939 ) is a travel account by Graham Greene , based on his 1938 trip to Mexico , to see the effects of the government 's campaign of forced anti - Catholic secularisation and how the inhabitants had reacted to the brutal anticlerical purges of President Plutarco Elías Calles .
Epistle to a Godson and other poems is a book of poems by W. H. Auden , published in 1972 .
Beautiful Solitude ( Chinese : 又寂寞又美好 , which literally means `` Lonely and Wonderful . `` ) is a picture book , authored and illustrated by Jimmy Liao , completed in 2003 .
The Great Compilation of Fatwa ( Arabic : Majmu al - Fatwa al - Kubra ) is a collection of religious tracts written by the 13th century Islamic scholar Ibn Taymiyyah .
The Painted Word is a 1975 book of art criticism by Tom Wolfe .
Les Misérables ( pronounced /leɪ ˌmɪzəˈrɑːb/ or /leɪ ˈmɪzəˌrɑːb/ ; French pronunciation : ​(le mizeʁabl(ə ) ) ) is a French historical novel by Victor Hugo , first published in 1862 , that is considered one of the greatest novels of the 19th century .
Lo Crestià ( or The Christian in English ) was an encyclopaedia , that was sponsored by the king Peter IV of Aragon and written by Francesc Eiximenis between 1379 and 1392 .
Curse of the Starving Class is a play by Sam Shepard , considered the first of a series on family tragedies .
Dear Bruce Springsteen is a juvenile fiction novel published in 1987 by Kevin Major .
Limit of Vision is a 2001 science fiction book by author Linda Nagata .
Recuerdos de Provincia ( also known in English as : Recollections of a Provincial Past ) is an autobiography written in 1850 by Domingo Faustino Sarmiento , a writer and journalist who became the seventh president of Argentina .
Freedom ™ , the sequel to Daemon , is the second of a two - part novel , by the author Daniel Suarez , about a distributed , persistent computer application , known as The Daemon , that begins to change the real world after the original programmer 's death .
`` The Nepenthaceae of the Netherlands Indies '' is a seminal monograph by B. H. Danser on the tropical pitcher plants of the Dutch East Indies and surrounding regions .
Some Thoughts Concerning Education is a 1693 treatise on the education of gentlemen written by the English philosopher John Locke .
Love and Will ( 1969 ) is a book by American existential psychologist Rollo May , in which he articulates the principle that an awareness of death is essential to life , rather than being opposed to life .
Atkinson & Hilgard 's Introduction to Psychology is a popular introductory textbook on psychology written originally by Ernest Hilgard , Richard C. Atkinson and Rita L. Atkinson and edited and revised by Edward E. Smith , Daryl J. Bem , Susan Nolen - Hoeksema , Barbara L. Fredrickson , Geoff R. Loftus and Willem A. Wagenaar .
Icehenge is a science fiction novel by American author Kim Stanley Robinson , published in 1984 .
Tabataba suivi de pawana is the title of two short stories `` Tabataba '' followed by Pawana(Awaité Pawana)in one book written in French by French Nobel laureate J. M. G. Le Clézio .
Last Cab to Darwin is a 2003 Australian drama / comedy stage play written by Reg Cribb and based upon the true story of taxi driver Max Bell who was diagnosed with terminal stomach cancer in the early 1990s .
The Awkward Age is a novel by Henry James , first published as a serial in Harper 's Weekly in 1898 - 1899 and then as a book later in 1899 .
No Coffin for the Corpse ( 1942 ) is a whodunnit mystery novel written by Clayton Rawson .
Domains of Darkover is an anthology of fantasy and science fiction short stories edited by Marion Zimmer Bradley .
The House of the Mosque ( Dutch : Het huis van de moskee ) is a Dutch - language novel by Iranian writer Kader Abdolah , published in 2005 .
The Thin Man ( 1934 ) is a detective novel by Dashiell Hammett .
The Outward Urge is a science fiction novel by John Wyndham ( although it might arguably be regarded as a collection of linked short stories ) .
The Colleen Bawn , or The Brides of Garryowen is a melodramatic play written by Irish playwright Dion Boucicault .
Anatomy of a Typeface is a book on typefaces written by Alexander Lawson .
An Essay on Liberation is a 1969 book by Frankfurt School philosopher Herbert Marcuse .
The Son of the Red Corsair ( original title : Il figlio del corsaro rosso ) is an exotic adventure novel written by Italian author Emilio Salgari , published in 1908 .
We of the Never Never is an autobiographical novel by Jeannie Gunn .
Flight into Camden is a novel by British author and playwright David Storey .
The Cruise of the Snark ( 1911 ) is a non - fictional , illustrated book by Jack London chronicling his sailing adventure in 1907 across the south Pacific in his ketch the Snark .
The Shanghai Moon is a Lydia Chin / Bill Smith mystery novel by S. J. Rozan .
Joshua Son of None is a 1973 political thriller by Nancy Freedman .
The Twelve and the Genii , or The Return of the Twelves in the U.S. , is a low fantasy novel for children by Pauline Clarke , first published by Faber in 1962 with illustrations by Cecil Leslie .
The Jesus Dynasty is a book written by James Tabor in which he develops the hypothesis that the original Jesus movement was a dynastic one , with the intention of overthrowing the rule of Herod Antipas ; that Jesus of Nazareth was a royal messiah , while his cousin John the Baptist planned to be a priestly messiah .
Morale scolarium is a book of mildly satirical elegiac poems composed in Latin in 1241 by Johannes de Garlandia , an English grammarian who taught at the universities of Toulouse and Paris .
From A to X is a novel written by John Berger , published by Verso Books in 2008 .
The Entropy Effect is a novel by Vonda N. McIntyre set in the fictional Star Trek Universe .
Gray Victory is a 1988 alternate history novel by Robert Skimin , taking place in an alternate 1866 where the Confederacy won its independence .
Spell Wars is a fantasy novel by Katherine Roberts , published on August 3 , 2000 by Element Books and aimed at pre - teens .
`` The Maiden Flight of McCauley 's Bellerophon '' is an award - winning science fiction / magical realism novella by Elizabeth Hand .
Where Angels Fear to Tread ( 1905 ) is a novel by E. M. Forster , originally entitled Monteriano .
Amadeus is a play by Peter Shaffer , which gives a highly fictionalized account of the lives of the composers Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart and Antonio Salieri .
The Amber Witch is a German novel published by Wilhelm Meinhold ( 1797 - -1851 ) in 1838 .
The Day of the Owl ( Italian : Il giorno della civetta ) is a crime novel about the Mafia by Leonardo Sciascia , finished in 1960 and published in 1961 .
The Sheikh and the Dustbin is the third and last collection of short stories by George MacDonald Fraser , featuring a young Scottish officer named Dand MacNeill .
Mary and the Giant is an early , non - science fiction novel written by Philip K. Dick in the years between 1953 and 1955 , but not published until 1987 .
Ray McKibben ( October 27 , 1945 or 1946 -- December 6 , or December 8 , 1968 ) was a United States Army soldier and a recipient of the United States military 's highest decoration -- the Medal of Honor -- for his actions in the Vietnam War .
Stig Claesson 's work has received many awards , such as the literature prize of the newspaper Svenska Dagbladet and the Selma Lagerlöf Prize .
Jean Stafford ( July 1 , 1915 -- March 26 , 1979 ) was an American short story writer and novelist , who won the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction for The Collected Stories of Jean Stafford in 1970 .
Rustam Kasimdzhanov ( Uzbek : Rustam Qosimjonov ; Russian : Рустам Касымджанов ; born 5 December 1979 ) is an Uzbek chess Grandmaster , best known for winning the FIDE World Chess Championship in 2004 .
Dinesh Chandra Bhandary ( born August 4 , 1934 ) is a Group Captain in the Indian Air Force who was awarded the Vir Chakra , The third highest military decoration in India for the services rendered by him during the Indo - Pakistani War of 1971 .
Marc Elder ( Marcel Tendron ) ( 31 October 1884 , Nantes -- 16 August 1933 , Saint - Fiacre - sur - Maine ) was a French writer , winner of the Prix Goncourt for The People of the Sea .
Bartłomiej Heberla ( born 19 June 1985 ) , in Rybnik is a Polish chess Grandmaster ( 2006 ) and currently one of the leading Polish players .
Eugénio de Andrade received numerous awards including the Prize of the Associação Portuguesa de Escritores ( 1986 ) , Prize D. Dinis from Casa de Mateus Foundation ( 1988 ) , the Great Poetry Prize of the Portuguese Association of Writers ( 1989 ) and the Camões Prize ( 2001 ) .
Lim Seng Hoo ( born 1956 ) is a Singaporean chess International Master .
Like Hakkasan , Yauatcha gained a Michelin star rating in 2005 , which it has retained .
Prince Michał Hieronim Radziwiłł ( 1744 - 1831 ) was a Polish nobleman , politician , diplomat and Knight of the Order of the White Eagle ( awarded on September 7 , 1773 ) .
Jóhann Hjartarson ( born 8 February 1963 in Reykjavík ) is a chess Grandmaster from Iceland .
Joshua Sweeney is an American gold medal sledge hockey player and Purple Heart recipient who competed in 2014 Winter Paralympics in Sochi , Russia .
Hans - Hartwig Trojer ( 22 January 1916 -- 27 September 1943 ) was a German U - Boat commander in World War II . He was also a recipient of the Knight 's Cross of the Iron Cross ( German : Ritterkreuz des Eisernen Kreuzes ) .
In 2011 , the original Alice Cooper band was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame .
Wing Commander John Marlow Thompson , DFC , Reserve of Air Force Officers awarded the Distinguished Service Order ( DSO ) This officer has a fine operational record .
Hell 's Hinges has been selected for preservation in the National Film Registry , and is considered by some to be one of the finest silent Westerns .
Dolarrai Mankad , ( Hindi : डोलरराय मांकद Gujarati : ડોલરરાય માંકડ ; 23 January 1902 -- 29 August 1970 ) , full name Dolarrai Rangildas Mankad , was a Gujarati critic , researcher and poet who won the 1964 Sahitya Akademi Award for Gujarati language for his essay Naivedya .
N. Gopalaswami is a former Chief Election Commissioner of India ( CEC ) who has been awarded the Padma Bhushan in 2015 .
Ian Swingland was made an Officer of the Order of the British Empire ( OBE ) in the New Year Honours List for 2007 for his services to conservation .
In 1949 , a special act of Congress was passed to award the Distinguished Flying Cross to Roscoe Turner , who received it on August 14 , 1952 at the Pentagon .
Nisha Millet , and the Arjuna Award winner , was the only woman in the 2000 Sydney Olympics swim team for India .
After its restoration in 2000 , `` The Dickson Experimental Sound Film '' was selected for inclusion in the United States National Film Registry .
Corporal Jason Lamont , MMV is a Canadian soldier who was among the first recipients of the Medal of Military Valour , a Canadian military decoration , in recognition of actions under enemy fire in Afghanistan .
Peter Zumthor ( born 26 April 1943 ) is a Swiss architect and winner of the 2009 Pritzker Prize and 2013 RIBA Royal Gold Medal .
On March 8 , 2007 , the U.S. Department of State honored Susana Trimarco with the International Women of Courage Award , conferred by Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice .
In 1990 , Rebel Without a Cause was added to Library of Congress 's National Film Registry as being deemed `` culturally , historically , and aesthetically significant '' .
Dan Bucatinsky ( born September 22 , 1965 ) is an American actor , writer and producer , best known for his role as James Novak in the Shonda Rhimes drama series Scandal , for which he won the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actor in a Drama Series in 2013 .
1 January 1969 Wing Commander Michael Horace Miller was awarded the Air Force Cross .
Gilbert Motier de La Fayette ( 1380 -- 22 February 1462 ) Lord of La Fayette , Pontgibaud , Ayes , Nébouzac , Saint - Romain and Monteil Gelat was a Marshal of France He was brought up at the court of Louis II , Duke of Bourbon .
General Sir Walter Norris Congreve VC KCB MVO DL ( 20 November 1862 -- 28 February 1927 ) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross , the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces .
Georg Schewe ( 24 November 1909 -- 16 September 1989 ) was a famous Korvettenkapitän with the Kriegsmarine during World War II . He was also a recipient of the Knight 's Cross of the Iron Cross ( German : Ritterkreuz des Eisernen Kreuzes ) .
Subramaniam Raman , born in Chennai , is an Arjuna Award table tennis player .
Ivar Giaever ( Norwegian : Giæver , IPA : ( ˈiːvɑr ˈjeːvər ) ; born April 5 , 1929 ) is a Norwegian - American physicist who shared the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1973 with Leo Esaki and Brian Josephson `` for their discoveries regarding tunnelling phenomena in solids '' .
In 1939 , Rena Galibova was awarded the title of Merited Artist of Tajikistan and in 1941 she was given the title of People 's Artist of Tajikistan as well as the Order of Lenin after she performed in front of Joseph Stalin and he was very impressed by her talent .
Heinz Edhofer ( 15 December 1917 -- 27 May 1978 ) was a highly decorated Oberfeldwebel in the Luftwaffe during World War II . He was also a recipient of the Knight 's Cross of the Iron Cross .
William Heffernan has received the Edgar Award , is a member of the Authors Guild , The Mystery Writers of America , and was once President of the International Association of Crime Writers .
Lieutenant Colonel Harold Marcus Ervine - Andrews VC ( 29 July 1911 -- 30 March 1995 ) was an Irish recipient of the Victoria Cross , the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces .
Philippe Antoine d'Ornano , 1st Comte d'Ornano ( January 17 , 1784 - October 13 , 1863 ) was a French soldier and political figure who rose to the rank of Marshal of France .
Louis Charles Birch FAA ( 8 February 1918 in Melbourne -- 19 December 2009 ) was an Australian geneticist specialising in population ecology and was also well known as a theologian , writing widely on the topic of science and religion , winning the Templeton Prize in 1990 .
Heinrich Rohrer ( 6 June 1933 -- 16 May 2013 ) was a Swiss physicist who shared half of the 1986 Nobel Prize in Physics with Gerd Binnig for the design of the scanning tunneling microscope ( STM ) .
Vladimir Eljanov ( 8 May 1951 -- 19 October 2013 ) was a Ukrainian chess International Master , Honoured Coach of Ukraine , FIDE Senior Trainer ( 2013 ) and chess book publisher .
William P. Thompson ( January 11 , 1844-October 7 , 1864 ) was a sergeant in the American Civil War and a recipient of the Medal of Honor for action at Battle of the Wilderness during which he was killed on May 6 , 1864 with an award being issued to him on December 1 , 1864 .
Often considered one of the greatest martial arts films of all time , in 2004 , Enter the Dragon was deemed `` culturally , historically , and aesthetically significant '' in the United States and selected for preservation in the National Film Registry of the Library of Congress .
For `` The Selected Poems of Oleh Lysheha , '' Lysheha and his co - translator James Brasfield from Penn State University , received the 2000 PEN Award for Poetry in Translation published by the Harvard Ukrainian Research Institute .
Tania Sachdev ( born 20 August 1986 in Delhi ) is an Indian chess player , who holds the FIDE titles of International Master and Woman Grandmaster .
Vice Admiral Nilakanta Krishnan Padma Bhushan , DSC , PVSM ( 1919 -- January 1982 ) , was the Flag Officer Commanding in Chief of the Eastern Naval Command of the Indian Navy during the 1971 Indo - Pakistani War .
Distinguished Service Order ( 4 March 1918 ) Second Lieutenant ( Temporary Captain ) Brian Edmund Baker , MC , General List and Royal Flying Corps .
Sivaramakrishna Chandrasekhar ( 6 August 1930 -- 8 March 2004 ) was an Indian physicist who won the Royal Medal in 1994 .
William C. Bryan , ( 1852 - 1933 ) was a United States Army officer that received the Medal of Honor .
Major General Sir Henry Hugh Clifford VC KCMG CB ( 12 September 1826 -- 12 April 1883 ) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross , the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces .
Sri Lanka Sikhamani Sunna Deniya Gunadasa ( known as S. D. Gunadasa or Dasa Mudalali ) was a Sri Lankan business magnate who brought the concept of the supermarket to Sri Lanka in 1977 .
Joseph Watt , VC ( 25 June 1887 -- 13 February 1955 ) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross , the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces .
Pascal Caffet is a World - Champion and Meilleur Ouvrier de France French pastry confectioner and chocolate maker .
Peng Zhaoqin ( Simplified Chinese : 彭肇勤 ; born 8 May 1968 in Guangzhou , Guangdong ) is a Chinese - born Dutch chess player , who has the FIDE title of Grandmaster , which was awarded in October 2004 .
Charles Mackerras was appointed a Commander of the Order of the British Empire ( CBE ) in the 1974 New Year Honours , and was knighted in the 1979 New Year Honours .
Leo James Rainwater ( December 9 , 1917 -- May 31 , 1986 ) was an American physicist who shared the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1975 for his part in determining the asymmetrical shapes of certain atomic nuclei .
Eva Repková ( born 16 January 1975 in Stará Ľubovňa ) is a Slovak chess player holding the FIDE titles of International Master ( IM ) and Woman Grandmaster ( WGM ) .
Paul Grüninger ( 27 October 1891 - 22 February 1972 ) was a Swiss police commander in St. Gallen , a football player , and a Righteous Among the Nations .
In the fall of 1945 , while still at Oak Ridge , Lt . Col . Richard W. Cook was awarded the Legion of Merit for his work on the A - Bomb Project .
Juan José Millás ( born 1946 ) is a Spanish writer and winner of the 1990 Premio Nadal .
Nicholas Pert ( also known as Nick Pert ; born 22 January 1981 ) is an English chess player who holds the title Grandmaster .
Piotr Murdzia ( born 20 February 1975 in Gdańsk ) is a Polish chess International Master ( IM ) , International Solving Grandmaster and seven - time World Chess Solving Champion .
Stephie D'Souza was the first woman to win the Arjuna Award presented by the Government of India .
On 21 September 2010 , the Board of the Carnegie Foundation announced that Peace One Day and Jeremy Gilley would be the recipient of the Wateler Peace Prize .
Alexander Kochyev ( Russian : Александр Кочиев ; born March 25 , 1956 , Saint Petersburg ) is a Russian chess Grandmaster ( 1977 ) .
Dr. Horst Patuschka ( 22 May 1912 -- 6 March 1943 ) was a German Luftwaffe night fighter ace and recipient of the Knight 's Cross of the Iron Cross during World War II . The Knight 's Cross of the Iron Cross was awarded to recognise extreme battlefield bravery or successful military leadership .
Goodnight , Vienna ( also known as Magic Night ) is a 1932 British musical film directed by Herbert Wilcox and starring Jack Buchanan , Anna Neagle and Gina Malo .
Ultimate Deception , also known as `` Ultimate Betrayal '' , is a 1999 made - for - TV movie drama starring Yasmine Bleeth and Richard Grieco , who were living together in real life at the time the film was produced .
Devil and Angel ( Chinese : 恶棍天使 ) is a 2015 Chinese comedy film directed by Yu Baimei and Deng Chao and starring Deng Chao and Sun Li .
The Adventure of Mr. Philip Collins ( German : Herrn Filip Collins Abenteuer ) is a 1925 German silent comedy film directed by Johannes Guter and starring Georg Alexander , Ossi Oswalda and Elisabeth Pinajeff .
A workplace ensemble comedy , Stacked revolves around Skyler Dayton ( Pamela Anderson ) who is tired of her non - stop partying lifestyle and bad choices in boyfriends .
By Cyrene , Apollo had a son named Aristaeus , who became the patron god of cattle , fruit trees , hunting , husbandry and bee - keeping .
Xerxes I was the eldest son of Atossa and Darius .
Chandan Dass is married to Yamini Dass and has one son , Namit Das , who is an actor and singer .
Åsta Gudbrandsdatter ( c. 975/980 -- c. 1020/1030 ) was the mother of two Norwegian kings , King Olaf II of Norway and King Harald III of Norway .
Gao Wei , who formally passed the throne to his son Gao Heng , was captured while trying to flee to Chen Dynasty , and later that year , the Northern Zhou emperor executed him and almost all members of his clan .
Lieutenant James Victor Gascoyne DFC ( 25 May 1892 -- 1976 ) was an English World War I flying ace credited with five aerial victories .
At the outbreak of World War I , on August 3 , 1914 , Kiffin Rockwell offered his services to France by letter , which he wrote with his brother Paul , to the French Consul - General in New Orleans .
Wolfgang Kretzschmar ( 2 July 1907 -- 27 December 1944 ) was a German officer serving during World War II and recipient of the coveted Knight 's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves and Swords ( German : Ritterkreuz des Eisernen Kreuzes mit Eichenlaub und Schwertern ) .
Robert Blume ( November 19 , 1868 - -September 16 , 1937 ) was an American sailor serving in the United States Navy during the Spanish-- American War who received the Medal of Honor for his actions .
Edmund Brooke Alexander ( October 6 , 1802 -- January 3 , 1888 ) was an officer in the United States Army in the Mexican - American War through the American Civil War who rose to the rank of brevet Brigadier General in 1865 .
Horst Rudat ( born 3 May 1920 in Wirtkallen , district Insterburg , East Prussia ; died 31 August 1982 in Laaber / Waldelzerberg ) was a German World War II Luftwaffe bomber pilot .
Commandant Fernand Bonneton was a French World War I flying ace credited with nine confirmed aerial victories .
Georg Staats ( 13 March 1916 in Bremen -- 12 November 1943 in the Bay of Biscay ) was a German U - boat commander in World War II and recipient of the Knight 's Cross of the Iron Cross ( German : Ritterkreuz des Eisernen Kreuzes ) .
The Henschel Hs 293 was a World War II German anti - ship guided missile : a radio - controlled glide bomb with a rocket engine slung underneath it .
Irving Goff ( 1900 - 17 May 1989 ) was a member of the Communist Party USA and the Abraham Lincoln Battalion , a unit that volunteered to fight during the Spanish Civil War for the Popular Front .
Leutnant Max Näther ( 24 August 1899 -- 8 January 1919 ) Royal House Order of Hohenzollern , Iron Cross , was a German World War I ace fighter pilot noted for the destruction of ten enemy observation balloons and sixteen aircraft .
Samuel Ovenshine was a United States Army officer who served as a brigadier general during the Philippine-- American War .
The Army of Northern Virginia was the primary military force of the Confederate States of America in the Eastern Theater of the American Civil War , as well as the primary command structure of the Department of Northern Virginia .
