Stephen Silas is an American basketball coach , currently working as an assistant coach for the Charlotte Hornets of the National Basketball Association ( NBA ) .
Niall Annett ( born 7 May 1992 ) is a professional rugby union player for Worcester Warriors , having previously played for Ulster Rugby .
The Pitze ( also : Pitzbach ) is a right tributary of the river Inn in the Imst ( district ) and flows through the Pitztal valley .
The Arsenyevka River ( Russian : Арсеньевка , formerly Daubi - He ) is a left tributary of the Ussuri River in Anuchinsky and Yakovlevsky Districts of Primorsky Krai , Russia .
Skawa ( German : Schaue ) is a river in southern Poland , a right tributary of the Vistula .
Kyzylsu River rises on the southern slopes of the Vakhsh Range in the north - east of Tajikistan 's Khatlon Province and runs south - west for a length of 230 km until joining Panj River on the border with Afghanistan .
The River Swilly rises near Glendore , a mountain in County Donegal , and flows for around 41.8 km ( 26.0 mi ) through Letterkenny before flowing into the Atlantic Ocean at Lough Swilly .
The Bourne Brook or Black Brook , as it is known in its upper reaches , is a tributary of the River Tame in Staffordshire , England .
The Ohlanga River is a river in KwaZulu - Natal , South Africa , which empties into the Indian Ocean just north of Umhlanga , KwaZulu - Natal , north of Durban .
Viga River ( Russian : Вига ) is a river in Kostroma Oblast in Russia , a right tributary of the Unzha River .
The Pelly River is a river in Canada , and is a headstream of the Yukon River .
The Alster is a right tributary of the Elbe river in Northern Germany .
The Emba River ( Kazakh : Ембі or Kazakh : Жем , Russian : Эмба ) in west Kazakhstan rises in the Mugodzhar Hills and flows some 400 miles ( 640 km ) southwest into the Caspian Sea .
Although there is no clear channel , Tuggeranong Creek flows south - west to form confluence with the Murrumbidgee River , south of Greenway .
The River Beck is one of the tributaries of the River Ravensbourne in south London .
The Saloum River rises about 105 kilometers east of Kaolack , Senegal , and flows into the Atlantic Ocean .
The Kara Dere is a river that empties into the Black Sea 20 miles east of Trabzon , Turkey .
The Imo River ( Igbo : Imo Mmiri ) is in southeastern Nigeria and flows 240 kilometres ( 150 mi ) into the Atlantic Ocean .
The Woronora River rises on the northwestern slopes of the Illawarra escarpment and has its origin from Waratah Rivulet , near Darkes Forest , and flows generally north for approximately 36 kilometres ( 22 mi ) , joined by three minor tributaries , before reaching its confluence with the Georges River , between Como and Illawong .
Przemsza ( German : Przemsa ) is a river in the south of Poland , a tributary of the Vistula .
Magelungsdiket ( Swedish : Magelungen Ditch ) is one of three inflows of Lake Magelungen in southern Stockholm , Sweden .
The Virgin River is a tributary of the Colorado River in the U.S. states of Utah , Nevada , and Arizona .
The Djoua River is a tributary of the Ivindo River in Gabon and the Republic of the Congo .
The estuary of Saint - Charles River in Saint - Lawrence River has a special historical significance since it is at this location that was built the Saint - Lawrence Iroquoian village of Stadaconé and that Jacques Cartier spent his first winter on Canadian soil in 1535 - -36 .
The Archbach , also called Planseeache , is an about 15 km long influx on the right side of the Lech River in Tyrol , Austria .
The Eden Creek , a perennial stream of the Richmond River catchment , is located in Northern Rivers region in the state of New South Wales , Australia .
Oaky River rises on the southern slopes of Round Mountain , the highest peak of the Snowy Range , a spur of the Great Dividing Range south southwest of Ebor , and flows generally southwest , joined by one minor tributary before reaching its confluence with the Chandler River , southwest of Jeogla .
The Pakhra River ( Russian : Пахра́ ) is a river in Moscow Oblast and the city of Moscow , Russia , a right tributary of the Moskva River .
The Walaqa River , a tributary of the Blue Nile , is river in the Amhara Region of Ethiopia .
The Bargo River rises in the southern slopes of Southern Highlands , north of Colo Vale , and flows generally north - east , joined by two minor tributaries , before reaching its confluence with the Nepean River , near Bargo .
In extreme events , water from the Finke River flows into the Macumba River , and thence into Lake Eyre , a total distance from headwater streams of around 750 km ( 470 mi ) .
Moonan Brook , a mostly perennial stream of the Hunter River catchment , is located in the Hunter region of New South Wales , Australia .
The Johanna River rises in the Otway Ranges in southwest Victoria , below Lavers Hill and flows generally south through the Great Otway National Park before reaching its river mouth and emptying into the Great Australian Bight , west of Cape Otway at Johanna Beach , near Johanna .
The Limpopo River rises in central southern Africa , and flows generally eastwards to the Indian Ocean .
The river flows generally northwest to the Staaten River National Park and then west , joined by eleven minor tributaries before reaching its mouth and emptying into the Gulf of Carpentaria .
The headwaters of the Taggerty River rise on the north -- western slopes of the Yarra Ranges , below Lake Mountain and descend to flow into the Steavenson River near Marysville .
The Ivaí River ( Portuguese , Rio Ivaí ) is a river of Paraná state in southern Brazil .
The Mtshabezi River is a tributary of the Thuli River in southern Zimbabwe .
The Zarqa River ( Arabic : نهر الزرقاء‎ ) is the second largest tributary of the lower Jordan River , after the Yarmouk River .
A number of smaller streams joined the Little Zab in the Ranya Plain , which is now partly inundated by Lake Dukan .
The Kok River is a tributary of the Mekong River , with its mouth at Sop Kok in Chiang Saen district , opposite the Lao border .
The Radunia ( German : ' Radaune ' ) is a small river in Kashubia ( Pomerelia ) , which issues from a lake and falls into the Motława ( Mottlau ) near Gdańsk ( Danzig ) .
The Adige crosses Trentino and later Veneto , flowing past the city of Verona and the towns of Rovereto and Adria through the Lagarina Valley and the north - eastern part of the Po Plain into the Adriatic Sea .
The Lėvuo is a river in Northern Lithuania , tributary of the river Mūša .
Jacobson rings were introduced independently by Krull ( 1951 , 1952 ) , who named them after Nathan Jacobson because of their relation to Jacobson radicals , and by Goldman ( 1951 ) , who named them Hilbert rings after David Hilbert because of their relation to Hilbert 's Nullstellensatz .
The name is derived from the ancient Veneti people who inhabited the region by the 10th century BC . The city was historically the capital of the Republic of Venice .
The Norian was named after the Noric Alps in Austria .
Brezinaite was named in honour of Aristides Brezina ( 1848 - -1909 ) , a past Director of the Mineralogy - Petrology Section of the Natural History Museum , Vienna , Austria .
The region of Auvergne was named after the Arverni , one of the most powerful Gallic tribes .
In mathematics the Chebyshev polynomials , named after Pafnuty Chebyshev , are a sequence of orthogonal polynomials which are related to de Moivre 's formula and which can be defined recursively .
The Euler angles are three angles introduced by Leonhard Euler to describe the orientation of a rigid body .
The Dvorak Simplified Keyboard ( i / dᵊˈvɔræk/ d - VOR - ak ) is a keyboard layout patented in 1936 by Dr. August Dvorak and his brother - in - law , Dr. William Dealey .
Newton polygons are named after Isaac Newton , who first described them and some of their uses in correspondence from the year 1676 addressed to Henry Oldenburg .
In physics , the Thomas precession , named after Llewellyn Thomas , is a relativistic correction that applies to the spin of an elementary particle or the rotation of a macroscopic gyroscope and relates the angular velocity of the spin of a particle following a curvilinear orbit to the angular velocity of the orbital motion .
Graz Cathedral ( German : Grazer Dom ) , also called St. Giles ' Cathedral ( German : Dom St. Ägidius ) , is the cathedral church in the Austrian city of Graz , dedicated to Saint Giles .
Nikolsky 's sign is a clinical dermatological sign , named after Pyotr Nikolsky ( 1858 - -1940 ) , a Russian physician who trained and worked in Ukraine , which was part of the Russian Empire at that time .
In orbital mechanics , a Lissajous orbit ( pronounced : ( li.sa.ʒu ) ) , named after Jules Antoine Lissajous , is a quasi - periodic orbital trajectory that an object can follow around a Lagrangian point of a three - body system without requiring any propulsion .
Plumbogummite is a rare secondary lead phosphate mineral , belonging to the alunite supergroup of minerals , crandallite subgroup .
Copley Square , named for painter John Singleton Copley , is a public square in Boston 's Back Bay neighborhood , bounded by Boylston Street , Clarendon Street , St. James Avenue , and Dartmouth Street .
Taylor 's theorem is named after the mathematician Brook Taylor , who stated a version of it in 1712 .
In theoretical physics , particularly in discussions of gravitation theories , Mach 's principle ( or Mach 's conjecture ) is the name given by Einstein to an imprecise hypothesis often credited to the physicist and philosopher Ernst Mach .
The Delmarva Peninsula or simply Delmarva is a large peninsula on the East Coast of the United States , occupied by most of Delaware and portions of Maryland and Virginia .
Menachem Mendel Schneerson and Yosef Yitzchok Schneersohn are both descendants of Rabbi Menachem Mendel Schneersohn , known as the Tzemach Tzedek , the third Rebbe of Chabad Lubavitch .
Percival Molson Memorial Stadium ( also known in French as Stade Percival - Molson ; commonly referred to as Molson Stadium in English or Stade Molson in French ) is an outdoor football stadium located downtown on Mount Royal in Montreal , Quebec , Canada .
USS Sunfish ( SSN-649 ) , a Sturgeon - class attack submarine , was the second ship of the United States Navy to be named for the ocean sunfish ( Mola mola ) , a marine species having a deep body truncated behind , and high dorsal and anal fins .
Owenus is a genus of ichneumonid wasp , named for Denis Owen .
The OTR-23 Oka ( Russian : OTP-23 `` Ока '' ; named after Oka River ) was a mobile theatre ballistic missile ( Russian : оперативно-тактический ракетный комплекс ) deployed by the Soviet Union near the end of the Cold War to replace the obsolete SS-1C ' Scud B ' .
In mathematics applied to computer science , Monge arrays , or Monge matrices , are mathematical objects named for their discoverer , the French mathematician Gaspard Monge .
Hafnium is named after Hafnia , the Latin name for Copenhagen , where it was discovered .
The Beaufort cipher , created by Sir Francis Beaufort , is a substitution cipher similar to the Vigenère cipher , with a slightly modified enciphering mechanism and tableau .
Legendre 's conjecture , proposed by Adrien - Marie Legendre , states that there is a prime number between n2 and ( n + 1)2 for every positive integer n. The conjecture is one of Landau 's problems ( 1912 ) on prime numbers ; as of 2015 , the conjecture has neither been proved nor disproved .
The Volterra integral equations were introduced by Vito Volterra and then studied by Traian Lalescu in his 1908 thesis , Sur les équations de Volterra , written under the direction of Émile Picard .
Darwinism is a theory of biological evolution developed by the English naturalist Charles Darwin and others , stating that all species of organisms arise and develop through the natural selection of small , inherited variations that increase the individual 's ability to compete , survive , and reproduce .
The Schelf Church of St. Nicholas ( German : Schelfkirche St. Nikolai ) is an Evangelical Lutheran church dedicated to Saint Nicholas in the Schelfstadt quarter of Schwerin in Germany .
Marshall University is a coeducational public research university in Huntington , West Virginia , United States , founded in 1837 , and named after John Marshall , the fourth Chief Justice of the United States .
Between 1952 and 1989 the university was named Bolesław Bierut University of Wrocław ( Polish : Uniwersytet Wrocławski i m . Bolesława Bieruta ) after Bolesław Bierut , President of the Republic of Poland ( 1947 - -52 ) .
The name Firefox was said to be derived from a nickname of the red panda , which became the mascot for the newly named project .
In algebraic geometry , a Fano fibration or Fano fiber space , named after Gino Fano , is a morphism of varieties whose general fiber is a Fano variety ( in other words has ample anticanonical bundle ) of positive dimension .
The Lénárt sphere was invented by István Lénárt in Hungary in the early 1990s and its use is described in his 2003 book comparing planar and spherical geometry .
Sokoto , usually referred to as Sokoto State to distinguish it from the city of Sokoto , is located in the extreme northwest of Nigeria , near to the confluence of the Sokoto River and the Rima River .
In mathematics , the Lie product formula , named for Sophus Lie ( 1875 ) , states that for arbitrary n × n real or complex matrices A and B , e^(A+B ) = \lim--(N \rightarrow \infty ) ( e^(A / N)e^(B / N))^N , where eA denotes the matrix exponential of A. The Lie--
Hilbert 's fifth problem is the fifth mathematical problem from the problem list publicized in 1900 by mathematician David Hilbert , and concerns the characterization of Lie groups .
The P-500 Bazalt ( Russian : П-500 `` Базальт '' ; English : basalt ) is a turbojet - powered , supersonic cruise missile used by the Soviet and Russian navies .
Officially opened in 1984 and named after Charles , Prince of Wales , Prince of Wales Hospital now provides approximately 1,478 hospital beds and 24 hours accident and emergency service with about 4,470 staff .
In computer science , Hirschberg 's algorithm , named after its inventor , Dan Hirschberg , is a dynamic programming algorithm that finds the optimal sequence alignment between two strings .
The pre - history of Unix dates back to the mid-1960s when the Massachusetts Institute of Technology , AT&T Bell Labs , and General Electric were developing an innovative time - sharing operating system called Multics for the GE-645 mainframe .
The name Burdigalian comes from Burdigala , the Latin name for the city of Bordeaux , France .
Soviet Strike is set after the disintegration of the Soviet Union , and takes place in a fictionalised Russia , Eastern Europe and around the Caspian Sea .
Filmed in Portland , Oregon , What the Bleep Do We Know ! ? presents a viewpoint of the physical universe and human life within it , with connections to neuroscience and quantum physics .
Get Lost ! is a British television drama serial made by Yorkshire Television in 1981 for the ITV network .
The show takes place in Los Angeles , California , where Irish - American Ray Donovan ( Liev Schreiber ) , originally from South Boston , works for the powerful law firm Goldman & Drexler , representing the rich and famous .
Following the departure of Deputy Chief Brenda Leigh Johnson from the Los Angeles Police Department , Captain Sharon Raydor ( McDonnell ) is selected as the new head of its Major Crimes Division .
David Arroyo Durán ( born 7 January 1980 in Talavera de la Reina , Toledo ) is a Spanish professional road bicycle racer , riding on the UCI Professional Continental Team Caja Rural - Seguros RGA .
Baron Johann von Berenberg - Gossler ( born 13 February 1839 in Hamburg , died 8 December 1913 in Hamburg ; né Johann Gossler ) , known as `` John , '' was a German banker from the city - state of Hamburg and owner and head of Berenberg Bank from 1879 until his death .
Ariel Wizman ( born 19 May 1962 ) is a French musician , DJ , journalist and actor born in Casablanca , Morocco .
René Bérenger , born in Bourg - lès - Valence ( Drôme ) on 22 April 1830 and died Alincourt ( Ardennes ) on 29 August 1915 , was a French lawyer , judge , and politician .

Joshua Kadison ( born February 8 , 1963 , Los Angeles , California ) is an American singer - songwriter , pianist , and writer .
Ju Ji - hoon ( Hangul : 주지훈 ; also romanized as Joo Ji - hoon ; born May 16 , 1982 ) is a South Korean actor .
Sankarshan Thakur is an Indian print journalist .
Scarlet Moon de Chevalier ( 1952 -- June 5 , 2013 ) was a Brazilian actress , journalist and writer .
Orlando Tucker ( born February 8 , 1988 ) better known by his stage name Jahlil Beats , is an American hip hop record producer and songwriter from Chester , Pennsylvania .
Jean - Antoine Lépine ( L’Pine , LePine , Lepine , L’Epine ) , born as Jean - Antoine Depigny , was an influential watchmaker .
Johnny Kastl is an American actor , best known for his role as Dr. Doug Murphy on the medical comedy Scrubs .
Mirosław Żuławski ( January 16 , 1913 -- February 17 , 1995 ) was a Polish writer , prosaist , diplomatist and screenwriter .
`` Baby '' Joe Mesi ( born November 27 , 1973 ) is an American retired boxer and politician from Tonawanda , New York .
James Arthur Ray ( born November 22 , 1957 ) is a motivational speaker and author who was convicted of felony negligent homicide .
An Geon - hyeong ( Hangul:안건형 ) ( born Nov 15 , 2000 ) is a South Korean figure skater .
Bert Hadley ( April 12 , 1882 -- December 30 , 1968 ) was an American stage and early silent film actor who appeared in over sixty motion pictures between 1912 and 1927 .
Kristian Sohlberg ( born 15 March 1978 in Espoo ) is a Finnish rally driver , who scored three World Rally Championship points during his career with a best finish of sixth on the 2006 Rally d'Italia Sardegna .
Featuring Roger Redgate as composer and conductor .
Devang Patel is an Indian singer , actor , rapper , songwriter , dancer , film producer , film director and music performer .
Grant Cramer ( born November 10 , 1961 ) is an American actor and producer who has starred in films and on television .
Mel Novak is an American award winning character actor who is best known for villainous roles in Black Belt Jones , Bruce Lee 's Game of Death , and Chuck Norris ' An Eye for An Eye .
Innocenzio Taccone was an Italian painter of the Baroque .
Scot McFadyen is a Canadian film director , producer and music supervisor whose work focuses on the subculture of heavy metal .
After the August Revolution in 1945 , Nguyễn Tuân joined the Communist party and kept working as a writer .
Henriette Major ( January 6 , 1933 -- November 17 , 2006 ) was a Canadian writer living in Quebec .
Brian Silverman is a Canadian computer scientist , the creator of many programming environments for children , and a researcher in cellular automata .
Mariusz Kazana ( August 5 , 1960 -- April 10 , 2010 ) was a Polish diplomat and political figure .
Rebecca Shoichet ( pronounced `` Shoy - ket '' ) ( born February 16 , 1975 ) is a Canadian voice actress and singer working for Ocean Productions in Vancouver , British Columbia .
Teresa Medeiros ( born 1962/1963 ) is a United States award - winning romance novelist with more than eight million books in print .
Andrew Catlin is an English photographer , artist , director , cinematographer , psychology graduate , portrait and documentary photographer and filmmaker .
William Templeman , PC ( September 28 , 1842 -- December 15 , 1914 ) was a Canadian newspaper editor and politician .
Todd Lickliter ( born April 17 , 1955 ) is a college basketball coach who most recently coached at Marian University in Indianapolis .
Meaghan Davies is an Australian born actor working internationally in film , television , radio , and stage .
Roger Labric was a French journalist ( specialising in aviation and motor racing ) and racing driver .
Mamtaz Sanghamita was a physician and an Indian politician .
William Crutchfield ( November 16 , 1824 -- January 24 , 1890 ) was an American politician who represented the 3rd congressional district of Tennessee in the United States House of Representatives for one term ( 1873 - -1875 ) .
Columbia Lancaster ( 1803 - -1893 ) was an American lawyer and politician who served as the first Delegate from the Territory of Washington to the United States House of Representatives .
Rex Chandler is an American actor and former gay pornographic film actor .
Buffy Sainte - Marie , OC ( formerly Beverly Sainte - Marie ; born 1941 ) is a Native Canadian singer - songwriter , musician , composer , visual artist , educator , pacifist , and social activist .
Abderramán Brenes la Roche ( born October 22 , 1978 ) is a Puerto Rican judoka , who played for the half - middleweight category .
Antoine Dayori is a Beninese politician and the leader of the Hope Force ( Force Espoir ) political party .
Paul Chrisman ( born August 23 , 1949 ) , better known by his stage name Woody Paul , is an American singer , fiddler , and composer , best known for his work with the Western swing musical and comedy group Riders in the Sky .
Teofil Żebrawski ( 1800 - -1887 ) was a Polish mathematician , bibliographer , architect , biologist , archeologist , cartographer and geodesist ; an erudite and polymath .
Louise Fitzhugh ( October 5 , 1928 -- November 19 , 1974 ) was an American writer and illustrator of children 's books , known best for the novel Harriet the Spy .
Lucile Petry Leone ( January 23 , 1902 -- November 25 , 1999 ) was an American nurse who was the founding director of the Cadet Nurse Corps in 1943 .
Winlock W. Steiwer ( August 7 , 1852 -- July 18 , 1920 ) was an American banker , rancher , and politician in the state of Oregon .
Murray Mednick ( born 1939 ) is an American playwright and poet .
Cyrus Leo Sulzberger II ( October 27 , 1912 -- September 20 , 1993 ) was an American journalist , diarist , and non - fiction writer .

Paddy Morgan is an Australian former professional snooker player from Ardoyne , Belfast , he was a prominent and successful player of both snooker and English billiards during the 1960s and 70 's .
Gian Tommaso Scarascia Mugnozza ( May 27 , 1925 -- February 28 , 2011 ) is an Italian agronomist and geneticist .

Richard of Staines ( or Richard de Stanes ) was an English clerical judge .

George Radwanski ( February 28 , 1947 -- September 18 , 2014 ) was a public servant , policy adviser , journalist and author .
Chief Olu Oyesanya was a Nigerian journalist and diplomat .
Elizabeth Cook - Lynn ( born 1930 ) is an editor , essayist , poet , novelist , and academic , whose trenchant views on Native American politics , particularly tribal sovereignty , have caused controversy .
Carol Cymbala is the choir director for the Brooklyn Tabernacle Choir .
Dixie Allen ( born January 27 , 1935 ) is a politician from Dayton , Ohio , who served in the Ohio House of Representatives and on the Montgomery County Commission .
Asim Inam Osmani is a successful Pakistani engineer and the director and CEO ( Chief Executive Officer ) of Osmani & Company ( Pvt . ) Ltd. , one of the oldest , largest and most reputed consultancy organizations in Pakistan .
Federico Johow , born as Friedrich Richard Adelbert ( or Adelbart ) Johow ; ( February 5 , 1859 - -April 30 , 1933 ) was a German - Chilean botanist and biologist born in Kolmar , Province of Posen .
SJ Stovall ( September 26 , 1925 -- July 14 , 2010 ) was an American politician and civil engineer .
Nuufolau Joel `` Joe '' Seanoa ( born March 17 , 1979 ) , better known by his ring name Samoa Joe , is an American professional wrestler , currently signed to WWE .
Manke Nelis , born Cornelis Pieters , was a Dutch singer in the levenslied genre .
Ryeisha Berrain ( born November 25 , 1990 ) , known by her stage name Rye Rye , is an American rapper , singer , dancer and actress .
Charles Rappleye is a writer and editor working in Los Angeles .
John Dufilho is an American singer , songwriter and multi - instrumentalist best known as the lead creative talent behind indie rock band The Deathray Davies .
Stephen Schaffer is a film editor who has worked on several films produced by Pixar .
Siavash Alamouti ( Persian : سیاوش الموتی‎ ) is an Iranian - American engineer who is best known for the invention of the Alamouti space -- time block code , filed in 1997 and patented jointly with Vahid Tarokh .

Stephen Hodges ( born February 12 , 1952 ) is an American percussionist and composer .

Wihthun 's last datable subscriptions are to two charters of 805 : a grant by Cuthred , King of Kent , to Archbishop Wulfred , and a grant by Coenwulf , King of Mercia , and Cuthred , King of Kent , to a priest called Wulfhard .

James Roday ( /roʊˈdeɪ/ ; born James David Rodriguez ; April 4 , 1976 ) is an American actor , director and screenwriter .
George Henry Paulin , often called Harry Paulin , or ' GHP ' ( his sculpting insignia ) was a Scottish sculptor and artist of great note in the early 20th century .
Robin Spry ( October 25 , 1939 -- March 28 , 2005 ) was a Canadian film director and television producer and screenwriter .
Nicki Hunter ( born December 19 , 1979 ) is an American pornographic film director , producer , make - up artist , radio personality , and former pornographic actress .
Sir Henry Lello was an English diplomat , warden of the Fleet Prison , and Keeper of the Palace of Westminster .
Tristram Coffin ( August 13 , 1909 - -March 26 , 1990 ) , also known as Tris Coffin , was a film and television actor from the latter 1930s through the 1970s , usually in westerns or other action - adventure productions .

Archie Bleyer ( June 12 , 1909 - March 20 , 1989 ) was an American song arranger , bandleader , and record company executive .
Sujatha Singh is an Indian career diplomat who served as India 's Foreign Secretary from August 2013 to January 2015 .

Herman Hollerith ( February 29 , 1860 -- November 17 , 1929 ) was an American inventor who developed an electromechanical punched card tabulator to assist in summarizing information and , later , accounting .

Néstor García Canclini ( born 1939 ) is an Argentine - born academic and anthropologist , known for his theorization of the concept of `` hybridity . ''
Nora Waln ( 1895 - -1964 ) was a best - selling American writer and journalist in the 1930s--50s , writing books and articles on her time spent in Germany and China .
Ray Cheney is a retired rugby union player and sportsman from Wales .
Pere Oller ( fl . 1394 - 1442 ) was a Catalan Gothic sculptor .

Oli Beaudoin is the drummer of Kataklysm .
María Teresa Chacín ( born in Caracas , January 22 , 1945 ) , is a Venezuelan singer .
Guillem de Berguedà ( c.1130 - -1195/6 ; fl.1138 - -1192 ) , or Guilhem de Berguedan in Occitan , was a Catalan troubadour and viscount of Berguedà .
Robby Blackwell ( born September 21 , 1986 in Dallas , Texas ) is an American singer - songwriter , producer , and instrumentalist .
Philip James ( May 17 , 1890 -- November 1 , 1975 ) was an American composer , conductor and music educator .
Zacharie Dupuy ( 1608 or 1610 -- 1676 ) was a soldier and seigneur in New France .
Gong Hyung - jin ( born April 10 , 1969 ) is a South Korean actor and television host .
Manmohan Nath Sharma ( born November 1924 ) is an Indian architect and a heritage activist .
Jerome Charles White , Jr. ( born September 4 , 1981 ) , better known by his stage name Jero ( ジェロ ) , is an American enka singer of African and Japanese descent .
David P. Campbell is an American psychologist who co - authored the Strong - Campbell Interest Inventory which is widely used in vocational counseling .
Harold Mabern , Jr. ( born March 20 , 1936 ) is an American jazz pianist and composer , principally in the hard bop , post - bop and soul jazz fields .
Louis Sussmann - Hellborn ( March 20 , 1828 -- August 15 , 1908 ) , also spelled Ludwig Sussman Hellborn , was a German sculptor , painter , art collector and contractor .
Howard Ashley ( H.L. Ashley ) was a Scottish architect practicing in Malaya since 1952 .
Ernie Bourassa is a former Canadian politician , who served as mayor of Whitehorse , Yukon from 2000 to 2006 .
Candace Dempsey is an American author , journalist and travel writer .
Sam Granick ( February 16 , 1909 - April 29 , 1977 ) was an American biochemist known for his studies of ferritin and iron metabolism more broadly , of chloroplast structure , and of the biosynthesis of heme and related molecules .
Deyanira África Melo is a Mexican sculptor who generally works in ceramics , depicting elements of the human form , especially the torso , generally with mutilations and other disturbing elements to dispute the otherwise traditional and sensual depictions of the human body .
Mischa Levitzki ( also seen as Levitski ; May 25 , 1898 -- January 2 , 1941 ) was a Russian - born American concert pianist .
William Alonso ( January 29 , 1933 -- February 11 , 1999 ) was an Argentinian - born American planner and economist .
Estefanía Bacca is an Argentine vedette , acrobat - dancer , actress , model and choreographer .
Akira Rabelais is a Los Angeles - based composer and author .
Blanche Willis Howard ( July 20 , 1847 -- October 7 , 1898 ) ( aka Blanche Willis Howard von Teuffel ) was a best - selling American novelist who lived most of her productive years in southern Germany .
Apple Pope is an American rugby league player who currently plays for the United States national team .
Sarah White is a singer - songwriter based in Richmond , Virginia , whose music can be roughly characterized as folk or alt - country .
Peter Alsop ( born September 18 , 1946 ) is an American musician whose work has ranged from satirical music for adults to children 's music .
Mark Abramson was an American record producer and artist .
Jedidiah Morse ( August 23 , 1761 -- June 9 , 1826 ) was a notable geographer whose textbooks became a staple for students in the United States .
Raquel Pennington ( born September 5 , 1988 ) is an American mixed martial artist who competes in Ultimate Fighting Championship women 's bantamweight division .
Lin - Manuel Miranda ( born January 16 , 1980 ) is an American composer , lyricist , librettist , rapper , and actor , best known for creating and starring in the Broadway musicals In the Heights and Hamilton .
Sreerama Chandra Mynampati is a professional singer and 2010 Indian Idol winner from Hyderabad who debuted his playback career in the Telugu film industry .
Liesl Herbst ( born November 8 , 1902 , Jaegerndorf , Silesia ; died February 25 , 1990 , London , England ) was an Austrian championship tennis player .
Jason JetPlane is an American pop , soul , and R&B singer - songwriter , record producer , pianist and drummer .
Baba Shah Esfahani , also known as Baba Shah Araghi , was the most famous Iranian calligrapher in the 16th century and the most prominent calligrapher of Nastaliq script in the era of Tahmasp I. He was titled as Reyis or - Roassa .
Julio María Sosa Venturini ( February 2 , 1926 -- November 26 , 1964 ) , usually referred to simply as Julio Sosa or El Varón del Tango , was a Uruguayan tango singer .
J. Patrick Greene OBE is a British archaeologist and a museum director .
Lorraine Bethel is an African - American lesbian feminist poet and author .
John Brunne or Brun ( died c.1405 ) , of Willingham , Cambridgeshire , was an English politician .
James Timothy Shaw ( August 9 , 1939 -- January 30 , 2014 ) , known as The Mighty Hannibal , was an American R&B , soul and funk singer , songwriter and record producer .
Tim Harford ( born 1973 ) is an English economist and journalist , residing in London .
Chinni Prakash is an Indian film choreographer , art director , actor , script - writer , director .
Thapelo Mokoena is a South African actor and television presenter best known for presenting the first season of the South African version of the reality competition Fear Factor in 2005 .
John Roger Voudouris ( December 29 , 1954 - August 3 , 2003 ) was an American singer - songwriter / guitarist best known for his 1979 hit , `` Get Used to It . ''
Kathleen Hays is a university - trained economist with experience at the Federal Reserve and who is now an on - air financial reporter for Bloomberg Television .
Furthermore , in 2014 , according to ISI Web of Knowledge , Didier Raoult microbiologist is the 7th most cited worldwide .
Pyruz Payandeh Azad ( Persian : پیروز پاینده آزاد‎‎ , born May 4 , 1962 ) is a Persian pop singer , songwriter , guitarist , and former member of the group Black Cats .
Marcus Titius was a Roman politician ( suffect consul in 31 BC ) and commander at the end of the Roman Republic .
J. P. Lockney ( March 17 , 1867 , date of death unknown ) was an American actor of the silent film era .
Randall Wallace ( born July 28 , 1949 ) is an American screenwriter , director , producer , and songwriter who came to prominence by writing the screenplay for the 1995 film Braveheart .
Fred R. Volkmar , M.D. , is a psychiatrist , psychologist , and former director of the Yale Child Study Center .
Oliver Marc Hartwich ( born 8 July 1975 in Gelsenkirchen ) is a German economist and media commentator .
Johnnie Davis , also billed as Johnny Davis and Johnnie `` Scat '' Davis , ( April 11 , 1910 -- October 28 , 1983 ) was an American actor , singer and trumpeter .
Ashin used to be Mayday 's sole composer ; it was only during production of the band 's fifth album that other band members began to contribute their own work .
Liaquat Ahamed ( born on November 14 , 1952 in Kenya ) is a Pulitzer Prize - winning author .
Irving Wallace ( March 19 , 1916 -- June 29 , 1990 ) was an American best - selling author and screenwriter .
Shelley Mayfield ( June 19 , 1924 -- March 22 , 2010 ) was an American golf course architect and professional golfer who played on the PGA Tour in the 1950s .
Clint Baker ( born January 27 , 1971 , in Mountain View , California ) is an American traditional jazz musician performing on cornet , trumpet , trombone , clarinet , saxophone , guitar , banjo , tuba , string bass , and drums .
Molly Smith is an American theatre director and the artistic director of Arena Stage in Washington D.C ..
Benedetto Briosco ( c.1460 - -c.1517 ) was an Italian Renaissance sculptor and architect , active in Lombardy .

Tavo Hellmund ( b. February 24 , 1966 ; Austin , Texas ) is an American former racing driver and promoter .
Aleksandar Miladinovski ( Macedonian : Александар Миладиновски ; born August 4 , 1979 ) is a Macedonian former swimmer , who specialized in butterfly and individual medley events .
Staff Sergeant George T. Alexander Jr. ( August 5 , 1971 -- October 22 , 2005 ) was the 2,000th American soldier killed in combat in Iraq since the beginning of the 2003 Invasion of Iraq , according to the Associated Press .
Donald L. Graham ( born December 15 , 1948 ) is an American lawyer and Senior United States District Judge .
Med Hondo ( born Mohamed Abid Hondo , May 4 , 1936 ) is a Mauritanian film director , producer , screenwriter , actor and voice actor .
Lauren van Oosten ( born November 17 , 1978 ) is a Canadian competition swimmer and a breaststroke specialist .
James Kahn is an American medical specialist and writer , best known for his novelization of Return of the Jedi .
Mauro Maur ( born August 8 , 1958 ) is an Italian trumpeter and composer .
Ratu Suliano Matanitobua is a Fijian chief and politician , who previously served as Minister of State for Fijian Affairs in the early 2000s , and is currently an Opposition Member of Parliament .
Lee Toland Krieger ( born January 24 , 1983 ) is an American film director and screenwriter best known for the films The Vicious Kind ( 2008 ) and Celeste and Jesse Forever ( 2012 ) .
Dixon Hall Lewis ( August 10 , 1802 -- October 25 , 1848 ) was an American politician who served as a Representative and a Senator from Alabama .
Eva Alterman Blay , a Brazilian sociologist , was born in São Paulo in 1937 .
Ashok Shinde ( Marathi:अशोक शिंदे ) is an Indian film and stage actor , who works in Marathi cinema , known for films like Rangat Sangat .
Ketsia is a Haitian - Canadian singer and songwriter , born in Montreal , Quebec .
Julyan Holmes is a Cornish scholar and poet .
Cecilia Jarlskog ( born in 1941 ) is a Swedish theoretical physicist , working mainly on elementary particle physics .
Louis Fabian Bachrach , Jr. ( April 9 , 1917 -- February 26 , 2010 ) was an American photographer , known for portraits of celebrities , politicians , presidents and other prominent individuals .
Robert Smoktunowicz ( pronounced ( ˈrɔbɛrt smɔktuˈnɔvit͡ʂ ) ; born January 30 , 1962 in Warsaw ) is a Polish politician .

John D. Hancock ( born February 12 , 1939 ) is an American stage and film director , producer and writer .

Sam Groom ( born June 13 , 1938 in Columbus , Ohio ) is an actor most noted for his numerous roles on television .

Megan Romano ( born February 2 , 1991 ) is an American competition swimmer who specializes in backstroke and freestyle events .

Peter McDowell is an American politician who represented the 4th Barnstable District in the Massachusetts House of Representatives from 1975 to 1979 .

Jane Thornthwaite ( born 1958 or 1959 ) is a Canadian politician and activist who was elected as a Member of the Legislative Assembly of British Columbia in the 2009 provincial election .

Ross Murdoch ( born 14 January 1994 ) is a Scottish competitive swimmer who has represented Great Britain in the FINA world championships and European championships , and Scotland in the Commonwealth Games .

Kevin Rockett , PhD is an Irish film historian , writer and scholar , considered authoritative on the emergence and growth of scholarship on the history of Irish cinema .
Lord Jamar ( born Lorenzo Dechalus , September 17 , 1968 ) is an American rapper and actor .
Elizabeth Turk is an American sculptor who works primarily with marble , transforming this material into refined pieces infused with classical beauty .

Gary Mauer is an actor who most recently starred in the third national tour of The Phantom of the Opera playing the role of the Phantom .

Liliana Porter is a contemporary artist working in a wide variety of media , including photography , printmaking , mixed media pieces , installation , and video .
Battista di Biagio Sanguigni , formerly known as the Master of 1419 ( active 1393 - -1451 ) was an Italian painter from the region around Florence in the first half of the 15th century .

Paul Biddle is an English fine art photographer , who specialises in creating carefully studied surreal artworks using real objects and studio lighting for artistic effects .

Everett Riskin ( 1895 - 1982 ) was an American film producer , best known for his work at Columbia and MGM , where he specialised in comedies .

Leonard Grunstein ( born July 18 , 1952 ) is an American finance executive , retired lawyer and philanthropist .

Under the stage name of Henri Fursy , he was a chansonnier , a singer of humorous songs , in Montmartre .
Robert Gwiazdowski ( born 1960 ) is a Polish jurist and economist .
Les Stroud ( born October 20 , 1961 ) is a Canadian survival expert , filmmaker and musician best known as the creator , writer , producer , director , cameraman and host of the television series Survivorman .
Walter Frank Woodul ( September 25 , 1892 -- October 1 , 1984 ) was a Texas politician who was an early proponent of a state highway system .
Roger Welsch ( born November 6 , 1936 ) was a senior correspondent on the CBS News Sunday Morning program , and was featured in a segment called `` Postcards from Nebraska . ''

Paula Bourne is a Canadian historian and professional educator whose research , writing and teaching focuses on Canadian women 's history , contemporary issues facing Canadian women , and gender issues and education .
Murray Klein ( March 25 , 1923 -- December 6 , 2007 ) was a Jewish American entrepreneur who helped transform New York City 's famous Zabar 's speciality food emporium from a small Jewish delicatessen based on Manhattan 's Upper West Side into one of the city 's premier culinary destinations .
Alexandra Kotur is an American author and fashion journalist .
Sigurd Solid was a Norwegian ski jumper who competed in the 1930s .

Ernest Kent Coulter ( November 14 , 1871 -- May 1 , 1952 ) , was a War Veteran journalist , lawyer , public administrator , and developer of civil society and human welfare programs most notably through his work in child advocacy .
Walter Inglis Anderson ( September 29 , 1903 -- November 30 , 1965 ) was an American painter , writer , and naturalist .
Dr. Estelle Lazer is a freelance archaeologist who has worked on sites in the Middle East , Italy , Cyprus , the UK , Antarctica and Australia .
Ifeanyi also credited as Ifeanyi Chijindu is a Nigerian - American author / writer , entrepreneur , artist , actress and screenwriter .
Manuel Berberian is an Iranian - Armenian earth scientist , specializing in earthquake seismology , active faulting and folding , active tectonics , continental tectonics , historical seismicity , archaeoseismicity , earthquake hazard minimization , geological mapping , and environmental science and engineering .
Diego Seminario De Col ( born May 12 , 1989 ) is a Peruvian actor and industrial designer .
Francis Towne ( 1739 or 1740 -- 7 July 1816 ) was a British watercolour landscape painter and teacher , who spent his career between his native London and Exeter .
Adam Busch ( born July 6 , 1978 ) is an American actor best known starring as Warren Mears on the television series Buffy the Vampire Slayer .
In October 1942 , at the age of 22 , Hildegard Lächert , a German nurse , was called to serve at Majdanek as an Aufseherin .
Enrique Tirabocchi ( variously spelled as Enrico Tiraboschi ) was an Argentinian marathon swimmer who in August 1926 became the fourth person to successfully swim across the English Channel .
Marie Meyer ( born July 18 , 1984 ) in Mulhouse , France is an actress and model .
Sandahl Bergman ( born November 14 , 1951 ) is an American dancer , stuntwoman , and actress .
Rafael Bolívar Coronado was a Venezuelan composer and author .
H. John Caulfield ( March 25 , 1936 -- January 31 , 2012 ) was a well - known American physicist who specialized in holography and optical computing .

Mark Ramos Nishita , known professionally as Money Mark , is an American producer and musician , best known for his collaborations with the Beastie Boys from 1992 until 2011 .
Adam Purple ( November 10 , 1930 -- September 14 , 2015 ) was an activist and urban Edenist or `` Guerrilla Gardener '' famous in New York City for his `` Garden of Eden '' .
Takeo Shiota ( July 13 , 1881 - December 3 , 1943 ) was a Japanese - American landscape architect , best known for his design of the Japanese Hill - and - Pond Garden at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden .
Johan Gottlieb Gahn ( August 19 , 1745 -- December 8 , 1818 ) was a Swedish chemist and metallurgist who discovered manganese in 1774 .
Professor Lawrence Lau Juen - yee , JP ( Chinese : 劉遵義 ; born 1944 ) is a Hong Kong economist and the former Vice - Chancellor of the Chinese University of Hong Kong .
Nate Bauers ( born March 11 , 1982 in Oakton , Virginia ) was a professional lacrosse player with the Washington Bayhawks of Major League Lacrosse .
Mark Lukasiewicz ( born March 8 , 1973 in Jersey City , New Jersey ) is a former professional baseball player who played two seasons for the Anaheim Angels of Major League Baseball .
Tang Xiaodan ( Chinese : 汤晓丹 ; February 22 , 1910 -- January 21 , 2012 ) was a Chinese film director .
Ryan Zoghlin is an artist and photographer .
Vera Katz ( born August 3 , 1933 ) is an American Democratic politician in the state of Oregon .
Tom Sturges is an American music executive , teacher , speaker , and author .
Sadia Groguhé ( born November 9 , 1962 ) , is a French - Canadian politician .
Fily Dabo Sissoko is chiefly remembered as one of the most influential political leaders of pre - independence Mali , primary conservative rival to Mali 's first President Modibo Keita , and an influential writer of the Negritude movement .
Christie Brinkley ( born Christie Lee Hudson ; February 2 , 1954 ) is an American model and actress .
Abe Olman ( December 20 , 1887 -- January 4 , 1984 ) , born Abraham Olshewitz , was an American songwriter and music publisher .
Jolin Tsai ( Chinese : 蔡依林 , born September 15 , 1980 ) is a Taiwanese singer , songwriter , dancer , actress and entrepreneur .
Julien Mertine ( born 26 June 1988 ) is a French foil fencer , team European and team World champion in 2014 .
Jihad Khodr ( born December 30 , 1983 ) is a Brazilian professional surfer .
Daniel Lapaine ( born 15 June 1971 ) is an Australian stage , film and television actor , currently residing in London .
Toanui Isamaela is a Cook Islands politician and member of the Cook Islands Parliament , representing the Amuri - Ureia Constituency .
Edward Gaylord Bourne , Ph . D. ( June 24 , 1860 -- February 24 , 1908 ) was an American historian , born in Strykersville , New York , and educated at Yale graduating in 1883 with high honors .
Kenneth Harlan ( July 26 , 1895 -- March 6 , 1967 ) was an American actor of the silent film era , playing mostly romantic leads or adventurer types .
Brendan Price is a British theatre , movie , and television actor .
Dr. Laurie Rozakis ( born July 20 , 1952 ) is a writer of the Complete Idiots books and an expert on writing , grammar , usage , test preparation , and coaching writers .
Michael L. Marin is an American vascular surgeon , the first in the United States to perform minimally invasive aortic aneurysm surgery ( stent graft procedure ) together with Drs . Frank Veith , Juan C. Parodi and Claudio J. Schonholz .
Tony Swartz ( born September 24 , 1943 in Iowa as Russell Anthony Swartz ) is an American actor whose roles include Flight Sergeant Jolly on the original Battlestar Galactica television series .
Iowa athletic director Bump Elliott took Bob Commings up on his challenge , making him the 23rd head coach in the history of Iowa football by signing him to a one - year contract for the 1974 season .
Milan Smrčka , more known as Záviš , is a Czech singer , guitarist and poet .
Jan Staller is an American photographer who captures imagery of urban landscapes that focus on patterns of highway graveyards , unfinished buildings , and ongoing construction sites .
Samuel Prescott Hildreth ( 1783 - -1863 ) was a pioneer physician , scientist , and historian , authoring numerous scientific and historical works .
Richard La Ruina is a London - based entrepreneur , author and dating coach .
Nicholas Huddleston ( fl . 1404 ) , of Lincoln , was an English politician .
John Malcolm Macgregor CVO ( born 3 October 1946 ) is a retired British diplomat who was ambassador to Poland and Austria .
Faith Hill ( born Audrey Faith Perry ; September 21 , 1967 ) is an American country pop singer and occasional actress .
Andrew Fried ( born February 10 , 1976 in Long Beach , New York ) is an American television and film producer and president of Boardwalk Pictures .
Tracy Claeys ( born December 25 , 1968 ) is an American football coach who is currently the head coach at the University of Minnesota .
Edward Hyland , more commonly known as Eddie Hyland , ( born 24 April 1984 in Dublin , Ireland ) is an Irish professional boxer who fights in the super featherweight division .
Mingjie Zhang ( Chinese : 张明杰 ) , born in Ningbo , is a famous structural biologist in China .
Frank E. Mann ( May 1 , 1920 -- April 25 , 2007 ) was a politician from the state of Virginia .
Nicholas Lens ( born 1957 ) is a Belgian composer of contemporary music , particularly known for his operas .
Felix Octave Pavy ( November 27 , 1879 -- May 13 , 1962 ) , was a physician and Democratic politician from Opelousas , Louisiana .
Irv Bauer also known as Irvin S. Bauer was an American playwright , screenwriter , educator and theatre critic based in New York .
Priyanka Singh Rawat is politician from Bhartiya Janata Party .
Michael Stahl - David ( born October 28 , 1982 ) is an American actor , known for his role as Sean Donnelly on the NBC drama series The Black Donnellys and his lead role in the J. J. Abrams - produced film Cloverfield .
Luis Orlando Lagos Vásquez ( January 17 , 1913 -- February 4 , 2007 ) , also known as `` Chico Lagos '' , was a Chilean photographer best known for his work photographing Chilean president Salvador Allende .
Slade Callaghan ( born August 21 , 1970 in Bridgetown , Barbados ) is a jockey in Thoroughbred horse racing .
Hamish McLeod is a former East African cricketer , who played in the 1975 Cricket World Cup .
Andre Brandon deWilde ( April 9 , 1942 -- July 6 , 1972 ) was an American theatre , film , and television actor .
Daisy Mallory ( born May 19 , 1993 ) is a country music singer - songwriter based in Nashville , Tennessee .
Kazimierz Ludwik Bieliński ( ? -1713 ) was a Polish noble , politician and diplomat .
Richard Ned Lebow ( legal date of birth , April 24 , 1942 ) is an American political scientist best known for his work in international relations , political psychology , classics and philosophy of science .
Michael T. Goodrich is a mathematician and computer scientist .
Rosalba Géraldine Bazán Ortíz ( born January 30 , 1983 ) is a Mexican actress , singer , and anchorwoman currently living in Miami .
Cliffton Hall ( born February 10 , 1975 in Oakland , California ) is an American theater actor and singer .
Harley Gaber ( June 5 , 1943 -- June 16 , 2011 ) was a visual artist and composer known for his minimalist and spectral approaches to time and sound .
Hayley Marie Kohle ( May 6 , 1982 -- October 11 , 2008 ) was a Canadian fashion model active in the 2000s .
Lorenzo di Pierfrancesco de ' Medici ( August 4 , 1463 -- May 20 , 1503 ) , nicknamed the Popolano , was an Italian banker and politician , and the brother of Giovanni il Popolano .
Tony Leech is an American director , screenwriter and actor .
Ettore Muti ( May 2 , 1902 - -August 24 , 1943 ) was an Italian aviator and Fascist politician .
Carlos Wilcox ( October 22 , 1794 - May 29 , 1827 ) was a minor American poet .
Cristina Otero ( born Cristina Otero Pascual ; November 29 , 1995 ) is a Spanish photographer and artist best known for her self portraits .
Carlos Gamerro is an Argentinean novelist , critic , and translator .
Anita West is a British actress and former television presenter .
Stephen Dorff ( born July 29 , 1973 ) is an American actor , known for portraying Stuart Sutcliffe in Backbeat , Johnny Marco in Sofia Coppola 's Somewhere , and for his roles in Blade , Cecil B. DeMented , The Motel Life , and Space Truckers .
Mohsin Naqvi ( 1947−1996 ) was a renowned Pakistani poet .
Mir Bandeh Ali Khan Talpur ( Urdu : میر بندہ علی خان تالپور ‎ ) was a politician from Sindh , Pakistan .
William Wagstaff , commonly known as Will Wagstaff , is a leading ornithologist and naturalist in the Isles of Scilly , and also an author .
Chow Chi Yuen ( Chinese:周至元 ) , born in Shunde , Guangdong , China , is a Chinese entrepreneur and the founder of Chow Tai Fook Jewellry Company .
Jeff Dawson is a Canadian record producer , song writer , engineer , and mixer .
Cícero Moraes is a Brazilian 3D designer , which through open source programs like InVesalius , Blender and MakeHuman has become a reference in the field of forensic facial reconstruction in his country .
Máiréad Carlin is an Irish singer and a member of the ensemble Celtic Woman .
George Duning ( February 25 , 1908 -- February 27 , 2000 ) was an American musician and film composer .
Charlie Ellix is an English former darts player .

Liran Shoshan , better known by his stage name Lyrik ( in Hebrew ליריק ) , is an Israeli music producer , songwriter and singer born in Jerusalem , Israel .
Sofia Cocea , also known under her married name as Sofia Chrisoscoleu or Sofia Hrisoscoleu ( 1839 - -1861 ) , was a Moldavian - born Romanian essayist , journalist and poet .
James C. Leary ( born August 26 , 1973 ) is an American actor best known for his portrayal of the relatively benign demon Clem who appears in Seasons Six and Seven of the television series Buffy the Vampire Slayer .
Heinrich Lamm , a Jewish physician , was a pioneer of using optical fibers for communication purpose .
Katherine Tate ( born November 8 , 1962 ) is an American political scientist best known for her research on race and ethnic minority politics .
Oliver Evans ( September 13 , 1755 -- April 15 , 1819 ) was an American inventor , engineer and businessman .
Paz Lenchantin ( born December 12 , 1973 ) is an Argentine American musician .
David Leppard is a British journalist and assistant investigations editor of The Sunday Times .
Gary Talley ( born August 17 , 1947 ) is an American guitarist , singer , songwriter and author .
John Edward Heys ( born April 24 , 1948 ) is an American independent filmmaker , actor and writer who lives and works in Berlin .
Archibald McIntyre ( June 1 , 1772 Kenmore , Perthshire , Scotland -- May 6 , 1858 Albany , Albany County , New York ) was an American merchant and politician .
Rod Monroe ( born August 20 , 1942 ) is an American Democratic politician from the US state of Oregon .
John N. Bambacus ( born May 28 , 1945 ) is an American politician , and represented District 1 in the Maryland Senate , which covers Garrett , Allegany , and Washington Counties .
Graduate from the École centrale de Lyon ( promotion 1979 ) , Hervé Renaudeau began his career as a hardware design engineer on the Mirage 2000 autopilot from 1980 to 1981 , then as a simulator design engineer for company Crouzet ( 1981 - -1984 ) .
William Shaler ( 1773 -- March 29 , 1833 ) was an American government official who served as a diplomat and confidential agent in several foreign locations , including Algiers , Mexico and Cuba .
Linda A. Morabito ( born November 21 , 1953 ) , also known as Linda Kelly , Linda Hyder , and Linda Morabito - Meyer , is the astronomer who made the discovery of volcanic activity on Io , a moon of Jupiter , on March 9 , 1979 , at NASA 's Jet Propulsion Laboratory .
Frankie Chan Fan - kei ( born 1951 ) is a Chinese martial arts actor , film director , producer , action director , and composer .
Eugen Felix ( born 27 of April 1836 , died 21 of August 1906 ) was an Austrian painter .
Herbert Pigg ( 4 September 1856 -- 8 June 1913 ) was an English cricketer who played first - class cricket for Cambridge University , the Marylebone Cricket Club ( MCC ) and other amateur sides between 1877 and 1891 .
Norman M. Scott was a Canadian figure skater who competed in both single skating and pair skating .
Brett Grimley ( born 3 March 1960 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played for Fitzroy in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) during the 1980s .
Hamza El Din ( July 10 , 1929 -- May 22 , 2006 ) was a Nubian Egyptian composer , oud player , tar player , and vocalist .
Andre Cason ( born January 20 , 1969 ) is an American former sprinter and a convicted fraudster .
Per Flatberg ( born September 18 , 1937 ) is a Norwegian environmentalist and pharmacist .
Jessica Cambensy , also known as Jessica C. ( born April 18 , 1988 ) is an American - born model and actress .
Steve Roccaforte ( born May 21 , 1965 ) is currently an assistant men 's basketball coach at Virginia Tech . He joined Buzz Williams ' staff on July 9 , 2014 after three seasons as an assistant at the University of South Florida .
Arthur Fehr , F.A.I.A. ( November 19 , 1904 - January 23 , 1969 ) was an American architect who turned in mid - career from his traditional architectural education to the Modern or International style and was one of its first practitioners in Texas .
David Reilly ( May 5 , 1971 -- October 16 , 2005 ) was the singer and songwriting / production partner in the electro - rock band God Lives Underwater ( GLU ) , signed by Rick Rubin to American Recordings in 1993 .
Georg Heike ( German : ( ˈɡeːɔʁk ˈhaɪkə ) ; born July 21 , 1933 ) is a German phonetician and linguist .
Barbara Plett - Usher is a Canadian born UK journalist with experience in the Middle East and the UN .
Yacouba Sawadogo is a farmer from the west African nation of Burkina Faso who has been successfully using a traditional farming technique called Zaï to restore soils damaged by desertification and drought .
Richard McKeon ( /məˈkiːən/ ; April 26 , 1900 -- March 31 , 1985 ) was an American philosopher .
George Huntston Williams ( April 7 , 1914 in Huntsburg -- October 6 , 2000 ) was an American professor of Unitarian theology and historian of the Socinian movement .
Stewart MacFarlane is a figurative Australian painter .
Ben Lyon ( February 6 , 1901 -- March 22 , 1979 ) was an American actor and a studio executive at 20th Century Fox .

Peter Thomas Ruocco , also known as Peter Ruocco , is an American film actor , theatre actor , and theatre director based in San Francisco , California .
Sharon Sayles Belton ( born May 13 , 1951 ) is an American community leader , politician and activist .
Larry Correia is an American fantasy novelist , known for his Monster Hunter and Grimnoir Chronicles series .
Luigi Pagano was an Italian painter , known for his colorful depictions of his native Campania .
Jan Goldsmith is a Republican politician from San Diego , CA who currently serves as the San Diego City Attorney .
Ken Overlin ( August 15 , 1910 -- July 24 , 1969 ) , was an American - born middleweight boxer who fought professionally from 1931 to 1944 , compiling a record of 131 wins ( 23 by knockout ) , 18 losses , and 9 draws .
Dorothy von Beroldingen ( d. December 20 , 1999 ) was an American lawyer , judge , and political figure .
William Thomas Lucas ( July 26 , 1875 -- March 27 , 1973 ) was a Canadian farmer and a federal politician .
Jacob Sacks is an American jazz pianist and composer .
Benito Canónico ( January 3 , 1894 -- October 13 , 1971 ) was a Venezuelan composer , musician , orchestrator and teacher .

Charan , is an Indian film playback singer , actor , and producer known for his works primarily in Tamil Cinema Son of popular Indian singer S. P. Balasubrahmanyam , he first worked as a playback singer in the Tamil and Telugu cinema .
Beverly Thomson ( born April 15 , 1966 ) is a Canadian journalist and co - host of Canada AM , CTV 's national morning show .
Percy Brand Blanshard ( August 27 , 1892 -- November 19 , 1987 ) was an American philosopher known primarily for his defense of reason .
Mikuláš of Kadaň ( Czech : Mikuláš z Kadaně ) was an Imperial clockmaker who designed the clock machine of Prague Orloj together with Jan Šindel around 1410 ( the Emperor at that time was Wenceslas IV ) .
Bobby Few ( born October 21 , 1935 ) is an American jazz pianist and vocalist .
Fatmawati Salapuddin is a Filipino politician and director of the Sulu - based Lupah Sug Bangsamoro Women 's Association .
Denise McCann ( born December 16 , 1948 , in Clinton , Iowa ) is an American - Canadian singer / songwriter .
Ed Peranio is an American film actor and associate production designer , working primarily in the films of John Waters .
Harrison R. Crandall ( November 23 , 1887 -- December 14 , 1970 ) was an American photographer and painter known for his images of Grand Teton National Park .
Michael Cashmore is a British composer and musician who has created music under the name of Nature And Organisation and more recently ( 2006 ) under his own name .
Pan Wu - hsiung ( Chinese : 潘武雄 ; pinyin : Pān Wǔxióng ; Wade -- Giles : Pan1 Wu3 Hsiung2 ; born March 11 , 1981 ) is a Taiwanese baseball player who currently plays for Uni - President Lions of Chinese Professional Baseball League .
Jacek Kawalec ( born 22 September 1961 in Warsaw ) is a Polish actor , game show and television personality .
Shira Gorshman ( April 10 , 1906 -- April 4 , 2001 ) was a Yiddish language short story writer and memoirist .
Claudio Marrero ( born March 6 , 1986 ) is a boxer from the Dominican Republic that fought for the interim WBA featherweight title .
Jon Dette ( born April 19 , 1970 ) is a heavy metal drummer , best known for playing in Evildead , Iced Earth , Slayer , Testament , Anthrax , and Heathen .
Steve Brennan ( born 2 February 1951 ) is a former darts player who competed in the 1980s .
Heinrich Hora ( born 1931 in Bodenbach , Czechoslovakia ) is a German - Australian theoretical physicist who made contributions to solid state physics , optical properties of plasma with relativistic and quantum effects and nonlinear dynamics with applications of lasers for producing nuclear fusion energy .
Irvin Willat ( November 18 , 1890 -- April 17 , 1976 ) was an American film director of the silent film era .
Donnie Williams ( born July 26 , 1983 ) is an American soul , gospel and jazz singer - songwriter who in 2004 became a Top 32 Finalist in Season 3 of American Idol .
Kálmán Kittenberger ( Léva , October 10 , 1881 - Nagymaros , January 4 , 1958 ) was a Hungarian traveller , natural historian , biologist and collector .

Anthony Wheatley ( 176 ? - 1838 ) was an Epsom Derby winning jockey of the 18th century .
Lucie Bertaud is a French amateur boxer and MMA fighter .
Habib Azar ( born October 19 , 1979 in Pennsylvania , USA ) is an American film , theater and television director .
Dee Molenaar ( born June 21 , 1918 ) is an American mountaineer , author and artist from Tacoma , Washington .
Hiroshige Koyama ( born 1937 ) is a Japanese botanist specialist of Asteraceae .
Calvert Charlton Miller , ( September 3 , 1899 - July 1 , 1978 ) , was a Canadian lawyer , politician and jurist .
Imee Ooi ( /ˈiːmiː ˈwuːiː/ EE - mee WOO - ee ; Ch : 黃慧音 , pinyin : Huáng Huìyīn ) is a Chinese - Malaysian record producer , composer , and singer who composes and arranges music for classic Buddhist chant , mantra , and dharani .
Buster Mathis ( June 11 , 1943 -- September 6 , 1995 ) was a boxer who had a very successful career as an amateur heavyweight boxer .

Manfred Thiesmann is a former German Olympic swimming coach of the 1970s , 1980s , 1990s and 2000s who was the head coach of the German swimming team at the 2000 Summer Olympics .
Joe Hurley ( born 2 December ) is a singer , songwriter , actor , playwright and voice - over artist .
Stephen Holden ( born July 18 , 1941 ) is an American writer , music critic , film critic , and poet .
Maxut Zhumayev ( born December 23 , 1976 ) is a Kazakhstani mountaineer who climbed all 8,000 metres ( 26,000 ft ) peaks without oxygen .
Mrinalini Sharma is an Indian model and Bollywood actress .
Daniel Pierce Thompson ( October 1 , 1795 -- June 6 , 1868 ) was an American author and lawyer who served as Vermont Secretary of State and was New England 's most famous novelist prior to Nathaniel Hawthorne .
Martin Reimann is a psychologist and marketing researcher .
Robert Dowland ( ca . 1591 -- 1641 ) was an English lutenist and composer .
Chris Horrie is a journalist and writer specialising in investigative journalism , finance and profiles of major public figures .

Randal William McGavock ( 1826 - -1863 ) was an American lawyer , Democratic politician , Southern planter , and Confederate Lt . Colonel .
Pius Heinz ( born 4 May 1989 ) is a German professional poker player from Bonn , best known as the winner of the Main Event at the 2011 World Series of Poker .
Freculf ( Freculphus Lexoviensis ; died 8 October 850 or 852 ) , a Frankish ecclesiastic , diplomat and historian , was a pupil of the palace school of Aachen during the reign of Charlemagne and Bishop of Lisieux from about 824 until his death .
Karen Lee Orzolek ( born November 22 , 1978 ) , better known by her stage name Karen O , is a South Korean - born American singer and musician .
Gustav Renker ( October 12 , 1889 -- July 23 , 1967 ) was an Austrian and Swiss journalist and writer known for his literary regionalism .
Lila Latrous ( Arabic : ليلى العتروس‎ ; born July 15 , 1979 ) is an Algerian judoka , who played for the lightweight category .

Jana Korbasová ( born March 20 , 1974 ) is a Slovak former swimmer , who specialized in backstroke and in individual medley events .
Ryan Singer is a Navajo contemporary painter living in Albuquerque , New Mexico .
Ingrīda Latimira , formerly Ingrīda Ūdre , ( born November 14 , 1958 ) is a Latvian politician who belongs to the Latvian Farmers ' Union political party .
Linden Soles ( born October 26 , 1956 in Winnipeg , Manitoba ) is a Canadian television journalist , best known to international audiences as an anchor on CNN .
Herb Jaffe ( May 20 , 1921 -- December 7 , 1991 ) was an independent film producer in the United States .
In early 2008 , Guo Quan , a university professor who had been dismissed after having founded a democratic opposition party , announced plans to sue Yahoo ! ( Chief Executive Jerry Yang ) and Google in the United States for having blocked his name from search results in China .
Robert Paige ( December 2 , 1911 -- December 21 , 1987 ) was an actor and a TV newscaster and political correspondent and Universal Pictures leading man who made 65 films in his lifetime : he was the only actor ever allowed to sing on film with Deanna Durbin ( in 1944 's Ca n't Help Singing ) .
Purshottam Solanki is a Bhartiya Janata Party politician and ( as of 2012 ) the Minister of Fishery in the Government of Gujarat .
Englés ( fl . 1253 ) was a Navarrese jongleur and troubadour of the mid 13th century .

Dominic Reyes is a professional sleight of hand magician from England .

Florent Mothe ( born May 13 , 1981 ) is a French singer , actor and musician .

Mike Quin ( 1906 - -1947 ) was the pen name of an American writer , born Paul William Ryan .
Richard Stephen Shaw ( born December 8 , 1966 ) , better known by the stage names Bushwick Bill and Dr. Wolfgang Von Bushwickin the Barbarian Mother - Funky Stay High Dollar Billstir , is a Jamaican - born American rapper .
Amy Kohn ( born June 5 , 1972 ) is an American composer , lyricist , singer , pianist and accordionist .
Phalon Alexander , professionally known as Jazze Pha ( /ˌdʒæzi ˈfeɪ/ JAZ - ee FAY ) , is an American record producer , songwriter and rapper from Atlanta , Georgia .
Jason Adams ( born February 7 , 1964 ) , often known as Ash Adams , is an award - winning American independent filmmaker , producer , writer , and TV and movie actor .
Jesse Tyler Ferguson ( born October 22 , 1975 ) is an American actor best known for portraying Mitchell Pritchett on the ABC sitcom Modern Family , which has earned him five nominations for the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Comedy Series .
Milislav Demerec ( January 11 , 1895 -- April 12 , 1966 ) was a Croatian - American geneticist , and the director of the Department of Genetics , Carnegie Institution of Washington ( CIW ) , now Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory ( CSHL ) from 1941 to 1960 , recruiting Barbara McClintock and Alfred Hershey .
Seamus Lynch ( born 1945 ) is a former Irish republican and socialist politician .
Karl Gustaf Scherman ( born August 30 , 1938 ) is a Swedish economist and government official .
Lu Hsi - chuen is a Taiwanese professional golfer .
Awam Amkpa is a Nigerian actor , playwright , and professor of dramatic arts .
Gurpreet Sandhu ( born March 16 , 1965 ) is an Indian - based entrepreneur .
Luke Pinder is a 27-year - old British rally driver from Shipley , West Yorkshire .
John Watkins Oliver ( December 17 , 1914 -- April 25 , 1990 ) was a United States federal judge ; born in Cape Girardeau , Missouri , Oliver received an A.B. from the University of Missouri in 1933 and an LL.B. from the University of Missouri School of Law in 1936 .
Hanns Goebl ( June 23 , 1901 -- August 12 , 1986 ) was a Bavarian sculptor who worked for the Nymphenburg Porcelain Factory .
Elliot Ngok Wah , better known as Yueh Hua , is a former Shaw Brothers actor and veteran TVB actor .
Daniel Elbittar Villegas ( April 30 , 1979 ) , is a Venezuelan actor , model and entertainer , considered one of the 50 Most Beautiful TV , is also famous for acting in soap operas .
Dagmar Nordstrom ( December 12 , 1903 -- April 9 , 1976 ) was an American composer , pianist and singer .
Juan Manuel Márquez Méndez ( born August 23 , 1973 ) is a Mexican professional boxer and multiple - time world champion .
Emerico Amari ( 1810 - -1870 ) was an Italian jurist and a pioneer of comparative law .
Jack Szwergold is a comedy writer and the Webby - Award - winning first webmaster for the news parody publication The Onion .
Joel Townsley Rogers ( 1896 - -1984 ) was an American writer who wrote science fiction , air - adventure , and mystery stories and a handful of mystery novels .
Imran Hasnee ( Hindi : इमरान हसनी ) is an actor who has worked in Hollywood films A Mighty Heart and Slum Dog Millionaire , played lead as well as character roles .
John Henry Haaren ( born August 13 , 1855 , New York , New York -- d. September 23 , 1916 , Brooklyn , New York ) was an American educator and historian .
Kenneth S. Deffeyes is a geologist who worked with M. King Hubbert , the creator of the Hubbert peak theory , at the Shell Oil Company research laboratory in Houston , Texas .
José Clímaco ( born 1924 ) was a Filipino film director .
Benjamin M. Coates ( September 8 , 1819 - August 26 , 1880 ) was an American miner , businessman , and politician .
Elizabeth Llewellyn , ( born 1974 ) is a British opera singer who debuted with the English National Opera in 2010 .
Asi Cohen ( Hebrew : אסי כהן , also ' Assi ' ; born October 10 , 1974 ) is an Israeli comedian and actor .
Dirk Mai is an American photographer , currently working for Cliché Magazine .
Nancy Rawles is an African American playwright , novelist , and teacher .
Gil Formosa is a French cartoonist and an illustrator .
Raouf Benabid ( Arabic : رؤوف بن عبيد‎ ; born August 3 , 1985 ) is an Algerian former swimmer , who specialized in individual medley events .
Heimann Hariton Tiktin ( August 9 , 1850 -- March 13 , 1936 ) , born Heimann Tiktin , was a Silesian - born Romanian Jewish linguist and academic , one of the founders of modern Romanian linguistics .
Brian O'Sullivan ( born 1990 in Ballygunner ) is an Irish hurler who plays for both the Waterford Inter - county hurling team and the Ballygunner GAA club .

Mykola Puzderko ( born June 13 , 1990 ) is a Ukrainian freestyle skier , specializing in aerials .
Martha Matilda Harper ( September 10 , 1857 , Oakville , Ontario -- August 3 , 1950 , Rochester , New York ) was a Canadian - American businesswoman , entrepreneur , and inventor who built an international network of franchised hair salons that emphasized healthy hair care .
William S. Dalton is an American physician and oncologist , who is board certified in internal medicine and oncology .
Filippo Bottino ( December 9 , 1888 - October 18 , 1969 ) was an Italian weightlifter and Olympic champion .
Anna Karin Larsson ( born 30 August 1941 ) is a retired Swedish swimmer who won a bronze medal at the 1958 European Aquatics Championships in the 4×100 m freestyle relay .
Muffy Calder OBE FRSE FREng ( née Thomas ) is a Scottish computer scientist , Vice - Principal and Head of College of Science and Engineering , and Professor of Formal Methods at the University of Glasgow .
Edward Einhorn ( born September 6 , 1970 ) is an American playwright , theater director , and novelist , noted for the comic absurdism of his drama and the imaginative richness of his literary works .
Carl - Johan Häggman ( born 22 February 1963 Helsinki ) ( also called : Carl Johan Haggman or `` Haggis '' ) is a Finnish composer , musician and multi - artist .
Dario Varotari the Younger ( active 1660 ) was an Italian painter , engraver , and poet of the Baroque .
Neil Metcalfe from Leeds is a former international standard competitive swimmer .
Caroline Woodruff is an English voice - over artist and actor based in Stockport .
William Herbert Rollins is a forgotten American scientist and dentist .
John Alan Maxwell ( March 7 , 1904 -- April 13 , 1984 ) was an American artist known primarily for his book and magazine illustrations , as well as historical paintings .
Olafur Eliasson ( Icelandic : Ólafur Elíasson ; born 1967 ) is a Danish - Icelandic artist known for sculptures and large - scale installation art employing elemental materials such as light , water , and air temperature to enhance the viewer 's experience .
Kathryn Casey is an American true crime writer , novelist and journalist .
Mark Lindley ( born 1937 ) is a noted musicologist and , more recently , a historian of modern India , and a teacher of economics .
Anis Chedly ( Arabic : انيس الشاذلي‎ ; born February 19 , 1981 ) is a Tunisian judoka who competed in the super heavyweight division ( + 100 kg ) and open class .
Charles B. Curtis ( born April 27 , 1940 ) is an American lawyer , currently the President Emeritus and Board Member of the Nuclear Threat Initiative ( NTI ) , a non - profit organization working to reduce the threats from nuclear , biological and chemical weapons .
Almon Harris Thompson ( September 24 , 1839 -- July 31 , 1906 ) , also known as `` A. H. Thompson '' , was an educator , topographer , geologist , explorer , and Civil War veteran .

Stanley Wasserman ( born August 29 , 1951 ) is an American statistician and Rudy Professor of Statistics , Psychology , and Sociology at Indiana University Bloomington , known for his work on social network analysis , mathematical sociology , network science and multidimensional network .
Lee Irby ( born 1963 ) is an American novelist and historian .
Charlie Brill ( born January 13 , 1938 , Brooklyn , New York ) is an American actor , voice artist , and comedian .
