Thomas Polk ( c. 1732 - -January 25 , 1794 ) was a planter , military officer in the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War from 1775 to 1781 , and a politician who served in the North Carolina House of Commons , North Carolina Provincial Congress , and Council of State .
Alfredo Donelli was a leading Italian cinematographer who worked on a number of silent films including the largely abandoned Italian - shot scenes of MGM 's blockbuster Ben Hur ( 1925 ) .
Robert Bruce Moser ( November 24 , 1916 -- October 14 , 2015 ) , known as Bruce Mozert , was an American photographer .
Christopher Galloway was a Scottish engineer and architect who worked in Russia during the reign of Tsar Mikhail ( 1621 - -1645 ) .
Dr June Jackson Christmas is a psychiatrist , a former New York City Commissioner of Mental Health and Mental Retardation Services , member of President Jimmy Carter transition team , the beneficiary of Human - Services Award , the founder of a community psychiatric program in Harlem - Harlem Rehabilitation Center .
Brent Laing ( born December 10 , 1978 in Meaford , Ontario ) is a Canadian curler currently residing in Calgary , Alberta .
Mojib Latif ( born September 29 , 1954 ) is German meteorologist and oceanographer of Pakistani descent .
Sydney Ball is an Australian abstract painter .
Gün Sazak ( March 26 , 1932 -- May 27 , 1980 ) was a Turkish nationalist politician and former government minister who was assassinated in a terrorist attack by left wing militants .
Tristan Dyer is an American film director , stop - motion animator , and Iraq war veteran from Waldoboro , Maine .
Rajkumar Santoshi is an Indian film director , producer and screenwriter of Hindi films .
Tshepo Mhozya ( born on November 29 , 1985 in Botswana ) is a Botswana cricketer and is the current captain of Botswana national cricket team .
Randy Halberstadt ( born May 1 , 1953 in New York , New York ) is an American jazz pianist , composer , recording artist , author , and teacher .
Joseph Goldberger ( Hungarian : Goldberger József ) ( July 16 , 1874 -- January 17 , 1929 ) was an American physician and epidemiologist employed in the United States Public Health Service ( PHS ) .
Gary Dontzig is an American television producer , screenwriter , and actor .
William Happer ( born July 27 , 1939 ) is an American physicist who has specialised in the study of atomic physics , optics and spectroscopy .
Sway Calloway ( born August 23 , 1970 ) , better known mononymously as Sway , is an American rapper and reporter and executive producer for MTV News .
Shawn McGrath ( May 9 , 1976 -- January 26 , 2011 ) was an American professional wrestler , better known by the ring name Shawn Osborne .
Miltiades Manno ( March 3 , 1880 -- February 16 , 1935 ) was a Hungarian rower and artist .
Edmund Docwra ( fl . 1571 - 2 ) of Chamberhouse Castle at Crookham in Berkshire , was an English politician .
Lisa Ono ( 小野リサ , Ono Risa , born July 29 , 1962 ) is a popular Japanese - Brazilian bossa nova singer .
Kadiyam Srihari is an Indian politician , presently Deputy Chief Minister and Education minister of Telangana State .
Simona Armstrong ( born 1977/78 ) is a Romanian born actress and singer who lives and works mainly in the UK .
John Peavey ( born September 1 , 1933 ) is a rancher and Democratic politician from Carey , Idaho .
Deacon Ignjatije ( Serbian : Ђакон Игњатије ) was Russian deacon who accompanied Metropolitan Pimen during his travel to Constantinople at the end of the 14th century .
Joel Dreyfuss ( born in Haiti , 1945 ) is a Haitian - American journalist , editor , and writer now based in Paris , France .
H.F. Russell ( dates unknown ) was an English cricketer .
Ali Sharif Al Emadi is a Qatari economist and businessman .
Saint Sergius of Valaam ( Сергий Валаамский ) was a Greek monk and wonderworker credited with bringing Orthodox Christianity to Karelian and Finnish people .
Carl G. von Iwonski ( 1830 - -1912 ) was a painter born in Germany who became a naturalized American citizen .
George Boba , a painter and engraver of the 16th century , known by the name of Maître Georges , was a native of Rheims , and is said by Karel van Mander to have been a disciple of Frans Floris , and by others of Titian .
Abdur Rashid Kardar ( 1904 - -1989 ) , often abbreviated as A.R. Kardar , was an actor and film director / film producer .
Nico Minardos ( born February 15 , 1930 in Pangrati , Athens , Greece , died August 27 , 2011 in Woodland Hills , California ) , was a Greek - American actor .
Johann Strauss I ( German : Johann Baptist Strauß , Johann Strauss ( Vater ) ; also Johann Baptist Strauss , Johann Strauss , Sr . , the Elder , the Father ; March 14 , 1804 -- September 25 , 1849 ) was an Austrian Romantic composer .
John Carroll O'Connor ( August 2 , 1924 -- June 21 , 2001 ) , known as Carroll O'Connor , was an American actor , producer and director whose television career spanned four decades .
Bela Bose was a prolific dancer and actress in Hindi films during the 1960s and 70s .
Henri Pitot ( May 3 , 1695 -- December 27 , 1771 ) was a French hydraulic engineer and the inventor of the pitot tube .
Karla Kienzl ( sometimes listed as Carla Kienzl or Karla Kienzl ) ( born October 21 , 1922 ) was an Austrian luger who competed during the 1950s .
Neema Barnette is an American film director , and the first African - American woman sitcom director .
Reena Bhardwaj is a British Indian singer , songwriter and recording artist best known for her collaborations with AR Rahman and Nitin Sawhney .
Clement Cheng is a screenwriter , film director , and visual effects art director in the cinema of Hong Kong .
Dylan Ramsey is an American / Canadian actor and film producer , known for his portrayals of dark dramatic and comedically eccentric characters of diverse ethnicity .
Ellen Rogers is an English photographer and visual artist , known for her `` all - analogue '' approach to image making .
Evan Glodell is an American feature film director , producer , writer , and actor , who directed the indie film Bellflower on a shoestring budget of $ 17,000 .
Lester Strong ( born Lester Franklin Strong , circa 1949 ) was a reporter and news anchor at WHDH - TV from June 1984 until 2000 .
Hideo Shimizu ( 清水 英男 ) is a Japanese mathematician who introduced Shimizu L - functions .
D. S. Adhimoolam was an Indian politician and former Member of the Legislative Assembly of Tamil Nadu ..
Clifford Chase is an American novelist who has written Winkie , a novel about a sentient teddy bear accused of terrorism , The Hurry - Up Song :

Luc Dupanloup , more famous under his pen name Dupa , was a Belgian comics artist best known as the creator of Cubitus which later was turned into an animated series called Wowser .
Walter O'Keefe ( August 18 , 1900 -- June 26 , 1983 ) was an American songwriter , actor , syndicated columnist , Broadway composer , radio legend , screenwriter , musical arranger and TV host .
Joel Thome ( born in Detroit , Michigan ) is the conductor and artistic director of Orchestra of Our Time .
Bruce Simonson is an American planetary scientist and geologist notable for his contributions to meteoroid astronomy and glaciology .
Johnny Archer ( born November 12 , 1968 in Waycross , Georgia ) is an American professional pool player .
Alekos Livaditis ( Greek : Αλέκος Λειβαδίτης , 1914 -- March 23 , 1980 ) was a Greek actor in theatre and cinema .
The abuse began in 1982 and continued for two years , when the victim was an altar boy in Valleymount parish and Thomas Naughton was curate .
Jeannette Hamby ( March 15 , 1933 -- January 27 , 2012 ) was an American politician and nurse in Oregon .
George Nick Clements ( October 5 , 1940 -- August 30 , 2009 ) was an American theoretical linguist specializing in phonology .
Gao Qinrong ( Chinese : 高勤荣 ; pinyin : Gāo Qínróng ; born c. 1955 ) is a Chinese journalist who was imprisoned for eight years after reporting on a fraudulent irrigation project in his home province of Shanxi .
Roy Koerner MBE was a Polar explorer who participated in what the then Prime Minister , Harold Wilson described as `` a feat of endurance and courage which ranks with any in polar history '' , and Prince Philip feels `` ranks among the greatest triumphs of human skill and endurance '' .
Joseph Victor Gomez Ejercito ( born December 26 , 1969 in Manila ) , commonly known as JV Ejercito or JV Ejercito Estrada , is a Filipino politician who served as Representative for the Legislative district of San Juan City , Mayor of that same city , and is currently , a Senator .
Nicole Fiscella ( born September 15 , 1979 ) is an American actress and model , of Indian and St Lucian ancestry , who rose to fame through the book - based TV series Gossip Girl as Isabel Coates .
Enric Martí Carreto was a Catalan textile entrepreneur in the second half of the 20th century .
Claire Bishop is an art historian , critic , author , and Professor in the History of Art Department at CUNY Graduate Center , New York since September 2008 .
Herman Hartwich ( or Hartwick , July 8 , 1853 in New York City -- March 8 , 1926 in Munich ) was a German - American landscape and genre painter .
Norman Love is an American pastry chef located in Fort Myers , Florida .
Habiba Dembélé Sahouet is an Ivorian journalist and television presenter .
Ernest van den Haag ( September 15 , 1914 -- March 21 , 2002 ) was a Dutch - American sociologist , social critic , and John M. Olin Professor of Jurisprudence and Public Policy at Fordham University .
Venise T. Berry is an award - winning American novelist known for her novels about contemporary African - American relationships .
J. Owen Forrester ( April 27 , 1939 -- July 1 , 2014 ) was a United States federal judge , a position he held from 1981 to 2004 .
Pycard , also spelt Picard and Picart ( late 14th century -- early 15th century ) was an English or French Medieval and Renaissance transitional composer .
Duane Martin ( born August 11 , 1965 ) is an American film and television actor and real estate agent .
Eleanor Margaret Burbidge ( née Peachey ) , FRS ( born August 12 , 1919 in Davenport ) is a British - born American astrophysicist , noted for original research and holding many administrative posts , including Director of the Royal Greenwich Observatory .
John Thomson Mason ( January 8 , 1787 -- April 17 , 1850 ) was an American lawyer , United States marshal , Secretary of Michigan Territory from 1830 through 1831 , land agent , and an important figure in the Texas Revolution .
Suzanne M. Levine , DPM , PC , is a clinical podiatrist and a foot surgeon at the NewYork--
Chandra Mohan Sharma ( born 1976 ) is an Indian social activist , who used the Right to Information ( RTI ) act to fight against illegal encroachments of government land .
Henri René ( born Harold M. Kirchstein ; December 29 , 1906 -- April 25 , 1993 ) , was an American musician who had an international career in the recording industry as a producer , composer , conductor and arranger .
Nidia Guenard ( born March 12 , 1979 ) is an American retired professional wrestler who is best known for her time with World Wrestling Entertainment ( WWE ) under the ring name , Nidia .
John Hessin Clarke ( September 18 , 1857 -- March 22 , 1945 ) was an American lawyer and judge who served as an Associate Justice of the United States Supreme Court from 1916 to 1922 .
Irina Petrushova ( born 1965 ) is a Russian journalist , founder and editor - in - chief of the weekly Respublika in Kazakhstan .
Qahar Asi ( Persian : قهار عاصی‎ ) ( April 12 , 1956 -- September 29 , 1994 ) was a notable modern Afghan poet and agriculturist .
George Van Tassel ( March 12 , 1910 -- February 9 , 1978 ) was an American contactee , ufologist , author .
Joe Thein ( born July 17 , 1991 in Esch - sur - Alzette ) is a Luxembourgish politician , councillor of Pétange and flight attendant .
Roger Youderian ( January 21 , 1924 -- January 8 , 1956 ) was an American evangelical Christian missionary to Ecuador who , along with four others , was killed while attempting to evangelize the Huaorani people through efforts known as Operation Auca .
Archer MacMackin ( February 7 , 1888 -- February 8 , 1961 ) was an American silent film director , producer , and screenwriter .
George Henry Challenger ( 1881 - 1947 ) was a British aviator and aero - engineer , originally with the Bristol Aeroplane Company and later with Vickers he designed a number of aircraft and held a number of aviation related patents .
G. Edward Bradley ( October 21 , 1906 -- September 24 , 1993 ) was an American optometrist and politician who served in the Massachusetts House of Representatives and as the 24th Mayor , of Somerville , Massachusetts .
Fabián Dobles Rodríguez ( January 17 , 1918 -- March 22 , 1997 ) was a Costa Rican writer and left - wing political activist .
Louis Gathmann ( August 11 , 1843 - -June 3 , 1917 ) was a German American engineer and an inventor who is best remembered as the inventor of the Gathamnn gun , a large howitzer .
Linda Perhacs is an American psychedelic folk singer , who released her first album Parallelograms in 1970 to scant notice or sales .
Sam Boardman - Jacobs ( born 1942 ) is a Wales - based playwright , director scenographer and recently choreographer , since receiving a master 's degree from Trinity/ Laban .

Kevin Schilder is a video game composer .
Ajay Rai is an Indian politician , who is a five - time MLA from Uttar Pradesh .
Kari Korhonen ( born 1973 ) is a Finnish cartoonist known for his stories about Donald Duck .
O'Ryan ( born O'Ryan Omir Browner ; February 12 , 1987 in Compton , California ) is an American R&B singer .
David B. Kaplan is an American physicist born in 1958 .
Harvey L. Clark ( October 7 , 1807 -- March 24 , 1858 ) was an educator , missionary , and settler of what became Forest Grove , Oregon , United States .
Loren R. Pierce ( December 26 , 1878 -- June 24 , 1961 ) was a Vermont attorney and politician who had a long career in the Vermont General Assembly .
Hasan Zaydan is an Iraqi politician and a member of the Iraqi National Assembly with the Iraqi National Dialogue Front .
Frances Carter Barron Casteel , known as Carter Casteel ( born December 10 , 1942 ) , is an attorney and Republican politician from New Braunfels , Texas .
Kris Angelica ( January 2 , 1999 ) is a Filipina singer and a Television Personality .
Robert Linderholm ( October 19 , 1933 -- July 6 , 2013 ) was an amateur American astronomer who discovered eight asteroids .
Eric Funk is an American contemporary classical composer and conductor .
Philip Granville Short , known as Phil Short ( born January 31 , 1947 ) , is a retired military officer formerly from Covington , Louisiana , USA , who served in the Louisiana State Senate for District 12 ( St. Helena , St. Tammany , Tangipahoa , and Washington parishes ) from 1996 to 1999 .
Don Costello ( September 5 , 1901 -- October 24 , 1945 ) was an American stage ( Broadway ) and movie actor .
John C. Shabaz ( June 25 , 1931 - August 31 , 2012 ) was a United States federal judge for the United States District Court for the Western District of Wisconsin and legislator .
William Coulter is an American Celtic guitarist , performer , recording artist , and teacher .
Louis Ozawa Changchien ( born October 11 , 1975 ) is an American actor , best known for his role in the 2010 film Predators and 2012 The Bourne Legacy .
James M. Lilly was an American politician who served as the twenty second Mayor of North Adams , Massachusetts .
Gavin MacKenzie ( born November 9 , 1952 ) is a Canadian lawyer and former Treasurer of the Law Society of Upper Canada .
Jorge Marrale ( born June 30 , 1947 ) is a well - known Argentine actor .
Diana Lee Inosanto ( born May 29 , 1966 ) is an American actress , stuntwoman , martial artist and film director , sometimes credited as D. Lee Inosanto .
Grant Hinkle is an American poker player who won the 2008 World Series of Poker ( WSOP ) $ 1,500 No - Limit Hold'em event .
John C. Van Hollen ( June 27 , 1933 ) is a Wisconsin businessman and politician .
Robert Kimmel Smith ( born July 31 , 1930 , Brooklyn , New York ) is a novelist and award - winning American children 's author .
Dee Jaywalker is a Belgian punk rock musician and songwriter .
Penny Warner is an American mystery writer who has won multiple Agatha Awards .
Barnabe Barnes was well acquainted with the work of contemporary French sonneteers , to whom he is largely indebted , and he borrows his title , apparently , from a Neapolitan writer of Latin verse , Hieronymus Angerianus .
Zachary Lipton ( born 1985 ) is a jazz saxophonist , composer , and bandleader from New Rochelle , New York .
James Scheffer ( born June 8 , 1970 ) , professionally known as Jim Jonsin , is an American music producer , songwriter and businessman from South Florida .
La Mont West , Jr. ( born July 2 , 1930 ) is an anthropologist .
Vikram Chopra ( also known as Vicky Chopra ) born on June 9 is an Indian film director , screen writer and actor .
Elizabeth Tikvah Sarah ( also known as Rabbi Elli Sarah ) is a British rabbi and author .
Deborah Henson - Conant ( born November 11 , 1953 in Stockton , California ) is an American harpist and composer .
Count Edmund Francis Dunne ( July 30 , 1835 -- October 4 , 1904 ) , born Edmund Francis O'Dunne , was an American politician and jurist who served as Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Arizona Territory .
Jean - Marie Séguin ( January 27 , 1929 -- August 21 , 2011 ) was an educator , insurance broker and politician in Quebec .
Roscoe Conkling ( October 30 , 1829 -- April 18 , 1888 ) was a politician from New York who served both as a member of the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate .
Michelle Belegrin is an American actress and model , who starred as Andrea Zavatti on the MyNetworkTV serial Desire .
Hans Olsson , a Swedish alpine skier specialising in the speed events , is Jon Olsson 's brother .
Bill Sherk is a Canadian writer and journalist and is an authority on old cars .
Max Swarner is a professional singer and actor from Dallas , TX .
Alvin Lustig ( February 8 , 1915 - December 5 , 1955 ) was an American book designer , graphic designer and typeface designer .
Ravi Bhatia ( born on November 30 , 1988 ) is an Indian television actor .
José Graziano da Silva ( born November 17 , 1949 ) is an American - born Brazilian agronomist and writer .
J. Patrick Lewis ( born May 5 , 1942 ) is an American poet and prose writer noted for his children 's poems and other light verse .
Ernesto Cardenal Martínez ( born January 20 , 1925 ) is a Nicaraguan Catholic priest , poet and politician .
Jean Dinning ( March 29 , 1924 -- February 22 , 2011 ) was an American singer and songwriter , best known for co - writing , with her then - husband , Red Surrey , the 1959 hit song `` Teen Angel '' , the most popular version of which was sung by her brother Mark Dinning .
Mohamad Zain Bin Mohd Saidin ( born February 23 , 1984 ) or more commonly known as Zain Saidin is a Malaysian actor and a model .

Marina Abramović ( Serbian Cyrillic : Марина Абрамовић , ; born November 30 , 1946 ) is a Serbian performance artist based in New York .
Hank Mizell ( November 9 , 1923 -- December 23 , 1992 ) was an American singer , guitarist and songwriter .
Robert Joseph Bandoni ( 11 November 1926 -- 5 May 2009 ) was a mycologist who specialized on the taxonomy and morphology of the heterobasidiomycetes ( `` jelly fungi '' ) .
Fernando Sanford ( 1854 - -1948 ) was an American physicist and university professor .
M. Korkut Uygun is a Turkish chemical engineer and a medical researcher .
Bernard Hocke is a television and film actor .
Henry Judd Baker is an American actor known for such films and television shows as Oliver Stone 's Seizure , Clean and Sober , The Mighty Quinn , William Friedkin 's Cruising and Dark Shadows .
Tanya Ryno is an American film and television producer , director , and writer .
Johnny Shannon ( born John Shannon , 29 July 1932 ) is a South London born English actor who appeared in numerous television and film productions over a 40-year period , often playing policemen or crooks in crime dramas .
Kenneth Hayes Miller ( March 11 , 1876 -- January 1 , 1952 ) was an American painter , printmaker , and teacher .
Piero Malvestiti ( 1899 - -1964 ) was an Italian politician who was a minister in successive governments in the 1940s and 1950s , a European Commissioner and President of the High Authority of the European Coal and Steel Community .
Apollonius of Tyana ( Ancient Greek : Ἀπολλώνιος ὁ Τυανεύς ; c. 15 -- c. 100 AD ) , sometimes also called Apollonios of Tyana , was a Greek Neopythagorean philosopher from the town of Tyana in the Roman province of Cappadocia in Anatolia .
Verena Winiwarter ( born July 26 , 1961 in Vienna ) is an Austrian environmental historian .
Morris Steggerda ( September 1 , 1900 − March 15 , 1950 ) was an American physical anthropologist .
Mihail Zervos is a Greek financial mathematician .
Mohamed Aloulou ( November 19 , 1941 ) is a Tunisian cardiologist and politician .
Luke Joseph Scarpa ( October 4 , 1928 -- April 3 , 2012 ) was an American professional wrestler who was best known by the ring name Chief Jay Strongbow .
Leon Drolet ( born January 9 , 1967 ) is a Michigan Republican politician and political activist known for his libertarian views .
Clayton Worbeck is a Canadian multi - instrumentalist , producer , engineer and remixer .
Joan Whitney Kramer ( June 26 , 1914 -- July 12 , 1990 ) was an American singer and songwriter .
Jamie Allan ( born c. 1860 ) was a Scottish professional golfer who played in the late 19th century .
Gregorio Soriano Araneta ( April 19 , 1869 -- May 9 , 1930 ) , also known as Don Gregorio S. Araneta , was a Filipino lawyer , businessman , nationalist and patriot , during the Spanish and American colonial periods .
Paula Barbieri ( born December 31 , 1966 ) is an American former model and actress .
Huang Lung - yi ( simplified Chinese : 黄龙义 ; traditional Chinese : 黃龍義 ; born June 20 , 1979 ) is a Taiwanese baseball player for the La New Bears .
Tami Gaines is an accomplished author , marketing and business strategist , and motivational speaker and trainer .
Juan Manuel Suárez Fernández ( July 11 , 1962 -- October 9 , 1992 ) also known by Juanma Suárez was a Spanish punk rock bassist and singer , founder and member of one of the most influential Spanish punk rock band Eskorbuto , since 1980 to 1992 .
Jürgen W. Gansel , ( born July 6 , 1974 ) is a German politician .
Terence Gaffney ( born 9 March 1948 ) is an American mathematician who has made fundamental contributions to singularity theory -- in particular , to the fields of singularities of maps and equisingularity theory .
Ola Ray ( born August 26 , 1960 ) is an American model and actress most notable for her role in Michael Jackson 's Thriller as Michael 's girlfriend .
Sarwar Munir Rao is a Pakistani television news journalist , columnist , TV analyst and a media consultant .
Tomasi Vuetilovoni , commonly known as Tom Vuetilovoni , is a former Fijian politician , who was Minister for Tourism and Transport in 2006 , following the parliamentary election held on 6 - -13 May that year .
Tamara Bernier Evans ( born Tamara Michele Bernier ) is a Canadian actress , director , singer , writer and producer .
Maria Luisa Tucker ( born August 20 , 1979 ) is an award - winning American journalist .
Lewis H. Nash ( 1852 -- November 11 , 1923 ) was an American engineer who invented the liquid - ring - vacuum pump , and was the holder of over a hundred United States patents for pumps , engines , and other equipment .
Russell Scott ( June 30 , 1921 -- August 27 , 2012 ) , also known as Blinky the Clown , was an American clown and television personality and presenter who starred in a Denver , Colorado television program called Blinky 's Fun Club .
`` Kelvin '' Leong Ian Veng ( born 12 September 1968 ) also known as Kelvin Leong is a Macanese racing driver previously competing in the Macau Touring Car Championship and the World Touring Car Championship , where he made his debut in 2012 .
Z. Vanessa Helder ( May 30 , 1904 -- May 1 , 1968 ) was an American watercolor painter who gained national attention in the 1930s and 40s , mainly for her paintings of scenes in Eastern Washington .
Debra Cowan is a singer based in Shrewsbury , Massachusetts .
Anton Vidokle is an artist and founder of e - flux .
William Mahone ( December 1 , 1826 -- October 8 , 1895 ) was a civil engineer , railroad executive , soldier and politician .
Hans Domnick ( 1909 - -1985 ) was a German film editor , film producer and documentary maker .

Prudencio Baldivia ( May 7 , 1929 -- October 11 , 1997 ) , better known as Dencio Padilla or Tata Dens , was a veteran Filipino actor and comedian .
Tommy Lorne ( December 7 , 1890 -- April 17 , 1935 ) was a Scottish music hall comedian of the 1920s .
Joel Rafael is an American singer - songwriter and folk musician from San Diego County , California .
Herbert Grossman ( September 30 , 1926 -- September 11 , 2010 ) was an American conductor who was chiefly known for his work within opera and musical theatre .
Uwe Windhorst ( Prof . Dr. Uwe Windhorst ) is a German neuroscientist , systems scientist and cyberneticist , who was born in Bremen , Germany in 1946 .
Morley Baer ( April 5 , 1916 -- November 9 , 1995 ) was an American photographer and teacher , born in Toledo , Ohio .
Lewis R. Foster ( August 5 , 1898 -- June 10 , 1974 ) was an American screenwriter , film / television director , and film / television producer .

André Hallet ( 1890 - -1959 ) was a Belgian post - impressionist painter whose paintings have been exhibited at more than 60 museums worldwide , including the Louvre in Paris , France .
Beverly Lynn Bennett is an American vegan chef and author .
Jerome Clark ( born November 27 , 1946 ) is an American researcher and writer , specializing in unidentified flying objects and other paranormal subjects .
Lauren Worsham ( born April 4 , 1982 ) is an American actress and singer known for her work in the opera and musical theatre .
Jim Fenwick ( born 11 October 1934 ) is a former Australian photojournalist most well known for being a Walkley Award recipient and former chief photographer for The Courier Mail .
Pat Cashman ( born September 16 , 1950 ) is an American comedian and television and radio personality , based in the Seattle metropolitan area .

Wayne Delmenico ( born 21 August 1952 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played for Melbourne in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) and South Fremantle in the West Australian Football League ( WAFL ) .
Patricia Cornelius is an Australian playwright and co - founder of Melbourne Workers Theatre .
Kip Anderson ( January 24 , 1938 -- August 29 , 2007 ) was an American soul blues and R&B singer and songwriter .
Kenzo Mori ( Japanese : 森研三 , 1914 -- January 5 , 2007 ) was an Nisei Japanese - Canadian journalist , writer , editor and publisher of the New Canadian , an English - language newspaper aimed at second- and third - generation Japanese Canadians .
Fran Landesman ( October 21 , 1927 -- July 23 , 2011 ) was an American lyricist and poet .
Lillian Faderman ( born July 18 , 1940 ) is an American historian whose books on lesbian history and LGBT history have earned critical praise and awards .
Arlene Perly Rae is a Canadian journalist , literary critic and author .
Peter Salem ( c. 1750 - -August 16 , 1816 ) was an African American from Massachusetts who served as a soldier in the American Revolutionary War .
Princess Baba Jigida is a Sierra Leonean politician .

Alfonso Teofilo Brown ( 1902 - -1951 ) , better known as Panama Al Brown , was a bantamweight boxer from Panama who made history by becoming boxing 's first Hispanic world champion .

Svetislav Mandić ( Serbian Cyrillic : Светислав Мандић ; March 8 , 1921 -- October 4 , 2003 ) was a Yugoslav and Serbian historian , copier , fresco conserver , poet and painter .
Kirk J. Schneider , PhD is a psychologist and psychotherapist who has taken a leading role in the advancement of existential - humanistic therapy , and existential - integrative therapy .
Josh Bernstein ( born February 24 , 1971 ) is an American explorer , author , survival expert , anthropologist , and TV host best known as the host of Digging for the Truth .
Harry Sidebottom is a British author and historian , best known for his fiction series Warrior of Rome .
Rob Massam ( born 29 October 1987 ) is an English - born , Welsh international rugby league player who currently plays for the North Wales Crusaders .
John Mosher Bailey ( August 24 , 1838 -- February 21 , 1916 ) was an American politician who represented New York in the United States House of Representatives from 1878 - 1881 .
Horsley was the first neurosurgeon appointed to the hospital in Queen Square , London , now called the National Hospital for Neurology and Neurosurgery -- the Victor Horsley Department of Neurosurgery is named in his honour .

John C. Koch ( October 18 , 1841 -- September 9 , 1907 ) was a Republican politician who served two terms as mayor of Milwaukee , Wisconsin .
MG Srinivas ( Bangalore ) is an Indian film director and screenwriter in Kannada cinema .

František Záviška ( November 18 , 1879 -- April 17 , 1945 ) was a renowned Czech physicist .

Niall Gilligan ( born 12 August 1976 ) was an Irish hurler who usually played as a right corner - forward for the Clare senior team .
A well - known Somali poet Abdullahi Moalin Ahmed `` Dhoodaan '' died at age of 72 in the city of Harar .
Isidoro Ocampo was both a graphic artist and painter but was best known for his graphic work .
Archeanassa or Archaeanassa ( Greek Ἀρχεάνασσα , Ἀρχαιάνασσα ) , a native of Colophon , was a hetaera or courtesan living in Athens in the late 5th century BC . According to biographical sources about Plato , the philosopher as a young man was deeply in love with Archeanassa and addressed a four - line epigram to her .
Lise Bissonnette , OQ ( born December 13 , 1945 ) is a Canadian writer and journalist .

Waldo Colburn ( November 13 , 1824 -- September 26 , 1885 ) was an American lawyer , jurist and politician from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts .
Alexei Sultanov ( Russian : Алексей Султанов ; August 7 , 1969 -- June 30 , 2005 ) was a Russian classical pianist of Uzbek origin .
Norman Jaques ( June 29 , 1880 -- January 31 , 1949 ) was a farmer and a Canadian federal politician who represented the electoral district of Wetaskiwin in the Canadian House of Commons from 1935 to 1949 .
Winston Miller ( June 22 , 1910 -- June 21 , 1994 ) was an American screenwriter , film producer and actor .
He Min ( Chinese : 何敏 , born August 16 , 1992 ) is a Chinese diver who specialises in the 1 metre springboard event .
Onufriy Stepanov ( Russian : Онуфрий Степанов ) ( died June 30 , 1658 ) was a Siberian Cossack and explorer of the Amur River .
Delaney Gibson is an American singer - songwriter who has recorded three solo albums , The Worst Kind of Way , Hurricanes and Forget Me Nots and Tall Like the Tree .
Jonathan Cherry is a Canadian actor known for playing Rory Peters in Final Destination 2 ( 2003 ) and also had a lead role in the video game film adaptation House of the Dead .
Carnie Wilson ( born April 29 , 1968 ) is an American singer and television host , perhaps best known as a member of the pop music group Wilson Phillips .
Louis Philippe Demers ( September 16 , 1863 -- November 3 , 1951 ) was a Canadian lawyer , professor , and politician .
Regna Darnell is a Canadian anthropologist known for her linguistic anthropological fieldwork with the Plains Cree of northern Alberta and with southwestern Ontario First Nations peoples as well as for her scholarship on the history of anthropology .
Georgi Georgiev - Gogo ( Bulgarian : Георги Георгиев-Гого ) ( born November 5 , 1971 ) is a Bulgarian actor .
William J. Mann is an American novelist , biographer , and Hollywood historian best known for his studies of Hollywood and the American film industry , especially his 2006 biography of Katharine Hepburn , Kate :
Rubén Rada ( born 17 July 1943 ) ; moniker `` El Negro Rada '' ) is an Afro - Uruguayan percussionist , composer and singer .
Meng Xuenong ( simplified Chinese : 孟学农 ; traditional Chinese : 孟學農 ; pinyin : Mèng Xuénóng ; born August 1949 ) is a Chinese politician .
Larry Fuller is an American choreographer , theatre director , dancer , and actor .
James Kari is a linguist and Professor Emeritus with the Alaska Native Language Center at the University of Alaska Fairbanks ( UAF ) specializing in the Dene or Athabascan languages of Alaska .
Santana Garrett ( born May 22 , 1988 ) is an American model , professional wrestler and valet .
William Conant Church ( 1836 - -1917 ) was an American journalist and soldier .
Daniel Josefsson ( born October 15 , 1981 ) is a Swedish professional ice hockey player currently playing with AIK of the Swedish Elitserien ( SEL ) league , having signed from the Malmö Redhawks in 2012 .
George Stanfield Blake ( 1876 - -1940 ) was a British mineral and mining geologist , fluent in French , Italian , German and latterly his family understood Palestinian Arabic / Levantine Arabic , which aided his later survey work .
Brian Vollmer ( born June 30 , 1955 ) is the lead singer and only remaining original member of Canadian hard rock group Helix .
Gino Antonio ( Jack Badon in real life ) was a former Filipino actor .
Anders Lindström or Boba Fett as he is often called is a Swedish rock musician most known for being the organist and pianist of the Swedish rock band The Hellacopters and co founder and guitarist of The Diamond Dogs .
Howard Drossin ( born October 2 , 1970 ) is an American composer for film and video games .
Pasi Kinturi is a retired Finnish association football player who played professionally in the USL A - League .
Ronald E. Neumann ( born 1945 ) is an American diplomat who served as the United States Ambassador to Afghanistan ( 2005 - -2007 ) , Bahrain ( 2001 - -2004 ) and Algeria ( 1994 - -1997 ) .
Matthew Ziff ( born March 24 , 1991 , Englewood , New Jersey ) is an American actor and producer .
János Terbócs or Terbocs ( Slovene : Janoš Terboč , or Ivan Terboč ) was a Slovene Lutheran priest , dean and writer in the 17th century in the Slovene Circumscription ( Kingdom of Hungary ) .
Thomas Wanker , also known as Thomas Wander , is a film and television series composer .
Tae Jin - ah ( Hangul : 태진아 ; born on April 5 , 1953 ) is the stage name of South Korean veteran trot singer Jo Bang - hun ( Cho Bang - hun ) .
Nóra Görbe ( born September 3 , 1956 ) is a Hungarian pop singer and actress .
Lamjavyn Gündalai ( Mongolian : Ламжавын Гүндалай ) is a Mongolian politician .
Ahmad Reza Asghari , ( also spelled Hamid Reza Eshagi , and also known as Moshen Randjbaran ) , was an Iranian diplomat accused of organizing terrorist acts in Argentina .
Matthias Dahms ( born October 17 , 1961 ) is a German virtuoso vibraphone and marimba soloist , percussionist and composer .
Anna Funder trained as an international and human rights lawyer , interests which she continues to pursue in her professional and public life as a writer .
Aonghus Fionn Ó Dálaigh ( known as `` The Pious '' ) , was an Irish poet , fl .
Aslıhan Koruyan Sabancı , née Dilek Aslıhan Koruyan ( born c. 1972 ) , is a Turkish chef and author , who specializes in healthy and creative recipes .
Billy Lawrence ( born May 3 , 1972 , in Boca Raton , FL ) is an American R&B / soul singer - songwriter , record producer and arranger .
The founder , Anine Bing , is also a blogger as well as a former model and singer .
J .- Eugène Bissonnette ( March 4 , 1892 -- September 13 , 1980 ) was a Quebec - born politician and physician .
Hannibal Buress ( born February 4 , 1983 ) is an American stand - up comedian , actor , and television writer .
Jan Paweł Nowacki ( 25 June 1905 Berlin -- 23 May 1979 Warsaw ) was an engineer .
Jason Marcy is a cartoonist living in Hamilton , Ontario who works primarily in the field of autobiographical comics .
Paul O. Williams ( January 17 , 1935 -- June 2 , 2009 ) was an American science fiction writer and haiku poet .
Marc Copland ( born May 27 , 1948 , as Marc Cohen ) is an American jazz pianist and composer .
John Bleifer , also known as John Melvin Bleifer , was an American actor whose career began at the very tail end of the silent film era , and lasted all the way through the mid-1980s .
Thomas Pinckney ( October 23 , 1750 -- November 2 , 1828 ) was an early American statesman , diplomat and veteran of both the American Revolutionary War and the War of 1812 .
Dr Guy Dutson is a British - born veterinarian , ornithologist and a leader of birding tours , who is a world authority on the birds of the south - west Pacific region .
Jory Nash is a folk music - oriented Canadian singer - songwriter and musician .
William John Gies ( February 21 , 1872 -- May 20 , 1956 ) was a US biochemist and dentist .
Nydia Caro ( born June 7 , 1948 ) is a Puerto Rican singer born in Puerto Rico 's community in New York City .
Vaibhav Kaul ( born 1991 ) is a Himalayan photographer , painter , geographer and environmental scholar .
Frank Hudec was a drummer who was part of the Stan Seltzer Trio .
Hobart Henley ( born Hess Manassah Henle , November 23 , 1887 - May 22 , 1964 ) was an American silent film actor , director , and screenwriter .
Ra Vincent is a New Zealand set decorator and art director who was nominated at the 85th Academy Awards for Best Production Design for his work on The Hobbit :
Andrew Quinn ( born 25 May 1983 ) is an Irish hurler who played as a right corner - forward for the Clare senior hurling team .
Ralph Helmick ( born 1952 ) is an American sculptor and public artist .
John Donowell was a little - known , eighteenth - century British architect and engraver , most notable for his architectural work at West Wycombe Park in Buckinghamshire , where he appears to have been influenced by the works of Colen Campbell .
Ciro Díaz is composer , lead guitarist of the band Porno para Ricardo , and leader of the alternative rock band La Babosa Azul .
Xavier De Cuyper is a Belgian agricultural engineer and civil servant .
Simon Wilde ( born 1960 ) is an English cricket journalist and author .
Carol Cassella is a bestselling novelist and practicing anesthesiologist at the Surgery Center of Silverdale and Virginia Mason Medical Center in Seattle .
José Vicente Ferrer de Otero y Cintrón ( January 8 , 1912 -- January 26 , 1992 ) , best known as José Ferrer , was a Puerto Rican actor , theatre and film director .
Pedro Nunes Tinoco ( died February 8 , 1641 ) was a Portuguese architect who worked in what George Kubler described as the ' Plain Style ' , and is known also as the patriarch of a number of a family of notable Portuguese architects .
David Aaron Baker ( born August 14 , 1963 ) is an American actor whose credits stretch across theater , film , and television .
Pedro Carneiro is a Portuguese solo classical percussionist , marimba player , composer , and conductor .
Andriy Yahodka ( Ukrainian : Андрiй Ягодка ; born 6 July 1988 ) is a Ukrainian sabre fencer , bronze medal in the 2012 European Fencing Championships and team silver medal in the 2009 European Fencing Championships .
Lucien Campeau ( June 20 , 1927 -- March 15 , 2010 ) was a Canadian cardiologist .
Joseph Arvay , QC ( born March 18 , 1949 ) is a Canadian lawyer who has argued numerous landmark cases involving civil liberties and constitutional rights .
Dr Penelope Diane Olsen is an Australian ornithologist and author .
Moses Macdonald ( April 8 , 1815 -- October 18 , 1869 ) was an American attorney and Democratic politician in the U.S. state of Maine .
Scott Jacobs is an American painter known for his photorealistic work of Harley - Davidson motorcycles .
Isaac Don Levine ( January 19 , 1892 -- February 15 , 1981 ) was a Russian - born American journalist and writer .
Ichthyas ( Greek : Ἰχθύας ; fl . 4th - century BCE ) , the son of Metallus , was a Greek philosopher and a disciple and successor of Euclid of Megara in the Megarian school .
Julie Markes is an American children 's book writer .
George Washington Warren ( October 1 , 1813 -- May 13 , 1883 ) was a Massachusetts attorney , jurist , and politician who served as the first mayor of Charlestown , Massachusetts .
Ann Rosener ( November 25 , 1914 -- May 19 , 2012 ) was an American photojournalist who is remembered for her photographs of home front activities for the Farm Security Administration in 1942 - -43 .
Kat Parsons is an American pop singer - songwriter , pianist and guitarist .
Lewis Hodous ( simplified Chinese : 何乐益 ; traditional Chinese : 何樂益 ; Pinyin : Hé Lèyì ; Foochow Romanized : Hò̤ Lŏk - ék ; December 31 , 1872 -- August 9 , 1949 ) was an American Board missionary to China , educator , Sinologist and Buddhologist .
Frank Caeti ( born August 11 , 1973 ) is an American actor and comedian known for his time as a cast member on the FOX sketch - series MADtv from 2005 to 2007 .
Jenny Hiloudaki ( Greek : Τζένη Χειλουδάκη ) ( born February 21 , 1968 ) is a transsexual Greek former model and brothel keeper who regularly attracted the attention of the Greek media .
Phil Williamson ( born May 29 , 1965 ) is a former professional tennis player from the United States who competed for Antigua and Barbuda in the Davis Cup .
Lenny Welch ( born Leon Welch , May 31 , 1938 ) , is an American MOR / pop singer .
Eileen Barton ( November 24 , 1924 -- June 27 , 2006 ) was an American singer best known for her 1950 hit song , `` If I Knew You Were Comin ' I 'd 've Baked a Cake . ''
Joan Oates , FBA ( née Lines ) is an American archaeologist and academic , specialising in the Ancient Near East .
Edward Kofler ( November 16 , 1911 -- April 22 , 2007 ) was a mathematician who made important contributions to game theory and fuzzy logic by working out the theory of linear partial information .
Bruno Landry is a Québécois comedian and humorist .
Louis Mellis is a Scottish actor and screenwriter .
Satya Sarkar was an Indian cricketer who played for Assam .
Morris Mike Medavoy ( born January 21 , 1941 ) is an American film producer and executive , co - founder of Orion Pictures ( 1978 ) , former chairman of TriStar Pictures , former head of production for United Artists ( 1974 - -1978 ) and current chairman and CEO of Phoenix Pictures .
Junko Itō is a Japanese - born American linguist .
Charlotte Anne Eaton ( 1788 - -1859 ) , surname before marriage Waldie , was an English travel writer , memoirist and novelist .
Xie Sun ( Hsieh Sun , traditional : 謝蓀 , simplified : 谢荪 ) ; was a Chinese landscape painter during the Qing Dynasty ( 1644 - -1912 AD ) , one of the Eight Masters of Nanjing .
Roberto Azank is an artist of the late 20th century and early 21st century , known primarily for his work as a still life painter .
Liang Shih - chiu ( January 6 , 1903 -- November 3 , 1987 ) , also romanized as Liang Shiqiu , and also known as Liang Chih - Hwa(梁治華 ) , was a renowned educator , writer , translator , literary theorist and lexicographer .
Biswamohan Pani is a former design engineer at Intel .
Thomas Morrow Reavley ( born June 21 , 1921 ) is a senior judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit .
Robert Bertelli , better known as Bob Bert , is an American rock drummer .
Peter Corp Dyrendal is a Thai - Danish singer , recording artist and model , who has had one acting role on Thai television ( as a character who is a kayak instructor of Thai / New Zealand descent ) .
Garett Bischoff ( born April 20 , 1986 ) is an American professional wrestler and a former referee .
James Lipton ( born September 19 , 1926 ) is an American writer , lyricist , actor and dean emeritus of the Actors Studio Drama School at Pace University in New York City .
Eric M. Genden is an American otolaryngologist with the distinction of being the first surgeon to perform a jaw transplant in the United States .
Martin Brain was a British racing driver known for his exploits in British hillclimbs and club racing .
John H. Stracey ( born September 22 , 1950 in Bethnal Green , England ) is a former professional boxer who was world Welterweight champion .
Before emigration , Alfred Waud had entered the Government School of Design at Somerset House , London , with the intention of becoming a marine painter .
Robert Whiting ( born October 24 , 1942 ) is a best - selling author and journalist who has written several successful books on contemporary Japanese culture - which include topics such as baseball and American gangsters operating in Japan .
David Sington is a British - born producer , screenwriter , director , author and journalist .
Jerzy Kowalewski ( born 6 May 1944 ) is a retired Polish diver .
Sandra Crouch ( born July 1 , 1942 ) is an American Gospel music performer , drummer and songwriter .
John Preston Buchanan ( January 30 , 1888 -- September 15 , 1937 ) was an American politician who served as a member of the Virginia Senate , representing the state 's 1st district .
Fiona Samuel ( born 1961 ) is a New Zealand writer , actor and director who was born in Scotland .
Christopher Uriarte ( born 1977 ) is an American computer scientist and entrepreneur employed by the London - based fraud prevention and payment processing company , Retail Decisions .
Ben Sollee ( born November 28 , 1983 ) is an American cellist , singer - songwriter , and composer known for his political activism .
Muhammad Ali Luqman was a Yemeni lawyer , writer and journalist .
Erik Guldentops ( born ca . 1941 ) is a Belgian computer scientist and management consultant , who was systems engineer at SWIFT and Executive Professor at Antwerp Management School , known for his work on IT governance .
J. Edward Day ( October 11 , 1914 -- October 29 , 1996 ) was an American lawyer and business executive , most widely known as the United States Postmaster General under whose leadership the ZIP code was introduced .
Thomas Jonathan Burrill ( April 25 , 1839 -- April 14 , 1916 ) was an American botanist and plant pathologist who first discovered bacterial causes for plant disease .
Jayne Cortez ( May 10 , 1934 -- December 28 , 2012 ) was an African - American poet , activist , small press publisher and spoken - word performance artist whose voice is celebrated for its political , surrealistic and dynamic innovations in lyricism and visceral sound .
Andoni Lafuente Olaguibel ( born September 6 , 1985 in Guernica , Basque Country ) is a Spanish professional road and track bicycle racer .
Mohammad Kaykobad ( Bengali : মোহাম্মদ কায়কোবাদ ) is a computer scientist , educator , author , and columnist from Bangladesh .
Saul Hertz , M.D. ( April 20 , 1905 -- July 28 , 1950 ) was an American physician who discovered the use of radioactive iodine for the treatment of thyroid disease .
Anhayla Rene Stanley ( born May 24 , 1988 ) , better known by her stage name Anhayla ( /ˈɑːnˈheɪlɑː/ ahn - HAY - lah ) , is an American singer , songwriter , and guitarist .
Lila Azam Zanganeh is a writer raised in Paris , France , by exiled Iranian parents .
Altus Theart is a South African film , stage and television actor , best known for his roles in the South African soap opera Kruispad , and for his starring role in the 2008 Afrikaans teen comedy Bakgat .
Brenda Ueland ( October 24 , 1891 -- March 5 , 1985 ) was a journalist , editor , freelance writer , and teacher of writing .
Rory Calhoun ( August 8 , 1922 -- April 28 , 1999 ) was an American television and film actor , screenwriter , and producer .
Howell Appling , Jr. ( September 5 , 1919 -- October 16 , 2002 ) was an American Republican politician and businessman in the U.S. state of Oregon
Shekhar Joshi ( born September , 1939 ) is a Hindi author , who is also known for his insight into the culture , traditions and lifestyles of people of Uttarakhand .
Michelle Zonato Nicolini or Michelle Nicolini ( born January 5 , 1982 ) is a Brazilian Jiu - Jitsu practitioner and mixed martial artist .
Lam Hin Chung ( Chinese : 林衍聰 ; Jyutping : lam4 hin2 cung1 ) is a Hong Kong fencer .
Daniel Alexander Cameron ( December 10 , 1870 -- September 4 , 1937 ) was a Canadian politician from the province of Nova Scotia .
William Bender ( May 30 , 1930 -- May 4 , 2014 ) was an American music critic who reviewed for the American Record Guide .
John J. McNeill ( September 2 , 1925 -- September 22 , 2015 ) was ordained as a Jesuit priest in 1959 and subsequently worked as a psychotherapist and an academic theologian , with a particular reputation within the field of Queer Theology .
George Roscoe Davis was a Washington , DC lawyer .
Mohd Zabri Abdul Hamid was a police officer most remembered as a member of the deep 69 Commandos of the Pasukan Gerakan Khas .
István Szabó ( born February 18 , 1938 ) is a Hungarian film director , screenwriter , and opera director .
Rex Weyler ( born September 10 , 1947 ) is an American / Canadian author , journalist and ecologist .
Diane Keaton ( born Diane Hall ; January 5 , 1946 ) is an American film actress , director , producer and screenwriter .
Laurence Gronlund ( 1846 - 1899 ) was a Danish - born American lawyer , writer , lecturer , and political activist .
Zoriah Miller ( born January 27 , 1976 ) , or simply Zoriah , is an American photojournalist and war photographer .
John Alan Glennon ( born September 24 , 1970 ) is an American geographer and explorer .
Dieter Enders ( born 1946 ) is an organic chemist who has done work developing asymmetric synthesis , in particular using modified prolines as asymmetric auxiliaries .
Millie Kirkham ( born Mildred Eakes ; June 24 , 1923 -- December 14 , 2014 ) was an American singer who was featured on many classic hit recordings from the mid-1950s through the 1980s .

Chris Landreth ( born August 4 , 1961 ) is an American animator working in Canada , best known for his work on the 2004 film , Ryan .
Marsha M. Linehan ( born May 5 , 1943 ) is an American psychologist and author .
Bernt Berntsen ( Chinese : 賁德新 , January 1 , 1863 -- October 16 , 1933 ) , also known as Brother B. Berntsen , was a Norwegian - American Protestant Christian missionary to China .
Eric Bercovici ( February 27 , 1933 -- February 9 , 2014 ) was an American television / film producer and screenwriter .
Zeynel Doğan ( pronounced ( zejnel doɣɑn ) ) , Kurdish actor and film director .
Esteban Mellino ( March 13 , 1945 -- June 9 , 2008 ) was an Argentine actor best known for portraying the comical character Professor Diogenes Lambetain in the television series Badia y Cia , Fashion VIP and El humor de Cafe Fashion .
Farrell Dobbs ( July 25 , 1907 -- October 31 , 1983 ) was an American Trotskyist , trade unionist , politician , and historian .
John C. Mongan ( born April 17 , 1925 ) is an American politician who was the 42nd and 44th mayor of Manchester , New Hampshire , first from 1962 until 1963 and again from 1968 until 1969 .
S. S. Rajamouli ( born Koduri Srisaila Sri Rajamouli ) is an Indian film director , and screenwriter known for his works mainly in Telugu cinema .
Christopher Robillard Mordetzky ( born January 8 , 1983 ) is an American professional wrestler best known by his ring name Chris Masters .
Carlota Alfaro ( born June 4 , 1933 ) is a high fashion designer from Puerto Rico .
Esther Allan ( née Boyarsky ; April 28 , 1914 -- July 21 , 1985 ) was an American composer , pianist and organist .
Ayodele Basel , better known as Del B , is a Nigerian sound engineer , record producer and songwriter .
Paul Hitch Roney ( September 5 , 1921 -- September 16 , 2006 ) was a United States federal judge .
Charles Carroll Wood DSO CD ( b. c.1874-d . 1899 ) was a Canadian army officer , a lieutenant who was notable as the first Canadian to die in the Second Boer War in South Africa .
Saul Friedman ( March 4 , 1929 -- December 24 , 2010 ) was an American political journalist and educator .
Andriy Kyforenko ( Ukrainian : Андрій Кифоренко or Andrei Kiforenko from Russian : Андрей Кифоренко , born September 7 , 1980 ) is a Ukrainian former competitive figure skater .

Cecil Bransky ( born 25 May 1942 ) is a former lawn and indoor bowler .
Raffaele Franceschi ( born 18 May 1960 ) is an Italian swimmer who won a bronze medal in the 4×200 m freestyle relay at the 1983 European Aquatics Championships .
Autumn de Forest ( born October 27 , 2001 ) is an American painter from Las Vegas , Nevada .
David Nadien ( Armenian Դավիթ Նադյան ) ( March 12 , 1926 -- May 28 , 2014 ) was an American violinist and violin teacher .
According to some ancient authorities , Stasinus ( Greek : Στασῖνος ) of Cyprus , a semi - legendary early Greek poet , was the author of the Cypria , in eleven books , one of the poems belonging to the Epic Cycle that narrated the War of Troy .
Abraham Cooper RA ( 1787 - -1868 ) , was an English animal and battle painter .
Ardele Lister is an artist working in time - based media .
Wahab Dosunmu ( died June 9 , 2013 ) was a Nigerian politician and a member of the Senate of Lagos State ( 1999 - -2003 ) .
Christian Renoux is a French historian and an activist for nonviolence .
Arousyak Papazian was originally a teacher .
Heber Manning Wells ( August 11 , 1859 -- March 12 , 1938 ) was an American politician and the first Governor of the State of Utah .
Ron Bain is a Scottish television actor , director , producer , comedian and former stage actor who now focuses primarily on directing .
Sir Bennet Soysa or Warusahennidige Abraham Bastian Bennet Soysa ( 30 March 1889 - 1981 ) was a Ceylonese politician and philanthropist .
Trevor Bentham ( born Oct 11 , 1943 ) is an English former stage manager and screenwriter .
Guillem Ramon de Gironella was a late thirteenth - century Catalan troubadour .
Louis Thiry ( born 1935 in Fléville - devant - Nancy ) , is a French organist , composer and pedagogue .
Croswell Bowen ( 1905 - -1971 ) was an American political reporter , activist journalist , and biographer who contributed extensively to newspapers and magazines in the 1940s and 1950s .
Annette Curtis Klause ( born June 20 , 1953 ) is an English - American writer and librarian , specializing in young adult fiction .
Matthew Edward Kimber ( born August 6 , 1977 ) , better known by his stage name Josh Martinez , is a Canadian rapper , record producer and record label executive .
Warren Babcock , Jr. ( September 15 , 1866 -- June 3 , 1913 ) was a Michigan politician and educator .
Nick Pollock is a Seattle - based guitarist , singer , and songwriter best known for his work with the grunge / metal band My Sister 's Machine .
Angelo Starr is an American singer , musician and record producer .
Karl Dominik ( Chinese name : Kaier , 凯洱 , pinyin : Kǎiěr , lit . `` Triumphant River '' , born March 2 , 1980 ) is a Western Chinese speaking actor based in China .
Frederick Robert Halsey Herbert Noyes was an Anglican priest in the last quarter of the 19th century and the first two decades of the 20th .
Zareh Kalfayan ( Born Constantinople , Ottoman Turkey 1887 - died 1939 ) was an Ottoman painter of Armenian descent .
Robert Ader ( February 20 , 1932 -- December 20 , 2011 ) was an American psychologist and academic who co - founded psychoneuroimmunology , a field of study which explores the links connecting the brain , behavior , and the immune system .
Donyale Luna ( August 31 , 1945 -- May 17 , 1979 ) was an American model and actress .
The Altamura Painter was a classical Greek vase painter .
Henry Margenau ( April 30 , 1901 -- February 8 , 1997 ) was a German - U.S. physicist , and philosopher of science .
Umesh Shukla is an Indian film director who directed the Indian drama film Oh My God .
Guillaume de Saint - André ( fl . 15th/16th centuries ) was the secretary and biographer of John IV of Brittany .
Marissa Paternoster is an artist , singer and guitarist active in New Jersey 's New Brunswick music scene .
Uma Shankar Bajpai ( died February 6 , 2005 ) was an Indian diplomat and a veteran journalist .
Uri Regev is a lawyer and rabbi of the Reform movement of Judaism in Israel , and an active civil rights and religious pluralism advocate .
Edward E. Hammer ( December 27 , 1931-July 16 , 2012 ) was an engineer who was at the forefront of fluorescent lighting research .
A'Me Lorain ( born Amy Trujillo on May 11 , 1967 in Simi Valley ) is an American singer who was the lead singer for The Family Affair .
Patti Dahlstrom is a widely respected singer / songwriter , recording artist and teacher .
Robert C. Pittman ( April 25 , 1922 -- October 27 , 1996 ) was a US Army Air Forces pilot , electrical engineer , and entrepreneur .
Emily Remler ( September 18 , 1957 -- May 4 , 1990 ) was an American jazz guitarist who rose to prominence in the 1980s .
Alexander A. Gurshtein ( born 1937 ) is a Russian astronomer and historian of science .
Alexandra Berková ( July 2 , 1949 -- June 16 , 2008 ) was a Czech writer and educator .
Arati Ankalikar - Tikekar ( born in Bijapur ) is an Indian classical singer .
Nelson Cavaquinho ( October 29 , 1911 -- February 18 , 1986 , birth name Nelson Antônio da Silva ) was one of the most important singer / composers of samba .
Dessie Hughes was an Irish racehorse trainer and jockey .
Neil Howe ( born October 21 , 1951 ) is an American historian , economist , and demographer .
Gerhard Gruber ( born May 6 , 1951 in Aigen i m Mühlkreis ) is an Austrian composer and piano player .
Robert McWade ( January 25 , 1872 -- January 19 , 1938 ) , was an American stage and film actor .
James L. White ( March 26 , 1936 -- July 13 , 1981 ) was an American poet , editor and teacher .
Janet Flanner ( March 13 , 1892 -- November 7 , 1978 ) was an American writer and journalist who served as the Paris correspondent of The New Yorker magazine from 1925 until she retired in 1975 .
Alexander Stepanovich Yakovlev ( Russian : Алекса́ндр Степа́нович Я́ковлев ) ( November 23 , 1886 -- November 4 , 1953 ) was a Russian / Soviet writer .
Peggy Little ( born 1942 ) is an American country music singer best remembered for her country cover version of Dusty Springfield 's `` Son of a Preacher Man '' Little was born in Marlin , Texas and raised in Waco , Texas .
Bao Junhui ( Chinese : 鮑君徽 ; fl . 798 ) was a late eighth - century Chinese poet .
Nancy F. Cott ( born November 8 , 1945 ) is an American historian and professor who has taught at Yale and Harvard universities , and has mainly specialized in gender topics in the US in the 19th and 20th centuries .
Babette Mangolte is a French - American cinematographer and film director .
Isaac Israel Hayes ( March 5 , 1832 -- December 17 , 1881 ) was an Arctic explorer , physician and politician .
Anna Border Sheppard ( born December 22 , 1952 ) is an American politician and a Republican member of the West Virginia House of Delegates representing District 9 since her appointment by West Virginia Governor Earl Ray Tomblin June 21 , 2011 to fill the vacancy caused by the death of her husband , Representative Larry Border .
Paul Sabu ( born January 2 , 1960 ) is an American singer , songwriter , producer , and guitarist .
Peter Bussian is an independent filmmaker , photographer and visual media consultant who is known mainly for his work with refugees and other international development issues .
Augustus Washington ( 1820/1821 - June 7 , 1875 ) was an African - American photographer and daguerreotypist , who later in his career emigrated to Liberia .
Robert X. Cringely is the pen name of both technology journalist Mark Stephens and a string of writers for a column in InfoWorld , the one - time weekly computer trade newspaper published by IDG .
Vincenzo Mazza ( c 1748 - -1790 ) was an Italian painter and scenic designer for theaters , mainly in his native Bologna .
Henry Ulke ( January 29 , 1821 -- February 17 , 1910 ) was an American photographer and portrait painter .
Lars Ljungqvist ( born May 12 , 1959 ) is a Swedish economist probably best known as the author of Recursive Macroeconomic Theory , a standard graduate level textbook of modern macroeconomics , with Thomas J. Sargent .
Larry Mowry ( born October 20 , 1936 ) is an American professional golfer who played on the PGA Tour and Senior PGA Tour ( now known as the Champions Tour ) .
Herbert Hice Whetzel ( September 5 , 1877 -- November 30 , 1944 ) was an American mycologist and plant pathologist .
Joseph Pancoast ( November 23 , 1805 -- March 6 , 1882 ) was a renowned American surgeon .
Of Waterston 's exhibition Last Days , Regina Hackett wrote : `` If there 's a more imitated painter in America than Darren Waterston , I ca n't imagine who it would be .
Maulana Obaidullah Khan Azmi is an Indian Sunni Islamic Scholar and politician from Nationalist Congress Party .
Lucy Elizabeth Bather ( 1836 - -1864 ) , was an English writer for children , known as `` Aunt Elizabeth . ''
Francis Bret Harte ( August 25 , 1836 -- May 5 , 1902 ) was an American author and poet , best remembered for his short fiction featuring miners , gamblers , and other romantic figures of the California Gold Rush .
Colm Ó Maonlaí ( born 11 December 1966 ) is an Irish actor and musician who is best known for his portrayal of Sean Flynn in the film A Place to Stay .
Slaughter Joe aka Joe Foster ( born Joseph James Foster Ruiz ) is an English musical artist , record producer , historian , and an actor .
James Merritt Ives ( March 5 , 1824 -- January 3 , 1895 ) was an American lithographer , bookkeeper , and businessman .
Joseph Crespino ( born January 10 , 1972 ) is a political historian of the 20th Century United States , specializing in the history of the American South and of modern conservatism .
Travis Kauffman ( born August 21 , 1985 ) is an American heavyweight boxer nicknamed `` My Time . ''
R. Sakkarapani is an Indian politician and incumbent Member of the Legislative Assembly of Tamil Nadu from Oddanchatram Constituency .
Sergey Kazakov ( born July 8 , 1976 ) is a Russian amateur boxer best known to win the World Championships 2003 and European Championships 1998 , 2002 and 2004 in the Men 's Light Flyweight .
Dave McCaig ( born December 6 , 1971 in Thunder Bay , Ontario ) is a Canadian artist and colourist who also works in the animation industry .
Annie Laurie Gaylor ( born November 2 , 1955 ) is a co - founder of -- and , with her husband Dan Barker , a current co - president of -- the Freedom From Religion Foundation .
Kevin Hofbauer is an Australian actor known for his role as Constable Christian Tapu in the Australian police drama series Rush .
John Ingle ( May 7 , 1928 -- September 16 , 2012 ) was an American actor best known for his role as scheming patriarch Edward Quartermaine in the ABC soap opera General Hospital .
Doug Swingley ( born May 14 , 1953 ) is an American dog musher and dog sled racer who lives in Lincoln , Montana , who is a four - time winner of the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race across Alaska .
Klariza Clayton ( born 9 March 1989 ) is a British actress and singer known for her roles in television shows including Dani 's House , Skins , and House of Anubis .
Eric Lange ( born February 19 , 1973 ) is an American television and movie actor , best known for his roles as Erwin Sikowitz , an acting teacher from the television show Victorious , as Stuart Radzinsky on the ABC television series Lost , and as David Tate / Kenneth Hasting on FX 's The Bridge .
Isaac Leeser ( December 12 , 1806 -- February 1 , 1868 ) was an American , Ashkenazi Jewish lay minister of religion , author , translator , editor , and publisher ; pioneer of the Jewish pulpit in the United States , and founder of the Jewish press of America .
Michael Witney ( born Whitney Michael Armstrong November 21 , 1931 -- November 30 , 1983 ) was an American film and television actor .
Robert N. Bradbury ( March 23 , 1886 -- November 24 , 1949 ) was an American film director and screenwriter who directed 125 movies between 1918 and 1941 .
Reed Pierce ( born on April 24 , 1963 , Jackson , Mississippi ) is an American professional pool player .
Karabo Modise ( born July 20 , 1988 in Botswana ) is a Botswana cricketer and currently plays for the Botswana national cricket team .
Jessie Bernard was a prolific writer , having published 15 sole - authored books , 9 co - authored books , over 75 journal articles , and over 40 book chapters .
Nicolas Mesnager ( or Le Mesnager or Ménager ) ( 1658 - -1714 ) was a French diplomat .
Barry McGuire ( born October 15 , 1935 ) is an American singer - songwriter best known for the hit song `` Eve of Destruction '' , and later as a pioneering singer and songwriter of contemporary Christian music .
John Vaillant is an American writer and journalist whose work has appeared in The New Yorker , The Atlantic , National Geographic , and Outside .
Tommy Rainone ( born January 8 , 1980 in Rockville Centre , Long Island , New York ) is an American welterweight boxer nicknamed ' The Razor ' .
Father Albert Braun OFM ( September 5 , 1889 -- March 6 , 1983 ) was a Roman Catholic priest and teacher in the Southwest and the Pacific United States .
Yarden Gerbi ( Hebrew : ירדן ג'רבי‎ , born July 8 , 1989 ) is an Israeli judoka world champion .
Hans Feurer ( born Hanspeter Feurer , 1939 ) is a Swiss fashion photographer .
George Kapetan is an American actor who is earning a growing cult status in film .
Lino Tonti ( September 16 , 1920 -- June 8 , 2002 ) was an Italian motorcycle engineer known for designing a number of sport and racing motorcycles in the 1950s and 1960s , and for creating his signature ' Tonti frame ' for Moto Guzzi 's 1967 V7 Sport , setting his stamp on all Moto Guzzis since .
RAS-1 ( Richard Arthur Smith ) is a musician ( guitarist / singer ) who was in the band Long Beach Shortbus with former Sublime bassist Eric Wilson and Willard `` trey '' Pangborn of Falling Idols , along with drummer Damien Ramirez .
Jon Cowan is an American television producer and writer , best known for his work on television shows Crossing Jordan and Private Practice .
Quincey Daniels ( born August 4 , 1941 in San Diego , California ) is an American former welterweight boxer .
Uma Ramanan ( Tamil : உமா ரமணன் ) is an Indian playback singer , singing predominantly in Tamil .
Heinz Dürr is a German entrepreneur and a major shareholder in the Stuttgart - based engineering firm Dürr AG , founded by his grandfather in 1895 .
Hilary Weaver ( born May 2 , 1991 ) is a singer - songwriter born in Toronto .
Ludwig Elsholtz ( 1805 - 1850 ) , a German painter of genre subjects and battles , born at Berlin , studied in the Academy of his native city , and afterwards in the studio of Franz Krüger , the painter of horses .
Daniel Lencina - Ribes ( born February 5 , 1977 ) is a retired professional tennis player who is born in Alicante , Spain After marrying a Lithuanian tennis player Gabrielė Masiliūnaitė ( now Gabrielė Lencina ) he got by presidential decree , from president Paksas , the Lithuanian nationality .
Elizabeth Warlock is a noted magician and author and the daughter of the stage magician Peter Warlock .
Laurens Perseus Hickok ( December 20 , 1798 -- May 7 , 1888 ) , American philosopher and divine , was born at Bethel , Connecticut .
Benjamin C. S. Boyle ( born September 1 , 1979 in Monterey , California ) is an American composer , pianist , and music theorist .
Stephany Smith ( born August 10 , 1965 ) was the head women 's basketball coach at the University of Alabama from 2005 to 2008 and at Middle Tennessee State University from 1997 to 2005 .
Khalif Diouf , known by his stage name Le1f ( /liːf/ ) , is an American rapper and producer from New York City .
Richard Henry Major ( October 3 , 1818 -- June 25 , 1891 ) was a geographer and map librarian who curated the map collection of the British Museum from 1844 until his retirement in 1880 .
Helio Orovio `` The most important ( Cuban ) musician of the ( 19th ) century was Manuel Saumell Robredo '' The scores of Saumell 's Contradanzas for piano are available at Cuatro 40 Ediciones in printed form or downloadable PDF .
Klaus H. Hofmann ( February 21 , 1911 -- December 25 , 1995 ) was an American chemist and medical researcher .
Geoffrey Arend ( born February 28 , 1978 ) is an American film , television , voice and theater actor .
Mario Palanti ( September 20 , 1885 -- September 4 , 1978 ) was an Italian architect who designed important buildings in the capital cities of both Argentina and Uruguay .
Andy Bumatai is a Hawaiian - based comedian and actor .
Rafael Calventi Gaviño ( born in March 18 , 1932 , La Vega , Dominican Republic ) is a Dominican architect and diplomat .
Although Lamachus was known for his courage and military skill , he was sometimes thought less qualified than other generals because he lacked the necessary wealth and social position .
Kwon Jin - ah ( Hangul : 권진아 ; born July 18 , 1997 ) is a South Korean singer and guitarist .
Antoine Vialon ( 1814 -- 4 March 1866 ) was a French draftsman and engraver who became music editor and composer of vocal music later in his life .
Onur Şipal ( born March 17 , 1989 ) is a Turkish amateur boxer best known to qualify for the 2008 Olympics .
Joey Murphy is screenwriter and television producer , currently working as executive producer for Desperate Housewives .
Edwin Nanau Sitori , also known as Eddie Sitori ( born in the mid-1930s in Onepusu , Malaita ) , is a Solomon Islands former amateur composer and singer , best known for composing the country 's unofficial `` national song '' , `` Walkabout long Chinatown '' .
C. Sue Carter is a biologist and behavioral neurobiologist .
Abū al‐ʿUqūl Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al‐Ṭabarī ( flourished in Yemen during the 14th century ) was a leading astronomer in Ta'izz and the first teacher of astronomy at the Muʾayyadiyya Madrasa .
Daniel Templon is a French contemporary art dealer born in 1945 .
Akira Mitake ( 見岳 章 ; born November 11 , 1956 in Tokyo ) is a Japanese composer .
Sze Yu ( born 30 September 1962 ) is a Chinese - born Australian actor , television presenter and retired badminton player .
Jack Monroe ( born 1988 , Southend - on - Sea ) is a writer , journalist and activist .
Li Zhuhao ( born January 9 , 1999 in Wenzhou , Zhejiang ) is a Chinese competitive swimmer , specializing in butterfly .
Abraham Gabriel ( 16th to 17th - century ) was a Palestinian rabbi of probable Italian origin who lived at Safed .
Ralph Haver was an architect working in metropolitan Phoenix , Arizona , USA from 1945 until the early 1980s .
Harry Mark Petrakis ( pronounced /ˌpɛˈtreɪkɪs/ , pe - TRAY - kis ) ( born June 5 , 1923 ) is an American novelist and writer of short stories .
Robert Brubaker ( October 9 , 1916 -- April 15 , 2010 ) was an American character actor best known for his roles in television and movie westerns , including as Gunsmoke and 40 Guns to Apache Pass .
Dieter Vollhardt ( born September 8 , 1951 ) is a German physicist and Professor of Theoretical Physics at the University of Augsburg .
Jan Brett ( born December 1 , 1949 ) is an American illustrator and writer of children 's picture books .
Mark Romero ( born July 21 , 1963 ) is a retired American second generation professional wrestler better known by his ring name Mark Youngblood .
Morley Saunders ( c.1675 - 1737 ) was an Irish politician , barrister and landowner .
Lynne Duke ( July 29 , 1956 -- April 19 , 2013 ) was a prestigious journalist and author .
Erich Berneker ( February 3 , 1874 -- March 15 , 1937 ) was a German linguist , Slavicist and Balticist , follower of the Neogrammarian school .
Alastair Humphreys is an English adventurer , author and motivational speaker .
Fabio Mechetti is a Brazilian - born conductor .
Allyson Brown ( born 1984 or 1985 , sometimes credited as Allyson Ava - Brown ) is a British actress and singer .
Carolyn Denning ( May 30 , 1927 -- January 10 , 2016 ) was an American pediatrician whose research specialized in learning more about and treating cystic fibrosis .
Ger Maguire ( born 1973 ) is an Irish retired hurler and Gaelic footballer who play as a full - forward for the Tipperary senior teams .
César Soto Esquivel ( born September 17 , 1971 ) is a retired Mexican professional boxer and is a former WBC featherweight champion .
Loni Sanders ( born January 12 , 1958 ) is an American former pornographic actress and adult model .
Patrick Vinton Kirch is an archaeologist who studies Oceanic and Polynesian prehistory .
Iulian Pop ( March 12 , 1880 - November 22 , 1923 ) was an Austro - Hungarian and Romanian lawyer and politician , who became the first Romanian mayor of Cluj on January 19 , 1919 , one year after Transylvania became part of the Romanian state .
Leo Ruickbie is an historian and sociologist of magic , witchcraft and Wicca .
Pacino or Pecino da Nova ( late 14th century ) was an Italian painter active in a late Gothic art style around Bergamo .
Daniel Hobbins is a Professor of History at The Ohio State University ( OSU ) and an American historian specializing in Medieval France .
Eric Hoffer ( July 25 , 1898 -- May 21 , 1983 ) was an American moral and social philosopher .
Nelson Doubleday ( June 16 , 1889 -- January 11 , 1949 ) was a U.S. book publisher and president of Doubleday Company from 1922 - 1946 .
Nathalie Daoust ( born March 31 , 1977 ) is a Canadian photographer and contemporary artist .
Kristy Gazes ( born October 28 , 1967 ) is a professional poker player originally from California .
Yoseph Imry ( Hebrew יוסף אמרי ) is an Israeli physicist .
Mary Youngblood ( born June 24 , 1958 in Kirkland , Washington ) is a Native American musician who plays the Native American flute .
Rafikjon Sultonov ( born February 19 , 1988 ) is an Uzbek amateur boxer who competed at the 2008 Olympics at junior flyweight but was edged out by French southpaw Nordine Oubaali 7:8 .
Rafael Martínez Nadal ( April 22 , 1877 -- July 6 , 1941 ) was a Puerto Rican politician , senator , journalist , and businessman .
Clelia Duel Mosher ( KLEEL - ya DUE - el MOE - sher ; December 16 , 1863 -- December 21 , 1940 ) was a physician , hygienist and women 's health advocate who disapproved of Victorian stereotypes about the physical incapacities of women .
Josette Normandeau or Josette D Normandeau is a Canadian television producer and martial artist .
Johann Baptist Martinelli or Giovanni Battista Martinelli ( February 1701 - June 21 , 1754 ) was an Austrian architect and constructor of Italian descent .
Miloš Okuka ( born August 2 , 1944 , Porije near Ulog ) is a Serbian linguist , Slavist , dialectologist and literature historian .
Adolph A. Hoehling , Jr. ( November 3 , 1868 -- February 17 , 1941 in Washington , D.C. ) was a United States federal judge .
The Brygos Painter was an ancient Greek Attic red - figure vase painter of the Late Archaic period .
Jayaprakash Sittampalam Tissainayagam ( known as J. S. Tissainayagam , Tamil : ஜெயப்பிரகாஷ் சிற்றம்பலம் திசைநாயகம் ) is a Sri Lankan journalist .
Charles Bailey Clarke ( October 3 , 1875 -- January 27 , 1944 ) was a Portland , Maine politician .
Nick Larkins is an Australian rock musician who has played with various Australian acts , and solo .
Arjun Kapikad is an Indian film actor who appears in Tulu films and Kannada films .
Gary Thieltges is an American cinematographer , owner of Doggicam Systems and best known for inventing camera rigs used on big - budget Hollywood films and television shows .
Aaron Lewis ( born April 13 , 1972 ) is an American musician , who is the lead vocalist , rhythm guitarist , and founding member of the rock group Staind , with whom he has released seven studio albums .
Alfred Neobard Palmer ( 1847 - -1915 ) was a chemist and local historian .
Richard Melancthon Hurd ( June 14 , 1865 -- June 6 , 1941 ) was a pioneer real estate economist and political activist .
Kim Saiki - Maloney ( born January 24 , 1966 ) is a Japanese - American professional golfer who played on the LPGA Tour from 1992 to 2007 .
William Henry Merrill ( December 29 , 1868 -- September 17 , 1923 ) was an American electrical engineer who founded Underwriters Laboratories in 1894 .
Lenny Krayzelburg ( born September 28 , 1975 , as Leonid Krayzelburg ; Ukrainian : Леонід Крайзельбург , Russian : Леонид Крайзельбург ) is an American former backstroke swimmer , and Olympic gold medalist and former world record holder .
Jeremy Hobson is a national radio journalist .
Nina Roth ( born July 21 , 1988 as Nina Spatola ) is an American curler from McFarland , Wisconsin .
Giuseppe Zeno ( born May 8 , 1976 ) is an Italian actor of cinema , theatre and television .
George K. Fraenkel ( July 27 , 1921 -- June 10 , 2009 ) was an American physical chemist , dean of Graduate School of Arts and Sciences and chairman of the chemistry department at Columbia University .
Barry Zorthian ( 1920 -- 2010 ) was an American diplomat , most notably press officer for 4 1⁄2 years during the Vietnam war , media executive and lobbyist .
Liza Brönner ( Liza Bronner ) is an Afrikaans singer and songwriter .
Doris Grau ( October 12 , 1924 -- December 30 , 1995 ) was an American script supervisor , actress , and voice artist from Brooklyn .
Vartan Pasha ( Armenian : Վարդան փաշա ) , ( Hovsep Vartanian or Osep Vartanian ) was an Ottoman Armenian statesman , author , and journalist of the 19th century , promoted to the rank of `` Pasha '' after three decades in the service of the state .
Eystein Husebye ( born 1937 ) is a Norwegian seismologist .
Antonio Contri ( before 1701 -- September 10 , 1731 ) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period , mainly active in Ferrara .
Mike Porcel is an exiled Cuban born - American musician , guitarist , composer , orchestrator and song writer better associated with the Cuban musical movement of the 60s & 70s Nueva trova .
Theo Bleckmann is a jazz singer and new music composer , he was grammy nominated and received the ECHO award in 2010 .
Matty Dawson is an English rugby league player for St Helens in the European Super League .
George O. Petrie ( November 16 , 1912 -- November 16 , 1997 ) was an American radio and television actor .
Joshua Toole is a rugby league player who plays as a centre for Illawarra Cutters , a feeder team for St. George Illawarra Dragons .
Stephen Pohlig is an electrical engineer currently working at MIT Lincoln Laboratory .
Dr. Scott Sandford , is an astronomer and NASA space scientist .
Tapi Mra is a mountaineer from India and the first person from Arunachal Pradesh to scale Everest .
Vilhelm Bryde ( April 8 , 1888 -- April 24 , 1974 ) was a Swedish actor and art director .
Gudavalli Ramabrahmam was an Indian film director , screenwriter , and producer known for his works predominantly in Telugu cinema .
Inisai Toga was a Fijian rugby league player who played for the St George Dragons in the 1970s .
Walter Neale ( fl . 1618 - -1639 ) was an English military officer and an explorer and colonial administrator in the territory of New England that later became New Hampshire .
Karl Stevens ( born November 21 , 1978 in Concord , Massachusetts ) is a graphic novelist and painter .
Vato Gonzalez ( born 6 June 1983 as Björn Franken ) is a Dutch record producer , songwriter , artist , DJ , who is signed to Levels Recordings / Ministry of Sound / Crowd Control / Spinnin ' Records .
