James R. Pitts , known as Jim Pitts ( born January 1 , 1947 ) is an American state politician and lawyer who served in the Texas House of Representatives from 1993 to 2015 .
Eugenia Volodina ( Russian : Евгения Володина , born September 23 , 1984 ) is a Russian model .
Evgeny Messner ( Russian : Евгений Эдуардович Месснер , German : Eugen Messner ; 1891 - -1974 ) was a Russian professional soldier and military theorist .
Percival Goodman ( January 13 , 1904 -- October 11 , 1989 ) was an American urban theorist and architect who designed more than 50 synagogues between 1948 and 1983 .
Abraham Lincoln Marovitz ( August 10 , 1905 -- March 17 , 2001 ) was a federal judge on the United States District Court for the Northern District of Illinois .
Alfredo `` El Salsero '' Escalera ( born March 21 , 1952 ) is a Puerto Rican also known as Alfredo Escalera who was a world champion boxer .
Harry Lucey ( November 13 , 1913 -- August 28 , 1984 ) was an American comic artist best known for his work in MLJ and Archie Comics .
Christopher Shane Sweet ( born on January 6 , 1986 ) is an American actor , perhaps best known for his role as Josh Stevenson , Robbie 's younger brother , on Nickelodeon series The Journey of Allen Strange .
Edna Barker ( born 1936 ) is a former English international cricketer , who played 15 Test matches for the England women 's cricket team between 1957/58 and 1968/69 .
Ollie E. Brown ( sometimes credited as simply Ollie Brown ) ( born April 20 , 1953 ) is an American drummer , percussionist , record producer , and high - school basketball coach .
Lee Chin Cheh ( Chinese : 李景杰 ; pinyin : Lǐ Jǐngjié ) is a Malaysian politician and the former Selangor state assemblyman of the Kajang seat .
Mike Mattison is an American musician and vocalist of the Grammy Award - winning rhythm and blues group , the Tedeschi Trucks Band , as well as lead vocalist and co - founder of the blues rock trio Scrapomatic .
Anthony Dirrell ( born October 14 , 1984 ) is an American professional boxer and former WBC super middleweight champion .
Anthony Buckie Leach is an American foil fencing coach and fencer .
Gruffudd ab Adda ( fl . mid 14th century ) was a Welsh language poet and musician .
Giulio Caporali ( Perugia , active 1540 ) was an Italian painter and architect of the Renaissance .
Zheela ( also spelled as Zhila and Zhilla , Persian : ‎ ژیلا , July 15 , 1943 -- June 28 , 2009 ) was an Afghan singer and actress .
Frank Bartleman ( December 14 , 1871 -- August 23 , 1936 ) was an American Pentecostal writer , evangelist and missionary .
Wu Pau - hsien ( Chinese : 吳保賢 ; born February 6 , 1980 in Taiwan ) is a Taiwanese baseball player who currently plays for Brother Elephants of Chinese Professional Baseball League .
Gastón Arce Sejas ( December 25 , 1964 ) is a Bolivian performer , conductor , pedagogue and composer of contemporary music .
Piotra Sych ( Belarusian : Пятро Сыч or Пётра Сыч ) ( January 18 , 1912 - June 20 , 1963 ) , a Belarusian writer and journalist , born in Baturyna , Western Belarus , near Vileyka .
Sallie Chapman Gordon Law ( nicknamed Mother of the Confederacy ) ( 1805 - -1894 ) was the first recorded Confederate nurse in the American Civil War .
Rolf Deyhle ( 1938 - 2014 ) was a German property developer , art collector and film producer .
Franco Riccardi ( June 13 , 1905 -- May 24 , 1968 ) was one of the greatest Italian fencer and Olympic champion in épée competition .
Travis Mohr is a world record setting Paralympic swimmer and civil engineer .
Pamela Rambo is a colorist who has worked in the comics industry , perhaps best known for her work on Dark Horse Comics 's Star Wars series .
Felix Karasev or Felix Sutyrin was a KGB General and Soviet diplomat .
Elías Isaac Alippi was an Argentine actor , theatrical impresario , film director and theater director .
Anita Singhvi is an Indian classical singer .
Margaret Becker ( born July 17 , 1959 ) is an American Christian rock singer , guitarist , and songwriter .
Dave Gould ( March 11 , 1899 - June 3 , 1969 ) was a Hungarian - American choreographer and dance director .
Supoj Saenla ( born August 15 , 1980 ) is a former Thai professional snooker player who lives in Chiang Mai .
Rudolf Zahradník ( born October 20 , 1928 in Bratislava , then Czechoslovakia , now Slovakia ) is a Czech chemist .
John Sack ( March 24 , 1930 -- March 27 , 2004 ) was an American literary journalist and war correspondent .
Taaha Shah is an Indian actor and former model working in the Hindi film industry , known for his leading role in the 2011 Y - Films romantic comedy Luv Ka The End , a critical and commercial success , and subsequently featured in the 2013 commercially successful drama Gippi .
Enrique Bátiz Campbell ( born May 4 , 1942 ) is a Mexican conductor and pianist .
Jane Turzy was a Chicago , Illinois - born singer of traditional pop music .
Mort Shuman ( November 12 , 1936 -- November 2 , 1991 ) was an American singer , pianist and songwriter , best known as co - writer of many 1960s rock and roll hits , including `` Viva Las Vegas '' .
Rob Fleming is a Canadian politician who represents the riding of Victoria - Swan Lake in the Legislative Assembly of British Columbia .
Sophie Cooke ( born 3 April 1976 ) is a Scottish novelist , short story writer , poet , and travel writer .
Alan E. Steinweis ( born 1957 in Brooklyn ) is an American historian and a professor at the University of Vermont .
Jerry Portnoy ( born November 25 , 1943 , Chicago , Illinois , United States ) is an American harmonica blues musician , who has toured with Muddy Waters and Eric Clapton .
Alma Zohar ( Hebrew : עלמה זהר‎ ) ( born June 6 , 1977 ) is a critically acclaimed Israeli musician and singer .
Ferdinand Eckstein ( 1790 - -1861 ) , Baron d'Eckstein , was a philosopher and playwright .
James Augustus Fox ( August 11 , 1827 -- December 15 , 1900 ) was a Massachusetts lawyer and politician who served on the Board of Aldermen and as the Mayor of Cambridge , Massachusetts .
Ingrid Cole is an Atlanta , Georgia actor with the American Musical Theatre .
Ron Fletcher ( May 29 , 1921 -- December 6 , 2011 ) was an American Pilates Master Teacher , an author and a Martha Graham dancer .
Herbert M. Merrill ( September 13 , 1871 , in Campton , Grafton County , New Hampshire -- March 5 , 1956 , in Schenectady , New York ) was an American politician from New York .
Rosalie Abrams was an American feminist playwright , actress , and activist .
Asaf Avidan ( Hebrew : אסף אבידן‎ ; born March 23 , 1980 ) is an Israeli singer - songwriter and musician .
Patrizia Genovesi is an Italian photographer and video artist .
Boris Mordukhovich is an American mathematician recognized for his research in the areas of nonlinear analysis , optimization , and control theory .
Owen George Anthony Silvera ( born c.1956 ) , better known as Ambelique , is a Jamaican reggae singer , primarily working in the lovers rock genre .
Britt Vonk ( born April 11 , 1991 in Enschede ) is a Dutch softball player , who has represented the Dutch national team in international competitions .
Adam Riegler ( May 27th , 1998 ) is an American child actor .
Ray Browning is a fitness expert , biomechanist and former professional triathlete .
Marianne Macdonald ( born July 9 , 1934 in Kenora , Ontario ) is a Canadian children 's books author and novelist best known for her mystery series featuring London antiques bookstore owner and amateur investigator Dido Hoare .
Roberto de Villacis ( born March 10 , 1967 , as Robert O. Henrichsen de Villacis ) is an Ecuadorian American fashion designer and artist , best known as for his Trash Couture clothing brand and art collective , United Aliens .
Ralph Hammeras ( March 24 , 1894 -- February 3 , 1970 ) was an American special effects designer , cinematographer and art director .
John Morrissey ( February 12 , 1831 -- May 1 , 1878 ) , also known as Old Smoke , was an Irish American bare - knuckle boxer and a gang member in New York in the 1850s and later became a Democratic State Senator and U.S. Congressman from New York , backed by Tammany Hall .
Yoon Kuk Lee ( born August 24 , 1953 ) is a South Korean - born Austrian Composer and conductor .
Harry Elmer Barnes ( June 15 , 1889 -- August 25 , 1968 ) was an American historian who , in his later years , was known for his historical revisionism .
Sippy Pallippuram is a highly acclaimed children 's story writer in Malayalam who has won several awards including Kendra Sahitya Akademi Award and Kerala Sahitya Akademi Award .
Ben Oliver is a British comics artist who has worked for 2000 AD on Judge Dredd as well as providing art for The Authority , The Losers , and Ultimate X - Men
Michel Jean is a Canadian television journalist , who currently hosts the newsmagazine series JE on TVA and was formerly an anchor on the 24-hour news channel RDI .
Helena Ekholm ( née Helena Jonsson ) ( born September 6 , 1984 in Helgum ) is a former Swedish biathlete .
Patsy McGlone ( born 8 July 1959 ) is an Irish politician from Ballinderry in Northern Ireland .
Desmond Dube is a South African singer , actor , mime artist and entertainer .
Stanley Coulter ( June 2 , 1853 -- June 26 , 1943 ) was an American biologist , brother of J. M. Coulter , born at Ningpo , China , and educated at Hanover College .
Betty Jo Teeter Dobbs ( October 19 , 1930 -- March 29 , 1994 ) was a historian specializing in Isaac Newton 's occult studies .
Frank D. Stafford was an American physician and politician who served in the Vermont House of Representatives and as the fourth and sixth Mayors of North Adams , Massachusetts .
Dwight Nevil ( born August 25 , 1944 ) is an American professional golfer who played on the PGA Tour in the 1970s and later played on the Champions Tour .
The Adnan Hajj photographs controversy ( also called Reutersgate ) involves digitally manipulated photographs taken by Adnan Hajj , a Lebanese freelance photographer based in the Middle East , who had worked for Reuters over a period of more than ten years .
Charles Yuill ( August 14 , 1889 -- July 30 , 1972 ) was a butcher shop owner , former Mayor of Barrhead , Alberta and served as a Canadian federal politician from 1953 to 1958 .
Karel Fialka is an Indian born British singer - songwriter , best known for his 1987 single , `` Hey , Matthew '' .
Roy St. John is an American - born singer - songwriter .
Shawn Dou ( simplified Chinese : 窦骁 ; traditional Chinese : 竇驍 ; pinyin : Dòu Xiāo ; born December 15 , 1988 ) is a Chinese actor .
Tarun Arora is an Indian model turned actor who works in Bollywood films .
William Hayhurst ( December 31 , 1887 -- May 19 , 1975 ) was a farmer , principal , teacher , businessman and a Canadian federal politician .
Stephen Mear ( born 1964 ) is an English dancer and choreographer best known for his award - winning work in musical theatre .
Shajoon Kariyal is an Indian film director and producer working in Malayalam cinema .
Hui Shi ( Chinese : 惠施 ; pinyin : Huì Shī ; Wade -- Giles : Hui4 Shih1 ; 380 - -305 BCE ) , or Huizi ( Chinese : 惠子 ; pinyin : Huìzǐ ; Wade -- Giles : Hui4 Tzu3 ; `` Master Hui '' ) , was a Chinese philosopher during the Warring States period .
Constantine Andreou ( also : Costas Andreou , Kostas Andreou ; French : Constantin Andréou , Costas Andréou ; Greek : Κωνσταντίνος Ανδρέου , Κώστας Ανδρέου ) ( March 24 , 1917 -- October 8 , 2007 ) was a painter and sculptor of Greek origin with a highly successful career that spanned six decades .
Alexander Gurevich , ( born February 7 , 1944 ) is an Israeli painter and graphic artist .
Fritz von Uhde ( born Friedrich Hermann Carl Uhde ; May 22 , 1848 -- February 25 , 1911 ) was a German painter of genre and religious subjects .
Alex MacKinnon is a retired Canadian professional darts player who competed in the 1980s .
Catherine Steiner - Adair is a clinical psychologist , school consultant , author , and teacher whose professional life is devoted to working with children , parents , and schools .
Lü Buwei ( 291 - -235 BC ) was a politician of the Qin state in the Warring States Period of ancient China .
Daniel T. Willingham ( born 1961 ) is a psychologist at the University of Virginia , where he is a professor in the Department of Psychology .
Khatun Sapnara ( Bengali : খাতুন সাপনারা ; born 29 April 1968 ) is a Bangladeshi - born British judge .
Roland Piquepaille ( October 18 , 1946 -- January 6 , 2009 ) was a technology writer , both for ZDNet and for his own blog , Roland Piquepaille 's Technology Trends , and a former software engineer at Silicon Graphics and Cray Research .
Ethan Ash is an English singer - songwriter and musician , based in Cambridge , England .
Tamar Getter , born in Tel Aviv in 1953 , is an Israeli painter .
Josh Ryan is an American photographer who specializes in fashion and glamour photography .
Thaha is a Malayali Indian film director and writer known primarily for his slapstick comedy movies .
Carlos Abella y Ramallo ( April 13 , 1934 -- August 12 , 2014 ) was a Spanish diplomat whose career with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs spanned forty years until his retirement in 2004 .
George Raft ( born George Ranft ; September 26 , 1901 -- November 24 , 1980 ) was an American film actor and dancer identified with portrayals of gangsters in crime melodramas of the 1930s and 1940s .
Jean Lee Latham ( April 19 , 1902 -- June 13 , 1995 ) was an American writer who specialized in biographies for children or young adults .
Maria McCool ( born 23 May 1974 ) ( Irish : Maria Nic Cumhaill ) is an Irish singer from Gweedore , County Donegal .
Jesse Greer ( August 26 , 1896 -- October 4 , 1970 New York City ) was an American Broadway songwriter .
Beat Wyss ( 1947 in Basle ) is a Swiss art historian , professor ordinarius for art history and media theory at Karlsruhe University of Arts and Design , Germany , and member of the Heidelberg Academy of Sciences and Humanities .
Hasan Abidi ( Urdu : حسن عابدی ) was a noted Pakistani journalist , writer , and a senior Urdu language poet .
Jimmy Britt ( October 5 , 1879 , in San Francisco , California -- January 21 , 1940 ) was a boxer from 1902 to 1909 .
Bandō Mitsugorō X ( Japanese : 十代目 坂東 三津五郎 ) ( January 23 , 1956 -- February 2 , 2015 ) was a Japanese television presenter and kabuki actor .
Fred Spiker ( formerly known as Fred McQueen ) is an actor who bears a striking resemblance to Steve McQueen , whom Spiker claims is his father .
Jennifer Love Hewitt ( born February 21 , 1979 ) is an American actress , producer , author , television director and singer - songwriter .
John Philip Cohane , born in New Haven , Connecticut , was an archaeologist for the University of Pennsylvania .
George Litto is an American film producer and talent agent .
Arthur Mag ( October 11 , 1896 -- October 23 , 1981 ) was a Kansas City lawyer and philanthropist .
Ernest P. Young is an American historian of China and East Asia who focused his research on the Catholic Church in China and on Sino - Japanese relations .
Catherine Taft is an art critic , curator , and writer .
George Tattersall ( pseud . `` Wildrake '' ) ( June 13 , 1817 -- August 16 , 1849 ) was a sporting artist and architect .
S. P. Muthuraman is an Indian film director who works in the Tamil film industry .
Liz Rose ( born in Dallas , Texas ) is an American country music songwriter best known for her work with Taylor Swift .
Thomas Hale Boggs , Sr . ( February 15 , 1914 - presumably October 16 , 1972 but not declared dead until January 3 , 1973 ) was an American Democratic politician and a member of the U.S. House of Representatives from New Orleans , Louisiana .
Jason Robert Brown ( born June 20 , 1970 ) is an American musical theatre composer , lyricist , and playwright .
Andriy Grechylo ( Ukrainian : Андрій Богданович Ґречило , Andriy Bohdanovych Grechylo / Greczylo ) , is an Ukrainian historian , heraldist and vexillologist .
Minkailu Bah ( born in Magburaka , Tonkolili District ) is a Sierra Leonean politician and Lecturer and currently serves as Sierra Leone 's Minister of Education , Youth and Sports .
Andrew Cantrill is a British - born organist and choral director .
Lloyd Stone ( June 29 , 1912 -- March 9 , 1993 ) was an American poet who wrote the first two stanzas of the 1934 hymn This is My Song using the Finlandia Hymn melody composed by Jean Sibelius .
Gus Edson ( September 20 , 1901 - September 26 , 1966 ) was an American cartoonist known for two popular , long running comic strips , The Gumps and Dondi .
Larry Jeffries is an American former basketball player who is best known for his collegiate career at Trinity University in San Antonio , Texas between 1965 - -66 and 1968 - -69 .
Kevin MacAdam ( born February 28 , 1967 ) is a former Canadian politician and current political advisor .
Niccolò Zucchi ( Italian pronunciation : ( nikkoˈlɔ ˈdzukki ; * ˈtsukki ) ; December 6 , 1586 -- May 21 , 1670 ) was an Italian Jesuit , astronomer , and physicist .
Paul Calandrillo ( January 31 , 1956 in Hoboken , New Jersey -- December 30 , 2007 ) , better known as Paul Land , was an American actor who appeared in the movies Spring Break and The Idolmaker .
Joseph Cook ( December 29 , 1922 -- April 15 , 2014 ) , known as Little Joe Cook , was an American rhythm and blues singer and songwriter .
Melissa Errico is an American actress , singer , recording artist and writer .
James Farr is a freelance animator and animation director based at present in Tulsa , Oklahoma .
George Bruce Upton ( October 11 , 1804-July 1 , 1874 ) was an American shipbuilder and politician who served as a member of the Massachusetts House of Representatives in the Massachusetts Senate and in the Massachusetts Executive Council .
Kieran Joyce ( born 4 April 1987 ) is an Irish hurler who currently plays as a right wing - back for the Kilkenny senior team .
Joey Osbourne is a founding member and drummer for Acid King , Altamont , and The Stimmies .
Fritz August Breuhaus ( February 9 , 1883 -- December 2 , 1960 ) was a famous German architect , interior designer , and designer in the 20th century .
W. R. F. Browning is an Anglican clergyman and theologian .
Jade Yorker ( born June 16 , 1985 ) is an American actor of film and television .
Dan Ponce is a Chicago television journalist for WGN - TV , radio talk show host on WLS - AM ( 890 ) and founder of the renowned a cappella group Straight No Chaser .
Emanuel Ortega is an Argentine pop singer .
Edward Aczel is a British stand - up comedian known for his `` anti - comedy '' style of clumsy delivery presenting as uninterested and lacking belief in both his material and performing skills .
Albert Innaurato ( born June 2 , 1947 ) is an American playwright , theatre director , and writer .
Georg Nikolaus von Nissen ( sometimes Nicolaus or Nicolai ; January 22 , 1761 -- March 24 , 1826 ) was a Danish diplomat and music historian .
Norman F. Dixon is a British psychologist most noted for his 1976 book On the Psychology of Military Incompetence .
Mark Leslie Norton ( February 7 , 1956 -- April 5 , 2007 ) , better known as Mark St. John , was a guitarist best known for his brief work with the rock band Kiss from April to November 1984 .
Xavier Simoni ( born 20 March 1984 in Biarritz , France ) is a professional ice hockey player .
Amandititita is a Mexican singer and songwriter of cumbia .
Mark Summer was the Turtle Island Quartet 's original cellist ; he is a co - founder of the quartet and performed with Turtle Island ( a.k.a . Turtle Island String Quartet ) from its founding in 1985 until the fall of 2015 .
Taku Iwasa is a Japanese professional wrestler who currently wrestles for Dragon Gate .
Everett Fox is a scholar and translator of the Hebrew Bible , a graduate of Brandeis University .
Emily Lyons ( born July 18 , 1956 ) is an American nurse who was gravely injured when Eric Robert Rudolph bombed an abortion clinic in Birmingham , Alabama , where she worked .
Shane Hart is an English actor , writer , producer and casting director .
Dr. Naeem M. Abdurrahman ( a.k.a . Naeem Al - Gheriany ) P.h . D , PE ( Arabic نعيم عبدالرحمن الغرياني ) is a Libyan nuclear scientist , engineer and academic .
Jefferson Moore is an American actor , writer , producer , director and editor based in Louisville , Kentucky .
José Antonio Garrido Nataren is a Mexican engineer , currently serves as Rector of the University of Technology Tecamachalco
Adelmota of Carrara ( early 14th - century ) was an Italian physician .
Stephane Gauger is a Vietnamese - American film director , screenwriter , and cinematographer .
Will Knightley ( born 23 April 1946 ) is an English television and stage actor .
Václav Vích ( 1898 - -1966 ) was a Czech cinematographer , who worked on over a hundred films in a variety of different countries during his career .
Giora Feidman ( Hebrew : גיורא פיידמן‎ ; born March 26 , 1936 ) is an Argentine - born Israeli clarinetist who specializes in klezmer music .
Stephen Arthur Jennings ( May 11 , 1915 -- February 2 , 1979 ) was a mathematician who made significant breakthroughs in the study of modular representation theory , ( Jennings 1941 ) .
Dr. Pricilla Nanyang ( Priscila Nyanyang ) is a South Sudanese politician .
Rex Ballard is a cinematographer with a career in movies , music videos and television programs .
Michelle Mungall is a Canadian politician , who was elected as a New Democratic Party Member of the Legislative Assembly of British Columbia in the 2009 provincial election , representing the riding of Nelson - Creston .
Charles Whibley ( 1859 - -1930 ) was an English literary journalist and author .
John Hallet is a British actor , probably best known for his role as Barney in the 1970s television drama Survivors .
Robert Emhardt ( July 24 , 1913 -- December 26 , 1994 ) was an American character actor who worked on stage , in film and on television .
Mark Hempsell is a British aerospace engineer and CEO of Hempsell Astronautics Ltd. which is currently designing the Universal Space Interface Standard ( USIS ) , a system which aims to standardise berthing , docking and attachment of satellites and other spacecraft .
Dave Finkel ( born May 15 , 1970 ) is an American television producer , actor , and screenwriter who has worked on many successful television shows .
Felipe Codallos ( born in Guatemala ) was a Central American general and politician .
Talvin DeMachio is a retired escort and American pornographic actor who appears in pornographic movies aimed at gay audiences .
Colin McDowell is a British fashion writer , journalist and academic .
Christa Hughes is an Australian singer , known for her wild on - stage antics and powerful voice .
Lincoln Goldie ( November 11 , 1864 -- September 19 , 1931 ) was an industrialist and politician in Ontario .
Stryker McGuire ( born September 12 , 1947 ) is a journalist working in London .
Jesus Gil Abreu ( September 1 , 1823 -- June 30 , 1900 ) was a rancher and pioneer who owned a New Mexico ranch that now comprises Philmont Scout Ranch .
Mükerrem Kamil Su ( Bursa , 1906 - -1984 ) was a popular Turkish writer .
Aaron ben Eliezer Lipman was a mid - seventeenth century rabbi of the town of Sępólno Krajeńskie in Poland ( known as Zempelburg in German , and later part of West Prussia between 1772 and 1920 ) .
Frank Jay Haynes ( October 28 , 1853 -- March 10 , 1921 ) , known as F. Jay or the Professor to almost all that knew him , was a professional photographer , publisher and entrepreneur from Minnesota who played a major role in documenting through photographs , the settlement and early history of the great Northwest .
Judith Baumel ( b. October 9 , 1956 Bronx , New York ) is an American poet .
Tom Marcello has been a jazz photojournalist since the 1970s .
Joan Marcus is a theatrical photographer based in Manhattan , New York , USA .
Walter Matthau ( /ˈmæθaʊ/ ; October 1 , 1920 -- July 1 , 2000 ) was an American actor best known for his role as Oscar Madison in The Odd Couple and his frequent collaborations with Odd Couple co - star Jack Lemmon .
Derek Kerswill ( born April 5 , in Wilmington , DE ) is an American musician best known for his drumming in the bands Unearth , Seemless , Kingdom of Sorrow , and multiple fill - ins / studio projects .
Robert Wightman is an American actor perhaps best known for replacing Richard Thomas in the role of `` John - Boy Walton '' in the TV series The Waltons .
Ciro Punzo ( Naples , February 14 , 1850 - 1925 ) was an Italian painter , mainly of interior scenes of daily life and vedute of churches .
Sanford Plummer ( Ga - yo - gwa - doke ) ( 1905 - -1974 ) ( Seneca ) was a Native American narrative watercolor painter from New York state .
Rohit Bal is a fashion designer from New Delhi , India .
John Gregory Dunne ( May 25 , 1932 -- December 30 , 2003 ) was an American novelist , screenwriter and literary critic .
Heitor Villa - Lobos ( Portuguese : ( ejˌtoʁ ˌvilɐ ˈlobus ) ; March 5 , 1887 -- November 17 , 1959 ) was a Brazilian composer , described as `` the single most significant creative figure in 20th - century Brazilian art music '' .
William Boyd Allison Davis ( October 14 , 1902 -- November 21 , 1983 ) was an American educator , anthropologist , writer , researcher , and scholar .
Robert Stack ( born Charles Langford Modini Stack , January 13 , 1919 -- May 14 , 2003 ) was an American actor , sportsman , and television host .
Ashkan Sahihi is an Iranian - American photographer known for his unique photographic series .
Ajit Iqbal Singh ( born 1943 ) is an Indian mathematician , specialising in functional analysis and harmonic analysis .
Lew Lipton ( 1897 - -1961 ) , was an American screenwriter who was active during the latter part of the silent era and the beginning of the talking picture era .
Matthias Jabs ( born October 25 , 1955 ) is a German guitarist and songwriter .
Felice Taylor ( born Florian Taylor , January 29 , 1948 , Richmond , California , United States ) is an African American singer , best known for her recordings in the late 1960s .
Alfred Powell Rawlins Hawtin was an English cricketer active from 1902 to 1930 who played for Northamptonshire ( Northants ) .
Anthony Terrell Smith ( born March 3 , 1966 ) , better known by his stage name Tone Lōc or Tone - Lōc /ˈtoʊn ˈloʊk/ , is an American rapper and actor .
Ingvar Svensson , born 1944 , is a Swedish Christian democratic politician , member of the Riksdag since 1998 .
Trinere Veronica Farrington ( born November 29 , 1964 in Miami , Florida ) , better known as Trinere , is an American singer , songwriter and recording artist who had several major dance hits in the 1980s and early ' 90s and who was very influential in the freestyle music genre .
Ferris Foreman ( August 24 , 1808 - February 11 , 1901 ) was a lawyer , politician , and American soldier during the Mexican American War , as well as a Colonel commanding a Volunteer Regiment and the District of Southern California during the American Civil War .
Natalie Bookchin is an artist based in Brooklyn , New York .
Charles Albert Woods was an associate justice on the South Carolina Supreme Court and then a United States federal judge .
John Edward Schwitzer ( April 1870 -- January 1911 ) was assistant chief engineer for the Canadian Pacific Railway in the early 1900s .
Wallace Geoffrey was a British writer and actor .
Antônio Austregésilo ( April 21 , 1876 -- December 23 , 1960 ) , was a Brazilian neurologist important to the history of the field in his nation .
Patrick M. Hughes ( born September 19 , 1942 ) is a retired United States Army officer who served the 12th Director of the Defense Intelligence Agency .
Hettimulla Appuhamilage Shashikala Dedunu Siriwardene ( born 14 February 1985 ) in Colombo , known as Shashikala Siriwardene , is the Sri Lankan cricketer and current captain of the Sri Lankan women 's cricket team .
Ryan Singel is a San Francisco - based blogger and journalist covering tech business , tech policy , civil liberty and privacy issues .
Wilhelm of Herle ( born in Herle in Dutch Limburg at an unknown date in the fourteenth century ; time and place of death unknown ) was a painter .
Kęstutis Dirgėla ( born May 9 , 1960 , Klaipėda ) is a Lithuanian engineer and politician .
Shekhar Sen is a singer , music composer , lyricist and actor .
William Kapell ( September 20 , 1922 -- October 29 , 1953 ) was an American pianist and recording artist , killed at the age of 31 in the crash of a commercial airliner returning from a concert tour in Australia .
Daniel Frohman ( August 22 , 1851 -- December 26 , 1940 ) was an American theatrical producer and manager , and an early film producer .
Carey Eidel is an American actor , director , and writer .
Ralph Frary ( July 3 , 1876 -- November 9 , 1925 ) was a professional baseball player and umpire .
Maxamed Daahir Afrax ( Somali : Maxamed Daahir Afraax , Arabic : محمد طاهر أفرح‎ ) Ph . D. is a Somali novelist , playwright , journalist and scholar .
A Catholic priest , Peter Serracino Inglott was ordained in Milan by Cardinal Montini , later Pope Paul VI .
Gus Heinze ( born May 1 , 1926 in Bremen , Germany ) is an American photorealist painter .
Ophrah Shemesh ( December 9 , 1952 ) is an Israeli - American artist , best known for her intense , existentially themed oil and tempera paintings of women and men .
Konrad Wolff ( March 11 , 1907 -- October 23 , 1989 ) was a German pianist and musicologist .
Wang Luming ( Chinese : 王鲁明 ) ( November 1915 - September 28 , 2005 ) was a Chinese diplomat .
James Steven Sadwith ( born October 20 , 1952 ) is an American producer , screenwriter , and Emmy Award - winning film director .
Sir John Jackson , 1st Baronet ( 1763 - -1820 ) was a British politician and businessman .
Maria Rosa Canelas ( July 30 , 1941 -- June 10 , 2004 ) , better known as Rosinha de Valença , was a Brazilian composer , arranger and musician .
Elize Ryd ( born October 15 , 1984 ) is a Swedish singer - songwiter , dancer , composer and show artist , best known as one of the three vocalists in the melodic metalcore / power metal band Amaranthe .
Johnnie Newt ( born July 9 , 1979 ) better known by his stage name J. Valentine , is an American R&B singer , and songwriter .
Clark Ashton Smith ( January 13 , 1893 -- August 14 , 1961 ) was a self - educated American poet , sculptor , painter and author of fantasy , horror and science fiction short stories .
Gina Berriault ( January 1 , 1926 -- July 15 , 1999 ) , was an American novelist and short story writer .
Tony Bonello is an Australian professional mixed martial artist and grappler who is currently signed to ONE FC .
Du Shenyan ( Chinese : 杜審言 ; pinyin : Dù Shěnyán ; Wade -- Giles : Tu Shen - yen , ca . 645 - -708 ) was a poet of the early Tang dynasty , and one of whose poems was collected in the popular anthology Three Hundred Tang Poems .
John W. Lippitt ( April 21 , 1822 Adams , Berkshire County , Massachusetts -- May 15 , 1896 Solsville , Madison County , New York ) was an American politician from New York .
Damien O'Hagan is a former Tyrone Gaelic football player .
Harald Bode ( October 19 , 1909 -- January 15 , 1987 ) was a German engineer and pioneer in the development of electronic music instruments .
Mariano Melgar ( 1791 - -1815 ) was a Peruvian patriot , poet , artist , and warrior for the cause of independence from Spain .
Anna Maria Nobili is an Italian physicist active in the field of gravitational physics .
Alfredo Jocelyn - Holt Letelier is a Chilean writer and historian who has gained notoriety by his study of the Chilean elite aristocracy and plutocracy and his criticism of traditional state - centered historiography .
Marshall Purnell ( born June 8 , 1950 ) is a prominent African - American architect and 2008 president of the American Institute of Architects .
Chris Sheldon ( born 25 September 1962 ) is a record producer , particularly of rock music based in London , England .
Gianetto Cordegliaghi or Gianetto Cordella Aghi , also called il Cordella , ( Early 16th century ) was an Italian painter , active mainly in Venice .
Evan Rosen is an American author , speaker , business strategist , blogger , and journalist .
Kurt Laurenz Metzler ( born January 26 , 1941 ) , Signature `` KLM '' , is a Swiss sculptor .
Max Whitaker is a UK - based photographer whose work mostly involves people & portraits , often these concern arts subjects .
Catherine Connolly is an Irish Independent politician .
Stian Heimlund Skjæveland ( born November 19 , 1973 in Stavanger ) is a Norwegian representational painter and sculptor in the figurative tradition who also draws in black and white .
Wael Abdul Latif ( born c. 1950 ) is an Iraqi politician from the secular Iraqi National List coalition .
Anton Gag ( born Anton Gaag in Walk , Tachau , June 12 , 1859 -- New Ulm , May 22 , 1908 ) was a Bohemian - American painter and studio photographer known for his portraits , still lifes , landscapes , and murals .
Tobias Kassung ( born 1977 ) is a German classical guitarist and composer .
Curtis Earle Lang ( January 20 , 1937 -- December 17 , 1998 ) was a Canadian poet , artist , photographer , seaman , inventor and entrepreneur .
Saint Tuotilo ( Tutilo , Tutilo von Gallen , Tutilo of Gall , Tutilo of Saint Gall ) ( c.850 -- c.915 ) was a medieval monk and composer .
Catherine Cuthbertson was an English - language novelist published in London in the early 19th century .
Lucas Macías Navarro ( born in Valverde del Camino , Huelva , August 11 , 1978 ) is a Spanish oboist .
Jenny Lou Carson , ( January 13 , 1915 - -December 16 , 1978 ) , born Virginia Lucille Overstake , was an American country music singer - songwriter and the first woman to write a No . 1 country music hit .
Navaneetham Padmanabha Seshadri , popularly known as N. P. Sheshadri , was an Indian musicologist , scholar , administrator and the founder secretary of National Cultural Organization .
Giovanni Giacomo Coleti or Coletti ( May 2 , 1734 -- August 15 , 1827 ) was an Italian historian and philologist .
Apiarius of Sicca was an African priest convicted by the Bishops of Africa of numerous unspecified crimes in the early 5th century AD , and excommunicated by Bishop Urbanus of Sicca Veneria .
Steven Weisberg is a film editor who usually collaborates with director Alfonso Cuarón .
Kyle Prandi ( born June 19 , 1979 in Cleveland , Ohio ) is an American diver and Olympian from Strongsville , Ohio .
Enrique Tovar Ávalos was a Mexican film director notable for remaking several Universal Horror films into Spanish language versions .
Šarūnas Liekis is a Lithuanian historian and political scientist .
Julia Spencer - Fleming ( born 1961 ) is an American novelist of Mystery fiction .
Charles A. Hufnagel , M.D. ( August 15 , 1916 - -May 31 , 1989 ) was an American surgeon who in the early 1950s invented the first artificial heart valve .
Ernst Evald Bergroth ( April 1 , 1857 -- November 22 , 1925 ) was a Finnish physician and amateur entomologist .
Maurice Weiner ( August 18 , 1930 -- September 30 , 2012 ) was an American politician who served as Deputy Mayor of Los Angeles under Mayor Tom Bradley .
Jama Musse Jama ( Somali : Jaamac Muuse Jaamac , Arabic : جامع موسى جامع‎ ) ( b. 1967 ) is a prominent Somali ethnomathematician and author .
Otto Buck ( born 15 November 1876 ) was a former Australian rules footballer who played with Carlton in the Victorian Football League ( VFL ) .
Michael Gilday ( born January 5 , 1987 ) is a former Canadian short track speed skater from Yellowknife , Northwest Territories .
Yakov Kasman ( b. February 24 , 1967 ) is a Russian classical pianist , professor of piano , and artist - in - residence at the University of Alabama at Birmingham .
Alan Robert Rogowski ( born September 22 , 1942 ) , better known by his ring name of Ole Anderson , is an American retired professional wrestler and a promoter .
Juan Almeida Bosque ( February 17 , 1927 -- September 11 , 2009 ) was a Cuban politician and one of the original commanders of the insurgent forces in the Cuban Revolution .
Michael Anesko is an U.S. literary critic , writer and professor .
Kristine Peterson is a film director who worked as an assistant director and second unit director on several films as well as directing her own films in the late 80s and 90s .
Phoebe Kreutz is a singer - songwriter , primarily associated with the anti - folk scene of New York City , but also known for her theater and television work .
Shaukat Mahmood ( Bengali : শওকত মাহমুদ ) , also spelled as Shawkat Mahmud is a Bangladeshi journalist .
Abou Elela Mady ( Arabic : أبو العلا ماضي‎ ) ( born 3 April 1952 ) is an Egyptian engineer and politician .
Takehiko Bessho ( 別所 毅彦 Bessho Takehiko , October 1 , 1922 -June 24 , 1999 ) , born Akira Bessho ( 別所昭 , Bessho Akira ) , was a Japanese baseball player whose professional career as a player lasted from 1942 until 1960 .
Tamás Meggyes ( born March 7 , 1967 ) is a Hungarian politician , who served as mayor of Esztergom between 1999 and 2010 .
Richard Coke , Jr. ( November 16 , 1790 -- March 31 , 1851 ) was a nineteenth - century congressman and lawyer from Virginia .
David Sirlin is an American game designer and fighting game player .
Knud Arne Jürgensen ( born July 8 , 1952 ) is a Danish music- , ballet- and theater historian , dramaturg , curator of exhibitions , senior researcher , dr . phil .
Lawrence G. Paull ( born 1938 ) is an American neofuturistic production designer and art director .
Aaron Phillip ( born January 31 , 1974 ) , better known by his stage name Afu - Ra , is a New York - based American underground rapper .
Tim Spanton is an award - winning UK journalist and amateur international chess player .
David Zane Mairowitz ( born 1943 in New York , United States ) , is a writer .
Steven Handley ( born 23 July 1970 ) is a former Australian rules footballer who played with Geelong in the AFL during the 1990s .
In London Gilbert Shakespeare was a haberdasher , a seller of needlework supplies such as thread , needles , and ribbons , living in the parish of St Bride 's .
Serafino Belfanti ( March 28 , 1860 -- March 6 , 1939 ) was an Italian immunologist , founder of the Istituto Sieroterapico Milanese , the first Italian medical and vaccine research institute .
Andry Laffita Fernández ( born March 26 , 1978 in Pinar del Río ) is a retired Cuban amateur boxer .
Hàng Lâm Trang Anh ( born January 14 , 1990 ) , known by her stage name Suboi , is a Vietnamese rapper , singer , and songwriter .
Fred Fortin ( born Joseph Antoine Frédéric Fortin Perron on May 5 , 1971 in Dolbeau - Mistassini , Quebec ) is a Canadian rock singer - songwriter .
Joseph Kinsey Howard ( February 28 , 1906 -- August 25 , 1951 ) was an American journalist , historian , and author , who wrote extensively about the history , culture , and economic circumstances of Montana .
Redd Velvet ( born Crystal Tucker , December 29 , 1968 , Omaha , Nebraska , United States ) is an American blues and soul singer , best known for her unconventional entrance into the music industry .
Charles Evenden , soldier , cartoonist , and author , is probably best remembered as the founder and guiding inspiration of the ex - servicemen organisation known as the Memorable Order of Tin Hats .
Dorothy Davenport ( March 13 , 1895 -- October 12 , 1977 ) was an American actress , screenwriter , film director , and producer who appeared in silent film for Biograph Studios under the direction of D.W. Griffith .
Cole South is a 27-year - old professional poker player , author , and entrepreneur from Washington , DC . South is best known for his play online , though he has also made television appearances on Poker After Dark in season 5 of the show .
Shana Hiatt ( born 17 December 1975 ) is an American model and presenter who has appeared in several magazines .
Michael Arthur Herrera ( born November 6 , 1976 ) , known professionally as Mike Herrera , is an American singer , songwriter , musician , and bass guitarist , most widely known as the lead vocalist , bass guitarist , and composer for the punk band MxPx .
Darris Kilgour is a former professional lacrosse player and coach .
Ryan Quinn ( born January 22 , 1987 ) is an American professional mixed martial artist who most recently competed in the lightweight division of Titan FC .
Pauline de Rothschild ( née Potter ; December 31 , 1908 -- March 8 , 1976 ) was a writer , a fashion designer , and , with her second husband , a translator of both Elizabethan poetry and the plays of Christopher Fry .
Joel Polis ( born October 3 , 1951 ) is an American television , film and stage actor .
The Master of the Malchin Altar ( German : Meister des Malchiner Altar ) was a northern German Late Gothic painter who was active in Hamburg in the first half of the 15th century .
William A. Lord ( August 28 , 1849 -- August 21 , 1927 ) was a Vermont lawyer and politician who served as Speaker of the Vermont House of Representatives .
Hansjörg Knauthe ( born July 13 , 1944 in Geising ) is a retired East German biathlete , who competed at the Olympics .
Francis Strother Lyon ( February 25 , 1800 -- December 31 , 1882 ) was a prominent Alabama attorney and politician .
Steve Guyger ( born September 12 , 1952 ) is an American Chicago blues harmonica player , singer , and songwriter .
Lenka Dusilová ( born December 28 , 1975 ) is a Czech Angel Award - winning singer - songwriter .
Charlie Bisharat is an American Grammy - winning violinist who has toured and/or recorded with numerous notable artists .
Mou Zongsan ( Chinese : 牟宗三 ; pinyin : Móu Zōngsān ; Wade -- Giles : Mou Tsungsan , 1909 - -1995 ) was a Chinese New Confucian philosopher .
Gérard Pierre - Charles ( December 18 , 1935 , Jacmel -- October 11 , 2004 , Cuba ) was a Haitian politician and former leader of the Unified Party of Haitian Communists .
Wade McCollum is an American film actor , stage actor and composer / musician .
Raul Amaya ( born February 2 , 1986 ) is an American mixed martial artist who competes in Bellator 's welterweight division .
Alfred Jacob Miller ( January 2 , 1810 -- June 26 , 1874 ) was an American painter and sketcher best known for his paintings concerning the northwestern United States .
Mel Carter ( born April 22 , 1939 , Cincinnati , Ohio ) is an American singer and actor .
Tim Lucas ( born May 30 , 1956 ) is a film critic , biographer , novelist , screenwriter , blogger , and publisher / editor of the video review magazine Video Watchdog .
Shadi Petosky ( born September 18 , 1974 ) is an American comics author , designer , and television animator .
Richard Fleischner is a Providence , RI based environmental artist .
Martin Iveson is a British composer known for his audio work within the video games industry and better known for his contributions to the world of music releases .
Carwyn Davies ( 1964 - -1997 ) is a former Welsh international rugby union player .
Niccola Ricciolini ( born 1637 , date of death unknown ) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period .
Fiona Fairhurst is the inventor of the Speedo Fastskin swimsuit .
Rod MacDonald ( born August 17 , 1948 ) is an American singer - songwriter , novelist , and educator .
Essie Kelley - Washington ( born January 12 , 1957 ) is an American former middle - distance runner who specialized in the 800-meter run .
Farkhunda Zahra Naderi ( Dari : فرخنده زهرا نادری ) is an Afghan politician .
Washington Gardner ( February 16 , 1845 -- March 31 , 1928 ) was a lawyer , minister , politician and Civil War veteran from the U.S. state of Michigan .
Budd Mishkin ( born 1959 ) is a television host and correspondent for New York 's 24-hour news network , NY1 .
Kay Burley ( born 1961 ) is an English television newsreader and presenter .
Guy Sigsworth is a British composer , producer and songwriter .
Justice Smith ( August 9 , 1995 ) is an American film and television actor , best known for playing Radar in the film Paper Towns .
Carolyn Fluehr - Lobban is an anthropologist and Sudanist and a founder and past president of the Sudan Studies Association .
Sidney E. King ( August 22 , 1906 - April 24 , 2002 ) was an American painter and art teacher who lived in Massachusetts and Virginia .
Shreya Guhathakurta ( শ্রেয়া গুহঠাকুরতা ) ( February 3 , 1975 ) is an Indian Rabindra Sangeet singer .
Jacqueline Logan ( November 30 , 1904 -- April 4 , 1983 ) was a star of the silent motion picture screen who was on board William Randolph Hearst 's yacht the Oneida in 1924 when film director Thomas Ince died .
Quintin Hoare is a British leftist intellectual and literary translator .
Tõnu Kalam is an American orchestral pianist and conductor .
Angelo Dundee ( born Angelo Mirena ; August 30 , 1921 -- February 1 , 2012 ) was an American boxing trainer and cornerman .
Roger Huerta ( born May 20 , 1983 ) , is an American mixed martial artist .
Noémie Lafrance ( born November 22 , 1973 ) is a Canadian - born choreographer living and working in New York since 1994 .
Thomas N. Soffron ( December 10 , 1907 -- February 21 , 2004 ) was the clam digger and restaurateur who created the fried clam strip .
Darby Slick is an American guitarist and songwriter , best known as a former member of The Great Society , and as the writer of the Jefferson Airplane song , `` Somebody to Love '' .
Linda Gordon is an American feminist and historian .
The Urxed was exclusively a live performance - only musician , with exception to two compilation appearances , and various remix work , until November 2011 , when a split 12 `` with Stephen Steven , was released by PPM Records .
Selma George is an Indian film singer in Malayalam cinema during the 1970s .
James W. Plummer ( January 29 , 1920 -- January 16 , 2013 ) was an engineer who served as the fifth Director of the National Reconnaissance Office .
Epic Mazur ( born Bret Hadley Mazur on August 31 , 1970 ) is an American vocalist , rapper , and record producer .
Russell Martingell ( details of birth and death unknown ) was an English cricketer who was associated with Surrey and made his first - class debut in 1828 .
Jesper Ahle ( born February 13 , 1981 ) is a Danish handball player who plays for Danish Handball League side Team Tvis Holstebro .
Edmund Horne of Canterbury , Kent , was an English politician .
Mel Kendrick ( born July 28 , 1949 ) , is an American artist , known primarily for his sculptural work in wood , bronze , rubber , paper and , most recently , cast concrete .
Mahmud ibn Sa'ad was an architect who lived in 13th-14th centuries .
Peter Riegel is an American research engineer who developed a mathematical formula for predicting race times for runners and other athletes given a certain performance at another distance .
José Ron ( born August 8 , 1981 ) , is a Mexican television actor .
Phil Moy , like his twin brother Jeff Moy , is a professional comic book artist .
Anne Lorne Gillies ( Scottish Gaelic : Anna Latharna NicGillìosa ) is a singer , writer and Gaelic activist .
Ajai Lall is a Christian preacher and missionary in India .
Cassandra O'Neal ( born Cassandra Louise O'Neal on January 17 , 1973 ) is an American musician , composer , and producer .
Gunturu Seshendra Sarma B.A. B.L. ( October 20 , 1927 -- May 30 , 2007 ) , also known as Yuga Kavi , was a Telugu poet , critic and litterateur .
The Honourable A. Catherine Everett , formerly a judge of the Provincial Court of Manitoba , was appointed to the Family Division of the Court of Queen 's Bench of Manitoba on November 23 , 2006 .
Najibullah Quraishi is an award winning Afghan journalist and filmmaker .
Jason Suecof ( born April 3 , 1980 ) is an American record producer , mixer , guitarist and song - writer .
Franklin Freeman Randall , known by his stage name Fly Young Red is an American rapper who gained notoriety due to his controversial song `` Throw That Boy Pussy '' .
Jacob Cox ( November 9 , 1810 -- January 2 , 1892 ) was a landscape and portrait painter in Indianapolis , Indiana , US .
Paul Bertolli is a chef , writer , and artisan food producer in the San Francisco Bay area of California .
Giorgio Antoniotto ( Giorgio Antoniotto d’Adurni ) , ( 1680 - -1766 ) , was an Italian musician , who is noted as the author of a musical treatise , L’arte armonica , and as an early composer of music for violoncello .
Bear McCreary ( born February 17 , 1979 ) is an American composer and musician living in Los Angeles , California .
Richard Herd , Jr. ( born September 26 , 1932 ) is an American actor in television and film .
Jean - Baptiste Quéruel ( 1779 - -1845 ) was the inventor of the method for industrial production of sugar from beet .
William Irwin Grubb ( March 8 , 1862 -- October 27 , 1935 ) was a United States federal judge who struck down key portions of President Roosevelt 's New Deal .
Michelangelo Spada ( active 1730 ) was an Italian painter in Verona .
Désiré Collen ( born 21 June 1943 ) is a Belgian physician and chemist .
Dennis Clontz ( April 10 , 1951 -- June 14 , 2004 ) was an American playwright , journalist , and screenwriter .
Matthew Diamond ( born November 26 , 1951 ) is an American film and television director , producer and choreographer .
Trey Gunn ( born December 13 , 1960 ) is an American musician , known for his membership in progressive rock band King Crimson from 1994 to 2003 , playing Warr Guitar and Chapman Stick .
Tony Yazbeck is an American actor , singer , and dancer , best known for his work on the Broadway stage including the 2014 revival of On the Town for which he received 2015 Tony Award and Outer Critics Circle Award nominations for lead actor in a musical .
Jason McGerr is an American musician , best known as the drummer for the band Death Cab for Cutie .
Tad Hilgenbrink ( born Tad M. Hilgenbrinck , October 9 , 1981 ) is an American actor , known for his role as Matt Stifler in American Pie Presents :
Gabriele Taylor is a philosopher and university teacher .
Christine Bestland ( born April 28 , 1992 ) is an ice hockey player for the Mercyhurst Lakers women 's ice hockey program .
Fritz Sdunek ( pronounced zdoo - neck , April 18 , 1947 -- December 22 , 2014 ) was a German professional boxing trainer and previously an amateur boxer .
Josh Stolberg ( born March 7 , 1971 ) is an American film director , screenwriter , and photographer .
Ewald Walch ( born August 18 , 1940 ) was an Austrian luger who competed from the mid-1950s to the early 1970s .
Kerstin Alm ( born May 9 , 1949 ) is a politician of the autonomous Åland Islands .
George Getz Shumard ( 1823 - -1867 ) was an American geologist and surgeon .
Francisco Hernández Tomé ( d.1872 ) was a Spanish mural painter who decorated the interiors of many churches and theatres in Madrid .
C. A. Stephens ( born Charles Asbury Stevens , October 21 , 1844 -- September 22 , 1931 ) was an American writer of short stories and articles .
Douglas Huebler ( October 27 , 1924 -- July 12 , 1997 ) was an American conceptual artist .
Sir Lloyd Erskine Sandiford , KA , PC ( born March 24 , 1937 ) is a Barbadian politician .
Henry Munn is a writer and poet who studied the use of hallucinogenic plants by the Conibo Indians of eastern Peru and also the Mazatec Indians of the mountains of Oaxaca .
Robert Victor Evan Wong ( July 4 , 1895 - October 19 , 1952 ) was a politician , civil engineer , rancher and businessman , elected to the British Guiana legislature in 1926 and 1934 , and appointed to its Executive Council in 1928 .
Sydnee Michaels ( born June 15 , 1988 ) is an American professional golfer currently playing on the LPGA Tour as of 2012 .
Thomas Blacket Stephens ( 1819 - -1877 ) was an alderman and mayor of Brisbane Municipal Council , a Member of the Legislative Assembly of Queensland and a Member of the Queensland Legislative Council .
Lil ' Wil ( born Wil Martin , March 25 , 1987 ) is an American rapper , born in New Orleans , Louisiana and raised in Dallas , Texas .
Janet Kauffman ( born June 10 , 1945 ) is an American novelist , poet , and mixed media artist .
Marcus Deen ( born 5 August 1973 ) is a former Dutch figure skater .
Elinor Burkett ( born October 9 , 1946 ) is an American journalist , author , film producer , and documentary director .
Yulia Belokobylskaya ( Russian : Юлия Белокобыльская ) ( born December 14 , 1995 ) is a Russian former artistic gymnast and was the Russian national champion in the floor exercise in 2011 .
Fabio Novembre ( October 21 , 1966 ) is an Italian architect and designer .
Allan Gurganus is an American novelist , short story writer , and essayist whose work , which includes Oldest Living Confederate Widow Tells All and Local Souls , is often influenced by and set in his native North Carolina .
John Herzfeld is an American film and television director , screenwriter , actor and producer .
Maxine D. Brown is an American computer scientist and associate director of the Electronic Visualization Laboratory ( EVL ) at the University of Illinois at Chicago ( UIC ) .
Koren Shadmi was born in Israel , where he worked as an illustrator and cartoonist for various magazines .
Bargil Pixner ( March 23 , 1921 -- April 5 , 2002 ) was an ethnically German , yet politically Italian , Benedictine monk , Biblical scholar and archaeologist , and Benedictine authority on the Dead Sea scrolls .
Robert Lissauer ( May 1 , 1917 -- October 14 , 2004 ) was an American composer , author , and musicologist .
Srđan Šajn ( Serbian Cyrillic : Срђан Шајн , Romani : Srdjan Šajn ; born March 28 , 1963 ) is a Serbian politician .
Ciarán McGann is an Irish hurler from Castlelyons in County Cork .
Loula Anagnostaki ( born ca 1935 - 1940 ) is a Greek writer .
John Mankiewicz ( born February 18 , 1954 ) is an American television and film executive producer and screenwriter .
Ferenc Anisits ( born December 23 , 1938 ) is a Hungarian engineer , engine developer .
Herb Dean ( born September 30 , 1970 ) is an American mixed martial arts referee and former fighter .
Georgia Wettlin Larsen is a Nakota singer who has released several discs featuring Native American songs .
Michael Bisio ( March 4 , 1955 Troy , New York ) is an American jazz double bass player , composer and bandleader .
Charles Corbett Powell Wilson was a Victorian engineer and public servant , responsible for construction and Maintenance of bridges in Western Region of Victoria , Australia .
Mike Gunn ( born 1964 ) is a British stand - up comedian , presenter , actor , writer , and voiceover artiste .
Tyler Perry ( born Emmitt Perry Jr. ; September 13 , 1969 ) is an American actor , producer , director , screenwriter , playwright , author , and songwriter , specializing in the gospel genre .
John Gould Fletcher ( January 3 , 1886 -- May 10 , 1950 ) was an Imagist poet ( the first Southern poet to win the Pulitzer Prize ) , author and authority on modern painting .
Daniel Coronell is a Colombian journalist and Vice President of News for Univision in the United States .
Alberto Fernández de Rosa ( Spanish pronunciation : ( alˈβerto ferˈnandes ðe ˈrosa ) ; born in 1944 ) is an experienced Argentine actor .
Meri Wilson Edgmon ( June 15 , 1949 -- December 28 , 2002 ) , known professionally as Meri Wilson , was a model and singer - songwriter , best known for singing double entendre novelty songs .
Shane Rimmer ( born 28 May 1929 ) is a Canadian actor and voice actor , known for providing the voice of Scott Tracy in the British television series Thunderbirds ( 1965 - -66 ) .
John Mark Nelson ( born November 23 , 1993 ) is a songwriter and producer based in Minneapolis , Minnesota .
Dijon Prioleau ( born December 19 , 1992 ) , known as Dijon , is an American gospel singer .
Eric Oemig was an American politician from Washington state , who served as a Democrat in the Washington State Senate .
Víctor Hugo Cárdenas Conde ( born 1951 ) is a Bolivian indigenous Aymara activist and politician .
Shaun Casey ( born January 7 , 1954 ) is a former model active from the mid-1970s through the mid-1980s .
Chuck Oberstein ( December 18 , 1935 -- May 8 , 2002 ) was an American painter , best known for clown paintings .
Benjamin Chertoff is a journalist , photographer and video producer .
Michael Ann Holly is an American art historian renowned for her work on historiography and the theory of art history .
Joe Enook is a Canadian politician , who was elected to represent the district of Tunnuniq in the Legislative Assembly of Nunavut in a by - election on September 12 , 2011 .
Stephan Güsgen ( born March 26 , 1962 in Dormagen , North Rhine - Westphalia ) is a retired West German swimmer , who specialized in sprint freestyle events .

Abdul Rahman Jassim is a Bahraini modern pentathlete .
Ambrose Lam San - keung ( Chinese : 林新強 ) is a Hong Kong solicitor who served as the President of the Law Society of Hong Kong from 2013 until his resignation in 2014 .
Cornelius Ambrosius Logan ( born Baltimore , Maryland , May 4 , 1806 ; died on the Ohio River near Wheeling , then in the state of Virginia , February 22 , 1853 ) was an American actor , playwright , and journalist who was father to a famous family of actresses and writers .
Doris Kearns Goodwin ( born January 4 , 1943 ) is an American biographer , historian , and political commentator .
In 2008 , Valdo Randpere won the Estonian version of the Just the Two of Us ( Laulud Tähtedega ) reality television singing contest in duet with Estonian singer Eda - Ines Etti .
Rick Lewers is a bishop in the Anglican Church of Australia .
Gustav Langenscheidt ( October 21 , 1832 -- November 11 , 1895 ) was a German language teacher , book publisher , and the founder of Langenscheidt Publishing Group .
Ota Kulhánek , born 1935 , is a Czech seismologist who currently resides in Uppsala , Sweden , where he is emeritus professor of geophysics at Uppsala University .
Gareth Myles is a British academic economist .
Theodosia Tsatsou ( Greek : Θεοδοσία Τσάτσου ) is a Greek singer , known for her songs with the band `` Ble '' , and also for her solo career .
Aaron Craze is an English celebrity chef who often appears in the ITV Food series Saturday Cookbook .
Dawn Holden is an English cricketer and a former member of the England women 's cricket team .
Enrique Pinti ( born October 7 , 1939 in Buenos Aires ) is an Argentine actor and comedian .
Harrison Carroll Hobart ( January 31 , 1815 - January 23 , 1902 ) was a colonel in the Union Army during the American Civil War and a lawyer and politician in the state of Wisconsin .
Zdeněk Košler ( March 25 , 1928 -- July 2 , 1995 ) was a Czech conductor , who played an important role in Czech musical life of the second half of 20th century , notably during the sixties and the eighties .
Salvador Mazza ( June 6 , 1886 -- November 9 , 1946 ) was a noted Argentine physician and epidemiologist , best known for his strides in helping control American trypanosomiasisan endemic disease among the rural , poor majority of early 20th century South America .
C. Bradford Welles ( August 9 , 1901 -- October 8 , 1969 ) was an American Classicist and ancient historian , born in Old Saybrook , Connecticut .
Angus MacInnis ( September 2 , 1884 -- March 3 , 1964 ) was a socialist politician and Canadian parliamentarian .
Emre Aydın ( born February 2 , 1981 ) is a Turkish rock singer - songwriter .
Frans Ceusters is a Flemish television writer .
Kerry S. Harris ( born December 8 , 1969 ) is an American entrepreneur and inventor .
Ben Feleo ( January 24 , 1926 -- September 21 , 2011 ) was a Filipino film director and screenwriters who directed more than forty films .
Chai Songyue ( Chinese : 柴松岳 ; November , 1941 ) is a politician of the People 's Republic of China .
Bob Avian ( born December 26 , 1937 ) is an American choreographer , theatrical producer , and stage director .
Margaret Nagle ( born January 12 , 1969 ) is a screenwriter , television producer and human rights activist .
Jonathan Corwin ( also Curwin or Corwen , November 14 , 1640 -- June 9 , 1718 ) was a wealthy New England merchant , politician , and magistrate .
Aaron Kraten is a mixed media artist situated in Cookeville , Tennessee .
Helen Donaldson ( born 14 March 1968 in Rockhampton , Queensland ) is an Australian opera singer best known for her performances of the heroines in Gilbert and Sullivan operas .
Nicolas - Ignace de Beaubois ( October 15 , 1689 -- January 13 , 1770 ) was a French Jesuit priest and missionary who joined the Canadian mission in Quebec in 1719 .
Noga Nir - Kistler ( May 18 , 1979 ) is an Israeli born American Paralympic swimmer and table tennis player who won 2 silver medals at the 2007 Parapan American Games for table tennis singles and doubles .
Kris Fillat ( Buchanan ) ( born November 7 , 1970 , in San Diego , California ) is a former field hockey player from the United States , who made her international senior debut for the Women 's National Team in 1990 .
Emily Jenkins ( born 1967 ) , who sometimes uses the pen name E. Lockhart , is an American writer of children 's picture books , young - adult novels , and adult fiction .
Benjamin Ferris ( August 7 , 1780 - November 9 , 1867 ) was a watchmaker and historian from Wilmington , Delaware .
Isaac Wilbour ( April 25 , 1763 -- October 4 , 1837 ) was an American politician from Rhode Island holding several offices , including the sixth Governor of the state .
Henry Bond Fargo ( August 29 , 1843 -- December 1 , 1932 ) was an American politician and businessman who spent most of his professional career in Geneva , Illinois .
Hogan Sheffer ( born Mark Wayne Sheffer on June 12 , 1958 ) is an American screenwriter .
Aziz Sait was an Indian politician , who served in the council of ministers of Karnataka state .
Janice Miller is an American singer who sings in Urdu , Punjabi and Hindi despite not speaking a word of any of the languages .
Harry Sternberg was an American painter , printmaker and educator .
George Henry Burgess ( June 8 , 1831 -- April 22 , 1905 ) was an English landscape painter , wood engraver and lithographer .
John Roddick ( born July 4 , 1976 ) is an American former professional tennis player and the current head tennis coach at the University of Oklahoma .
Jessica Dougherty is a modern pin - up artist born in 1975 , notable for being featured artist in a number of art and tattoo books and magazines .
Matt O'Gara is a former hurler from Toomevara , County Tipperary , Ireland .
Christopher E. Gerty ( born October 19 , 1975 ) is an American aerospace engineer who worked on NASA 's Constellation Program .
Ali Abdi Aware ( Somali : Cali Cabdi Aware , Arabic : علي عبدي العور‎ ) is a Somali politician .
Bruno Courcelle is a French mathematician and computer scientist , best known for Courcelle 's theorem in graph theory .
From 1986 to 1989 , after working in the scientific literature seminar of Babes - Bolyai University , Géza Szőcs went into political exile in Switzerland , where he worked in Geneva as a journalist .
Bill Kurtis ( born William Horton Kuretich ; September 21 , 1940 ) is an American television journalist , producer , narrator , and news anchor .

Ernesto Alonso ( February 28 , 1917 -- August 7 , 2007 ) was a Mexican producer , director , cinematographer and actor .
Mark Picchiotti is a club DJ , producer and songwriter based out of Chicago , Illinois .
Clement A. Riley ( November 20 , 1905 -- May 31 , 1988 ) was a Massachusetts politician who served as the Massachusetts Registrar of Motor Vehicles from 1957 - 1963 .
Juan de Santa Gertrudis was sent as a missionary to South America in 1757 and between 1758 and 1767 during his evangelizing , he founded a mission in Putumayo Department called Agustinillo .
Chen Chien - liang ( Chinese : 陳建良 ; pinyin : Wú Míngjī ) is a politician in the Republic of China .
Brooke Waggoner ( born May 30 , 1984 ) is an American singer - songwriter from New Orleans , Louisiana , who resides in Nashville , Tennessee .
George Branham III ( born November 21 , 1962 in Detroit , Michigan ) is a professional ten - pin bowler and former member of the Professional Bowlers Association ( PBA ) .
Jerzy Żurawlew ( December 25 , 1886 -- October 3 , 1980 ) was a Polish pianist , conductor , teacher , and founder of the International Chopin Piano Competition .
Symeon Cosburn is an accomplished jazz singer born in London , England .
João Simões Lopes Neto ( March 9 , 1865 -- June 14 , 1916 ) was a Brazilian regionalist writer of Rio Grande Do Sul .
Nabil Al Fadl ( 1949 -- December 22 , 2015 ) was a Kuwaiti politician who was a member of the Kuwaiti National Assembly and a columnist with the Al - Watan newspaper .
Tim O'Malley ( born 3 July 1944 ) is an Irish former Progressive Democrats politician .
John Guth ( born June 21 , 1981 ) is a professional poker player from Vancouver , Washington who won a bracelet at the World Championship Limit Omaha-8 event at the 2007 World Series of Poker .
William Dwight Whitney ( /ˈwɪtni/ ; February 9 , 1827 - -June 7 , 1894 ) was an American linguist , philologist , and lexicographer who edited The Century Dictionary .
Joseph - Edmond Roy ( December 7 , 1858 -- May 8 , 1913 ) was a Quebec notary , editor , historian and political figure .
Louis Quinn ( March 23 , 1915 -- September 14 , 1988 ) was an American television and film actor , best known for his role as Roscoe from 1958 to 1963 in the ABC / Warner Brothers detective television series , 77 Sunset Strip .
Walter Edwin Arnoldi ( New York , December 14 , 1917-October 5 , 1995 ) was an American engineer mainly known for the Arnoldi iteration , an eigenvalue algorithm used in numerical linear algebra .
Quan Hansheng ( simplified Chinese : 全汉升 ; traditional Chinese : 全漢昇 ; pinyin : Quán Hànshēng ; Wade -- Giles : Chu'an Han - Sheng , Chuan Han - Sheng September 19 , 1912 -- November 29 , 2001 ) is a notable Chinese Economic historian .

Gabino Coria Peñaloza ( February 19 , 1881 -- October 31 , 1975 ) was an Argentine poet and lyricist .
Bao Xun ( died 226 ) , courtesy name Shuye , was a general and politician of the state of Cao Wei during the Three Kingdoms period .
Wallada bint al - Mustakfi ( Arabic : ولادة بنت المستكفي‎ ) ( born in Cordova in 1001 - died March 26 , 1091 ) , was an Andalusian poet .
Dewey Balfa ( March 20 , 1927 -- June 17 , 1992 ) was an American Cajun fiddler and singer who contributed significantly to the popularity of Cajun music .
Zuhur Wanasi ( Arabic : زهور ونيسي ; also written as Zhour Ouanissi and Zhor Ounissi ; born 1937 ) is a prolific Algerian author and politician .
Michael Ray Aquino is a former intelligence officer in the police force of the Philippines .
Sylvester Primer ( 1842 - 1912 ) was an American linguist and philologist known for his pioneering work in 1887 on the dialect of the European - American residents of Charleston , South Carolina .
Redd Davis ( born 1896 , date of death unknown ) was a Canadian film director and producer who directed more than twenty films between 1932 and 1942 .
Maria Papadopoulou ( Greek : Μαρία Παπαδοπούλου ; born September 8 , 1980 ) is a Cypriot former swimmer who specialized in butterfly events .

Gaius Cocceius Balbus ( fl . 1st century BC ) was a Roman politician and military commander who served as suffect consul in 39 BC .
Peter Josyph is a New York artist who works concurrently as an author , a painter , an actor - director , a filmmaker , and a photographer .

Pietro da Rimini ( floruit 1315 - 1335 ) was an early 14th - century Italian painter .

Norman Geschwind ( January 8 , 1926 -- November 4 , 1984 ) was a pioneering American behavioral neurologist , best known for his exploration of behavioral neurology through disconnection models based on lesion analysis .

Claude Goudimel ( c. 1514 to 1520 -- between 28 August and 31 August 1572 ) was a French composer , music editor and publisher , and music theorist of the Renaissance .
Marie Colinet ( Fabry ) ( ca . 1560 - ca . 1640 ) , a midwife and surgeon , introduced the use of heat for dilating and stimulating the uterus during labour , performed caesarian sections successfully , and the first to use a magnet to extract a piece of metal from a patient 's eye .
Christian Wirth ( born in the 1970s ) , better known by the pseudonym RaD Man , is an American computer artist and historian .

Penelope Umbrico ( January 31 , 1957 ) is an artist / photographer best known for appropriating images found using search engines and picture sharing websites .
Gerald Home ( born October 18 , 1950 ) is the actor who played Tessek - Squid Head and the Mon Calamari Officer in Return of the Jedi .
