Elsie Allen ( 22 September 1899 -- 31 December 1990 ) was a Native American Pomo basket weaver from the Cloverdale Rancheria of Pomo Indians of California in Northern California , significant as for historically categorizing and teaching Californian Indian basket patterns and techniques and sustaining traditional Pomo basketry as an art form .
Koh Traoré ( born August 29 , 1989 in Ouagadougou ) is a Burkinabé - born Ivory Coast football striker who plays for EGS Gafsa in the Tunisian Ligue Professionnelle 1 .
Dyzaiss - Lys Mouithys Mickalad ( born July 4 , 1985 in Brazzaville ) is a Congolese football player , who is currently playing for Al - Qadisiyah FC .

Slavomír Kňazovický ( born May 3 , 1967 in Piešťany ) is a Czechoslovak - Slovak sprint canoer who competed from the early 1990s to the early 2000s ( decade ) .

Gjyste Vulaj ( born on July 9 , 1977 in the small town of Vuksanlekići , Montenegro ) is a very famous Albanian singer who sings Pop music and many other genres .
Carl Axel Magnus Lindman ( 6 April 1856 in Halmstad - 21 June 1928 ) was a Swedish botanist and botanical artist , the son of Carl Christian Lindman and Sophie Fredrique Löhr .
Petri Suvanto ( born November 13 , 1992 ) is a Finnish racing driver from Seinäjoki .
Jack Costanzo ( born September 24 , 1919 , Chicago , Illinois ) is an American percussionist .
Mangal Singh Champia ( born 9 November 1983 in Jamshedpur ) is an Indian archer , who won multiple medals in several International event , including Asian Games .
Piero Braglia ( born January 10 , 1955 in Grosseto ) is an Italian football manager and former player , currently in charge as head coach of Lecce in the Lega Pro division .
Yuval Spungin ( or Yuval Shpungin , Hebrew : יובל שפונגין‎ ; born 3 April 1987 in Ramat Gan ) is an Israeli footballer who currently plays for Maccabi Tel Aviv in the Israeli Premier League .
Philippe Ermenault ( born 29 April 1969 in Flixecourt ) is a French former track cyclist .
Richard Charles Guthridge ( also spelt Gutteridge and Guttridge in different records ) was born in Poplar , East London on 11 June 1837 , the son of James Gutteridge and Ann Illingworth .
Lauren LaPonzina ( born January 23 , 1979 , in Baltimore , Maryland ) is reporter in the West Palm Beach , Florida area .
Born in Düren , Max von Schillings was brother to the photographer Carl Georg Schillings .
Norbert Mészáros ( Hungarian pronunciation : ( ˈnorbɛrt ˈmeːsaːroʃ ) ; born 19 August 1980 in Pápa ) is a Hungarian football player .
Béla Hamvas was born on 23 March 1897 in Eperjes ( Prešov ) , in the Sáros County of the Kingdom of Hungary ( present - day Slovakia ) .
Petr Altrichter ( born May 24 , 1951 in Frenštát pod Radhoštěm , Czechoslovakia ) is a Czech conductor .
Torin Koos ( born July 19 , 1980 , in Minneapolis ) is an American cross country skier who has competed since 1998 .
Jonathan Anthony Solis Lapus ( or known as John Lapus or simply Sweet , born July 7 , 1973 in Manila ) is a Filipino actor , host and comedian .
Mary Schneider AM , ( 25 October 1932 , Rockhampton , Queensland ) is an Australian singer , songwriter and performer , who is a master at the classic Swiss Alpine style , she is best known for yodelling the works of various standards by many a classic composer .
Malbim was born in Volochysk , Volhynia to Yehiel Michel Wisser and his wife .
Franko B ( born Franco Bosisio in Milan in 1960 ) is an Italian performance artist based in London .
Georges Wybo was born in Paris in 1880 , the son of a jeweler .
Born in Modena , Raffaele Scapinelli di Leguigno studied at the seminary in Reggio - Emilia before being ordained to the priesthood in 1884 .

Ognjen Sviličić ( born 1971 in Split ) is a Croatian screenwriter and film director noted for his critically acclaimed 2007 film Armin .
Jesús Manuel Montané Juvillà ( Barcelona , 1972 ) is a film director , writer and journalist .
Benjamin Abram was born to a Jewish family on 23 September 1846 in Marseille .
Daxiong was born December 25 , 1975 in Jilin province , China , and developed an enjoyment for illustrating at an early age .
Paul - Joseph Delcloche , a Flemish painter of interiors and battle - pieces , was born at Namur in 1716 .
Walker Whiteside was born on March 16 , 1869 , near the confluence of the Wabash and Eel rivers at Logansport in northern Indiana .
Steven Schrader is an American writer from New York City .
Pedro Benoit was born in Buenos Aires in 1836 to María Josefa de las Mercedes Leyes and Pierre Benoit , a French émigré who had left his homeland following the Bourbon Restoration .
Tasia Valenza ( born April 5 , 1967 in New York City ) is an American actress who has most recently found acclaim as a voice actress .
Jarvin Skeete ( born August 03 , 1981 ) is a former Saint Lucian footballer who played for the Saint Lucia national football team , and played in the National Premier League , and the Canadian Soccer League .
Daniel Munduruku ( Belém do Pará , February 28 , 1964 ) is a Brazilian writer and educator .
Robert Leuci ( February 28 , 1940 -- October 12 , 2015 ) was a detective with the New York City Police ( NYPD ) , US , known for his work exposing corruption in the police department and the criminal justice system .
Hana Benešová ( born 19 April 1975 in Čáslav ) is a retired Czech sprinter who competed in the 200 and 400 metres .
Philippe Gas ( born 1964 in at Rueil - Malmaison ) was the president of Euro Disney S.A.S. , the management company of Euro Disney S.C.A. and Euro Disney Associés S.C.A. , the operator of Disneyland Paris until September 2014 .
Engelbert II of Nassau , Engelbrecht in Dutch ( 17 May 1451 -- 31 May 1504 ) , was count of Nassau and Vianden and lord of Breda , Lek , Diest , Roosendaal , Nispen and Wouw .
Manfred Wong ( Chinese : 王文雋 ; Wong Man - Chun ) ( born 1 January 1957 in Hong Kong ) is a Hong Kong radio personality , film producer , screenwriter , director and actor .
Born in La Madeleine , Nord as the seventh of nine children in a family of workers , Jeannette Vermeersch joined the workforce at the age of ten , despite the fact that at the time , children under the age of 13 were legally prohibited from working .
Sharon Morgan ( born 29 August 1949 in Llandyfaelog , Carmarthenshire ) is a Welsh actress of stage and screen , currently based in Cardiff .
Ivar Stukolkin ( born August 13 , 1960 in Tallinn ) is a retired Estonian swimmer .
Zhang Jiaxiang , astronomer , was born in Oct. 1932 in Nanjing , Jiangsu province .
Vincent M. Ferrara , also known as `` The Animal '' , ( born 1949 North End , Boston , Massachusetts ) is an Italian - American mobster from Boston , Massachusetts and former Capo of the New England based Patriarca crime family of La Cosa Nostra .
Victoria Newton ( born 9 March 1972 in Liverpool , England ) is the editor of The Sun on Sunday She ran the `` Bizarre '' showbiz column of Rupert Murdoch 's The Sun and then became deputy editor of the paper .
Giorgi Oniani ( born 7 September 1983 , in Tbilisi ) is a Georgian retired Association football defender .
Jonathan Scarth was born in Whitby , Yorkshire , England , the son of Thomas Scarth , a Quaker ship owner .
Jens Podevijn ( born 18 July 1989 in Aalst ) is a Belgian professional footballer who plays as a striker and who plays for FCV Dender EH .
Paolo Di Cioccio ( born 1963 in Rome ) is an oboist and composer .

Charles Henry Bartlett ( 6 February 1885 , Bermondsey , London -- 30 November 1968 , Enfield ) was a British track cyclist .
Hugh Conway , the pen name of Frederick John Fargus ( 26 December 1847 -- 15 May 1885 ) , was an English novelist born in Bristol , the son of an auctioneer .

Ayumu Nedefuji ( born 7 April 1994 in Otaru ) is a Japanese snowboarder .
Anette Bøe ( born 5 November 1957 in Larvik ) is a former Norwegian cross - country skier .
Buddy Landel ( August 14 , 1961 -- June 22 , 2015 ) , better known as `` Nature Boy '' Buddy Landel , was an American professional wrestler born in Knoxville , Tennessee .
Born in Bolton , Lancashire , the son of a Welsh railway guard , Glyn Owen left school aged 14 and worked in a telegraph office .
Georgi Velinov Velinov ( Bulgarian : Георги Велинов Велинов ; born 5 October 1957 in Ruse ) , nicknamed Johnny , is a former Bulgarian footballer and football manager .
Susan Cookson ( born 20 April 1965 in Manchester ) is an English television actress .
Nelson Ned d'Ávila Pinto ( 2 March 1947 , Ubá -- 6 January 2014 , Rio de Janeiro ) was a famous Brazilian singer from Ubá , Minas Gerais .
Marco Simone ( born 7 January 1969 in Castellanza ) is an Italian former professional footballer , who played as a striker or winger , and current manager of Tours FC .
Charlie Chin ( born Qin Xianglin , also spelled Chin Hsiang - lin , on May 19 , 1948 , in Nanjing , China ) is a Taiwanese actor .
Ali Maow Maalin ( also Mao Moallim and Mao ' Mo'allim ) ( 1954 -- 22 July 2013 ) was a Somali hospital cook and health worker from Merca who is the last person known to be infected with naturally occurring Variola minor smallpox in the world .
Jasimuddin was born in the village of Tambulkhana in Faridpur District on 30 October 1903 in the house of his maternal uncle .
Eddie Elguera , ( born November 12 , 1962 in Bellflower , California ) is a 2-time world champion skateboarder and Senior Pastor of The Rock Church of Coachella Valley , in the Palm Springs area of Southern California .
Griffin Boice , is an American record producer , mixer , songwriter , and composer from Rexburg , Idaho .
Bruno Henrique Corsini , simply known as Bruno Henrique ( born 21 October 1989 in Apucarana ) , is a Brazilian professional footballer who plays as a central midfielder for Corinthians .
Born in Budapest , Szabó is the son of Mária ( née Vita ) and István Szabó , the latter of whom was a doctor from a long line of doctors .
Sergei Borisovich Novikov ( Russian : Серге́й Борисович Новиков ; born June 13 , 1961 in Moscow ) is a retired Soviet and Russian professional football player .
Ivan Fuksa ( born July 15 , 1963 , in Příbram ) is a Czech local politician .
Jakub Hrůša ( born 23 July 1981 in Brno ) , is a Czech conductor , the son of the architect Petr Hrůša .
Margit Sandemo was born 23 April 1924 in a farm in Lena , Østre Toten , Valdres , Norway .
Luis Pardo Villalón ( born Santiago , Chile , 20 September 1882 - -died Santiago , 21 February 1935 ) was the captain of the Chilean steam tug Yelcho which rescued the 22 stranded crewmen of Sir Ernest Shackleton 's ship Endurance from Elephant Island , Antarctica , in August 1916 .
Achilles Statius ( or Aquiles Estaço ) ( 12 June 1524 -- 28 September 1581 ) was a Portuguese humanist and writer , since 1555 living in Rome , where he was a secretary of the pope .
Arnold Szyfman ( 23 November 1882 in Ulanów - 11 January 1967 in Warsaw ) was a Polish theatre director and stage director .
Alfred Schlemm died on 24 January 1986 at Ahlten near Hannover .
General John Pershing listed George Dilboy as `` one of the ten great heroes '' who `` died in the battlefield of France with super - human heroism and valor . ''
Andrzej Kusionowicz Grodyński ( 22 October 1861 -- 24 July 1925 ) , baptized as Andrzej Szymon Kusionowicz , was a Polish lawyer who worked as a Silesian circuit judge based in Cieszyn for much of his career .
Zsigmond Czakó ( Dés , June 20 , 1820 -- Pest , December 14 , 1847 ) was a Hungarian actor and playwright .
Tahsin Yazıcı ( 1892 in Monastir , Ottoman Empire ( now Macedonia ) -- February 11 , 1971 in Ankara , Turkey ) was an Ottoman Army officer and later a Turkish Army general and politician .
Mathias Albani ( 1621 - 1673 ) was a violin maker from Botzen ( now Bolzano in South Tyrol ) .
John H. McAvoy was the founder of the McAvoy Brewing Company in Chicago , Illinois and was elected Alderman of the 3rd ward of Chicago in 1869 .
Christoph Bernhard Francke , also known as Bernhard Christoph Francken ( c. 1660 - 1670 , Hanover - 18 January 1729 , Braunschweig ) was a German military officer and painter in the Baroque style .
In 1925 , Helmy Bahgat Badawi obtained his Law License degree from the Egyptian University in Cairo , Egypt , and in the following year he joined the Paris - Sorbonne University where he commenced his research work in the field of Commercial law .
Eugenio Rignano ( 31 May 1870 in Livorno -- 9 February 1930 in Milan ) was a Jewish Italian philosopher .
Saint Berardo ( 11th century -- 19 December 1123 ) is an Italian saint , patron saint of the city and diocese of Teramo .
Heinrich Johann Nepomuk von Crantz ( Roodt - sur - Eisch , Luxembourg , 25 November 1722 -- 18 January 1799 , Judenburg , Austria ) was a botanist and a physician .
Claes van Beresteyn ( 1627 -- 1684 ) , was a Dutch Golden Age landscape painter who founded a hofje in his hometown of Haarlem .
Françoise de Foix , Comtesse de Châteaubriant ( c. 1495 -- 16 October 1537 ) was a mistress of Francis I of France .
Carlos Zubizarreta was a writer born in Asunción , Paraguay in 1904 .
Engelbert I of Nassau ( c. 1370 , in Dillenburg -- 3 May 1442 , in Breda ) was a son of Count Johan I of Nassau and Countess Margaretha of the Marck , daughter of Count Adolph II of the Marck .
Johanne Nathalie Krebs ( born August 5 , 1895 in Aarhus , died January 5 , 1978 in Copenhagen ) was a Danish potter .
Hans Bendel , of Schaffhausen , in Switzerland , was an historical painter and lithographer , and attended the Academy of Munich , under Kaulbach .
Walter M. Fitch ( May 21 , 1929 -- March 10 , 2011 ) was professor of molecular evolution at the University of California , Irvine , until his death , preceded by three years at the University of Southern California and 24 years at the University of Wisconsin--
Joan Diener died of complications from cancer in New York City , aged 76 .
Evelyn Temple Emmett ( 1871 - -1970 ) was the first Director of the Tasmanian Government Tourist Bureau and a founder of the Hobart Walking Club .
Friedrich Specht ( 6 May 1839 Lauffen am Neckar - 12 June 1909 Stuttgart ) , was a German painter and natural history illustrator .
Elihu Burritt was born December 8 , 1810 , in the town of New Britain , Connecticut .
Anatoly Lutikov ( 5 February 1933 in Leningrad -- 15 October 1989 in Tiraspol ) was a Russian chess player .
Bohdan Ihor Antonych ( Ukrainian : Богдан-Ігор Антонич ; 5 October 1909 , Nowica -- 6 July 1937 , Lviv ) was a 20th - century Ukrainian poet .
Adolph Friedländer ( 17 April 1851 -- 7 July 1904 ) was a famed German lithographer of posters and a publisher hailing from Hamburg .
Adolphe Ganot ( born 1804 in Rochefort , Charente - Maritime , France ; died 1887 in Paris ) was a French author and publisher of physics textbooks .
Adolf Holm ( Lubeck , 8 August 1830 -- Freiburg i m Breisgau , 9 June 1900 ) was a German historian of antiquity .
John Absolon ( London 1815 -- May 5 , 1895 ) was a British watercolourist .
Mathieu Kessels ( 20 May 1784 - 4 March 1836 ) was a Dutch Neoclassical sculptor who mainly worked in Rome .
Jules Schmalzigaug ( Antwerp , 1882 or 1883 ( the sources have different data ) -- The Hague , 13 May 1917 ) was a Belgian futurist painter .
Jack Montrose ( December 30 , 1928 in Detroit , Michigan -- February 7 , 2006 in Las Vegas , Nevada ) was a jazz tenor saxophonist and arranger .
Rudolf Grauer ( 20 August 1870 , Hellbrunn , Salzburg -- 17 December 1927 , Vienna ) was an Austrian explorer and zoologist .
Alberto Cañas Escalante ( 16 March 1920 -- 14 June 2014 ) was a politician , writer , intellectual , public servant , and journalist from San José , Costa Rica .
Christoph Friedrich Bretzner ( 10 December 1748 -- 31 August 1807 ) was a Leipzig merchant famous for writing the libretto to a singspiel Belmont und Constanze , oder Die Entführung aus dem Serail , produced in Berlin and adapted in 1782 by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart and Gottlieb Stephanie as Die Entführung aus dem Serail .
Bedřich Golombek ( born February 5 , 1901 in Hrušov , today part of Ostrava -- March 31 , 1961 in Brno ) was a Czech journalist and writer .
Vasyl Makukh ( 1927 - 1968 ) was a Ukrainian who on November 5 , 1968 committed suicide by self - immolation at Khreshchatyk , Kiev in protest against the Soviet occupation of Ukraine .
Kasriel Hirsch Sarasohn ( b. Paiser , Suwalki Province , Congress Poland , 1835 - d. New York City , Jan. 12 , 1905 ) was a Jewish - American journalist who published several newspapers in New York .
Auguste Maure ( Marseille , 1840 - Biskra , 1907 ) is a French 19th - century photographer .
Jean - Pascal Delamuraz ( 1 April 1936 in Vevey -- 4 October 1998 in Lausanne ) was a Swiss politician and member of the Swiss Federal Council ( 1983 - -1998 ) .
Arne Brustad ( Oslo , 14 April 1912 -- 22 August 1987 ) was a Norwegian footballer .
James E. Keller ( August 13 , 1942 -- June 2 , 2014 ) was an American judge born in Harlan , Kentucky , whose judicial career was centered in Lexington , Kentucky .
Jean Crasset ( b. at Dieppe , France , 3 January 1618 ; d. at Paris , 4 January 1692 ) was a French Jesuit theologian , known as an ascetical writer .
Enayatollah Reza ( Persian : عنایت‌الله رضا‎ ; born June 18 , 1920 in Rasht , died July 20 , 2010 in Tehran ) was an Iranian historian and professor of philosophy , a former member of the Iranian Communist Party , and a former Iranian military officer .
Theodor Escherich ( 29 November 1857 -- 15 February 1911 ) was a German - Austrian pediatrician and a professor at universities in Graz and Vienna .
Hans - Otto Meissner ( 4 June 1909 in Strasbourg -- 8 September 1992 in Unterwössen , Germany ) was a German writer and novelist .
Aymeric of Piacenza ( born Piacenza , Italy ; died 19 August 1327 , Bologna ) was an Italian Dominican scholar , who became Master of the Order of Preachers .
Caterina Gabrielli was the daughter of a cook in the service of prince Gabrielli , in Rome .
Kurt Heegner ( German : ( ˈheːɡnɐ ) ; 16 December 1893 -- 2 February 1965 ) was a German private scholar from Berlin , who specialized in radio engineering and mathematics .
Cornelis Kruys ( 1619 , Haarlem -- 1660 , Schiedam ) was a Dutch Golden Age painter .
Nicéphore Niépce died of a stroke on 5 July 1833 , financially ruined by the semi - delirious spending of Claude such that his grave in the cemetery of Saint - Loup de Varennes was financed by the municipality .
Giorgio Belloni ( Codogno ( Lodi ) , 1861 -- Azzano di Mezzegra ( Como ) , 1944 ) was an Italian painter .
Bennie Moten ( November 13 , 1894 -- April 2 , 1935 ) was an American jazz pianist and band leader born in Kansas City , Missouri .
François Jacquier ( born at Vitry - le - François , 7 June 1711 ; died at Rome , 3 July 1788 ) was a French Franciscan mathematician and physicist .
Gaspare Ambrosini ( 24 October 1886 in Favara , Sicily -- 1986 in Rome ) was an Italian jurist and statesman .
Eugène Vaillé ( 10 August 1875 , Bédarieux , Hérault - 1959 , Riols ) was a French postal historian and the first curator of the postal museum of France , now La Poste 's Museum , from 1946 to 1955 .
Borhan Abu Samah ( 30 November 1964 -- 29 October 1999 ) was a Singaporean footballer who played for the Singapore national team in the 1990s .
Augustus Earle ( c. 1793 -- 1838 ) was a London - born travel artist .
Max Rudolf Kaufmann ( 29 April 1886 in Basel , Switzerland - 1963 in Bonn , Germany ) , was a Swiss author , translator from Turkish , and journalist , who worked and published in Switzerland , Turkey , the United States and Germany .
Radcliffe Killam ( July 1 , 1910 -- September 8 , 2007 ) was a wealthy oilman , rancher , businessman , and philanthropist in Laredo , the seat of Webb County in south Texas .
Ali - Naqi Vaziri ( 1887 in Tehran , Iran -- September 9 , 1979 ) was a musicologist , composer , a celebrated player of the tar , and the founder of the Academy of Music of Iran as well of Iran 's National Orchestra .
Juan Bautista Azopardo ( 19 February 1772 in Senglea , Malta -- 23 October 1848 in Buenos Aires ) was a Maltese Privateer and military man who fought under the flags of the Netherlands , Spain and Argentina .
Antonio Mario La Pergola ( 13 November 1931 , Catania - 19 July 2007 , Rome ) , Italian jurist , Advocate General and later Judge of the European Court of Justice of the European Union in Luxembourg , President of the Venice Commission of the Council of Europe in Strasbourg .
Charles de l'Écluse , L'Escluse , or Carolus Clusius ( Arras , February 19 , 1526 -- Leiden , April 4 , 1609 ) , seigneur de Watènes , was a Flemish doctor and pioneering botanist , perhaps the most influential of all 16th - century scientific horticulturists .
Johann Heinrich Strack ( 6 July 1805 , Bückeburg - 13 June 1880 , Berlin ) was a German architect of the Schinkelschule .
Julius Reinhard Oppel ( Grünberg , Hesse 1878-Leipzig , 1941 ) was a German composer .
Beatriz de Bobadilla y Ossorio ( Medina del Campo , 1462 - Las Palmas de Gran Canaria , 1501 ) was the daughter of Juan de Bobadilla and the niece of her namesake Beatriz de Bobadilla .
Alexandros Kontostavlos ( 1789 , Chios -- 1865 , Athens ) was a Greek banker , magnate and politician .
William Adam Piper ( May 21 , 1826 , Pennsylvania -- August 5 , 1899 , San Francisco ) was an American politician and a member of the United States House of Representatives from California .
Eleanore Deirdre O'Connell ( 16 June 1939 -- 9 June 2001 ) was an Irish American actress , singer , and theatre director who founded the Focus Theatre in Dublin , Ireland .
Johann Sölch ( 16 October 1883 in Penzing , near Vienna -- 10 September 1951 in Kitzbühel ) was an Austrian geographer , largely known for his geomorphological studies of the Eastern Alps .
Lorenzo Fasolo ( 1463 - -1518 ) , called Lorenzo di Pavia , was a Lombard painter living in the early part of the 16th century , who went from Pavia to Genoa , and was one of the artists employed by Lodovico Sforza in 1490 in the decorations of the Porta Giovia Palace at Milan .
Dorothea Viehmann was born as Katharina Dorothea Pierson in Rengershausen near Kassel as the daughter of a tavern owner .
Johannes Haarklou ( May 13 , 1847 in Haukedalen -- November 26 , 1925 in Oslo ) was a Norwegian composer , organist , conductor , and music critic .
Molly Cramer came from a wealthy merchant family in Hamburg .
Domenico di Pace Beccafumi ( 1486 -- May 18 , 1551 ) was an Italian Renaissance - Mannerist painter active predominantly in Siena .
Giovanni Schmidt ( c. 1775 in Livorno -- c. after 1839 in Naples ) was an Italian librettist .
Princess Augusta of Württemberg ( 4 October 1826 in Stuttgart -- 3 December 1898 , ibid . )
Lionel Pickens ( December 4 , 1983 -- May 17 , 2015 ) , better known by his stage name Chinx ( formerly Chinx Drugz ) , was an American rapper from Queens , New York .
Steven Hoogendijk ( 1 April 1698 -- 3 July 1788 ) was a Rotterdam watch and instrument maker and physicist .
Renato Castellani ( 4 September 1913 in Finale Ligure , Liguria - 28 December 1985 in Rome ) was an Italian film director and screenwriter .
Thomas Allcot Guy Pocock , writing under the name Tom Pocock , ( 18 August 1925 , London -- 7 May 2007 , London ) was an English biographer , war correspondent , journalist and naval historian .
Wilhelm Mülhens ( born 25 June 1762 in Troisdorf and died 6 March 1841 in Köln ) was a Cologne perfume designer and manufacturer , and the founder of the Mülhens company , famous for the fragrance `` 4711 '' .
Sir Kenneth MacMillan ( 11 December 1929 -- 29 October 1992 ) was a British ballet dancer and choreographer who was artistic director of the Royal Ballet in London between 1970 and 1977 , and its principal choreographer from 1977 until his death .
Jack Ritchie was born in a room behind his father 's tailor shop in Milwaukee , Wisconsin on February 26 , 1922 .
Otto , Count of Lippe - Brake ( 21 December 1589 -- 18 November 1657 in Blomberg ) was the first ruling Count of Lippe - Brake .
Jan Michiel Ruyten or Jan Ruyten ( Antwerp , 9 April 1813 -- Antwerp , 12 November 1881 ) was a Belgian Romantic painter , draughtsman and engraver known for his genre paintings , cityscapes , landscapes with figures and history paintings .
Ludwig Ruff ( * 29 May 1878 in Dollnstein ; † 15 August 1934 in Nuremberg ) was an architect during the National Socialist regime in Germany , the father of Franz Ruff and responsible for beginning the Nuremberg Party Congress Hall before his death in 1934 .
Pieter Gallis ( 1633 in Enkhuizen -- 1697 in Hoorn ) , was a Dutch Golden Age painter .
This award recognizes extreme battlefield bravery or successful military leadership by Nazi Germany during World War II . Alfred Siegling was born on 15 March 1918 at Erlau .
Alexander Roslin ( often spelled Alexandre in French ; 15 July 1718 -- 5 July 1793 ) was a Swedish portrait painter who worked in Scania , Bayreuth , Paris , Italy , and St. Petersburg , primarily for members of aristocratic families .
Jedediah Buxton ( 1707 - -1772 ) was a noted English mental calculator , born at Elmton , near Bolsover , in Derbyshire .
August Kalkmann ( 24 March 1853 , Hamburg -- 19 February 1905 , Berlin ) was a German classical archaeologist and art historian .
Henry MacRae was born in Toronto , Ontario , Canada on August 29 , 1876 and died in Beverly Hills , California , USA on October 2 , 1944 , aged 68 .
Alexandre - Marie Colin , a French painter of historical and genre subjects , was born in Paris in 1798 .
Louis Svećenski ( Croatian : Ljudevit `` Lujo '' Svećenski , born Ljudevit Kohn ; November 7 , 1862 -- June 18 , 1926 ) was notable Croatian - American violist - violinist and rector of the Boston Academy of Music .
Jean Guillaume Roquille 's birth in Rive - de - Gier , in the industrial Gier valley between Saint - Étienne and Lyon , was recorded on 26 October 1804 .
Chief Donnacona ( died c. 1539 in France ) was the chief of the village of Stadacona , located at the present site of Quebec City , Canada .
Carlos José Solórzano Gutiérrez ( 17 January 1860 in Managua -- 30 August 1936 in San José , Costa Rica ) was the President of Nicaragua between 1 January 1925 and 14 March 1926 .
Mario Guiducci ( 1585 - -1646 ) was an Italian astronomer and jurist , born in Florence .
Johann Jakob Breitinger ( 1 March 1701 in Zürich ; 14 December 1776 ) was a Swiss philologist and author .
Jüri Jaakson VR III/1 ( 16 January ( O.S. 4 January ) 1870 in Karula , Viljandi County , Livonia , Russian Empire -- 20 April 1942 in Sosva , Sverdlovsk Oblast , Soviet Union ) was an Estonian businessman and politician .
Edwin Le Roy Antony died in Dallas , Texas , and was buried in Oakland Cemetery .
Paul Peter Ewald , FRS ( January 23 , 1888 in Berlin , Germany -- August 22 , 1985 in Ithaca , New York ) was a German crystallographer and physicist , a pioneer of X - ray diffraction methods .
Antun Dobronić ( 2 April 1878 , Jelsa , Croatia -- 12 December 1955 , Zagreb , Croatia ) was a Croatian composer and pupil of Vítězslav Novák .
Tomás Burgos Sotomayor ( Osorno , September 18 , 1875 -- Valdivia , August 19 , 1945 ) was a Chilean philanthropist , one of the strongest supporters of the `` mutualist movement '' and the founder of `` Villa Lo Burgos '' , the present city of Purranque .
Petrus Cunaeus ( 1586 , in Vlissingen -- 2 December 1638 , in Leiden ) was the pen name of the Dutch Christian scholar Peter van der Kun .
Kiel Urban Mueller ( July 26 , 1944 , Pittsburgh , Pennsylvania -- December 28 , 1990 , Rancho Mirage , California ) , professionally known as Kiel Martin , was an American actor best known for his role as lovable rogue Detective John `` J.D. '' La Rue on the 1980s television drama Hill Street Blues .
Moriz Winternitz ( Horn , December 23 , 1863 -- Prague , January 9 , 1937 ) was a Jewish scholar from Austria who began his Indology contributions working with Max Müller at the Oxford University .
Antonio María Romeu Marrero ( Jibacoa , Cuba , 11 September 1876 -- Havana 18 January 1955 ) was a Cuban pianist , composer and bandleader .
Alec Talbot ( 13 July 1902 at Cannock , Staffs -- 13 August 1975 at Stourbridge ) was a centre - half for Aston Villa during the 1920s and 1930s .
François - Alfred Delobbe , ( 1835 , Paris - 1920 , Paris ) was a French painter in the Naturalist style .
Francisco Boix Campo ( 31 August 1920 , in Barcelona -- July 1951 Paris ) was a photographer who presented photographs that played a role in the conviction of Nazi war criminals .
Hellmut Lange started his acting career on radio drama shows for the West - German Radio Station SFB ( Sender Freies Berlin= Radio Free Berlin ) .
Yngve Brilioth ( 1891 , Västra Ed -- 1959 ) was professor for church history , later for Practical theology in Uppsala , Turku and Lund , Lutheran Bishop of Växjö from 1938 to 1950 and Archbishop of Uppsala from 1950 until 1958 .
Harry Randall Truman ( October 30 , 1896 -- May 18 , 1980 ) was a resident of the U.S. state of Washington who lived on Mount St. Helens .
Otto Höfler ( 10 May 1901 -- 25 August 1987 in Vienna ) was an Austrian scholar of German studies .
Henri Bouchet - Doumenq ( 13 May 1834 , Paris - 1884 ) ( alternate spellings : Bouchet - Doumeng , Bouchet - Doumencq , Boucher - Doumencq , Boucher - Doumeng , Doumenq - Boucher ) was a 19th - century French painter who specialized in portraits and landscapes .
Jonathan Wild ( 1682 or 1683 -- 24 May 1725 ) was a London underworld figure notable for operating on both sides of the law , posing as a public - spirited crimefighter entitled the ' Thief - Taker General ' .
Nils Lorens Sjöberg ( 4 December 1754 , Jönköping - 13 March 1822 , Stockholm ) was a Swedish officer and poet .

Dennis T. Sullivan was the Chief of the San Francisco Fire Department in 1906 .
William J. Collins ( 1896 - -1981 ) was a 20th - century Catholic priest who served as the ninth president of St. Ambrose College in Davenport , Iowa from 1956 to 1963 .
Count Viktor Nikitich Panin ( 9 April ( 28 March Old Style ) 1801 Moscow -- 13 April ( 1 April Old Style ) 1862 Nice ) was conservative Russian Minister of Justice ( 1841 - -1862 ) .
Mieczysław Mümler was demobilized in 1946 , settled in London where he worked as a baker .
Antoni Gołubiew ( February 25 , 1907 in Vilnius -- June 27 , 1979 in Kraków ) , nicknames Goa , Jan Karol Wayda , Jerzy Cichocki , was a Polish historian , writer and a Catholic publicist .
Bryan Mullanphy ( born 1809 in Baltimore , Maryland ; died June 15 , 1851 in St. Louis , Missouri ) was the tenth Mayor of St. Louis , serving from 1847 to 1848 .
Victor Weisz ( 25 April 1913 in Berlin , Germany - 22 February 1966 in London , England ) was a German - British political cartoonist , drawing under the name of Vicky .
Ann Bilansky ( born Mary Ann Evards Wright ) ( c. 1820 Fayetteville , North Carolina -- March 23 , 1860 Saint Paul , Minnesota ) was an American housewife convicted in 1859 of poisoning her husband with arsenic .
Giovanni Bordiga ( Novara , 2 April 1854 -- Venice , 16 June 1933 ) was an Italian mathematician who worked on algebraic and projective geometry at the university of Padua .
Matthys or Matthijs Naiveu ( 16 April 1647 , Leiden -- 4 June 1726 , Amsterdam ) was a Dutch Golden Age painter .
Friedrich Preller the Elder ( 25 April 1804 in Eisenach -- 23 April 1878 in Weimar ) was a German landscape painter and etcher .
Florence Henri ( 28 June 1893 , New York -- 24 July 1982 , Laboissière - en - Thelle ) was a photographer and artist .
Max Arwed Roßbach ( also spelled Rossbach , 24 November 1844 in Plauen - 31 December 1902 in Leipzig ) was a German historicist architect in the late 19th century .
James of Baux or James of les Baux ( French : Jacques des Baux , Italian : Jacopo del Balzo ; died 17 July 1383 ) , hereditary Duke of Andria , was Prince of Taranto and the last titular Latin Emperor of Constantinople from 1374 to 1383 , and Prince of Achaea from 1382 to 1383 .
John McCaul ( March 7 , 1807 -- April 16 , 1887 ) was an Irish - born Canadian educator , theologian , and the second president of the University of Toronto from 1848 to 1853 .
Abiel Foster ( August 8 , 1735 -- February 6 , 1806 ) was an American clergyman and statesman from Canterbury , New Hampshire .
Justus Möser ( December 14 , 1720 , Osnabrück -- January 8 , 1794 , Osnabrück ) was a German jurist and social theorist , best known for his innovative history of Osnabrück which stressed social and cultural themes .
Theodor Dannecker ( 27 March 1913 in Tübingen -- 10 December 1945 in Bad Tölz ) was an SS Hauptsturmführer ( captain ) and one of Adolf Eichmann 's associates .
Élie Ducommun ( 19 February 1833 , Geneva -- 7 December 1906 , Bern ) was a peace activist .
Zdeněk Mlynář ( Müller ) ( 22 June 1930 , Vysoké Mýto -- 15 April 1997 , Vienna ) was secretary of Czechoslovak communist party in the years 1968 - -1970 and an intellectual who went against the grain during a critical time in the development of Eastern European political history .
David de Wied ( 12 January 1925 -- 21 February 2004 ) was a Dutch professor of pharmacology at the University of Utrecht .
Johann Heinrich Jakob Müller ( 30 April 1809 , Kassel , Kingdom of Westphalia -- 3 October 1875 , Freiburg i m Breisgau ) was a German physicist .
Georges Marquet ( 18 September 1886 , Jemeppe - sur - Meuse - 27 March 1947 , Nice ) was a belgian hotel manager , owner of many luxurious hotels in Europe .
Richard de Capella or Richard of the Chapel ( died 1127 ) was a medieval Bishop of Hereford .
Joan Martorell i Montells ( Catalan pronunciation : ( ʒuˈam mərtuˈɾeʎ ) ) ( born 1833 in Barcelona , died 5 July 1906 in Barcelona ) was a Catalan architect and designer .
Rudolf Schottlaender ( August 5 , 1900 in Berlin , German Empire -- January 4 , 1988 in East Berlin , East Germany ) was a German philosopher , classical philologist , translator and political publicist of Jewish descent .
Mohammad Roem ( ( moˈhamad ˈrʊm ) ; born Temanggung 16 May 1908 -- died Jakarta 24 September 1983 ) was a diplomat and one of Indonesia 's leaders in the Indonesian war for independence .
Johann Wilhelm Brücke ( 4 March 1800 , Stralsund - 1 April 1874 , Berlin ) was a German landscape and architecture painter .
Although remaining committed to the cause of socialism , Earl Browder remained outside of the Communist Party until his death in Princeton , New Jersey on June 27 , 1973 .
From c. 1880 Alfred John West worked alongside his brothers and sisters in his father George West 's photographic business ' G West and Son ' at 97 High Street in Gosport Hants and later at 72 and 84 Palmerston Road Southsea .
Vasile Pârvan ( Romanian pronunciation : ( vaˈsile pɨrˈvan ) ; 28 September 1882 , Perchiu , Huruiești , Bacău -- 26 June 1927 , Bucharest ) was a Romanian historian and archaeologist .
John Bower Lewis , QC ( March 18 , 1817 -- January 24 , 1874 ) was the second mayor of Bytown in 1848 , the first mayor of Ottawa from 1855 to 1857 , and a member of the 2nd Canadian Parliament from 1872 to 1873 .
Binnie Barnes died in 1998 of natural causes , aged 95 , in Beverly Hills , California .
Gonzalo Güell y Morales de los Ríos ( 16 February 1895 in Havana , Cuba - 2 September 1985 in Coral Gables , Miami - Dade County , Florida USA ) was a Cuban lawyer and a career diplomat ( 1919 - -1959 ) .
Jimmy Greenhalgh ( 27 August 1923 -- 31 August 2013 ) was manager of the English football club Darlington from 1966 - 1968 .
Gwilherm Berthou ( 10 May 1908 , Paimpol -- 14 March 1951 , Rennes ) was a Breton nationalist and neo - Druidic bardic poet .
Giovanni Livraghi ( Milan , 1819 - Bologna , 8 August 1849 ) was an Italian patriot , who took part in various enterprises of Giuseppe Garibaldi , being part of the Italian legion which he founded in Montevideo in 1843 and participating , as a result , the defense of the Roman Republic .
Alberto Domínguez Borrás ( San Cristóbal de Las Casas , Chiapas 21 April 1913 -- Mexico City , 2 September 1975 ) was a Mexican songwriter .
François Bigot ( French pronunciation : ​(fʁɑ̃swa biɡo ) ; born Bordeaux , 30 January 1703 ; died Neuchâtel , Switzerland , 12 January 1778 ) was a French government official .
Teddy Buckner ( July 16 , 1909 in Sherman , Texas -- September 22 , 1994 in Los Angeles , California ) was a jazz trumpeter associated with Dixieland music .
Pedro de Padilla , ( ? in Talavera de la Reina -- 1599 in Granada , Spain ) , a prominent member of the Military Order of Santiago after 1597 , captain of the Infantry in Flanders and Maestro de Campo in Naples , Italy .
Arrigo Pedrollo ( born Montebello Vicentino , 5 December 1878 - died Vicenza , 23 December 1964 ) was an Italian composer .
Narayan Hari Apte , popularly known as Nanasaheb Apte ( 11 July 1889 -- 14 November 1971 ) was a Marathi popular novelist & writer of advice books and editor from Maharashtra , India .
Caffaro di Rustico da Caschifellone ( c. 1080 -- c. 1164 ) was a statesman , diplomat , admiral and historian of the Republic of Genoa .
Viacheslav Chornovil ( Ukrainian : Вячесла́в Макси́мович Чорнові́л ) ( December 24 , 1937 in Yerky , Katerynopil Raion , Kiev Oblast -- March 25 , 1999 , near Boryspil , Kiev Oblast ) was a Ukrainian politician .
Félix Coquereau ( 28 November 1808 , Laval - 9 November 1866 , Paris ) was chief almoner to the French Navy .
Georges Besse ( 25 December 1927 , in Clermont - Ferrand , France -- 17 November 1986 , in Paris ) was a French businessman who led several large state - controlled French companies during his lifetime .
Walter Grundmann ( 21 October 1906 , Chemnitz - 30 August 1976 , Eisenach ) was a German Protestant theologian and anti - Semitic Nazi and Stasi collaborateur during the Third Reich and GDR .
Jerzy Kluger ( 5 April 1921 -- 31 December 2011 ) was a Polish Jewish businessman who lived in Rome .
Enid Blyton was born on 11 August 1897 in East Dulwich , London , the eldest of three children , to Thomas Carey Blyton ( 1870 - -1920 ) , a cutlery salesman , and his wife Theresa Mary ( née Harrison ; 1874 - -1950 ) .
West trained as an actress in London , taking the name ' Rebecca West ' from the rebellious young heroine in Rosmersholm by Henrik Ibsen .
André Pilette ( 6 October 1918 , in Paris , France -- 27 December 1993 , in Etterbeek , Belgium ) , son of former Indy 500 participant Théodore Pilette , was a racing driver from Belgium .
Thomas Dachser ( 13 March 1906 in Haldenwang ( near Günzburg ) - 11 April 1979 in Munich ) was a German businessman .
Maria Bolognesi was born in 1924 in Rovigo and received the name of her stepfather .
Edmundo O'Gorman O'Gorman ( 24 November 1906 in Mexico City -- 28 September 1995 in Mexico City ) was a Mexican writer , historian and philosopher .
Dora Davidsohn was born in Berlin into a Jewish family .
Jean - Paul de Saumeur ( off Marseille , 1598 -- Toulon , 20 December 1667 ) , often called Chevalier Paul was a French admiral who served in several Mediterranean campaigns .
The Master of Frankfurt ( 1460 - -c . 1533 ) was a Flemish Renaissance painter active in Antwerp between about 1480 and 1520 .
Isabella Fabbrica ( Milan , c. 1802 -- Turin , c. 1860 ) was an Italian operatic contralto .
Tilemann Heshusius ( also Hesshus , Heßhusen , Hess Husen , Heshusen ( November 3 , 1527 in Wesel -- September 25 , 1588 in Helmstedt ) was a Gnesio - Lutheran theologian .
Vladimir Grigoryevich Zakharov ( born on the 18th of September 1901 in Bogodukhov , today part of Donetsk , and died in 1956 on July 13 in Moscow , ) was a Soviet Russian composer .
John of Legnano ( Italian : Giovanni da Legnano ; ca . 1320 -- February 1383 ) was an Italian jurist , a canon lawyer at the University of Bologna and the most prominent defender of Urban VI at the outbreak of the Western Schism .
Marcel Kint ( 20 September 1914 in Zwevegem -- 23 March 2002 in Kortrijk ) was a Belgian professional road bicycle racer who won 31 races between 1935 and 1951 .
Jan Bouman ( Amsterdam , 28 August 1706 - Berlin , 6 September 1776 ) was a Dutch architect , mainly notable for his work as designer and general contractor on the Dutch Quarter in Potsdam .
Philipp Albert Stapfer ( Bern , 23 September 1766 -- Paris , 27 March 1840 ) was a Swiss politician and philosopher .
Jean Agélou ( 16 October 1878 - -Gien , France , 1921 ) was a French photographer of the 1910s and 1920s , best known for his erotic and nude photographs made at the beginning of the 20th century .
In 1846 he went to the spa of Druskienniki ( Druskininkai ) , but the treatment was unsuccessful and Jan Czeczot died on 23 August of the following year .
Roberts Rugh was born to Arthur and Gertrude ( Roberts ) Rugh in Springfield , Ohio on April 16 , 1903 and died on 11 November 1978 in Bethesda , Maryland .
Nicolas Vleughels ( 1668 , Paris - 1737 , Rome ) was a French painter .
Harry Farjeon was born on 6 May 1878 in Hohokus Township , New Jersey , United States , the eldest son of author Benjamin Farjeon , who was from the East End of London , and Margaret , the daughter of American actor Joseph Jefferson .
Josef Skupa ( 16 January 1892 in Strakonice -- 8 January 1957 in Prague ) was a Czech puppeteer .
When not traveling Luc Leestemaker lived and worked in Los Angeles , California .
Pierre Johanns ( 1 April 1882 , Heinerscheid , Luxembourg - 8 February 1955 , Arlon , Belgium ) was a Luxemburger Jesuit priest , missionary in India and Indologist .
Pierre Busée ( Petrus Busaeus , Buys ) ( born at Nijmegen in 1540 ; died at Vienna in 1587 ) was a Dutch Jesuit theologian .
Ramón José Castellano ( 15 Feb. 1903 -- 27 Jan. 1979 ) was the Argentine Archbishop of Córdoba , known to have ordained to the Catholic priesthood Jorge Mario Bergoglio , S.J. , who later became Pope Francis .
William J. Brinkmann ( 1874 - 24 February 1911 , Chicago ) , sometimes spelled Brinkman , was an architect most well known for his work designing Chicago area churches .
Guillaume - Charles Faipoult de Maisoncelle , was born in Paris on 4 December 1752 , son of a noble family of Champagne .
Rizvan Chitigov ( Amerikanets , Marine ) was a prominent Chechen rebel field commander in Shalinsky District of the Chechen Republic ( Russia ) until his death in March 2005 .
Émile Boutmy ( 13 April 1835 -- 25 January 1906 ) was a French political scientist and sociologist who was a native of Paris .
Dom Gualdim Pais ( 1118 -- 13 October 1195 ) , a Portuguese crusader , Knight Templar in the service of Afonso Henriques of Portugal . He was the founder of the city of Tomar .
Déodat de Séverac ( pronounced : ( deoda də sevəʁak ) ) ( Saint - Félix - de - Caraman , Haute - Garonne , 20 July 1872 -- Céret , Pyrénées - Orientales , Roussillon , 24 March 1921 ) was a French composer .
Henry Février was born in Paris , and studied at the Paris Conservatoire , where his teachers included Jules Massenet and Gabriel Fauré .
Frances Villiers , Countess of Jersey ( 25 February 1753 , St James 's -- 23 July 1821 , Cheltenham ) was one of the more notorious of the many mistresses of King George IV when he was Prince of Wales , `` a scintillating society woman , a heady mix of charm , beauty , and sarcasm '' .
Viktor Ader ( 4 October 1910 in Tallinn -- 7 September 1966 in Tallinn ) , was an Estonian football player .
Ludovico I Gonzaga ( 1268 - 18 January 1360 ) was an Italian lord , the founder of the Gonzaga family who was the first capitano del popolo of Mantua and imperial vicar .
Manuel María Orellana Contreras ( 17 December 1870 , El Jícaro , Guatemala - 17 June 1940 , Barcelona , Spain ) was a Guatemalan army officer and politician , and from 17 to 31 December 1930 , de facto interim President of Guatemala , after leading a coup d'état that ended Baudilio Palma interim presidency .
Hans - Joachim Rotzsch was born in Leipzig and educated from 1940 to 1945 at the Musisches Gymnasium Frankfurt , directed by Kurt Thomas .
Camillo Rusconi ( 14 July 1658 -- 8 December 1728 ) was an Italian sculptor of the late Baroque in Rome .
While in exile , Osman Fuad Efendi lived in many places including Geneva , Rome , Cairo , Paris , Nice and Cannes .
Giambattista Costaguti was born in Rome in 1636 , the son of Prospero Costaguti , marquis of Sipicciano ( a member of the Genoese nobility ) and of his second wife Rocca Elvezia , Countess Vidman .
Arthur Lutze ( June 1 , 1813 -- April 11 , 1870 ) , was a major figure in medicine and regimen in Germany due to his establishment of a major homeopathic clinic and spa in Köthen , Germany in the mid-1800s .
William Matthew Scott ( born Leeds 30 September 1893 ; d. Herne Bay 7 May 1964 ) , pen name Will Scott , was a British author of stories and books for adults and children , published from 1920 to 1965 .
Kārlis Padegs was born on 8 October 1911 in Torņakalns , workers district of Riga .
Juan Manén ( or Catalan : Joan Manén , 14 May 1883 -- 26 June 1971 ) was a Spanish violinist and composer , born in Barcelona .
David Friedländer ( sometimes spelled Friedlander ; 16 December 1750 , Königsberg -- 25 December 1834 , Berlin ) was a German Jewish banker , writer and communal leader .
Gabriel Blanchard , known as Blanchard Le Neveu , ( 1630 Paris , France- 1704 ) the only son of Jacques Blanchard , was born in Paris in 1630 , and studied under his uncle , Jean Baptiste Blanchard .
Norah Lange ( October 23 , 1905 -- August 5 , 1972 ) was an Argentine author , associated with the Buenos Aires avant garde of the 1920s and 1930s .
After her last diary entry , in early July 1943 , Helga Deen was deported to Sobibór extermination camp and murdered .
Reveriano Soutullo Otero ( 11 July 1880 in Ponteareas , Galicia -- 29 October 1932 in Vigo ) was a Spanish composer of zarzuelas and pasodobles .
In 1983 , Adi Da moved with a group of about 40 followers to the Fijian island of Naitaba , purchased by a wealthy follower from the actor Raymond Burr .
Giovanni Buonconsiglio ( born Montecchio Maggiore c. 1465 , died 1535 or 1537 ; active during 1497 - -1514 ) was an Italian painter of the Renaissance period , active mainly in Venice and his native Vicenza .
Paul Bablot ( 20 November 1873 Boulogne - sur - Seine -- 23 December 1932 Marseille ) was a French racecar driver .
Alex Bradford died in Newark , New Jersey in 1978 after a stroke , as the musical Your Arms Too Short to Box with God was in production .
Heise started to work as a journalist in Berlin and later became a lector at the University of Kiel Hans - Jürgen Heise died in Kiel .
Jean Chapeauville ( b. at Liège , 5 January 1551 ; d. there 11 May 1617 ) was a Belgian theologian and historian .
Rafael Inchauspe Méndez , known as Rafael de Nogales Méndez ( San Cristóbal , Táchira , October 14 , 1879 -- Panama City , July 10 , 1936 ) was a Venezuelan soldier , adventurer and writer who served for the Ottoman Empire during the Great War ( 1914 - -18 ) .
Willy Millowitsch ( pronounced ( ˈvɪliː ˈmiloˌvɪʧ ) , ( ˈⱱɪli ˈmɪɫoˌⱱeˑʧ ) ) ( January 8 , 1909 -- September 20 , 1999 ) was a German stage and TV actor and the director of the Volkstheater Millowitsch in Cologne .
Sándor Reményik was born on 30 August 1890 in Kolozsvár , Austria - Hungary ( now Cluj - Napoca , Romania ) to a wealthy architect .
Ludvík Daněk ( Czech pronunciation : ( ˈludviːk ˈdaɲɛk ) ) ( 6 January 1937 in Blansko -- 15 November 1998 in Hutisko - Solanec near Vsetín ) was a Czechoslovak discus thrower , who won the gold medal at the 1972 Olympic Games with a throw of 64.40 m ( 211'3 `` ) .
Henri - Alexandre Junod ( 17 May 1863 Saint - Martin , Val - de - Ruz - 22 April 1934 Geneva ) was a Swiss - born South African missionary , ethnographer , anthropologist , linguist and naturalist , stationed for much of his career at Shiluvane in Limpopo Province .
Marguerite Bourgeoys , C.N.D. , was the French founder of the Congregation of Notre Dame of Montreal in the colony of New France , now part of Québec .
Paul Biva ( Montmartre 19 September 1851 -- 13 June 1900 , Avon , Seine - et - Marne ) was a French painter .
Brewer Phillips ( November 16 , 1924 -- August 30 , 1999 ) was an American blues guitarist , chiefly associated with Juke joint blues and Chicago blues .
Roger Cousinet ( 1881 , in Arcueil , France - 7 April 1973 , in Paris , France ) was a French teacher and a pioneer of the progressive education system in France .
Jacques Carelman ( born 1929 , Marseille -- 28 March 2012 , Argenteuil ) was a French painter , illustrator and designer .
Pierre Bérégovoy died on 1 May 1993 , in Paris after being transported by helicopter from Nevers ( Nièvre ) , where he had been found an hour earlier , in a coma with two bullets in the head .
Emil Eitel was killed on 14 September 1944 near Riga , Latvia during the Riga Offensive ( 1944 ) .
Gʻafur Gʻulomovich Gʻulomov was born to a poor family on May 10 , 1903 , in Tashkent .
Elena Maria Catargiu - Obrenović ( Serbian Cyrillic : Елена Марија Катарџи-Обреновић ; 1831 Iași -- 16 July 1876 or 28 June 1879 , Dresden ) , known in Serbia as Marija Obrenović , was a Moldavian and Romanian boyaress .
Roberto Forges Davanzati ( 23 February 1880 , Naples -- 1 June 1936 , Rome ) was an Italian journalist , academic and politician .
Karol Stryja ( 2 February 1915 in Cieszyn -- 31 January 1998 in Katowice ) was a Polish conductor and teacher .

Wilhelm Fleischmann ( 31 December 1837 in Erlangen -- 13 January 1920 in Göttingen ) was a German agriculturist and chemist .
Raquel Liberman ( 10 July 1900 in Berdichev , Ukraine -- 7 April 1935 in Buenos Aires , Argentina ) was a victim of human trafficking in Argentina .
Norman Francis McFarland ( February 21 , 1922 -- April 16 , 2010 ) was the second Roman Catholic Bishop of the Diocese of Orange .
Kanuty Rusiecki , or Kanutas Ruseckas in Lithuanian ( 10 February 1800 , Stebėkiai , near Vadokliai , Lithuania - 21 August 1860 , Vilnius , Lithuania ) was a famous Lithuanian painter of Polish descent .

Antoine - Alfred Marche ( 15 February 1844 , Boulogne - Billancourt -- 31 August 1898 , Paris , France ) was a French naturalist and explorer .
Geoffrey Bush was born in London , became a chorister at Salisbury Cathedral at the age of 8 and studied informally with the composer John Ireland .
Costas Georgiou ( Greek : Κώστας Γιώργιου , also Anglicized as Kostas Giorgiou ; alias `` Colonel Callan '' ) ( 1951 -- 10 July 1976 ) was an ethnic Greek Cypriot , British mercenary executed following the Luanda Trial for activities during the civil war phase of the Angolan War of Independence .
Friedrich von Hagedorn ( 23 April 1708 -- 28 October 1754 ) , German poet , was born at Hamburg , where his father , a man of scientific and literary taste , was Danish ambassador .
Daniel Joseph Bradley FRS ( 18 January 1928 -- 7 February 2010 ) was an Irish physicist , and Emeritus Professor of Optical Electronics , at Trinity College , Dublin .

Jessie White Mario ( 9 May 1832 in Hampshire , England -- 5 March 1906 in Florence , Italy ) was an English ( and naturalized Italian ) writer and philanthropist .
Scipione Lancelotti was born in Rome in 1527 , the son of Orazio Lancellotti ( personal physician of Pope Julius II and an abbreviator ) and his wife Antonina Aragonia .
Johan Vilhelm Snellman ( Swedish pronunciation : ( ˈjuːhan ˈvɪlːhɛlm ˈsnɛlːman ) ; 12 May 1806 , Stockholm -- 4 July 1881 , Kirkkonummi ) was an influential Fennoman philosopher and Finnish statesman , ennobled in 1866 .
Rudolf Charousek ( Hungarian : Charousek Rezső , born September 19 , 1873 , Prague -- died April 18 , 1900 , Budapest ) was a Hungarian chess player .
Francesco Furini ( c. 1600 ( or 1603 ) -- August 19 , 1646 ) was an Italian Baroque painter of Florence .
Leonard Jerome died at the age of 73 in Brighton , England .
Emil Andres ( July 22 , 1911 Tinley Park , Illinois -- July 20 , 1999 South Holland , Illinois ) was an American racecar driver active during the 1930s and 1940s .
Isaac Motte ( December 8 , 1738 -- May 8 , 1795 ) was an American soldier and statesman from Charleston , South Carolina .

Jacques - Noël Sané ( 18 February 1740 , Brest -- 22 August 1831 , Paris ) was a French naval engineer .

Hans Daucher ( 1486 , Augsburg -- 1538 , Stuttgart ) was a German Renaissance wood carver , sculptor and medal designer .
