Teofilo Patini ( Castel di Sangro , Abruzzo May 5 , 1840 -- Naples , November 16 , 1906 ) was an Italian painter , active in a Realist style .
Alessandro Costantini ( ca . 1581 - -1583 , Staffolo -- 20 October 1657 , Rome ) was an Italian baroque composer , maestro di cappella at the Collegium Germanicum .
Michael O'Donohue ( 1835 - -1912 ) was an Irish - American builder and architect from Hartford , Connecticut who designed a number of ecclesiastical buildings in New England for both Roman Catholic and Jewish clients .
Domenico Brandi ( 1683 - -1736 ) was an Italian painter , active in his native Naples , where he painted still lifes of birds and animals , as well as pastoral landscapes ( vedute ) .
Truesdell Sparhawk Brown ( 21 March 1906 , Philadelphia -- 13 January 1992 , Houston ) was a classical scholar , ancient historian , and co - founder of the journal California Studies in Classical Antiquity , which became the journal Classical Antiquity .
Pavel Janák ( 12 March 1881 , Karlín , nowadays district of Prague -- 1 August 1956 Prague - Dejvice ) was a Czech modernist architect , furniture designer , town planner , professor and theoretician .
Jean Effel , real name François Lejeune ( 12 February 1908 , Paris -- 10 October 1982 ) was French painter , caricaturist , illustrator and journalist .
Ferdinando Fuga ( 1699 - -1782 ) was an Italian architect , born in Florence , known for his work in Rome and Naples .
Édouard Bovet ( 1797 - -1849 ) was a Swiss watchmaker and founder of the Bovet Fleurier watch company .
Abd ar - Rahman V ( Arabic : عبد الرحمن الخامس‎ ) was an Umayyad Caliph of Córdoba .
Luigi Rizzo , Conte di Grado e di Premuda ( October 8 , 1887 in Milazzo -- June 27 , 1951 in Rome ) was an Italian naval officer .
Robert Edge Pine ( 1730 , London - November 18 , 1788 , Philadelphia ) was an English portrait and historical painter , born in London .
János György Szilágyi ( 16 July 1918 -- 7 January 2016 ) was a Hungarian historian who was a specialist in ancient drama and Greek art . He was born in Budapest .
Pierre Granier - Deferre ( 27 July 1927 , Paris -- 16 November 2007 ) was a French film director .
Paul Wallot ( 26 June 1841 Oppenheim am Rhein - 10 August 1912 Bad Schwalbach ) was a German architect of Huguenot descent , best known for designing the Reichstag building in Berlin , erected between 1884 and 1894 .
Michael Christian Festing was born in London to parents John and Elizabeth Festing .
Werner Lamberz was killed in a helicopter accident in Libya shortly after take - off , following a meeting in a large desert encampment with the Libyan head of government , Muammar Gaddafi .
Antoine Laurent Apollinaire Fée was a French botanist who was born in Ardentes , 7 November 1789 , and died in Paris on 21 May 1874 .
Gabriel Guevrekian ( or Guévrékian ) ( November 21 , 1892 ( ? ) Istanbul - October 29 , 1970 Antibes ) was an Armenian architect , who designed buildings , interiors and gardens , and taught architecture .
Heinrich Erfle ( born April 1 , 1884 , in Durkheim , died April 8 , 1923 , in Jena ) was a German optician who spent most of his career at Carl Zeiss .
Robert Ochsenfeld was a German physicist born on May 18 , 1901 in Hilchenbach ( Helberhausen quarter ) .
Wolfgang Lukschy ( born 19 October 1905 -- 10 July 1983 in Berlin ) was a German actor and dubber .
Joaquim Lúcio Cardoso Filho , known as Lúcio Cardoso ( Curvelo , Minas Gerais , Brazil , August 14 , 1912 - Rio de Janeiro , September 22 , 1968 ) was a Brazilian novelist , playwright , and poet .
Lawrence K. Karlton ( May 28 , 1935 -- July 11 , 2015 ) was a United States District Judge in Sacramento , California .
Đura Horvatović ( Serbian : Ђура Хорватовић ; January 17 , 1835 in Nova Gradiška -- February 28 , 1895 in Belgrade ) was a Serbian general and military minister .
Grigol Robakidze ( Georgian : გრიგოლ რობაქიძე ) ( October 28 , 1880 , Sviri ( West Georgia ) - November 19 , 1962 , Geneva ) was a Georgian writer , publicist , and public figure primarily known for his prose and anti - Soviet émigré activities .
Placido Campolo ( 1693 - -1743 ) was an Italian painter of the late - Baroque period , a native of Messina in Sicily .
Josef Jireček ( 9 October 1825 , in Vysoké Mýto -- 25 November 1888 , in Prague ) was a Czech scholar .
Born in Thiruvalla as the second son of evangelist George Kakkanadan and Rosamma , George Varghese Kakkanadan spent most of his childhood at Kollam and Kottarakkara .
Gustaf Larson died on 4 July 1968 , and is buried at the family tomb in Båstad , Göteborg , Sweden .
Anna Maria Garthwaite ( b. Harston , Leicestershire , 14 March 1688 -- October 1763 ) was an English textile designer known for creating vivid floral designs for silk fabrics hand - woven in Spitalfields near London in the mid-18th century .
Rūdolfs Bārda ( 7 February 1903 in Riga - 24 January 1991 in Riga ) was a Latvian footballer , brother of Edvīns Bārda , Arvīds Bārda and Oskars Bārda .
Baccio D'Agnolo ( 19 May 1462 -- 6 March 1543 ) , born Bartolomeo Baglioni , was an Italian woodcarver , sculptor and architect from Florence .
Pierre - Charles Simart ( born in Troyes on 27 June 1806 , died in Paris on 27 May 1857 ) was a French sculptor .
Ellison Harvie was recognised as an expert in hospital planning and administration , working on numerous Australian projects , including Mercy Hospital in East Melbourne ( 1934 - -36 ) and the original four multi - storey buildings of the Royal Melbourne Hospital ( 1936 - -41 ) .
Vadim Spiridonov born October 14 , 1944 in Moscow .
Lajos Werkner ( October 23 , 1883 in Budapest -- November 12 , 1943 in Budapest ) was a Hungarian sabre fencer .
He died in Prestwich in 1850 and is buried in the Churchyard of St Mary 's Parish Church in a tomb that calls him `` William Sturgeon ~ The Electrician '' .
Francis I. McKenna ( February 25 , 1859 -- February 24 , 1914 ) was a real estate and land developer , and architect from the 1890s to the 1920s in Portland , Oregon .
Carlo Pittara ( 1836 , Turin - 25 October 1891 , Rivara ) was an Italian painter who specialized in animals , pastoral landscapes , rivers and peasants at work .
Henry Corbin ( 14 April 1903 -- 7 October 1978 ) was a philosopher , theologian and professor of Islamic Studies at the École pratique des hautes études in Paris , France .
Helen Adam ( December 2 , 1909 in Glasgow , Scotland -- September 19 , 1993 in New York City ) was a Scottish poet , collagist and photographer who was an c , a literary movement contemporaneous to the Beat Generation that occurred in San Francisco during the 1950s and 1960s .
Franjo Punčec ( Serbian Cyrillic : Фрањо Пунчец ( fraːɲo pûːntʃěːts ) ; Hungarian : Puncsec Ferenc ( ˈpuntʃɛc ˈfɛrɛnts ) ; 25 November 1913 , Čakovec - 5 January 1985 , Johannesburg ) was a Yugoslav tennis player of Croatian ethnicity .
Erna Auerbach ( Frankfurt am Main 1897 - -London 1975 ) was a German - born artist and art historian best known for her work on artists of the Tudor Era in England .
Apollonius Cronus ( Greek : Κρόνος Ἀπολλώνιος ; fl . 4th century BCE ) from Cyrene was a philosopher of the Megarian school .
Upon his death in Outremont , Quebec in 1952 ( one day shy of his 84th birthday ) , Henri Bourassa was interred in Montreal 's Cimetière Notre - Dame - des - Neiges .
Saint Willibald ( born in Wessex c.700 and died c.787 in Eichstätt ) was an 8th - century bishop of Eichstätt in Bavaria .
Air Commodore Nazir Latif SJ and Bar ( July 10 , 1927 -- June 30 , 2011 ) was a one - star general officer in the Pakistan Air Force and a former director - general of the Operations and Plans at the Air Headquarters , Islamabad .
Wilhelm Malte I , Prince of Putbus ( 1783 -- 1854 ) was a German prince ( Fürst ) from the old Slavic - Rügen noble family of the lords of Putbus .
Étienne Pellot `` Montvieux '' , aka le Renard Basque ( the Basque fox ) , ( 1 September 1765 , Hendaye , France -- 1856 , Hendaye ) , was the last known French corsair , renowned for his bravery and success .
Born in Athens in 1873 , Konstantinos Typaldos - Alfonsatos entered the Hellenic Navy Academy on 2 September 1887 and graduated on 31 August 1891 as a Line Ensign .
Josephus Struthius ( Polish : Józef Struś ; 1510 in Poznań -- between 27 July 1568 and 26 January 1569 in Poznań ) was a Polish professor of medicine in Padua ( 1535 - -1537 ) and personal doctor of Polish kings .
Gaspare Gorresio ( Bagnasco , 18 January July 1808 -- Turin , 20 May 1891 ) was an Italian Orientalist and Indologist , best known for his translation of the Valmiki Ramayana , the great Hindu epic .
Nikolaas van Hoy , known in Austria as Nikolaus van Hoy ( alternative spellings of family name : ' van Hoey ' and ' van Hoj ' ) ( b. Antwerp , 1631 - d. Vienna , 25 June 1679 ) was a Flemish Baroque painter , draughtsman and etcher .
Leonardo Garzoni ( Venice , Italy , 1543 -- Venice , Italy , March 10 , 1592 ) was a Jesuit natural philosopher .
Olive Rush ( June 10 , 1873 near Fairmount , Indiana -- August 20 , 1966 in Santa Fe , New Mexico ) was an illustrator , muralist , and an important pioneer in Native American Art Education .
Il Sodoma painted in a manner that superimposed the High Renaissance style of early 16th - century Rome onto the traditions of the provincial Sienese school ; he spent the bulk of his professional life in Siena , with two periods in Rome .
Karel Farský ( 26 July 1880 , in Škodějov , Semily District , Bohemia -- 12 June 1927 , in Prague ) was a Czech Roman Catholic priest , and later founder and first patriarch ( 1920 ) of the Czechoslovak Hussite Church .
Carl Roesner ( 19 June 1804 , Vienna - 13 July 1869 , Steyr ) was an Austrian architect .
In 1463 , the Venetian Senate , seeking allies in its war against the Ottomans , sent Lazzaro Querini as its first ambassador to Tabriz , but he was unable to persuade Uzun Hassan to attack the Ottomans .
Giuseppe Diana ( July 4 , 1958 -- March 19 , 1994 ) , also known as Father Peppino , was a writer , a scout , and a Roman Catholic parish priest in Casal di Principe .
Louis Bonniot de Fleurac ( Louis Victor Marie Bonniot de Fleurac ; 19 November 1876 in Paris -- 20 March 1965 ) was a French athlete .
Wilfred Walter ( 2 March 1882 in Ripon , West Riding of Yorkshire -- 9 July 1958 in Ashtead , Surrey ) was an English film and theatre actor .
George Weissinger Smith was mayor of Louisville , Kentucky , the United States from 1917 to 1921 .
Bernhard Reichenbach ( 1888 in Berlin -- 1975 in London ) was a member of the Executive Committee of the Communist International .
Merrill De Maris ( February 26 , 1898 , New Jersey -- December 31 , 1948 , Escondido , California ) was a writer who worked on Disney Comic Strips for King Features Syndicate .
Juan Luis Segundo , S.J. ( March 31 , 1925 in Montevideo , Uruguay -- January 17 , 1996 in Montevideo ) was a Jesuit priest and theologian who was an important figure in the movement known as `` Liberation theology . ''
Georg Ritter von Frauenfeld ( 3 June 1807 , Vienna -- 8 October 1873 ) was an Austrian naturalist and one of the leading scientists on board the Austrian frigate Novara during its round - the - world voyage .
Michael Landmann ( 16 December 1913 , Basel -- 25 January 1984 , Haifa ) was a Jewish Swiss Philosopher .
Harrison Allen ( 1841 - 97 ) was an American physician and anatomist , born in Philadelphia .
The late Fernando Poe , Jr. 's low - key half - brother - actor Conrad Poe died on the morning of June 26 , 2010 , in his home in Meycauayan City , Bulacan .
Chief Constable Henry Solomon ( 1794 - 14 March 1844 ) was a police officer who became the first Chief Constable of Brighton Borough Police in East Sussex , England .
Louis Antoine Léon Riesener ( 21 January 1808 in Paris -- 25 May 1878 in Paris ) was a French Romantic painter .
Yuri Golov died following a long illness on 9 January 2014 , aged 77 , in his hometown of Nizhny Novgorod , Russia .
Ali Asllani ( Vajza , Vlorë District , Ottoman Empire , 28 November 1884 -- Tirana , Albania 20 December 1966 ) was Albanian poet , politician and activist of the Albanian National Awakening .
Theodor Birt ( 22 March 1852 in Wandsbek -- 28 January 1933 in Marburg ) was a German classicist and novelist .
Johan Rudolf Kjellén ( Swedish : ( ɕɛlleːn ) , 13 June 1864 , Torsö -- 14 November 1922 , Uppsala ) was a Swedish political scientist and politician who first coined the term `` geopolitics '' .
Matthias Jansz van Geuns ( Groningen , 15 September 1758 - Haarlem , 21 November 1839 ) was a Dutch Mennonite teacher and minister .
Pedro Roldán ( 1624 - -1699 ) was a Baroque sculptor from Seville , Andalusia , Spain .
Manfred Börner ( born 16 March 1929 in Rochlitz ; died 15 January 1996 in Ulm ) was a German physicist .
Karl Seebach ( June 28 , 1912 in Munich -- July 18 , 2007 in Munich ) was a German mathematician .
Carsten Tank was born at Rød Herregård , the family estate at Halden in Østfold County , Norway .
Klaus Mollenhauer graduated from school in 1948 , and then attended the College of Education in Göttingen , and working from 1950 to 1952 as an elementary school teacher in Bremen .
George Bagration of Mukhrani died in Madrid , Spain , in 1957 .
François Thurot ( 22 July 1727 at Nuits - Saint - Georges near Dijon in eastern France -- 28 February 1760 off the Isle of Man ) was a French privateer , merchant naval captain and smuggler who terrorised British shipping in the early part of the Seven Years ' War .
Joshua Boaz ben Simon Baruch ( died 1557 ) , also known as the Shiltei Giborim after a work he authored , was a prominent Talmudist who lived at Sabbioneta , and later at Savigliano .
Jean - Paul Laurens ( Fourquevaux 28 March 1838 -- 23 March 1921 Paris ) , was a French painter and sculptor , and one of the last major exponents of the French Academic style .
His grandfather ( also named Ludwig Binswanger ) was founder of the `` Bellevue Sanatorium '' in Kreuzlingen , and his uncle Otto Binswanger was a professor of psychiatry at the University of Jena .
María Antonieta Rivas Mercado Castellanos ( b. Mexico City , April 28 , 1900 - d. Paris , February 11 , 1931 ) was a Mexican intellectual , writer , feminist and arts patron .
Karl Braunsteiner ( 27 October 1891 -- 19 April 1916 in Tashkent , Uzbekistan ) was an Austrian football ( soccer ) player .
Muhammad Ibn Sirin ( Arabic محمد بن سيرين ) ( born in Basra ) was a Muslim interpreter of dreams who lived in the 8th century .
Adolf Schlatter ( 16 August 1852 -- 19 May 1938 ) was a world - leading Protestant theologian and professor specialising in the New Testament and systematics at Greifswald , Berlin and Tübingen .
Jean - Baptiste Martenot ( Saint - Seine - l'Abbaye Côte - d’Or 26 July 1828 - 30 March 1906 Rennes ) , was a French architect , born in Bourgogne , in the city of Rennes .
Only one year later , he was captured and sent to Copenhagen on the orders of the Danish treasurer and statholder , Christofer Walkendorf who was ruling Denmark after the sudden death of Frederick II . Magnus Heinason was tried , and was beheaded 18th .
Ester Rachel Kamińska ( Yiddish : אסתר רחל קאַמינסקאַ ) née Halpern ( Porozow , 10 March 1870 - Warsaw , 25 December 1925 ) was a Polish Jewish actress , known as the mother of Yiddish theatre .
Ralph Keeler ( also Keiler ) ( 1613 -- September 10 , 1672 ) was a founding settler of both Hartford , and Norwalk , Connecticut .
Auguste François - Marie de Colbert - Chabanais ( 18 October 1777 , Paris -- 3 January 1809 , Cacabelos , Spain ) , Comte de l'Empire joined the French army during the French Revolutionary Wars .
John Marie Durst died in Galveston on February 9 , 1851 and is buried in the family cemetery in Leon County .
James Alfred Ernest Corea grew up in the west coast town of Chilaw , with his older brother and his three younger siblings , They lived with their mother , who was of the Seneviratne family of Sri Lanka .
Willard MacGregor ( born October 15 , 1901 in Boston ; died July 30 , 1993 in New York City ) was an American classical pianist .
Johannes de Sacrobosco , also written Ioannis de Sacro Bosco ( c. 1195 -- c. 1256 ) , was a scholar , monk , and astronomer who was a teacher at the University of Paris .
Gaius Gracchus was born into a family who had a strong tradition in the politics of ancient Rome .
Adolf Pabst ( 30 November 1899 , Chicago -- 3 April 1990 , Berkeley , California ) was an American mineralogist and geologist .
Francesco Beccaruzzi ( c. 1492 - -1562 ) was an Italian painter of the Renaissance era , active near his hometown of Conegliano and in the neighborhood of Treviso .
William Hannon ( 1879 - -1950 ) was a Catholic priest from the United States who served as the fourth president of St. Ambrose College in Davenport , Iowa from 1915 to 1926 .
Eleonore Charlotte of Württemberg - Montbéliard ( 20 November 1656 in Horburg -- April 1743 in Wrocław ) , was by marriage Duchess of Oels - Württemberg .
Antoine Zacharie Adrien d'Épinay ( 6 February 1794 in Isle de France ( presently Mauritius ) -- 9 December 1839 ) in Paris .
Erich Everth ( born 3 July 187 ? in Berlin ; died 22 June 1934 in Leipzig ) was a German art historian , journalist and scientist of newspaper and cultivation .
Hal Robson ( August 16 , 1911 Mount Dennis , Ontario -- July 2 , 1996 San Bernardino , California ) was a Canadian racecar driver active in the 1940s .
Dimitar Milanov Stoyanov ( 18 October 1928 -- 1995 ) was a Bulgarian international footballer who played as a striker for CSKA Sofia .
Hippolyte Mège - Mouriès ( Draguignan 24 October 1817 - Paris 31 May 1880 ) was a French chemist and the inventor of margarine .
Friedrich von Hollmann ( January 19 , 1842 -- January 21 , 1913 ) was an Admiral of the German Imperial Navy ( Kaiserliche Marine ) and Secretary of the German Imperial Naval Office under Emperor Wilhelm II . Hollmann was born in Berlin , Germany .
Marcus Morton ( 1784 -- February 6 , 1864 ) was an American lawyer , jurist , and politician from Taunton , Massachusetts .
She was born in Lille , France , and died in Port Hueneme , California as Yola d'Avril Montiague .
Leopoldine von Sternberg ( Maria Leopoldine Walburga Eva ; 11 December 1733 , Vienna -- 1 March 1809 , Valtice ) was the princess consort of Liechtenstein as the wife of Prince Franz Joseph I , whom she married on 6 July 1750 .
Bernardo de Balbuena ( c. Valdepeñas ( Spain ) 1561 -- San Juan , Puerto Rico , October 1627 ) was a Spanish poet .
David José Kohon ( 18 October 1919 -- 30 October 2004 in Buenos Aires ) was an Argentine film director and screenwriter .
Armin Jordan died in Zürich five days after he collapsed while conducting Prokofiev 's opera The Love for Three Oranges at the opera house in Basel .
Johann Tobias Beck ( 22 February 1804 in Balingen , Württemberg -- 28 December 1878 in Tübingen ) was a German theologian .
Traian Trestioreanu ( June 9 , 1919 , Ploieşti -- August 28 , 1972 , Doicești ) was a Romanian painter , sketcher , and muralist .
Krzysztof Michalski ( 8 June 1948 -- 10 February 2013 ) was a Polish philosopher and the rector of Institut für die Wissenschaften vom Menschen ( IWM ) founded by him in Vienna in 1982 .
Louis Fischer taught about the Soviet Union at Princeton University until his death on January 15 , 1970 .
Bruno Corra is the pseudonym of Bruno Ginanni Corradini ( Ravenna , 9 June 1892 -- died in Varese , 20 November 1976 ) , an Italian writer and screenwriter .
Vincenzo Lancia ( 24 August 1881 in Fobello , Piedmont -- 15 February 1937 in Turin ) was an Italian pilot , engineer and founder of Lancia .
Karl Heilbronner ( 21 November 1869 Nürnberg -- 8 September 1914 Utrecht ) was a German psychiatrist .
Walther Kranz ( German : ( kʀants ) ; November 23 , 1884 in Georgsmarienhütte -- September 18 , 1960 in Bonn ) was a German classical philologist and historian of philosophy .
Massimo Brancaccio , also known by the stage names Max Coveri and Billy More ( February 3 , 1965 -- August 14 , 2005 ) , was an Italian drag queen and music artist based in Milan .
Piri Mehmed Pasha ( died 1533 , Silivri ) was an Ottoman Turk statesman .
Lucio Piccolo di Calanovella ( October 27 , 1901 in Palermo -- May 26 , 1969 in Capo d'Orlando ) , was an Italian poet .
Mauro Soderini ( 1704 - after 1739/1751 ) was an Italian painter of the late Baroque period , mainly painting sacred subjects and active in his native Florence .
Wilhelm Emelé ( 30 May 1830 Buchen , Odenwald - 11 October 1905 Freiburg i m Breisgau ) was a German painter of horses , military scenes and hunting scenes .
Born in Norwich , Connecticut , the son of Eliza ( née Coit ) and mill owner William Charles Gilman , a descendant of Edward Gilman , one of the first settlers of Exeter , New Hampshire , Daniel Coit Gilman graduated from Yale College in 1852 with a degree in geography .
Roger Rondeaux ( April 15 , 1920 in Mareuil - le - Port , France -- January 24 , 1999 in La Rochelle , France ) is a former cyclo - cross racer from France who was a professional from 1947 to 1958 .
Henry Zdík ( in Czech : Jindřich Zdík ) ( about 1083 - 1150 Prague ) was bishop of Olomouc from 1126 to 1150 .
Giambettino Cignaroli ( Verona , July 4 , 1706 -- Verona , December 1 , 1770 ) was an Italian painter of the Rococo and early Neoclassic period .
Alleyn was born in Bishopsgate , London , a younger son of Edward Alleyn , an innkeeper and porter to the queen , and Margaret Townley .
Nicolaes Grisz Grauwert ( 1582 -- 1658 ) , was a Dutch Golden Age member of the Haarlem schutterij .
Antonín Machek ( 31 October 1775 , Podlažice -- 18 November 1844 , Prague ) was a Czech painter in the Classical and Biedermeier styles .
Guillaume Delisle , also spelled Guillaume de l'Isle , ( 28 February 1675 , Paris -- 25 January 1726 , Paris ) was a French cartographer known for his popular and accurate maps of Europe and the newly explored Americas and Africa .
Bartolomeo Cavarozzi ( Viterbo , 15 February 1587 - Rome , 21 September 1625 ) was an Italian caravaggisti painter of the Baroque period active in Spain , alongside his master Giovanni Battista Crescenzi .
Antonín Reichenauer ( also known as Johann Anton Reichenauer , born c. 1694 Prague ; died 17 March 1730 in Jindřichův Hradec ) was a baroque composer .
Edward MacDowell was born in New York City to Thomas MacDowell , a Manhattan milk dealer , and Frances ( Fanny ) Mary Knapp .
Adolph Eduard Grube ( born 18 May 1812 in Königsberg - died 23 June 1880 in Wrocław ) was a German zoologist .
Robert Casadesus was born and died in Paris , and studied there at the Conservatoire with Louis Diémer , taking a Premier Prix ( First Prize ) in 1913 and the Prix Diémer in 1920 .
Anna - Lisa Frykman born Anna Elisabet Frykman on 4 January 1889 in Stockholm , Sweden , dead 14 June 1960 in Stockholm , Sweden was a Swedish composer , song lyricist and teacher .
Augustin Meinrad Bächtiger ( May 12 , 1888 , Mörschwil -- May 4 , 1971 , Gossau ) was a Swiss painter .
José Aguiar or José Aguiar García ( born 1895 ( Santa Clara , Cuba ) , died 1976 ( Madrid ) ) was a painter and muralist from La Gomera .
Benjamin Dale was born in Upper Holloway , Islington , London , to Charles James Dale , a pottery manufacturer from Staffordshire , and his wife , Frances Anne Hallett , daughter of a furniture manufacturer from Clerkenwell .
Liberale Cozza ( 20 July 1768 -- 26 May 1821 ) was an Italian painter , active mainly in his native Venice , but also in Brescia in a Neoclassical style .
Semyon L'vovich Ferdman PAR , better known by his stage name Semyon Farada ( Russian : Семён Львович Фердман , Семён Фарада , born December 31 , 1933 , Nikolskoye village of Moscow Oblast , USSR - died August 20 , 2009 in Moscow ) was a Soviet and Russian stage and film actor .
Curt von Bardeleben ( 4 March 1861 in Berlin -- 31 January 1924 ( aged 62 ) in Berlin ) was a German chess master , journalist , and member of the German nobility .
Philippe Alegambe ( 22 January 1592 , Brussels , Belgium - 6 September 1652 , Rome , Italy ) was a Belgian Jesuit priest and bibliographer .
Valentin Eduard Becker ( 20 November 1814 in Würzburg - 25 January 1890 also in Würzburg ) was a German composer .
Georges Adda ( Arabic : جورج عدة‎ ) ( September 22 , 1916 in Tunis -- September 28 , 2008 in Tunis ) , was a Tunisian politician and trade unionist , and a former leader of the Tunisian Communist Party .
Julius Buckler ( 28 March 1894 Mainz - Mombach -- 23 May 1960 Bonn ) was a German First World War fighter ace credited with 36 victories during the war .
Filippo Mariotti ( Apiro , September 6 , 1833 - Rome , June 25 , 1911 ) was an Italian politician and lawyer .
His father was a magistrate , and Jaishankar was educated at PS High School and The New College , Chennai , where he was awarded an honours degree .
Giuseppe Mosca ( 1772 in Naples -- 1839 in Messina ) was an Italian opera composer , the older brother of Luigi Mosca , also an opera composer .
On February 9 , 1991 , James Cleveland died in Culver City , California .
Joshua Tetley ( 20 July 1778 -- 26 August 1859 ) was the founder of the Tetley 's Brewery in Leeds , England .
Narcís Vinyoles , also Narciso Viñoles ( between 1442 and 1447 -- 1517 ) was a poet , lawyer and politician from Valencia , Spain .
Guido Alberto Fano ( 18 May 1875 in Padua -- 14 August 1961 at Tauriano di Spilimbergo ) was an Italian pianist and composer .
Herman Zanstra ( November 3 , 1894 , Schoterland -- October 2 , 1972 , Haarlem ) was a Frisian / Dutch astronomer .
Jules Romains was born in Saint - Julien - Chapteuil in the Haute - Loire but went to Paris to attend first the lycée Condorcet and then the prestigious École normale supérieure .
Walter Süß was listed as missing in action as of March 1945 in the Courland Pocket .
Jindřich Fügner ( born Heinrich Fügner , 12 September 1822 , Prague -- 15 November 1865 , Prague ) was co - founder ( together with Miroslav Tyrš ) and the first starosta ( leader ) of the Czech sport organization Sokol .
Fabio Maniscalco ( Naples 1 August 1965 - 1 February 2008 ) was an Italian archaeologist , specialist about the protection of cultural property and essayist .
Frank Farrington ( 8 July 1873 , London , England - 27 May 1924 , Los Angeles , California ) was an American silent film actor .
Ludwig Minkus was born Aloysius Bernhard Philipp Minkus on 23 March 1826 , in the Innere Stadt district of Vienna , the capital of the Austrian Empire .
Jean Jules Bousson ( 13 March 1834 in Vincennes -- 3 September 1926 in Paris ) was a French officer of the Cent - gardes Squadron .
Avicenna had access to the great libraries of Balkh , Khwarezm , Gorgan , Rey , Isfahan and Hamadan .
Hipolit Cegielski ( 6 January 1813 , Ławki -- 30 November 1868 , Posen ( Poznań ) , Kingdom of Prussia ) was a Polish businessman and social and cultural activist .
Giovanni Lorenzo Gregori ( 1663 in Lucca , Italy -- January 1745 in Lucca ) was an Italian violinist and composer .
Karl Benz , Bertha Benz , and their son , Eugen , moved 10 kilometres ( 6.2 mi ) east of Mannheim to live in nearby Ladenburg , and solely with their own capital , founded the private company , C. Benz Sons ( German : Benz Söhne ) in 1906 , producing automobiles and gas engines .
Angelino Fons was born on 6 March 1936 in Madrid , just months before the beginning of the Spanish Civil War .
Alessandro Milesi ( Venice , 1856 - -1945 ) was an Italian painter , mainly depicting genre subjects .
José Barnabé de Mesquita ( March 10 , 1892 , Cuiabá -- June 22 , 1961 , Cuiabá ) , generally known as José de Mesquita , was a Brazilian poet parnassian , romance and short story writer , historiographer , journalist , essayist , genealogist and jurist .
Nanna Ditzel ( October 6 , 1923 in Copenhagen - June 17 , 2005 in Copenhagen ) was a Danish furniture designer .
Paul Cornu died in 1944 in Lisieux -France , when his home was destroyed during the bombardment that accompanied the Landings of WW2 .
Christian Gottfried Körner ( 2 July 1756 , Leipzig -- 13 May 1831 , Berlin ) was a German jurist .
Eliza Carpenter ( 1851-December 16 , 1924 ) was a race horse owner and jockey who was born an enslaved person and achieved success as the only African - American horse racer in early Oklahoma .
Giuseppe Besozzi ( born 1686 in Milan -- d. 2 December 1760 in Naples ) was an Italian oboist .
Lucio Colletti ( December 8 , 1924 , Rome -- November 3 , 2001 , Venturina , Campiglia Marittima , Province of Livorno ) was an Italian philosopher .
Norberto Díaz ( March 18 , 1952 Buenos Aires - December 18 , 2010 ) , who was called Gallego by others in the entertainment industry , was an Argentine actor .
Aleksander Zelwerowicz ( 14 August 1877 in Lublin -- 18 June 1955 in Warsaw ) was a Polish actor , director , theatre president and a teacher .
Paavo Hukkinen ( 27 October 1911 in Hanover , Germany -- 7 June 1988 in Helsinki ) was a German - Finnish actor .
In 1979 , she and her husband founded the Pearl Primus `` Dance Language Institute '' in New Rochelle , New York , where they offered classes that blended African - American , Caribbean , and African dance forms with modern dance and ballet techniques .
Karl Peter Wilhelm Maurenbrecher ( 21 December 1838 -- 6 November 1892 , Leipzig ) was a German historian .
Levi Yitzchok of Berditchev ( 1740 - -1809 in Berdychiv ) , also known as the Berdichever , was a Hasidic leader .
Tony Anholt died in London of a brain tumour in 2002 , aged 61 .
Edmond Adolphe Maurice Jules Jacques de Rothschild , usually known as Baron Edmond Adolphe de Rothschild ( September 30 , 1926 -- November 2 , 1997 ) was born in Paris , France and died in Geneva , Switzerland .
Hugo Botstiber ( born 21 April 1875 , Vienna -- 15 January 1941 , Shrewsbury , UK ) , was an Austrian Jewish musicologist , who studied under Robert Fuchs and Guido Adler .
Johann Theodor Jablonski ( December 15 , 1654 - April 28 , 1731 , Berlin ) was a German educator and lexicographer who also wrote under the name Pierre Rondeau .
Born in London , Killigrew is perhaps best known as the subject of a famous elegy by the poet John Dryden entitled To The Pious Memory of the Accomplish'd Young Lady Mrs. Anne Killigrew ( 1686 ) .
Charles Stetson ( November 2 , 1801 -- March 27 , 1863 ) was a United States Representative from Maine , and the eldest member of a powerful Bangor political family .
Nicholas Liverpool died on 1 June 2015 in Miami , Florida , where he was receiving medical treatment .
After spending his childhood in Luxembourg , Auguste Trémont moved to Paris where he enrolled at the Ecole des Arts décoratifs in 1909 .
Niccolò di Segna ( died around 1348 ) was an Italian painter from Siena .
Leonhard Merzin ( 10 February 1934 in Aruküla , Kudina Parish ( now Maardla , Saare Parish ) -- 2 January 1990 in Tartu ) was an Estonian theatre and film actor , one of the Estonian actors active in the Soviet Union and abroad .
Pierre Chébly ( born on 19 December 1870 in Defoun , Lebanon - died on 30 May 1917 ) was an archeparch of the Maronite Catholic Archeparchy of Beirut .
Duan Qirui exiled himself to Tianjin and later moved to Shanghai where he died on November 2 , 1936 .
Kefee Obareki Don Momoh died of lung failure at a hospital in Los Angeles , California on June 12 , 2014 .
Simone Boccanegra ( Ligurian : Scimon Boccaneigra , Italian : Simone Boccanegra ; died 1363 ) was the first Doge of Genoa .
Alexander Preinfalk was shot down on 12 December 1944 by an American P-47 over Bruchsal , Germany and died after he bailed out .
Artur Carlos de Barros Basto ( Hebrew name : Abraham Israel Ben - Rosh ) was born December 18 , 1887 in Amarante , Portugal , and died in Porto on March 8 , 1961 .
Robert Adams II ( December 24 , 1832 -- May 12 , 1882 ) was a cotton planter from Lower Richland County , South Carolina , and Captain in the Army of The Confederate States of America .
Émile Maupas ( born 2 July 1842 in Vaudry , died 18 October 1916 in Algiers ) was a French librarian , zoologist and botanist .
Lalla Romano ( November 11 , 1906 in Demonte -- June 26 , 2001 in Milan ) was an Italian novelist , poet , and journalist .
Alois Vojtěch Šembera ( March 21 , 1807 in Vysoké Mýto , Bohemia , Austrian Empire -- March 23 , 1882 in Vienna , Austria - Hungary ) was a Czech linguist , historian of literature , writer , journalist and patriot .
Amory N. Hardy or A.N. Hardy ( 1835 - 1911 ) was a photographer in Boston , Massachusetts , in the 19th century .
Alexander Julius Klünder ( Russian : Александр Иванович Клюндер ; 20 February 1802 , Tallinn - 8 January 1875 , Tallinn ) was a Baltic - German painter and lithographer , known primarily for his portraits .
In 1937 Karl Wien was chosen to lead a German expedition to Nanga Parbat , the first since ten climbers had died on the mountain in 1934 .
John III , Duke of Mecklenburg - Stargard ( 1389 -- after 11 November 1438 ) was from 1416 to 1438 Duke of Mecklenburg , Lord of Stargard , Sternberg , Friedland , Fürstenberg , and Lychen .
Joan Salvat - Papasseit ( Catalan pronunciation : ( ʒuˈan səɫˈβat pəpəˈsɛjt ) ) ( Barcelona , 16 May 1894 - 7 August 1924 ) was a Catalan poet , though he also wrote articles , manifestos and other prose of a political and social nature .
He was born in Newbury , Berkshire in 1886 as Wernham Ryott Gifford but took the stage name of Stewart Rome , which was later unsuccessfully contested by Cecil Hepworth , who also used the name .
Johanna Niese , known as Hansi Niese ( 10 November 1875 in Vienna -- April 4 , 1934 ) was an Austrian actress .
Johann Kasimir Kolbe von Wartenberg ( 6 February 1643 , Wetterau -- 4 July 1712 , Frankfurt am Main ) was the first ever Minister - President ( effectively Prime Minister ) of the kingdom of Prussia , and the head of the `` Cabinet of Three Counts '' .
Georg Prochaska ( April 10 , 1749 in Blížkovice near Mahrisch Budwitz -- July 17 , 1820 in Vienna ) ( first name sometimes referred to as Juri , Jiří or Georgius ) ( Czech : Jiří Procháska ) was a leading Czech - Austrian anatomist , ophthalmologist , physiologist , writer and university professor .
Siegfried Oberndorfer ( 24 June 1876 in Munich - 1944 in Istanbul ) was a German physician and pathologist .
Friedrich Christian Hermann Uber ( April 22 , 1781 -- March 2 , 1822 ) was a German composer , who also served as the cantor of the Kreuzkirche in Dresden .
Gloria Emerson ( May 19 , 1929 , New York City -- August 3 , 2004 , New York City ) was an American author , journalist and New York Times war correspondent .
Maïna Kataki , née Juliette Pierre - Marie and nicknamed Nishtatai ( 1923 -- 20 November 2011 ; Pune , India ) was a French born , feminist author based in Pune , India .
Narciso Soldan ( 11 December 1927 , Nervesa della Battaglia , Veneto - 30 July 1987 , Conegliano , Veneto ) was an Italian professional football player .
Teddy Sampson died in Los Angeles more than 30 years later on November 24 , 1970 .
Mario Puccini ( 28 June 1869 , Livorno - 18 June 1920 , Florence ) was an Italian Post - impressionist painter who specialized in landscapes and village scenes .
Bernard Sarrette ( November 27 , 1765 -- April 1858 ) , founded what would become the Paris Conservatoire .
Carlos Padrós Rubió , also known as Carles Padrós Rubió ( 9 November 1870 , in Barcelona - 30 December 1950 , in Madrid ) was a Spanish football pioneer and club President of Real Madrid .
Andrzej Dobrowolski ( September 9 , 1921 in Lwów , Poland ( now Lviv . Ukraine ) -- August 8 , 1990 in Graz , Austria ) was a Polish composer and teacher .
Henrik Sillem ( 12 August 1866 , Amsterdam -- 13 July 1907 , Courmayeur , Italy ) was a Dutch jurist , mountaineer and sports shooter .
Arthur Ruysschaert ( born 21 February 1910 in Bruges - died 10 January 1995 in Bruges ) was a Belgian footballer .
João Álvares Fagundes ( born c. 1460 , Kingdom of Portugal , died 1522 , Kingdom of Portugal ) , an explorer and ship owner from Viana do Castelo in Northern Portugal , organized several expeditions to Newfoundland and Nova Scotia around 1520 - 1521 .
On 28 January 1946 Princess Marie Vassiltchikov married U.S. Army Captain Peter Graham Harnden of Military Intelligence ( born in London on 9 April 1913 ) .
Svetislav Stančić ( 7 July 1895 in Zagreb -- 7 January 1970 in Zagreb ) was a Croatian pianist and music pedagogue .
( Cristoforo Maria ) Luigi Canonica ( Tesserete , Canton Ticino , 9 March 1762 -- Milan , 7 February 1844 ) was a Swiss architect and urban planner whose prominent career as an exponent of neoclassicism was spent largely in Milan and Lombardy .
Philipp Ernst , 8th Prince of Hohenlohe - Schillingsfürst ( b. Schillingsfürst , 5 June 1853 - d. Bad Reichenhall , 26 December 1915 ) .
John ( Don Juan ) Forster ( 1814 -- February 20 , 1882 ) was born in England ; became a Mexican citizen of early California , and was one of the largest landowners in California .
Hakon Ahlberg ( June 10 , 1891 , Harplinge -- March 12 , 1984 , Stockholm ) was a Swedish architect , editor and author , best known as the official architect for the repair and restoration of Gripsholm Castle near the town of Mariefred in central Sweden .
Antón Losada Diéguez ( Moldes , ( Boborás ) , Spain on December 22 , 1884 - Pontevedra , Spain , in October 15 , 1929 ) was a writer , Spanish politician , member of the Irmandades da Fala of Ourense , impulsor of the magazine Nós and correspondent of the Royal Galician Academy .
François de Bonal ( b. 1734 at the castle of Bonal , near Agen ; d. in Munich , 1800 ) was Bishop of Clermont .
Laudomia Bonanni was born in 1907 in L’Aquila , the capital city of the mountainous Abruzzo region of Central Italy , located about 60 miles northeast of Rome .
Sigmund Exner ( also Sigmund Exner , Siegmund Exner - Ewarten , Siegmund Exner Ritter von Ewarten ; 5 April 1846 -- 5 February 1926 ) was an Austrian physiologist born in Vienna .
José María Iglesias was born into a wealthy family in Mexico City , but when he was 12 his father died .
Ulrich K. Goldsmith ( 1910 - -2000 ) was an American scholar of literature and emeritus professor at the University of Colorado at Boulder .
Lothar Baier ( Born Karlsruhe 16 May 1942 : died Montreal 11 July 2004 ) was a German author , publisher , translator and co - founder of the Literary periodical text + kritik .
Samuel Alfred Mitchell ( April 29 , 1874 in Kingston , Ontario , Canada -- February 22 , 1960 in Bloomington , Indiana ) was an astronomer who studied solar eclipses and set up a program to use photographic techniques to determine the distance to stars at McCormick Observatory , where he served as the director .
Marcel Raymond ( December 20 , 1897 in Geneva -- November 28 , 1981 in Geneva ) was a Swiss literary critic who specialized in French literature .
Georg Friedrich Daumer ( Nuremberg , March 5 , 1800 - Würzburg , December 14 , 1875 ) was a German poet and philosopher .
Werner of Oberwesel ( also known as Werner of Bacharach or Werner of Womrath ; b. 1271 in Womrath , Hunsrück ; d. 1287 ) was a 16-year - old boy whose unexplained death was blamed on Jews , leading to revenge killings of Jews across Europe .
Charlie Holmes ( January 27 , 1910 near Boston , Massachusetts -- September 19 , 1985 in Stoughton , Massachusetts ) was an alto jazz saxophonist of the swing era .
Major Teseo Tesei ( 1909 in Elba -- July 26 , 1941 in Malta ) was an Italian naval officer , who invented the human torpedo ( called `` Maiale '' , the Italian for `` pig '' ) used by the Regia Marina during World War II .
Baccio Baldini ( 1436 -- c. 1487 ) was an Italian engraver of the Renaissance , active in his native Florence .
Pieter Lastman was born in Amsterdam , the son of a town - beadle , who was dismissed in 1578 for being a Catholic .
Since 2008 , Brendan Coogan has been a regular and ad hoc presenter on BBC Radio Manchester , notably filling in on The Eamonn O'Neal and Jimmy Wagg Show .
Anthony Günther , Count of Oldenburg ( aka Anton Günther , 10 November 1583 in Oldenburg -- 19 June 1667 in Rastede ) was an Imperial Count and a member of the House of Oldenburg .
Václav Černý , PhD. , ( March 26 , 1905 Jizbice u Náchoda -- July 2 , 1987 Prague ) was a Czech literary scientist , writer and philosopher .
At the Los Angeles Olympics , Emmett Toppino from New Orleans ran the second leg in the American 4x100 m relay team , which won the gold medal with a new world record of 40.0 .
Fernand Deschamps ( July 13 , 1868 in Châtelineau -- March 15 , 1957 in Brussels ) was a Belgian intellectual who participated in the great socio - economic and ethical debates in the first half of the twentieth century .
Wolfgang Foerster ( born 4 August 1875 in Breslau ; died 14 October 1963 in Icking ) was a German officer and military historian .
Clementina Arderiu ( Barcelona , 1889 - -1976 ) was a Spanish poet who wrote in the Catalan language .
Pedro Max Fernando Frontin ( Petrópolis , 8 February 1867 -- Rio de Janeiro , 7 April 1939 ) was an Admiral from the Brazilian Navy .
Lydia Cabrera ( May 20 , 1899 in Havana , Cuba -- September 19 , 1991 in Miami , Florida ) was a Cuban anthropologist and poet .
Michael Furter ( died 1516 or 1517 ) was a printer of incunabula in Basel .
Alfonso de Castro ( 1495 in Zamora , Spain -- February 11 , 1558 in Brussels , Belgium ) , known also as Alphonsus a Castro , was a Franciscan theologian and jurist .
Iain McColl died in his sleep from complications of cancer at 9 p.m. on 4 July 2013 , at the Beatson Clinic in Glasgow , Scotland , at the age of 59 .
Jerzy Jan Lerski ( nom de guerre : Jur ; also known as George Jan Lerski ; was a Polish lawyer , soldier , historian , political scientist and politician . After World War II he emigrated to the United States , where he became a full professor at the University of San Francisco .
Paulo do Rio Branco da Silva Paranhos ( Paris , 10 July 1876 - Paris , February 1927 ) was a French - born Brazilian rugby union player .
Florbela Espanca ( Portuguese pronunciation : ( floɾˈbɛlɐ ( ɨ)ʃˈpɐ̃kɐ ) ; birth name Flor Bela de Alma da Conceição)(Vila Viçosa , December 8 , 1894 -- Matosinhos , December 8 , 1930 ) was a Portuguese poet .
Martin Wegelius ( 10 November 1846 -- 22 March 1906 ) was a Finnish composer and musicologist , primarily remembered as the founder , in 1882 , of the Helsinki Music Institute , now known as the Sibelius Academy .
Hans Clemer was a French painter of Flemish origin who worked most of his career at Piedmont .
Chantal Chaudé de Silans ( 9 March 1919 , Versailles -- 5 September 2001 , Grasse ) was a French chess player and a pioneer of women 's chess .
Dr. Rufus Henry Gilbert ( 1832 - 1885 ) was an American surgeon and inventor , who worked on rapid transit in New York City .
Hermann Föttinger ( 9 February 1877 in Nuremberg -- 28 April 1945 in Berlin ) was a German engineer and inventor .
Henrietta Maria de la Luz Boisier Gatica , known as Malú Gatica ( January 15 , 1922 , Purén -- August 10 , 1997 , Santiago ) was a Chilean actress and singer .
Tan Sri Dato ' Dr Lee Kong Chian ( 18 October 1893 -- 2 June 1967 ) , also known by his alias Lee Geok Kun , was a prominent Chinese businessman and philanthropist active in Malaya and Singapore from the 1930s to the 1960s .
Bartolomeo Bellano , also known as Bartolomeo Vellano , was an Italian renaissance sculptor and architect who was born in Padua in 1437 or 1438 .
Benedict Waldeck ( 1802 - -1870 ) in Berlin ) was a left - leaning deputy in the Prussian National Assembly , and later in the Second Chamber .
Degener Buggenhagen , also spelled Degner Buggenhagen ( died : 16 July 1420 in Garbodenhagen , near Stralsund ) was a German nobleman and Hereditary Lord Marshal of the Duchy of Pomerania - Wolgast .
Pierre Bruno Hugo Fontana otherwise known as Hugo del Carril ( 30 November 1912 -- 13 August 1989 in Buenos Aires ) was an Argentine film actor , film director and tango singer of the classic era .
Wilhelm August Golicke ( Russian : Вильгельм-Август Голике , also Василий Александрович Голике. 1802 , Tallinn or Saint Petersburg - 5 July 1848 , Saint Petersburg ) was a Baltic German painter .
Madeleine de Bourbon - Busset ( 23 March 1898 -- 1 September 1984 in Paris ) was the titular Duchess of Parma ( from 1974 ) and was also Carlist queen of Spain ( from 1952 ) as the consort of Xavier of Bourbon , the Carlist pretender to the Spanish throne .
Father Armand David ( 27 September 1826 Ezpeleta --10 November 1900 in Paris ) , also known in common names by the French Père David , was a Lazarist missionary Catholic priest as well as a zoologist and a botanist .
Donald Adam Hartman ( August 3 , 1929 -- July 5 , 1996 ) was the 33rd Mayor of Calgary from March 21 , 1989 to October 23 , 1989 .
Bernhardt Jungmann ( 1671 Ronneburg - 1747 Mexico ) was a German botanist who was a professor in Germany and visited America .
Barbara Castle died in Chiltern , Buckinghamshire , on 3 May 2002 , of pneumonia and chronic lung disease .
Walter Dexel ( born 7 February 1890 in Munich , died 8 June 1973 in Braunschweig ) was a German painter , commercial graphic designer , and transportation planner .
Heinrich Wolfgang Ludwig Dohrn ( 16 June 1838 , Braunschweig - 1 October 1913 , Florence ) was a German zoologist , entomologist and malacologist .
Francis Lyman Worden ( October 15 , 1830- February 5 , 1887 ) was a founder and prominent businessman of Missoula , Montana .
Sofia Sergeyevna Trubetskaya or Sophie Troubetskoy ( 25 March 1836 , Moscow -- 8 August 1898 , Madrid ) was a Russian princess .
Mukhayriq was a rabbi who lived in Medina and fought together with Muhammad in the Battle of Uhud on March 19 , 625 ( 3 Shawwal 3 AH in the Islamic calendar ) at the valley located in front of Mount Uhud , in what is now northwestern Arabia .
Baron Zsigmond Forgách de Ghymes et Gács , sometimes Sigismund Forgách ( Slovak : Zigmund Forgáč ; 1559 -- 23 June 1621 , Nagyszombat , today Trnava in Slovakia ) was a Hungarian nobleman in the Kingdom of Hungary , who served as Palatine from 11 May 1618 to 23 June 1621 .
Johann Gottfried Brügelmann ( baptized 6 July 1750 in Elberfeld , now a district of Wuppertal - 27 December 1802 , Ratingen ) was a German industrialist , most notable as founded of the first factory on mainland Europe , one of the forerunners of the Industrial Revolution .
Salomon Adler ( before 3 March 1630 -- 1709 in Milan ) was a German painter of the Baroque period , active in Milan and Bergamo as a portrait painter .
Amerigo Bartoli Natinguerra ( Terni , 1890 - Rome , 1971 ) was an Italian painter , caricaturist , and writer .
Adolf Rambold ( born 5 October 1900 in Stuttgart ; died 14 May 1996 in Meerbusch ) was a German inventor and engineer .
Henry Schoenfeld , also spelled Henry Schoenefeld , ( October 4 , 1857 in Milwaukee -- August 4 , 1936 in Los Angeles ) was an American composer .
Sep Ruf ( full name Franz Joseph Ruf ; born 9 March 1908 in Munich ; died 29 July 1982 in Munich ) was a German architect and designer , belonging to the Bauhaus group .
Johann Heinrich Bartholomäus Walter or Johann Heinrich Bartholomäus Walther ( 1734 -- 1802 ) was a German - Estonian master builder who moved to Tartu and built several significant buildings including Tartu Town Hall .
Emanuel van Meteren or Meteeren ( 6 September 1535 -- 11 April 1612 ) was a Flemish historian and Consul for `` the Traders of the Low Countries '' in London .
Eugène Bethmont was born in Paris on 12 March 1804 , son of a baker in the rue du Pont aux choux , in Le Marais .
Manuel de Sarratea , ( Buenos Aires , August 11 , 1774 -- Limoges , France , 21 September 1849 ) , was an Argentine diplomat , politician and soldier .
Pedro de Garibay ( 1729 , Alcalá de Henares , Spain -- July 7 , 1815 , Mexico City ) was a Spanish military officer and , from September 16 , 1808 to July 19 , 1809 , viceroy of New Spain .
Aleksa Simić ( March 18 , 1800 , Boljevci -- March 17 , 1872 , Belgrade ) was a Serbian politician and one of strongest of the Ustavobranioci ( Defenders of the Constitution ) .
May Gorslin Preston Slosson ( 10 September 1858 , Ilion , New York -- 26 November 1943 , Ann Arbor , Michigan ) was an American educator and suffragist .
Pierre de Lagarde Boal ( September 29 , 1895 , Thonon - les - Bains , Haute - Savoie , France -- May 24 , 1966 , Neuilly - sur - Seine , France ) was an American diplomat and aviator .
Nichita Stănescu finished high school in Ploieşti , then went on to study Romanian language and literature in Bucharest , graduating in 1957 .
Harry Hardt ( born Hermann Karl Viktor Klimbacher Edler von Reichswahr , Pula , 4 August 1899 -- Vienna , 14 November 1980 ) was an Austrian actor .
Christopher Slaughterford of London was executed in Guildford July 9 , 1709 , for the murder of Jane Young , his fiancée .
Born into a Protestant family in Paris , Louis Bouyer , after a receiving a degree from the Sorbonne , studied theology with the Protestant faculties of Paris and then Strasbourg .
Vivianna Torun Bülow - Hübe ( born December 4 , 1927 in Malmö -- died July 3 , 2004 in Copenhagen ) , often known simply as Torun , was one of Sweden 's most important 20th century silversmiths and a master jeweller .
Giuseppe Cilento ( July 21 , 1923 in Sorrento , Italy -- October 31 , 1994 in São Paulo ) was a Brazilian chemist who was born in Italy .
Malcolm Stuart Boylan was born in Chicago , Illinois , lived in Los Angeles , California during his writing career , and died in Hollywood , California .
Franz Schulz ( born 22 March 1897 in Prague , Austria - Hungary , died 4 May 1971 , in Muralto , Tessin , Switzerland ) was a playwright and screenwriter who worked from 1920 through 1956 .
Erich Pernice ( 19 December 1864 , Greifswald -- 1 August 1945 , Freest ) was a German classical archaeologist .
Tilman Riemenschneider ( c. 1460 -- 7 July 1531 ) was a German sculptor and woodcarver active in Würzburg from 1483 .
Ferdinand Simoneit ( June 14 , 1925 ; Duisburg -- April 3 , 2010 ; Löffingen ) was a German journalist , author , professor and World War II veteran .
Walther von Wartburg ( -Boos ) ( 18 May 1888 ; Riedholz -- 15 August 1971 ; Basel ) was a Swiss philologist and lexicographer .
Enrique de Borja y Aragón ( born December 19 , 1518 , Gandía - d. September 16 , 1540 , Viterbo ) , was a Spanish noble of the House of Borgia .
Mehmet Atıf Ateşdağlı ( 1876 ; Crete - December 3 , 1947 ; Istanbul ) was an officer of the Ottoman Army and of the Turkish Army .
Charles Devendeville ( 8 March 1882 in Lesquin -- 19 September 1914 in Reims ) was a French swimmer and Olympic champion .
Diego Vigil Cocaña ( 1799 , Tegucigalpa , Honduras -- 10 January 1845 , Granada , Nicaragua ) was a Central American politician .
Alfred - Marie Liénard ( April 2 , 1869 in Amiens -- April 29 , 1958 in Paris ) , was a French physicist and engineer .
Jameson Clark ( 1907 , Kirriemuir , Angus , Scotland -- 4 January 1984 , Kilbirnie , Ayrshire , Scotland ) was a Scottish character actor who appeared in 22 films and made many appearances on television .
Guy of Thouars died in 1213 in Chemillé in the county of Maine , and was buried with Constance at Villeneuve Abbey in Les Sorinières outside of Nantes .
Carl Georg Brunius ( 23 March 1793 -- 12 November 1869 ) was a classical scholar , art historian , archaeologist and architect working in the university town of Lund in southern Sweden .
James Edward Carpenter died suddenly while visiting his daughter Mrs. Helen Mosley on August 16 , 1901 in Newburyport , Massachusetts .
Cezar Lăzărescu ( born October 3 , 1923 in Bucharest , Romania - died on November 27 , 1986 in Bucharest , Romania ) was a Romanian architect and urban planner .
Ranbir Singh,(Urdu ; رنبیر سنگھ ) CIE ( August 1830 -- 12 September 1885 ) was the son of Maharaja Gulab Singh , Maharaja of Jammu and Kashmir and head of the Jamwal Rajput clan .
Syvert Nicolaas Bastert ( 1854 , Maarssen -- 1939 , Loenen aan de Vecht ) , was a 19th - century Dutch landscape painter , best known for his scenes along the river Vecht .
August Borms ( 14 April 1878 in Sint - Niklaas -- 12 April 1946 in Etterbeek ) was a Flemish nationalist politician active in Belgium during the first half of the twentieth century .
Petras Ciunis ( June 26 , 1898 in Perloja -- December 29 , 1979 in Vilnius ) was a Lithuanian army officer , educator .
Johann Friedrich Thilo Irmisch ( 14 January 1816 in Sondershausen -- 28 April 1879 in Sondershausen ) was a 19th - century German botanist .
Simeon Solomon ( 9 October 1840 , No . 3 Sandys Street , Bishopsgate , London -- 14 August 1905 , St. Giles 's Workhouse , Endell Street , London ) was an English Pre - Raphaelite painter .
Karl Jelinek ( 23 April 1822 , Brünn -- 19 October 1876 , Vienna ) was an Austrian physicist and meteorologist .
Wilhelm Franz Karl Ludwig Dill ( 2 February 1848 , Gernsbach - 24 October 1940 , Karlsruhe ) was a German ship and landscape painter who was a founding member of the Munich Secession .
Marquis Dino Perrone Compagni ( born 22 October 1879 in Florence - died 5 January 1950 in Florence ) was a leading figure in the early years of Italian fascism .
Lillie Hayward ( September 12 , 1891 -- June 29 , 1977 ) was an American screenwriter whose Hollywood career began during the silent era and continued well into the age of television .
Enrico Reycend ( Turin , November 3 , 1855 -- Turin , February 21 , 1928 ) was an Italian painter , mainly of landscapes and vedute .
Hanns Heinz Ewers ( 3 November 1871 in Düsseldorf -- 12 June 1943 in Berlin ) was a German actor , poet , philosopher , and writer of short stories and novels .
Arnold Scholz ( December 24 , 1904 in Berlin -- February 1 , 1942 in Flensburg ) was a German mathematician who proved Scholz 's reciprocity law and introduced the Scholz conjecture .
Maurice Fernez ( 30 August 1885 - 31 January 1952 , Alfortville , Paris , France ) was a French inventor and pioneer in the field of underwater breathing apparatus , respirators and gas masks .
Amadeo Bordiga remained with the International Communist Party until his death at Formia in 1970 .
Francesco Saverio Salfi or Franco Salfi ( Cosenza , 24 January 1759 -- Paris , 1832 ) was an Italian writer , politician and librettist .
Emmanuel Carasso or Emanuel Karasu ( 1862 in Salonica -- 1934 in Trieste ) was a lawyer and a member of the prominent Sephardic Jewish Carasso family of Ottoman Salonica ( now Thessaloniki , Greece ) .
Ferry de Clugny , Cardinal and Bishop of Tournai ( Autun ca . 1430 -- Rome 7 October 1483 ) was a highly placed statesman and ecclesiastic in the service of the Dukes of Burgundy .
Conrad Marca - Relli ( born Corrado Marcarelli ; June 5 , 1913 Boston -- August 29 , 2000 Parma ) was an American artist who belonged to the early generation of New York School Abstract Expressionist artists whose artistic innovation by the 1950s had been recognized across the Atlantic , including Paris .
Roberto Gavaldón ( born June 7 , 1909 in Jiménez , Chihuahua -- died September 4 , 1986 in Mexico City ) was a Mexican film director .
Pierre Nolf ( Ypres , 26 July 1873-Brussels , 14 September 1953 ) was a Belgian scientist and politician .
Adolfo Targioni Tozzetti ( 13 February 1823 , Florence -- 18 September 1902 ) was an Italian entomologist who specialised in Sternorrhyncha .
Louis Dega ( born 1890 , Marseilles , France -- died 1945 , French Guiana ) was a prisoner in the French Guiana penitentiary of Devil 's Island .
Matija Vuković ( Platičevo , 26 July 1925 -- Belgrade , 21 June 1985 ) was a Serbian sculptor .
Penelope Delta ( Greek : Πηνελόπη Δέλτα ; 1874 , Alexandria , Khedivate of Egypt -- 2 May 1941 , Athens ) was a Greek author of teenage literature .
Robert Edeson ( June 3 , 1868 , in New Orleans , Louisiana -- March 24 , 1931 , in Hollywood , California ) was an American movie and stage actor of the silent era .
Juriaen van Streeck or Juriaan van Streek ( Amsterdam , 29 February 1632 -- buried 12 June 1687 , Amsterdam ) was a Dutch Golden Age painter of still lifes .
Albert Tafel ( born 6 November 1876 in Stuttgart , died 19 April 1935 in Heidelberg ) was a German geographer , doctor and explorer .
Gérard Edelinck ( 20 October 1640 ( baptized ) -- 2 April 1707 ) was a copper - plate engraver and print publisher of Flemish origin , who worked in Paris from 1666 and became a naturalized French citizen in 1675 .
Alfrēds Hartmanis ( November 1 , 1881 , Riga , Latvia - July 27 , 1927 , Riga , Latvia ) was a Latvian chess player who won the Baltic Chess Congress in 1913 .
He was an uncle of the national councilor and mayor of Solothurn Wilhelm Vigier ( 1839 - 1908 ) .
Ferdinand Johann Wiedemann ( 30 March ( O.S. 18 March ) 1805 in Hapsal ( now Haapsalu ) -- 29 December ( O.S. 17 December ) 1887 in Saint Petersburg ) was an Estonian linguist who researched Uralic languages , mostly Estonian .
Eugen Habermann ( October 19 , 1884 in Tallinn , Estonia - September 17 , 1944 in Gdańsk Bay , Poland ) was an Estonian architect .
Gustav von Rohden ( 22 April 1855 , Barmen -- 9 May 1942 , Ballenstedt ) was a German clergyman and the author of books on various social issues ( the welfare of former prisoners , sexual ethics , etc . ) .
Patrick Van Antwerpen is a Belgian author - filmmaker born on 17 May 1944 in Ixelles ( Brussels ) and deceased in this commune on 3 December 1990 .
Johann Nordmann ( born Rumpelmayer , also published as Johannes Nordmann and under the pseudonym H. Naudh , March 13 , 1820 in Landersdorf , now Krems an der Donau -- August 20 , 1887 in Vienna ) was an Austrian journalist and travel writer .
Fazıl Küçük ( Turkish pronunciation : ( faˈzɯl cyˈt͡ʃyc ) ; 14 March 1906 in Nicosia -- 15 January 1984 in London ) was the first Vice President of the Republic of Cyprus .
Valentin Yoskov ( Bulgarian : Валентин Йосков ; born 5 June 1998 ) is a Bulgarian footballer who plays as a forward for Cherno More Varna .
Tal Makhlouf ( Hebrew : טל מכלוף‎ ; born 31 August 1991 ) is an Israeli football center defender .
Josep Seguer Sans ( 6 May 1923 -- 1 January 2014 ) was a Spanish football defender and manager .
Andreas Vasilogiannis ( Greek : Ανδρέας Βασιλόγιαννης ; born 21 February 1991 ) is a Greek football player currently playing for Cypriot First Division side Ermis Aradippou as a Right midfielder .
Marc Laniel ( born January 16 , 1968 in Oshawa , Ontario and raised in Scarborough , Ontario ) is a retired professional ice hockey defenceman .
Peter Schibetta is a fictional character on the HBO series Oz , portrayed by Eddie Malavarca .
Count Dooku is a fictional character from the Star Wars franchise , appearing as the primary antagonist in Star Wars Episode II : Attack of the Clones and a supporting antagonist in Star Wars Episode III :
Croc Master is a character from the G.I. Joe : A Real American Hero toyline and comic book series .
Janet Dillon ( maiden name Marlowe , previously Green , and often referred to as Janet from Another Planet ) is a fictional character on the daytime soap opera All My Children .
Tia Dalma , played by Naomie Harris , is a fictional character from the movie Pirates of the Caribbean : Dead Man 's Chest and a primary character in the movie Pirates of the Caribbean :
Heber the Kenite ( Hebrew : חבר הקיני‎ ) was , according to the Book of Judges in the Tanakh and the Bible , a descendant of Reuel the Midianite , the father - in - law of Moses .
Catherine Tramell is a fictional character in the 1992 film Basic Instinct and its sequel , Basic Instinct 2 .
Lord Alex Oakwell is a fictional character from the British soap opera Emmerdale , played by Rupam Maxwell .
Jesse McGregor is a fictional character from the Australian soap opera Home and Away , played by actor Ben Unwin .
Chloe Sullivan is a fictional character in the television series Smallville , which is based on the Superman and Superboy comics published by DC Comics .
Kobol is a planet in the fictional Battlestar Galactica universe .
Count von Count , often known simply as `` the Count '' or `` Count Count '' , is one of the Muppet characters on Sesame Street .
Grace Van Pelt is a fictional character on the CBS crime drama The Mentalist , portrayed by Amanda Righetti .
Rebecca von Lahnstein is a character on the German soap opera Verbotene Liebe ( Forbidden Love ) .
Lucinda Walsh ( born Mary Ellen Walters ; formerly Guest , Esteban , Dixon , Stenbeck and Wheatley ) is a fictional character on the CBS soap opera As the World Turns .
Tama Hudson is a fictional character on the New Zealand soap opera Shortland Street who was portrayed by David Wikaira - Paul from 2001 to 2006 .
Nicola King ( née Blackstock ; previously De Souza ) is a fictional character in the ITV soap opera , Emmerdale .
The story of Dushyanta 's encounter , marriage , separation and reunion with his queen , Shakuntala , has been immortalized in the Mahabharata and in The Recognition of Shakuntala by the great Sanskrit poet Kalidas .
In For Your Eyes Only , Bill Tanner ( now played by James Villiers due to Michael Goodliffe 's death in 1976 ) is given a bigger role , as Bernard Lee , who played M , had died .
Théodred is a fictional character in The Lord of the Rings by J.R.R. Tolkien .
Bradley Foster was a fictional character in UK soap opera Family Affairs , played by Harry Capehorn from 2004 to 2005 .
Jorah Mormont , nicknamed Jorah the Andal is a fictional character in the A Song of Ice and Fire series of fantasy novels by American author George R. R. Martin , and its television adaptation Game of Thrones .
Clark Green is a fictional character on the U.S. comedy television series The Office .
Sofia Curtis is a fictional character on the CBS crime drama , CSI : Crime Scene Investigation , portrayed by British actress Louise Lombard .
Jeffrey Sinclair is a character in the fictional universe of the science fiction television series Babylon 5 , played by actor Michael O'Hare .
Iago is a fictional character in Shakespeare 's Othello ( c. 1601 - -1604 ) .
Chronologically , Skywarp made his first appearance in The Transformers :
Revolver Ocelot is a recurring character in Konami 's Metal Gear series .
Actor Brent Stait played Kent Nelson / Doctor Fate in the Smallville two - part episode `` Absolute Justice '' , with Erica Carroll as Inza Nelson .
Petruchio ( an anglicisation of the Italian name Petruccio ; Italian pronunciation : ( peˈtruttʃo ) ) is the male romantic lead in Shakespeare 's The Taming of the Shrew ( c. 1590 - -1594 ) .
Hua Xiren ( simplified Chinese : 花袭人 ; traditional Chinese : 花襲人 ; pinyin : Huā Xírén ) is a major fictional character from the classic Chinese novel Dream of the Red Chamber .
Boaz ( /ˈboʊ.æz/ ; Modern Hebrew : בועז Bốʿaz ; Massoretical Hebrew : בֹּ֫עַז Bṓʿaz ; Hebrew pronunciation : ( ˈboːʕaz ) ) is a major figure in the Book of Ruth in the Bible .
Ellen Crozier is a fictional character on the New Zealand soap opera Shortland Street , who was portrayed by Robyn Malcolm for nearly 6 years in the mid to late nineties .
Alexandra Spaulding ( formerly von Halkein , Thorpe and Foley ) , affectionately known by family and friends as Alex , is a fictional character on CBS 's daytime drama Guiding Light .
Paul Ryan and Meg Snyder are fictional characters and a popular couple on the American soap opera As the World Turns .
Elliot Stabler is a fictional character portrayed by Christopher Meloni and one of the lead characters on the NBC police procedural series Law & Order : Special Victims Unit during the first twelve seasons .
Bhurishravas ( Sanskrit : भूरिश्रवस् / भूरिश्र्वा ) was a prince of a minor kingdom in the kingdom of Bahlika and played a role in the Mahabharata epic .
Sheng Long is a character hoax related to the Street Fighter series , created by Electronic Gaming Monthly ( EGM ) as an April Fool 's gag in 1992 ( in an issue published mid - February ) .
Quintus Valerius Pompey is a fictional character in the HBO / BBC2 original television series , Rome , played by Rick Warden .
A Moral Conjugal is a 2012 Portuguese drama film directed by Artur Serra Araújo and starring Dinarte Branco , São José Correia and José Wallenstein .
Amor de otoño ( English language : Love of Autumn ) is a 1996 Argentine romantic drama film directed and written by José Conrado Castelli .
Con Safos is the second and last album by Ruben and the Jets , recorded in 1974 as a follow - up to their 1973 debut For Real ! , which was produced by Frank Zappa ( whose 1968 album Cruising with Ruben & the Jets was the source for the band 's name ) .
The Simpsons Movie is a 2007 American animated adventure comedy film based on the Fox television series The Simpsons .
Rest on Your Shoulder ( Chinese : 肩上蝶 ) is a 2011 Chinese fantasy film created by Ning Bei Dao Cao Jia Cou Television Planning Co . LTD and released by EDKO Film Ltd ..
Ledfeather is a 2008 novel by Native American author Stephen Graham Jones , published by FC2 ( Fiction Collective Two ) .
Dragon Oath , also known as Tian Long Ba Bu ( abbreviation : TLBB ) in China , is a free - to - play MMORPG developed and published by Changyou.com and Sohu and launched in May 2007 .
The Journal of Web Semantics is an interdisciplinary peer - reviewed scientific journal published by Elsevier .
After Burner II is an arcade - style flight game released by Sega in 1987 .
KAtomic is a simple educational puzzle game that is part of the game package which ships with the KDE desktop environment .
Glitter in the Gutter is singer - songwriter Jesse Malin 's third studio album , released on Adeline Records on March 20 , 2007 .
`` I 'm on a Roll '' is Stefano 's first single after being signed to Hollywood Records .
`` Gon na Give Her All the Love I 've Got '' is a 1967 Soul song , originally recorded and made a hit by Jimmy Ruffin on Motown Records ' `` Soul '' Label imprint .
Night of the Furies is The Rosebuds ' third album , released April 10 , 2007 on Merge Records .
Under the Red Sky is the twenty - seventh studio album by American singer - songwriter Bob Dylan , released on September 10 , 1990 by Columbia Records .
Your Highness is a 2011 American fantasy stoner comedy film directed by David Gordon Green , and stars Danny McBride , James Franco , Natalie Portman , Zooey Deschanel and Justin Theroux .
Dialogue with the Carmelites ( French : Le dialogue des Carmélites , Italian : I dialoghi delle Carmelitane , also known as The Carmelites ) is a 1960 French - Italian historical drama film written and directed by Raymond Léopold Bruckberger and Philippe Agostini .
Den nye lægen ( English : The new doctor ) is a 1943 Norwegian drama film directed by Rasmus Breistein , starring Jon Lennart Mjøen .
Wicked Stepmother is a 1989 American comedy film written , produced , and directed by Larry Cohen .
Dash Akol ( in Persian : داش آکُل ) is a 1971 Iranian drama film directed by Masoud Kimiai .
Days of Inspector Ambrosio ( Italian : I giorni del commissario Ambrosio ) is a 1988 Italian crime film directed by Sergio Corbucci .
Typhon sur Nagasaki ( English : Typhoon Over Nagasaki ) is a French drama romance film from 1957 , directed by Yves Ciampi , written by Jean - Charles Tacchella , starring Jean Marais .
Sugar Cane Alley ( French title : La Rue Cases - Nègres ) is a 1983 film directed by Euzhan Palcy .
Moscow Elegy ( Russian : Московская элегия ) is a 1988 documentary film directed by Alexander Sokurov , about the later life and death of Soviet Russian filmmaker Andrei Tarkovsky .
The Final Game is a German thriller film directed by Sigi Rothemund , it was written by Timo Berndt and Borris Brandt .
When the Day Breaks is a Canadian animated short co - directed by Wendy Tilby and Amanda Forbis .
Hobo with a Shotgun is a 2011 Canadian exploitation action dark comedy - thriller film directed by Jason Eisener and written by John Davies , starring Rutger Hauer .
Katanga Business is a 2009 film by Belgian director Thierry Michel that explores the mining industry in Katanga Province , Democratic Republic of the Congo .
